Reviews.Title: “Great modern hotel with helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: csb44
Reviews.Content: We stayed six nights at the Fortyseven Hotel - at the end of the trip my fiancee and I both agreed that we will stay here again next time in Rome. The rooms are modern and spacious. We got a room on the fourth floor and did not have any problems with street noise. The location of the hotel is great - we basically walked everywhere (Ancient Rome, Pantheon, Villa Borghese, Trastevere, Testaccio, etc) except for the Vatican due to rain. The staff were very helpful - even before our arrival they arranged our car transfer from the airport and made us reservations for Easter lunch. Throughout the week they also assisted with reservations and also delivered a special dessert to our room for my birthday! Overall a great stay - we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff and clean room”
Reviews.Author: Sam709
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five days and enoyed every second. The room was very nice and clean and the staff was friendly and helpful. For example we wanted to book a taxi from the hotel to the airport and it could only be payed in cash 45 euro at the reception if we wanted a taxi-voucher. We only had 40 euro on us at the moment but it was not a problem, it worked out fine anyway thanks to the staff. The breakfast was very good and there were a lot of options to choose from. My boyfriend is allergic to dairy products and therefore couldn't eat the scrambled eggs, but the staff was very quick to make a dairy-free alternative so he too could enjoy the breakfeast! The hotel restaurant was nice and the food was great. The only minus that we could possibly think of is the noisy street outside wich makes it a bit hard to sleep (but that's what can be excpected if you want to live central) aswell as the somewhat hard beds. Overall we had a great time in Rome and we highly recommond this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: wanderer035
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved this hotel. The room and bathroom were spacious and well fitted out. We had a fantastic view and yes, once you open the windows, it's noisy but, to be fair, you're in the city. We loved to open the window in the morning and listen to the city wake up with an expresso in hand. The shutters will keep out a lot of the noise if you wish. Breakfast is great and there is enough choice to have something different every morning. The staff are friendly and helpful and nothing is too much trouble. The hotel is close to a lot of the main sights but equally, you can just wander round the narrow streets and see where you end up. Would highly recommend the hotel and now just need an excuse to go back

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel, very helpful staff, would thoroughly recomend”
Reviews.Author: Jollifed100
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here at end of March. The staff were great from helping to retrieve a bag left in a taxi, to arranging dinner reservations etc Would also recommend the rooftop restaurant. Room was spacious, although could have done with a little more drawer space, we were there three nights. All in all a hotel I would return to. DJ

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: sham64
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Clean, spacious rooms, great bathroom and amazing location. Amazing quality for the price. Free Internet and free breakfast was great. The only drawback is sound. You can hear a little of the sound from the other room and the street below. But I still highly recommend this hotel. The staff was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Forty Seven”
Reviews.Author: Alison C
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel and in a very good location.Rooms are very nice,but TV's are really old and also no tea and coffee making facilities.Paid 230 Euro's per night, but next time will negotiate hard to get this rate cheaper.Had two tea's delivered to room and this was very expensive. Alison from Derby UK

Reviews.Title: “1st rate experience”
Reviews.Author: michael c
Reviews.Content: We spent almost a week at Hotel 47in mid-March. Our experience was positive in almost all respects. The rooms were spacious and updated; the staff was good, some excellent but all very accommodating. The breakfast was especially top-notch. Highly recommended for the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Great. Skip Restaurant.”
Reviews.Author: BMW1200RT
Reviews.Content: Great location right near "Mouth of Truth". Close to bus line. Easy walking across river to get to more local restaurants. Easy walk around to Coliseum and VE Monument. Room was very nice (king deluxe). Bed very comfortable. Rooms quiet. Nice interior courtyard. Staff helpful. Breakfast extremely good. Very good value and in good neighborhood. Farmer's market nearby on Sat/Sun. Rated 4 because restaurant was not good at all.

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: viewjd
Reviews.Content: A quality hotel close to the Capital, the Roman Forum and the teatro marcello. Friendly and helpfull staff. Nice nice place for breakfast (very good), Rooms extremely clean, spacious and well decorated. A medium-sized hotel and therefore friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Give the restaurant a miss...”
Reviews.Author: teresalegg
Reviews.Content: My family and I thought it would be a great place for a birthday dinner. However we were badly let down. We waited a long time for cold pasta, over salted and tough veal and loud, disturbing Britney Spears music on rotation. We would not recommend this restaurant to anyone visiting Rome there are so many better ones to visit at these prices.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Choice!”
Reviews.Author: DRSLB_12
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel and read previous post. We would go back again. The location was great. Ten minutes to the Coliseum/Circus Maximus and Victorio Emanuel Monument/Piazza Venezia and Jewish Ghetto. We were pleased with our room (#410) for three adults - deluxe room. The bathroom was adequate sized even with the bidet. We were surprised by the daily surplus of towels and wash cloths for a European hotel. Internet connection was free! We were greeted by Alina who was fantastic and customer service driven. She was a tremendous help with our early check-in. She changed our Euro's into smaller bills, arranged a last minute private 2-hour plus tour of the Vatican for us (at a much cheaper rate than several options given to us by our travel agency), and scheduled a taxi back to the airport for us. Everything in this boutique hotel was new and modern. Yes, only two English speaking channels, but we didn't come to Rome to look at T.V. The hotel was accommodating when we had to change our departure date unexpectedly by one day earlier. If we were to go back we would make this our headquarters!

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Souren H
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was clean, comfortable and true to its boutique 4 Star rating. Hotel is at a busy intersection and the lower level and street front rooms can be noisy. We loved our stay in this Hotel. Marco, Alina and Claudia at the front and Stefan at the restaurant were just as nice as they com. Frankly everyone from the bell boy to the management was friendly, courteous and helpful. Continental breakfast was above average. Room and the bathroom were very clean and the beds were very comfortable and nicely done. We look forward to our next trip to Rome and staying in this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, excellent Claudia”
Reviews.Author: vivienne m
Reviews.Content: We stayed for our visit to Rome for my partners birthday and it was superb. We had one night in the standard room and three nights in the deluxe room . Both were excellent with great facilities, comfortable beds and spotless and beautifully designed bathrooms. The view was definately better in the deluxe room and the addition of the Expresso machine made a world of difference to us. Thank you to Claudia for arranging our change of room. Whilst on the subject of Claudia, we cannot praise her enough. Claudia remembered us by name each time she met us, gave us superb advice on restaurants and how to get to places on foot or by transport. My partner had a personalised cake sent to our room on his birthday again organised by Claudia. The restaurants were ALL excellent and Claudia interpereted our requirements perfectly ( we wanted Roman food, good atmosphere and interesting surroundings) and recommended different areas each night so we saw different parts of the city. All of the staff we met at other times of the day were extremly helpful as well but Claudia did stand out. The Breakfasts were excellent with a good selection of hot and cold food, the coffee was excellent and our waiter very pleasant and attentive, I think his name was Giacomo, we missed him on his day off! I would recommend getting to Breakfast before 9.30 as after that the food does seem to get a little sparse that is the only very minor fault that we found. We still had sufficient to eat but just not a great deal of choice on one of the mornings when we went out for an early walk and returned for a later breakfast. We loved the location of Fortyseven Hotel, a short walk across the river to Trastevere and easy walks to the Pantheon, The Capitoline, and the Roman Forum.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel for business and leisure”
Reviews.Author: NAHC
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights at the 47 (27 Feb - 1 Mar), and were very happy. The service was friendly, the location was excellent to explore the city all by foot. The breakfast buffet was well varied, sweet and savoury, there were healthy choices and filling, it was a great fuelling station to get the day started. The rooms were very clean, well maintained, contemporary design. If I had only one negative comment is that the walls between rooms were rather thin. The couple in the neighbouring room watched television until very late, past 1am, and I had to wait until they turned off their TV so I can sleep. We missed out on the rooftop restaurant experience, but we look forward to another stay there next we are in Rome. We tried the steam room on the first night, it was excellent especially if you had a long haul flight and are in need of some humid air to relax the lungs and body. A staff member gave us a city guide, a version for adults and a version for kids. I thought that was so thoughtful and well done. We followed a lot of the sites on the map, they were spot on!

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: agsLisboa
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights at the 47 (31st March-2nd April 2012) and will never choose (if given the chance) another Hotel in Rome. From the staff to the room (had 508 which is excelent) the view the location the breakfast, I have nothing but good things to say about this Hotel. 5stars all around. will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Peterjohn_10
Reviews.Content: I can only agree with what other reviewers have said about this hotel, it is fantastic. I arranged with the hotel for a Limo to collect me at the airport, this cost 50euro, 10 euro more than a taxi but well worth it. The greeting and checking in at reception by Alina was a pleasure, the best check in I have ever had !! The deluxe room on the 5th floor was really well furnished , spotless and had a balcony with great views. Great en suite with a very good shower. Buffet breakfast had a good choice of hot & cold food. The Circus Restaurant on the roof top not only provided spectacular views but the food was excellent as was the service. The hotel was memorable for all the right reasons I would recommend it without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Bauke H Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: It is a great place to stay and to visit the highlights of the eternal city. Very helpful and friendly staff, we really felt at home.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant, close to centre and river”
Reviews.Author: babydoor
Reviews.Content: My second stay at this fabulous hotel. Close to everything, was brought a complimentary bottle of wine on the first night. Great ecofriendly hotel. We had a room with a balcony and with unusually warm march weather we enjoyed time on the balcony with a glass of wine. Breakfast is always well stocked and delicious. A great way to start the day. We walked everywhere and the hotel was super accessible. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Rome. Great hotel, lovely rooms and fabulous staff.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: sfamatbeck
Reviews.Content: Having read previous reviews before booking I can only congratulate other contributors for their views. This Hotel is clean, comfortable, modern, well furnished and the staff helpful and attentive. Previous comments refer to the road noise and yes the hotel fronts a very busy main road and if you like to sleep with a window open this is not the hotel for you. If you use the shutters (buttons by side of bed) and close the windows its not a problem. The location is superb, with views of the Tiber, Ponte Palatine & The Temple of Vesta. 2 minutes walk to St Maria in Cosmedin, 10 to the Colosseum, Forum and Palatine, 30 mins to the Vatican. You are in the centre of Rome with history on every street corner. Rome is busy, noisy, full of character and enjoyable. If staying here you must visit the Trastevere area at night and enjoy the many restaurants and atmosphere, eat good food in charming restaurants at sensible prices. We ate in the Hotel one night (Monday) whilst the food was pleasant, the roof restaurant was closed and we were relegated to the breakfast room. With no view, few customers, no atmosphere it was a expensive mistake and we should have found somewhere else but this is our only complaint. The hotel will book a taxi to the airport E45 this is good value and cheaper than finding your own. We very much enjoyed Rome and The 47 and will return having thrown our coins into the fountain.

Reviews.Title: “Alina is great!”
Reviews.Author: H A
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very good - excellently situated in the center of Rome and with great quality rooms, a true gem. But what is most outstanding about the hotel is the staff, always friendly and with helpful advice. I had a small problem with my booking and Alina from reception, beautiful and friendly, was as helpful as she could be! It was a pleasure to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “modern hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: traveler29556
Reviews.Content: We capped off our twelve day vacation in Italy with five days in Rome and four nights at the Fortyseven Hotel. The hotel is very well-situated within a five minute walk of the Roman Forum and Palatine Hill and a fifteen minute walk of the Vatican, Pantheon and Trevi Fountain. The staff is helpful and made dinner reservations and arranged airport transportation for us. Check-in was quick and easy. Our room was large and clean with a nice bathroom and a good view. We ate breakfast at the hotel every morning, and there was a wide selection of meats, cheeses, cereal, fruit and yogurt. The only problem at breakfast was that the servers were quite stressed because they were understaffed. The gym was adequately outfitted with two treadmills, an elliptical, an exercise bike and weight machines. Overall, we had a good experience at this hotel and would consider returning on our next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, amazing staff!”
Reviews.Author: Esojeiram
Reviews.Content: We spent one lovely week in early March at the small, stylish and extremely well-located Forty-Seven hotel. Upon arrival, we were offered a nice, spacious, extremely clean room. This said, I was a bit disappointed about the lack of view from our window (we were on the 1st Floor, facing a side street). When I made a comment about this the next morning to Marco Luzietti, the front desk manager, he swiftly moved us to a lovely room located on the fifth floor, with a charming terrace and a stunning view (room 509- book it!). The weather was simply perfect during our stay, and we were lucky enough to be able to watch the sunset every night from our terrace, sipping a glass of Prosecco. Breakfast alfresco was also lovely. Marco was the perfect host, friendly and always professional, and so was the always charming and smiling Lorenza, also at the front desk, who was extremely helpful during our stay and booked several restaurants for us (the hotel is conveniently located close to the Trastevere, where nice, cosy restaurants are easy to find). I have already recommended this hotel to my friends and colleagues and will not hesitate to stay there for our next stay in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Find in a Great City”
Reviews.Author: GruffandMeri
Reviews.Content: Positioned in a great location for all the ancient sights, easy access to good restuarants, luxurious rooms, filling breakfasts and fantastic staff. For our annual city break with my aged parents we could not have asked for more from the hotel. A choice of soft & firm pillows, a bed large enough for me & my 6'2" husband and a bath for soaking in after a days walking made the rooms perfect. Self service breakfast was prepared and served as it was needed (no worries about rubbery scrambled eggs here) and plentiful supplies to set us up for the day. On our return each afternoon the staff were genuinely interested in how our day had gone. A refreshing cup of tea (mother) and a cocktail (me) on the Roof Garden was just the best way to relax before changing to go out to the Trastevere neighbourhood (a 10 minute stroll across the Tiber) for the evening to find lovely Roman food. A wonderful meal in the same roof top garden on the last night was the perfect end to a wonderful short stay. All the staff, the girls at reception the boys at breakfast & in the roof garden to the porters were great. It felt like visiting family.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with even better staff”
Reviews.Author: WoolyBully6954
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent twelve nights in Rome and our hotel experience only added to the enjoyment of our trip. First class management by the "Italian Stallion" Marco, wonderful tips by Adrienne, always helpful and smiling bellmen topped off by a fun and experienced front office staff. Thank you, ladies, one and all! The hot breakfast was always delicious and attended to by caring people. Restaurants are just a few minutes away along with many fabulous sights. Airport pick-up and drop-off was well worth the money and prompt. The rooms are very comfortable and quiet with a large bathroom. Lovely art through out the hotel. Busses can be caught nearly out the front door. A hotel can make or break a visit so do yourself a favour and book at this establishment. We truly do hope to return.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service, and great location!”
Reviews.Author: kbfeeler
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed this hotel, the location, and the service. it was perfect. Definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Ideally situated hotel for Rome attractions”
Reviews.Author: Tuareet
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 5 day trip to Rome and stayed at this hotel. It is just around the corner from the Colusseum and within 10-15 minutes walk from Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, the Pantheon etc. All staff were extremely welcoming and could not do enough for us, whenever we had a query no matter what it was they could help. On our first evening we asked for a suggestion for a restaurant, not only did the recepitonist tell us where to go, she reserved a table for us and then rang them to check we had arrived safely. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “When In Rome Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: mattycEastSussex
Reviews.Content: What a great gem of a hotel. Location - If you want to be a 15 minute walk from the Colosseum, a 10 minute walk from the heart of Ancient Rome, Have ancient ruins that lead into the Jewish area 2 minutes walk away, 30 minute walk to the Spanish Steps, 25 minute walk to the Trevi Fountain, 20 minutes to the Pantheon, a 45 minute walk up the river to the Vatican, a 5 minute walk to teh fantastic restaurants of Trastevere then please stay here. From Claudia on the front desk who would always welcome you back from your day sightseeing with questions about where you have been to her knowledge and helpfulnes of planning the next day was fantastic. We stayed in a room on the first floor and to be honest this is something i am never keen on in a city - safe to say we never heard traffic or noise during our four night stay. Room was nice size, great bed, athrrom was good with powerful shower built into bath. Hotel breakfast ws great - bacon, sausage and egg along with amazing pastries, bread, cheeses and cold meats, drinks of everything you would want - first class. If any of my famly or friends go to Rome and would insist on them staying here - i could not fault it.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Ron_the_Traveller
Reviews.Content: This great 4 star hotel is at a top location in central Rome. Ten minutes walking distance from all the famous sites (Forum, Colosseum). Good, comfortable and clean rooms, very good breakfast. Great service!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: bigal080
Reviews.Content: My fiancé and I went to Florence to visit some family and we wanted to stay in Rome for three nights. I found this hotel and we absolutely love it! It's really nice, clean, modern, and the service was great! The bathroom was a full bathroom with a large shower. I really enjoyed my stay and iwould recommend this hotel to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: on_da_edge
Reviews.Content: I booked into this hotel for New Years Eve, i was given a room on the lower floor, however I preferred a high floor. The staff were happy to allocate me another room on the top floor with a balcony. Very helpful staff, we required a doctor, the hotel sent one when requested and the Doctor was also very friendly and helpful. The location of the hotel is perfect for shopping and all the major tourist attractions. i will defiantely retrun this year for a second trip!

Reviews.Title: “Simply Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Daniel H
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel which just finished off a superb break in Rome. Couldn't have asked for anything else and the breakfast's are gorgeous and excellent value. If we would ever be lucky enough to go and visit Rome again, we'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel, great service and perfect location to explore the main sights.”
Reviews.Author: walkerspad
Reviews.Content: A lovely,modern and spotlessly clean hotel. The staff could not have been more friendly or helpful. Beautiful rooms. We booked a standard room and got a 5th floor room with a balcony. Although it was not included we asked for wifi and the receptionist said this was free and gave us a code. I had mentioned on booking that we were celebrating our wedding anniversary and there was a card and a bottle of wine waiting for us in our room. Breakfast was very nice with hot and cold choices. We walked everywhere and it felt a very safe area. Colleseum is just around the corner. Vatican is further but a nice walk along the river. Just across the road is a bridge over the river to the Trastevere area. This is a fantastic place to stroll the cobbled streets and there are lots of lovely places to eat at very reasonable prices. This hotel is in a perfect location. If you are flying with Ryanair, this hotel is featured in their in-flight magazine and if you present your boarding pass you get a free drink on arrival, free wifi (which we were given anyway) and a free room upgrade subject to availability. If going to Rome again I would not stay anywhere else. Don't hesitate to book, you won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Frederica84
Reviews.Content: We were in rome for a few days last summer and we stayed at the fortyseven hotel. I must say the location was great and it was easy to walk everywhere from the hotel. The rooftop terasse was also quite nice. We went for drinks there after our day in the city. The rooms were ok. The bed was comfortable, but I don't have anything special to add. Breakfeast was good...I especially liked the coffee. The service was not great however...when we ordered a drink it often take more than 20-25 minutes for someone to come see us and take our order. Plus we did ask for dinner recommendations, and we were not always very satisfied. I would recommend this hotel as the location and rooms of this hotel were good...however if you are going for a special occasion or are really looking for a 5 stars experience, I would look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great, friendly front desk staff.”
Reviews.Author: dumb_screen_name
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed my stay here. The front desk staff were especially nice and helpful. The location was very convenient to much of the sightseeing. I never did get to the rooftop restaurant to eat because all the days I had free they closed it for a private party. Plenty of good restaurants nearby in any case. Also the hotel is close to the river where there is a trail down by the water that was very nice for running or walking.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Perfect Rooftop Views”
Reviews.Author: piglet0576
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our dream trip to Italy, visiting Venice, Florence & Rome in August of 2007. I realize this is a bit dated, but I meant to review earlier. After searching all the reviews and tips on Trip Advisor, I booked the Fortyseven hotel for our visit in Rome. We were a little nervous having never been to Italy before, but were very happy once we arrived. The hotel was very modern, up to date & clean. Check in was super easy and our room was ready, they even had champagne waiting for us for our anniversary! The location of the hotel was fine, not right in the midst of everything but certainly within walking distance. We only used a taxi once the week we were there, walked everywhere! So bring good walking shoes and sunscreen! Make sure to visit the Trevi Fountain, Forum, Pantheon, Coliseum, Castel. Spanish Steps. St Peters, & the Vatican! The best feature of the hotel was the rooftop bar. The views during the day are amazing, but at night spectacular! We would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Impressed by the staff”
Reviews.Author: Valextra1981
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here in mid-December for 3 days and it was perfect. Excellent location, beautiful room, stunning views across Rome from the terrace and faultless customer service. The staff couldn't have been more attentive and hard-working. Thank you to Marco, Alina and Lory for a wonderful stay. Thank you again!

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite Hotel - Perfect Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Nick M
Reviews.Content: I took my wife to Rome for her 40th birthday and, after a lot of internet searching for a decent last minute package, we chanced upon this absolute gem of a hotel. Situated literally on the banks of the Tiber the 47 is not only perfectly situated within the bounds of ancient Rome for tourist forays and sightseeing, but is also only within 10 minutes walking distance of the Trastavere district's numerous authentic Italian eateries just across the Tiber. The room was excellent with all the usual facilities - very stylish too. We had two single beds made into a king but it was not noticeable that they had been pushed together. Transport links are very good with a plentiful supply of buses stopping 30 seconds from their front door which can take you to the farthest reaches of the capital. However, what made the whole experience special for me was that the staff were very attentive, especially Alina and Lorenza at the front desk. Nothing was too much trouble for them and they both went out of their way to ensure that my wife's stay was a memorable one at their hotel - a hotel of which they are both obviously very proud. Ladies, thank you to you both.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: deenaelattar
Reviews.Content: Perfect location.. Walking distance to almost everywhere and very convenient bus stops a few steps from hotel.. Rooms are clean and spacious (putting in mind you're in Rome) and concierge staff are really knowledgeable and friendly and would go out of their way to make your stay enjoyable..

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful, comfortable hotel!”
Reviews.Author: E_from_DC
Reviews.Content: This was easily the nicest hotel we stayed in during out 10-day swing through Italy. The rooms were huge by European standards (and fairly standardly spacious by American as well). The bathroom was first rate - I could have lived in our tub, and the shower was excellent. One of the nicest amenities were the soundproofed blackout shades on the windows too - really helped with jet lag adjustments. There really was not a single comfort that the room didn't offer. The hotel itself was very nicely decorated in common areas, and the roof restaurant/bar was fantastic. One of the best meals we had in Rome was at the hotel's restaurant, in fact, and yes, you pay for the view, but it's a FANTASTIC view. In advance of our trip, I'd contacted the hotel for help in arranging transportation to the airport, and they were very helpful, but overall, I'd say the service could be spotty. There were two people who worked the front lobby who were super, and two people who seemed a bit put out by any requests for help/questions. I'd stay at this hotel again in a heartbeat, and have already recommended it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in rome”
Reviews.Author: renaldoc
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, close to all sites, and best breakfast buffet ever

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Handle_11
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here twice and loved it both times. Ideal location between the Roman Forum and the Colosseum The staff is friendly and very helpful. The buffet breakfast is excellent and the Circus restaurant offers not only a wonderful menu, but also excellent views of many historic sites and the Tiber.

Reviews.Title: “Great location beware of the exchange rate”
Reviews.Author: scalscorpio
Reviews.Content: This is a very quaint boutique hotel that is very modern and clean. Staff is minimal, but very helpful. I would recommend this hotel as this is an excellent location and you can walk to the ruins, which is a must see. They also have a nice gym downstairs to use. The only issue I had is that the hotel charges an 8% surcharge to exchange money, which to me seems quite excessive. The hotel is also off of a busy street so make sure you do not get one of those rooms as it's way too noisy. We had to switch our rooms as I couldn't sleep.

Reviews.Title: “delightful”
Reviews.Author: thewac0kid
Reviews.Content: Checkin was easy, especially when the taxi drove onto the sidewalk to unload us. A busstop outside makes public transport convenient. It takes a minute to get to Piazza Venezia and service is very frequent. Lobby, breakfast area, and indoor patio are very relaxing. There are several elevators at different areas, so once your room is located, its only a short walk to one. The room was modern, comfortable, quiet, and well designed for storing luggage. Breakfast was great. This was our first trip to Rome and we will be back here definitely.

Reviews.Title: “Just as good third time aroumd”
Reviews.Author: ExperiencedInsight
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a four day break in a junior suite. This was our third stay here and standards appear not to have slipped. Very comfortable room on the fourth floor-slightly quieter than lower down and equipped with effective individually controlled air conditioning. Just as well as the weather was unseasonably warm in early December, Pristine housekeeping. Spacious room by Italian standards with an extremely comfortable king sized bed.One small blemish was that neither of the two TVs had good pictures especially on the only two English Language channels and the so called internet tv verged on the unusable.We typically travel without laptops and tend to use the hotels own systems but to be fair this was no more than a minor irritation. Reception and service standards remained very good although not quite as enthusiastic as during our last visit in February. Great location as the hotel is away from the centre but near many major attractions and within walking distance of most places.A busy location certainly but close the windows and seal the shutters and you would never know! Had dinner in the Circus Restaurant overlooking the area on two occasions Great views especially in winter when the Tiber is more clearly visible owing to the lack of leaf cover. Some of the best service we have experienced anywhere at dinner. Cuisine adventurous with some particularly unusual combinations and high quality throughout.The " Roman Tradition" part of the menu offers the best value.Wine prices in line with the upper end of the market but with a comprehensive and not prohibitively priced range. Excellent desserts. Breakfast on the ground floor was also fine although it lacked the rangeof the very best and they managed to run out of croissants on one occasion.Excellent coffee and prompt service at breakfast.The hotel attracts a wide range of guests and copes well with everyone. Billing precise and accurate and with a good near wholesale exchange rate in operation.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, suite is terrific”
Reviews.Author: VixStirling
Reviews.Content: an unusual location, Fortyseven overlooks the isola tiberna with limited buildings nearby. i stayed in the suite which has stunning views which is shared when you use the rooftop restaurant. an intimate hotel with approachable staff, definite recommendation

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: TIMMY2Belfast
Reviews.Content: Hotel Fortyseven exceeded our expectations. Fantastic location, lovely cheerful staff, Claudia and her colleagues on reception were great and very welcoming. Room gorgeous, lovely views and quiet thanks to double-glazing and shutters. Bed very comfortable, bathroom so modern and clean. Buffet breakfast fresh and plentiful, staff so helpful. Coffee maker in room great too. Didn't eat at rooftop restaurant but had drinks and a great view in the evening. In short, great value and would not stay anywhere else now in Rome. many thanks for a great visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: carmel1977
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in a great location, within walking distance of all the major sights. Staff were very helpful and breakfast was lovely. Rooms were modern and very clean, I would highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer S
Reviews.Content: Located in a marvellous part of Rome, this small hotel is simply superb. Our room was comfortable, clean and well appointed. You can breakfast in the little courtyard every morning and the fine Circus restaurant has a great food and wine menu and rooftop views of the city. You can walk to just about anywhere with ease from here, and it's worth exploring some of the smaller nearby streets as there are little trattorias hidden away where your companions will be locals rather than tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: KateMccarver
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel perfectly located to see ancient Rome and 5 minutes from great food in Trasevere. Alina in the lobby was great, the breakfast buffet very nice...be sure to ask for a cappuccino. We loved Vincenzo Alla Lungaretta pizzeria, we ate there 4 times and loved it. Simple fresh and delicious and a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel-Great Location in Ancient Rome”
Reviews.Author: 70Fish
Reviews.Content: We recently returned home from an eight day stay at Hotel 47. The location is excellent within walking distance of all of the major sights in Rome. We walked everywhere including to the Vatican and Borghese Gallery (although a good hike). Our room on the 5th floor was very clean, had a nice balcony and we did not hear the traffic others have mentioned. The staff was consistently gracious, accommodating and friendly. The breakfast buffet offered a variety of foods. We had dinner and drinks several evenings in the Circus Restaurant on the top floor. The food was excellent with wonderful views. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Special birthday”
Reviews.Author: Liz190730
Reviews.Content: This was a birthday treat from our boys and it did not disappoint. The staff were courteous and friendly. The room was reasonably spacious, clean with a good bathroom. It was also surprisingly quiet given its location on a busy road. It is in an excellent location for exploring Rome being near the Forum and other sights, a short bus ride from the vatican. In the evening we could walk over the Tiber to Trastavere and find a nice little trattoria to eat. MYyonly (minor) complaint would be that they sold us tickets for a tourist bus. They obviously have connections with the company (Green Line) but these buses run less frequently than other tourist buses and stop at 6.00pm. We had to get a train and a long walk home. Otherwise it was a lovely place to stay and we had a surprise cake waiting in the bedroom on my birthday.

Reviews.Title: “5* Star Service”
Reviews.Author: irishkidstoo
Reviews.Content: I can hardly believe that after all these years of reading reviews on Tripadvisor that I'm finally getting around to writing one!. For the most part I've felt that the well rated places I've stayed have hardly needed yet another good review indeed neither does Fortyseven, however they certainly deserve one from me. We stayed here for 4 nights in October 2011 and I can only reiterate all the positive things that have been said on here with regard to the rooms, location, facilities etc. What I can tell you though is that the service is amazing. I stupidly left our house and car keys in the room safe not realising until we arrived back in the UK. With Marcos utmost heIp I managed to get them couriered to the UK (easier said than done), he could not have done more and I am so very grateful to him and his staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: priz54
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights in November 2011. On arrival the staff were very welcoming and provided us with information about how to get around Rome and the best ways to see the sights. Had a breakfast buffet every morning, there wasn't a great deal of choice but the food that they did have was lovely. The hotel was in an excellent location which made it easy to walk around. Would definitely go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent from beginning to end”
Reviews.Author: Kimbrahay
Reviews.Content: A friend suggested, and couldn't have been a better start to our trip. The staff was so friendly, and helpful. A lovely restaurant on the roof, and the manager gave us great hints in the city. The breakfast was a great way to start the day. So close to the amazing sites in Rome. Really a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great choice”
Reviews.Author: Littlehedge
Reviews.Content: Staff couldn't have been more helpful,rooms most satisfactory as was breakfast,we had a most memorable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and good service!”
Reviews.Author: cpape
Reviews.Content: Very nice boutique hotel near ancient Rome and near Trastevere. Nice sized rooms, Good bathrooms. Very nice breakfast. We had an outside room without a view, but it was no big deal, since we were not in the room much except to sleep. Breakfast was very good with a wide variety of selections. The staff is very helpful. They helped us with tips, restaurants, taxis and anything else we needed.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel & Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: paul67Venezia
Reviews.Content: I was at the Fortyseven last week end. The hotel is located nearby the Forum and Coliseum. Rooms are comfortable and the Staff is young and attentive. Do not miss the opportunity to dine on the Roof at the Circus Restaurant food and wine worth one Michelin Star and the view is a breathless expericence, especially on the evening. I think this place is a bargain , really much better than traditional five star hotel as hilton, or other hotel chains. Business center can be improved but when in rome i have no doubt to book fortyseven again

Reviews.Title: “A new five star Luxury Hotel Rome”
Reviews.Author: Colin M
Reviews.Content: We where guests of Fortyseven a couple of years ago and we came back this year with my best friend for 3 nights. The Hotel is situated in the central part of Rome and all the main points of attraction are within walking distance, including the Colosseum, the Trastevere area, Venezia square, Navona square and many others. It is a wonderful location and nearby you can find the mouth of truth, the Colosseum and Venezia square. In addition to the wonderful location, the rooms are tastefully decorated with a beautiful view of Rome, we found the Reception improved. The staff were polite, elegant, helpful and very attentive to the smallest details. Fortyseven seems to have become a beautiful five-star hotel. The change in mood and feel of the hotel is led by a young man we met at the reception Marco Luzietti the Front Office Manager. We had the pleasure of chatting with him while going in and out of the hotel. He anticipates your questions as if psychic, Always friendly yet in command of everything around him ...If Fortyseven were to have a Fifth star they have found it in Marco. I would highly recommend Marco and his staff to make Fortyseven you home away from home in the eternal city of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, Modern Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Emily C
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during our Italian honeymoon in May, 2011. We stayed in one of their two big suites, and overall I thought it was beautiful. Very modern and clean, with an amazing terrace that had beautiful views of the surrounding city. The suite was a little oddly shaped, and you got from one room to the next by walking through very narrow, long hallways. It made the room feel less spacious than it was, but the giant floor to ceiling windows that lined the length of the suite helped quite a bit. We got lovely service from the staff, and the complimentary breakfast out in the courtyard made for a very pleasant morning. I really liked the restaurant on the top of the hotel. They make some fantastic pastas, which I would recommend over their meat dishes. There is also a gorgeous view from the restaurant, especially in the evening. The hotel is also very conveniently located, and we were able to walk to all the main sites during our trip. We had a fantastic time, and I would absolutely recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel All Around”
Reviews.Author: JRWB1960
Reviews.Content: This is a stylish hotel in an excellent central location in Rome. It is an easy walk to the Coliseum, Capitol, Corso, Spanish Steps, Pantheon, Trevi Fountain and Trastavere. The room and bathroom were large and well appointed. The feel is very sleek and modern. The rooftop restaurant provides a great atmoshphere, delicious food and pleasant service. The common areas of the hotel are bright and airy. There is a peaceful interior courtyard to relax or sit with companions. Regarding the staff: they were very accommodating. They were able to provide my early arriving companion with a room and they were very helpful with all our requests. There was one reservation agent in the evening who might consider a transfer to the accounting department due to her lack of people skills, but everyone else made up for her frostiness. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty much ideal”
Reviews.Author: Mr-Choosey
Reviews.Content: GREAT location, fantasitc rooftop bar / restaurant, good breakfast, very comfortable rooms that cut out all the outside noise. I imagine its pretty hard to beat for the price

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: JoseLuisContreras
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights here with spouse. Great location, comfortable rooms, good breakfast included in rate. Located two blocks from Piazza Venezia and opposite Trastevere where there are great restaurants, pubs etc. Rooms are comfortable and relatively big for European standards, TV programming had only two channels in English--BBC & CNN- and for some odd reason wi-fi codes had to to be changed every 24 hours which made the whole thing awkward: who thinks of these user unfriendly things and why does an otherwise perfect service hotel adopt them? Staff was good and tried to be helpful most of the time.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property, perfect location, attentive staff.”
Reviews.Author: Maureen1221
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Fortseven Hotel twice now and are very happy and satisfied with the experience. The entire hotel is spotless and well maintained. The rooms are spacious and surprisingly quiet considering the traffic on the street. The bathrooms are also spacious with a large comfortable shower and a bathroom scale which was thankfully not working. It is very well situated within walking distance of the Colosseum, the forum, the Palatino, Trastevere, Piazza Navona, Campo de' Fiori, the Pantheon, etc. We had no problem walking anywhere we wanted to go. A bus that literally stops at the front door will take you to the Vatican. Breakfast is delicious and the views from the rooftop bar are unbeatable. We would especially like to recommend and thank the excellent and professional staff who always greeted us and always had time for our questions and our small talk. We remembered Alina Manea from our stay five years ago because of her sparkling personality and how helpfulness. Again, she recommended a lovely travel agent who booked our tickets to Naples and was otherwise a particular help to us ensuring a wonderful experience in Rome. Marco Luzietti also was particularly helpful and kind and is an asset to the hotel. Our only complaint would be that the service in the rooftop bar is not very attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Rome”
Reviews.Author: Travelcritic079
Reviews.Content: Rooms are very small.. TV are pretty old. Few choices at the restaurant, very noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and the staff made our stay a delight.”
Reviews.Author: MPorteous2017
Reviews.Content: My wife and I checked in for two nights on a short city break. We were taken aback by the location of the hotel, overlooking the Tiber and less than a minute from the Bocca dela Verita. We had a 5th floor room with a balcony which I would definitely recommend. Throughout our stay the staff were very friendly, professional and helpful. The rooftop restaurant is excellent. We are both keen to return to Rome for a longer stay and certainly intend to return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Staff really go the extra mile!”
Reviews.Author: Robyn H
Reviews.Content: After some difficulty finding this hotel (there was a lot of construction, plus not much signage!) we were greeted by wonderfully friendly front desk staff that did their utmost to relieve our stress after driving in Rome. On finding out we were on our honeymoon, they immediately upgraded our room. We were offered a complimentary drink on their terrace (which is beautiful), and when we got to our room, all our luggage had been brought up from our car. The front desk staff provided us with a perfect two day itinerary, and nearly everything was in walking distance from the hotel. We had lunch there on our second day; food was okay, but the service was great. Our room was spacious by European standards, they provided us with a free code for the internet, and the bathroom was large with a huge glass walk in shower. We loved the in room Nespresso machine as well! They made dinner reservations for us, and when we got back to our room, had placed a fruit tray with a very sweet note on our table. All in all, this hotel was above and beyond what we had expected. The reception staff truly went above and beyond to help us feel comfortable and special. Very good value and a great location!

Reviews.Title: “perfect setting good amenities”
Reviews.Author: suenstu1
Reviews.Content: This break was for a wedding anniversary. The hotel was very comfortable clean and room was spacious. We enjoyed a meal with the rooftop view in balmy evening temperatures. We walked most places from the hotel and staff were particularly helpful with advice on music events with very good language skills. We were very pleased with our choice of accomodation and base

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: dobarann
Reviews.Content: i spent a 3 day stay with my mom last Spring at the Fortyseven Hotel in Rome. The location is excellent, just steps from the " bocca della verita" and the temple of Vesta, across the Tiberine Island, and in a few stesps you are in Trastevere. the archeological walk is nearby and anywhere else you want to stay is just but a few bus stops away. The room was modern, spotless and comfortable, with e nice big bathroom with plenty of light, and all the amenieties necessary. The staff was multi-lingual, and very friendly and helpful with all kinds of suggestions, from what Bus to take ( another convenience: the bus stop is in front of the Hotel). Breakfast was typical of a lot of hotels that cater to an international clientele, I wished for more "Italian flavor" like the wonderful " cornetti" and a real cappuccino, and I was a little disappointed by the blandness of the choices, plus the breakfast room is downstairs in a windowless area, when they have a rooftop bar where breakfast would be a real treat. The price ( for Rome) was moderate, and you definitely get what you pay for, internet access, nice modern rooms, decent breakfats and great staff, plus the location which is paramount in a place like Rome. Overall it is a good choice with great spacious and very modern and clean rooms.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels in the world”
Reviews.Author: Keithcu
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the delightful Hotel Fortyseven for five nights while in Rome on business and fun and loved everything about it. Location: it may seem out of the way on a map, but it's perfectly located for the Coliseum, Roman Forum, Tomb of the Unknown Soldier. Plus, you are steps away from the relatively unexplored Trastevere neighborhood just east of the river. Ambiance: You will feel cooler just staying here. The hotel is small, but not creepy B&B small. The bright, interesting decor makes the lobby very inviting. Its has desks and chairs, which invites you to sit and talk to the staff -- so much more civilized than the stiff reception bars you see in most hotels. The clientele was a nice mix of business and tourists. The staff was always cheerful and helpful even if they didn't really understand the term "happy hour". Room: Big and nice with all the amenities you want. The innovative TV/Desk was really useful for using my computer. I like the way the room uses indirect lighting (see my pictures) and has parquet wood floors and American-style showers. There's even an American electrical outlet in the bathroom. Needless to say the king-sized bed was super comfortable. Breakfast: really nice but not a huge selection. The scrambled eggs were better than usual. Get there early for the best selection of pastries. The little things: Hotel Fortyseven does them all. Free Internet, free newspaper, great rooftop bar, turn down service, blackout shades. I've been some places in my life, and this hotel can stand with hotels two or three times the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Input-from-EB
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful week at Hotel 47! The rooms are clean and comfortable, and not too small compared to others in Europe. Breakfast is included -- a great buffet of hot and cold items, a lovely courtyard setting and newspapers in many languages. The rooftop bar/restaurant has a great view and good food, although it's a bit pricey and the service is not the best...better for a drink than a meal. It's easy to walk anywhere in the city from this hotel...it is located across the street from the Jewish Ghetto, the river and Trastevere, and a short walk to the Collosseum and other sites. The only drawback we found was that it was a 20 minute walk to the nearest subway stop. But since Rome is all about walking, we didn't find this to be a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Soak Up the View and Enjoy the Shower!”
Reviews.Author: Michael J
Reviews.Content: Now this is a nice spot! It's Rome, home of the legendary broom closet bedroom and seriously non-power-shower! Hotel 47 has Great rooms (and real air-con) and great (walk in)showers. Location wonderful too. And the best bit is the rooftop bar and resto. Lovely, friendly service. Yes, it's slow service... it's supposed to be... it's La Dolce Vita. You can walk to a lot of good places to eat and taxis arrive FAST. Go, chill out. And you can go against that old rule about "never eat where you sleep." The food is perfectly adequate, the view, of course, is better.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great experience”
Reviews.Author: sologirltraveler
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel! I stayed here for 5 days during a whirlwind tour of a few European cities, and chose this one based on what I could find on TripAdvisor. The staff was amazingly helpful, and when i checked in I found my room was not as expected, but the gal at the desk made sure i was moved to a much better room at no additional charge the next day. I had a balcony and tons of windows and light and a beautiful view on the penthouse level. The fitness center was a nice surprise; it was in the basement and had some decent equipment. A/C did not work well though. My only beef was the food was not great; I had dinner on the rooftop restaurant on night one, and it was OK but the view was worth it. The next day I ordered a sandwich via room service and it was a goopy mess. However all the great things about this hotel made that not a big deal. Also I thought it was idiotic that when you leave your room and take your key, the electricity goes off in your room (that part is fine, I'm green) but it also shuts off your fridge and any gadgets you are charging! So I never got to have cold drinks or a fully charged iPad. The reason you want to stay here is (besides it being an upscale hotel) the location is PERFECT for walking out your door and going most anywhere. I loved walking over to Trastevere each day and wandering around the churches and side streets. Amazing stay and I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel!”
Reviews.Author: gmakker
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel and the price even makes it better. The hotel was modern and the rooms very nice. While it's not located right around shops and restaurants, it is a very quick walk to everything. We would walk back from dinner at 11PM or 12AM and still there were always people out which at first I thought might not be the case. And even if you take a cab, the cab rides were not expensive. The breakfast in the hotel is yummy. The terrace area is beautiful as well as the rooftop. The hotel manager Marco was awesome. He provided great service. We had one issue with our reservation and he dealt with it perfectly. Some of the other staff while they are were not rude, they were not the friendliest but I found that to be true in other situations and hotels -- so maybe it's cultural. Either way, it didn't take away from the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: mb1sf
Reviews.Content: There are certainly some good things about this hotel but in general our experience was just so-so. The location is good - near all the major sights and a short walk away from Trastevere - but it is located on a major intersection and the traffic all day is non-stop. Actually just crossing the street during the day is a major feat not to mention the relentless noise. The rooms are fine but nothing special - we spent little time in our room so basically needed a place to sleep. The breakfast is good. The service is hit and miss - sometimes great but other times indifferent. The rooftop bar/restaurant offers a wonderful view of the city and is really special. But I would probably not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “All in all, a very good hotel for a week-end gateway”
Reviews.Author: charlotte_reviews
Reviews.Content: I work in the hotel industry and have travelled extensively around Europe on Business or Leisure. I know how difficult it is to find a decent hotel in Rome whithout spending a fortune. After several unlucky atempt with other properties I have finally found my "go to place" while staying in Rome and I would definitely recommend it to anyone planing a trip to Rome! Service and staff is overall very good (especially Marco and Giulia), room is nice and clean and if you are lucky some rooms have an AMAZING view (ask if available upon check-in and they would do their best to accommodate you). We were even able to get into our room at 11AM as our flight landed early and were given late check-out at 1PM! Great experience, I will be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I have ever stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: nedderfredder
Reviews.Content: This hotel was phenomenal. I have stayed at a few spectacular places, and even the St. Regis in Rome, but this hotel took the cake--great rooms, great (included) breakfast, clean bathrooms, great cleaning staff. The best of all, though, was the staff. They were soo helpful (although some of them were sassy mcsassersteins, which was not so appreciated), and I think that was the real difference from other bigger hotels. It was a personal place to stay, and they always remembered what room we were staying in and that we were on our honeymoon. They kept some of our big bags safe when we went to another hotel overnight as well. They directed us to great restaurants and made reservations, and stepped in in a paternalistic fashion to prevent us from going to the San Lorenzo neighborhood, which we ended up going to anyway with minimal scariness. Also, the showers were big enough for my very tall husband.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Havlat
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed this hotel. The location is ideal, close to Trastevere for dinner and drinks at night. Centrally located to all the major sites for sightseeing during the day. The rooms and hotel are contemporary, clean and inviting. If noise is an issue make sure you ask for a room away from Via Luigi Petroselli. It is a busy road with all sorts of traffic all night long. The breakfast is good, there are some warm choices such as scrambled eggs, ham, sausage - which were nice to have after staying at other Italian hotels with only cold options. The seating was always busy in the breakfast room/courtyard, but we never had to wait to sit. They provided two free welcome drinks at the roof top bar when we arrived. The rooms are very nice. The windows are very good acoustically. The washrooms were very clean and had a large shower in our room. Standard TV with only MTV, CNN and BBC for the english speaking channels. The staff was my only concern with this hotel. Sometimes it didn't feel like they were happy to be there.....it was hit and miss, sometimes great service, sometimes it seemed an ordeal to deal with us.....but was generally better than not. We recommend this hotel. A clean, modern alternative to many other hotels in Rome. And the the price is good.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChalkyD
Reviews.Content: We arrived by taxi and thought we'd been dropped off at a tax office; lets say the exterior was a little annonamous to say the least. However we were in for a suprise because as we found out over the next four days, the Fortyseven was a lovely little hotel. We had an excellent view from our clean and well furnished and apointed room. The service and level of help from the reception staff was excellent and all in all we can recommend this to anyone travling to Rome. It is in a quiet location but is within walking distance of most of the main attractions and has a bar and restaurant on the roof with views to die for.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: lemon38
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights, September 2nd and 3rd. Sparkling clean and comfortable beds. The rooftop patio is a great place to enjoy a drink and dinner.

Reviews.Title: “We would go back to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Carlo and Danie... M
Reviews.Content: Marco and Alina, the front desk staff, were very helpful and friendly. Marco made great efforts to accommodate our requests, and was very detailed, concientious, and arranged tours and cabs for us. Alina provided us with information and helped us with taxi cabs. Other staff at the hotel were friendly, but sometimes had to be coaxed into helping us with our information requests (which according to the hotel's manual were part of the services). We had room 410 and it had a wonderful view of old roman monuments. The Hotel is ideally situated for exploration of ancient rome, with many ruins just outside your doorstep and within walking distance. The room we had was spacious, clean, well appointed, and had all of the amenities. However, we found the airconditioning to be very quirky. When we approached the staff about the airconditioning and we were made to feel like the stupid tourists who didn't understand anything and that we were telling tales about the a/c. They blamed us for the a/c problem by accusing us of having the window open all day, but we did not have the window open all day, we had just opened (to see if we could catch a breeze from outside, but there was none to be had) and closed the window upon our return to the room. Thereafter, the airconditioning still continued to have its quirks for the rest of our stay, so we just dealt with the A/C quirks on our own from then on. Most times the airconditioning shuts off after a while and even when the room is warm for a long while and the temperature rises in the room, it doesn't turn back on by itself, and it does not turn back on with any touch of the thermostat buttons; we found the trick to it was to re-open and close the window whenever the a/c stopped working and the room was still warm for a long period of time. The other quirky thing about the hotel is that it could take a full day to collect a food tray that is left in the hallways for pick up. Anyway, these are minor things, and apart from that the hotel great and all its staff are nice enough. The roof top restaurant and bar is nice and so is the ground floor courtyard. I also liked the use of the in-room nesspresso machine. Another good thing is that the staff are very visible at all hours of the night. If you are going to visit the Colosseum, we recommend getting the Roma Pass ahead of time, as it helps to surpass the Colosseum line ups. We also recommend the Underground and Roof Tour of the Colosseum, it was only 9 Euros per person in addition to the entrance fee. Apparently this is a relatively new tour that I believe is offered directly through the Colosseum. You can pre-book the underground and roof tours in English (we found the number through tripadvisor, but be sure to have the right number as some tours of the Colosseum are offered by other agencies) . When you get to the entrance of the Colosseum, ask the Colosseum staff where you can pick up your tour tag and the staff will point the way for you (the tour tag is to be picked up before you go through the the final turnstiles into the colosseum itself). We also recommend the Piazza della Rotonda on a Saturday night: its in front of the Pantheon and there was a opera singer street performer in the Piazza, and there were nice indoor/outdoor cafes, a water fountain with steps, horse and carriages, and very charming romantic. We also recommend, at night, Piazza Navona which is a spacious Piazza with street vendors, and nice outdoor/indoor cafes, water fountains, and street performers, and beautiful buildings surrounding the piazza. We hope you enjoy your stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel- a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Linda181
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a second stay at the Hotel 47 in Rome (also listed as Fortyseven Hotel). This time our stay was for a week. There simply is nothing negative we can say about the hotel, the staff, the service, the rooms and the location makes this one of the best hotels we have stayed in on our many trips throughout Europe This year our daughter and her best friend joined us and we were given two rooms next to each other on the 5th floor. It was their first time in Rome and we wanted them to have a great experience. The hotel arranged for a car to both pick us up at and return us to the airport. It is worth the extra $15.00 over what a taxi would cost, to have a knowledgeable friendly driver greet us at the airport after being en route for 12 hours. We had two rooms with balconies overlooking the church of Santa Maria in Cosmedin and a small park with a fountain. The view is wonderful; the rooms very clean and spacious. Rooms 506 and 507 have a full tub, wonderful to relax in after a long day of walking and sightseeing. The A/C was also pleasantly cool after long days in the sun. But more importantly, the staff is most accommodating- everything from converters, to taxis, bus tickets and directions. Marco Luzetti, the Front Office Manager, who is on duty Monday through Friday during the day was just fantastic. He is knowledgeable, friendly, and makes one feel as if you are a guest in his private home. According to my daughter, he is also quite handsome. Marco spent a considerable amount of time dealing with Alitalia for us. This is something we could not have accomplished as it required fluency in Italian. His staff, Jillian (afternoons) and Darnya (weekends) were well trained and always pleasant, cheerful and helpful. Valentino, the bellman, was always accommodating and welcoming (ask about his two children and you will see the biggest smile in Rome). All the staff is fluent in English, and very tolerant of our attempts at Italian. The morning breakfast buffet is served in a wonderful and comfortable open air patio on the first floor, and is excellent: fresh fruit, yogurt, creamy scrambled eggs, bacon, breakfast sausage, toast and fresh croissants, cereals, cold cuts, juices and coffee. There is something for everyone. The staff serves cappuccino and espresso – a nice way to start your day. For those that have indicated the hotel is out of the way, it truly is not. The only way to truly see Rome is by walking. The restaurants and night life in Trastevere are a 10 minute walk. The area called the Jewish ghetto (with some excellent restaurants – try Nonna Betta) is also a 10 minute walk. Piazza Navona is another 15 minute walk with its fountains, mimes, street artists and surrounding restaurants. We easily strolled up the Aventine hill in about 20 minutes to the see the Garden of the Oranges, and the Knights of Malta keyhole. Peek through this keyhole on a piazza designed by Piranesi in 1765, and you see a garden path that ends with bushes perfectly framing the dome of St. Peter's in the distance. The Coliseum is about a 20 minute walk or so from the hotel. St. Peters Basilica and the Vatican museum (a must see) would be better by bus ($1.45) or cab (about $12.00); but we walked back along the Tiber. It takes about 1 hour at a leisurely stroll. There is a bus stop just outside the hotel door. The rooms have motorized shutters which, when closed, drown out the noise and the light. All in all a perfect place to spend your time in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Gem in the heart of ancient Rome”
Reviews.Author: iolanta
Reviews.Content: Liked everything about the hotel: friendly & very helpful staff, location is just perfect, room was clean, lovely breakfast, comfy court yard and gorgeous view from the roof restaurant accompanied by DELICIOUS cocktails! Welcome drinks was an unexpected and a very pleasant gesture that set up our mood for the whole trip. Overall, referring to my staying-in-hotels experience, 47 has a Great value for money ratio (standard room for 170 Euro, free wi-fi connection, comparing to 370 euro paid before in a wow-oh-la-la-famous-dolce-vita hotel for a room with chipped and cracked walls, completely worn out carpet and old as this world furniture, never mind the smell and noise). So I would strongly recommend FortySeven for all my friends who will travel to the eternal city!

Reviews.Title: “Thank you for the perfect start to our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: AmaWW
Reviews.Content: A great start to a honeymoon. This review is a year late but this is one of the hotels my husband and I still talk about. The booking process was very easy, and the reservation agent was absolutely helpful. She provided lots of information and answered many of our questions. She helped us arranged our transportation from the airport to the hotel. When we arrived at the hotel, we were directed to sit down at a desk. The check in process was very personalized. The bell men then escorted us to our room and gave us a quick tour of our room and to make sure we were happy with it. It was very large room, clean and we also had a top floor with a balcony. Bathroom had lots of room and my husband loved the fact that they had decent sizes of soap, shampoo and other amenities. The hotel sent us a bottle of wine for our honeymoon. We were also quite impressed with the hotel’s restaurant (The Circus). Our food was cooked perfectly. The atmosphere on the patio was very relaxing. Our room included breakfast. It was actually a good breakfast. The breakfast was held downstairs on the main floor. It had a good selection. The hotel location was perfect for us. We were able to walk to everywhere. Our experience at hotel 47 was absolutely wonderful. When we come back to Rome, we plan on staying with you again. Thank you giving us a great start to our honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent, cosy hotel at the centre of everything”
Reviews.Author: AnnoymousHongKong
Reviews.Content: This is the first time we stayed in this hotel. It is situated near River (Fiume Tevere) and is about 30 mins from the airport. The hotel has arranged a car to pick us up. It costs 50E. Taxi may cost 40E if you bargain, but with a girl with us, the pre-arranged transport which took us right to the hotel suited us well. It is a boutique hotel. The room is comfortable and clean. The breakfast is excellent, as well as the service. Staff are friendly and helpful, except sometimes they may be too busy and you have to wait for their service. The best part is that it is situated at a quiet corner, but it is close to many popular tourist places. It is 10 mins on foot from circo massimo, about 20 min on foot from Colosseo, and about 25 min on foot from Trevi Fountain. It also has a nice terrace at the top of the building which gives you a nice view and is a good place to have a drink in the hot afternoon. There is also a nice reading room where computer facilities are provided free of charge. Certainly value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Hip, elegant, friendly and lovely hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Maria S
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here 3 nights, August 13, 14, 15, 2011 and were thrilled at how lovely, modern, spacious, attentive and delicious we found "47" to be. The rooms and amenities were fabulous. The breakfast every morning was delicious. The staff was very resourceful and offered lots of suggestions for places to eat and how to walk there, which we did.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: window_seat0
Reviews.Content: I had walked past this hotel a few times on previous visits to Rome. Our original thought was that it seemed in a kind of no-man's-land, on a busy artery, with nothing much immediately around, in terms of quaint café or terrace. I still was curious about trying the place, so we booked this hotel for our Rome visit this year and we were pleasantly surprised. First pleasant surprise is even though we had located on a map, we had not fully realized, but this hotel's neighbourhood is in fact Trastevere, a two minute walk away and across the river. That is in fact where we hung out in the evenings and found drinks and dinner. Second pleasant surprise was how quiet the hotel rooms are, even in this busy location. Third pleasant surprise was a fully functioning AC system that provides pleasant comfort in Rome's blistering August weather. The rooms are well appointed, and comfortable, high ceilings and amenity-rich. Breakfast was nice and plentiful, and eaten on a lovely terrace in the hotel's courtyard. Free wifi was a nice touch. Hotel employees were courteous and pleasant. It made our quick two-night Rome stop very pleasant experience. We would certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Would HIGHLY recommend this hotel - A+”
Reviews.Author: Crunchberry327
Reviews.Content: Been meaning to write a review and finally doing it since it came up AGAIN at dinner tonight what a fabulous hotel this was. Had 2 rooms, one for the kids, fantastic check in, food, ambiance. Just a very enjoyable stay, personnel were more than helpful, comfortable - would highly recommend for anyone and will def. be coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Roman Walks”
Reviews.Author: jdub89
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel is well located for those interested in walking to several different neighborhoods - the Trastavere, the Aventine, Campo de' Fiori, the Ghetto are the closest. Just understand that you will need to walk a bit to get to a restaurant or shop. The closest major tourist destinations are the Forum and the Palatine Hill, although their are quite a few smaller attractions right outside the door. We stayed for 6 nights over the New Year. The common areas were nice, fairly small and a little cool. There was an outdoor area that looked quite nice, as well. The breakfast buffet was ample, with eggs, sausage, breads, yogurts and cheeses. Their rooftop restaurant also looked quite nice, with gorgeous views of the Tiber. But with so many choices, we never got around to eating there. The room was clean, modern and fairly large. I really appreciated the electric shutters that completed blocked light and dampened any street noise. The bathroom was large, too, with a nice deep tub. The bed was comfortable with switches to control any light in the room at the bedside. I also really liked the closet. The room didn't have a lot of personality, but won on modern functionality. And that is the overall feeling of the hotel. I think the hotel is a great choice if you're not interested in staying in a tourist area and are more keen to take leisurely walks around the neighborhoods of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Very Good Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Eager_TravelerNY
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights in a deluxe room. We had no trouble with noise, and the room and bathroom were very nicely appointed. The hotel location was excellent, right near the Jewish Ghetto and close to antiquity sites and the Tiber River. Service was a bit uneven... some of the staff were absolutely great, and some acted as if they couldn't be bothered. We'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel in an ideal location.”
Reviews.Author: Botto
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the 47 hotel for 3 nights in July. The main reason we chose this hotel was because of the location and it didn't disappoint. We had a standard room, which was spotless, a good size, well-equiped and had a large bathroom. Our room was facing a busy road, but because the rooms are double-glazed, we couldn't hear the road noise with the windows shut. Breakfast was good - there was a good selection of continental breakfast items and also a few hot items such as eggs and sausages. My only niggle about breakfast was that you couldn't help yourself to coffee/tea and because the staff weren't eager to take our order, it was a bit of a hassle to get a hot drink. We had a few drinks at the roof terrace bar, which had great views over the forum and the river. The bar is on the expensive side, but it's probably worth it for the views. We didn't eat at the restaurant, even though the menu sounded very nice, because it seemed very overpriced in comparison to similar restaurants in the area. The location of the hotel was very good. Circus Maximus, the Forum and the Colesseum are very close by. Also, from there, it was easy to get around the rest of the city (with the exception of one day, when there was a Metro strike!). Also, the hotel is very close to the Travestere area of the city, which is just over the other side of the river. This area has lots of good bars and restaurants and also, in the summer months, each side of the river is lined with market stalls, bars and restaurants. This area is much less touristy, so more chilled out and food/drink prices were much more reasonable. Overall the staff at the hotel were friendly and very helpful, especially the reception staff, who recommended to us a lovely enoteca to visit for an aperitif. They were happy to help with any of our requests (taxis, restaurant bookings, etc). The bar/restaurant staff were good, but unfortunately, not that attentive, even when it was quiet, so it was sometimes a struggle to get served. Re: visiting Rome, if you are going to visit a few of the major sites and museums, its probably worth buying a Roma pass, which includes free entry to two attractions, discounts for others and free travel. If possible, I would suggest buying this in advance because it means that you can skip the queues for the first two places you visit. However, as there was a Metro strike when we were there, we didn't make good use of the free travel. Apparently strikes are quite common on Fridays in the summer, so it might be worth checking if one is planned. Overall, I would definitely recommend staying at this hotel. All aspects of the hotel are really good and the location is ideal for a short stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: arctic187
Reviews.Content: The hotel has an excellent location right by the roman forum/colleseum and across the river from trastevere. The staff was very friendly and helpful throughout our 3 day stay. The included breakfast was an amazing spread with eggs, bacon,sausage, fruit, cheeses, and baked goods. Everything was delicious. The hotel has a beautiful courtyard to sit and relax after walking all day in Rome. There is also a rooftop bar/restaurant with an amazing view. Only went up there for some afternoon coffee but a nice quiet place to sit and look out at the view. Also did a jogging package which included a running tour. It was a 40 min run at a comfortable pace with a guide who points out some interesting sites. The focus of the run is to take you through some nice areas for a relaxing run so it's not a heavy touristy educational thing, which is a good thing, you get to enjoy the run and the view and occasionally get some info on the sites. Would definitely recommend staying here!

Reviews.Title: “I would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: Texas_Girl999
Reviews.Content: I agree with others that reviewed this hotel in saying that the rooms were decent and generally clean. HOWEVER, we too did not find the staff overly helpful or friendly.
