Rest of the hotel was rather sterile. Location was on the dark side of town albeit it a mile or so walk to some of the main attractions. But the ace of all spades was that we had $1200 cash taken from the room and a charge card, of which someone went on a spending spree to the tune of $15,000 USD. All within a 5 mile radius of the hotel. The hotel manager appeared helpful but quickly went silent. So other than a "sorry for my loss", it has been left to the credit card fraud department to investigate.... There are many great hotel options in Rome that are willing to earn our business as tourists. This is not one of them.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Superb”
Reviews.Author: Stewy130
Reviews.Content: We travelled extensively throughout Britain and Europe in June/ July, staying in either 4 or 5 star hotels all the way. Hotel 47 was, by far, quite simply, the best hotel we stayed in. The staff were elegant, engaging, very helpful and gave close personal attention. We arrived nearly two hours early and yet no mention of this was made as the beautiful and highly professional Alina greeted us, checked us in and did everything in her power to assist us. Luggage was conveyed to our room on the spot by the very obliging Valentino, who then took the time to show us how the coffee maker, electronic blinds and air conditioniing worked. This very friendly, personal attention was consistent throughout our 4 day stay. Our room was superb in its view, decor, fittings and spaciousness and the air conditioning was extremely effective, despite every day of our stay being over 30 degrees ]. Bed and pillows were very comfortable. Hotel 47 staff also assisted us in arranging day excursions in and around Rome, even telephoning service providers, without our knowledge, to confirm transfers and prompt pick up etc. It goes without saying that all of the staff we encountered spoke English fluenty. The rooftop restaurant has a wonderful ambience, view and menu and certainly enhanced our experience of the hotel and Rome. Once again the courtesy and warmth of the staff, particularly the personal attention of the engaging David, are of note. When we return to Rome there will only be one hotel for us - Bravo Hotel 47!

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly hotel in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Tatianahairexts
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel47 for just one night. The location is superb, really a short walk from all the sights. We were kindly upgraded to a bigger room which was followed by a nice bottle of prosecco and a card as soon as we walked to the room. I thought it was a nice gesture as it was not necessary. Found the hotel clean, room very nice and the stuff friendly and helpful with directions and recommendations. Those who say the hotel is on a noisy street - it is a little ridiculous. If one comes to Rome for a few days to explore and feel the vibe of the big busy city then it is the right place to stay. If one is after serenity then the best thing is to drive an hour towards the coast. We came for the sights, the buzz, the restaurants and 47 was the best choice!

Reviews.Title: “A Gem of a Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: maklax7
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hotel 47 for a week to celebrate our 10 year wedding anniversary this past October. I was reluctant to write about this hotel because it was so good that I didn't want to spoil a good secret!! However, I promised the staff that I would comment on my stay. We loved the staff, location and the setting. Everyone went out of their way to assist us and make our stay comfortable. They were great with directions, setting up tours, getting taxis, helping us find the right restaurant (including securing reservations) when the one's we wanted to visit were booked. The location is perfect, close to the ruins in the heart of the ancient city and right off of the Tiber. Don't shy away from this place because it is not in a "main" tourist area, it is in an excellent location. Do yourself a favor and stay here, you'll be pleasantly surprised with what is around. There is a short cut to the ruins which are behind the hotel right off of Teatro di Marcello (make a right out of the hotel and walk up the street). You can walk to almost every major attraction from the hotel with the exception of the Vatican in which I would take a taxi, but I think everyone takes one there. The rooms are clean, simple, and modern. The breakfast is excellent...fresh mozarella and tomatoes, great espresso and coffee, prosciutto, eggs, etc. More than enough to hold you over to a late lunch. Roof top bar/ restaurant was cool too. We went there for a drink one night. It was very relaxing and had a nice view. My wife and I would definitely go back. I would recommend Hotel 47 to any person who is going to travel to Rome. Ciao.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Perfection”
Reviews.Author: mkj69
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Rome and stayed at Fortyseven Hotel. It was a fantastic experience. The rooms were very clean and spacious. The buffet breakfast was filling and we were walking distance to all the sights. Marco and his team of employees at the 47 were attentive to all our needs. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: ileanajoaquin
Reviews.Content: An excellent boutique hotel with great location. The staff was wonderful I have to thank all of them, they all went out of their way to help us with our lost bags. Thank you Marco and staff once again for all your help. The rooms are large and comfortable. Another thing to add is that breakfast was included and it was delicious and the courtyard was lovely. I was thrilled with this hotel and will stay here again. Thank you Marco and staff for making our stay an enjoyable one. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, very rude staff”
Reviews.Author: OdinTraveler
Reviews.Content: You'll love the location of this hotel and the nice amenities in the room. But be warned, the staff is extremely rude and curt. They won't answer your questions fully and when they are too busy to do something else they will walk away from you while you're still talking with them. If you can avoid interacting with the staff then you'll enjoy the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Delight!”
Reviews.Author: McBazz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at 47 Hotel during our honeymoon in Rome, April 2011. We loved our experience with 47 Hotel! The location was superb - we walked to every major Roman attraction in 10 - 30 minutes. The staff was lovely - they helped us arrange several dinners and had excellent recommendations overall. Our room exceeded expectations - we stayed in room 406 and had a perfect view of Temple of Hercules Victor and Santa Maria in Cosmedin. We had an oblique view of the Circus Maximus as well. We want their noise and light blocking shutters for our home - they were that good. The morning breakfast was very delicious and the courtyard was perfect. We loved our stay here and cannot wait to return on an anniversary trip!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing rooms, best location and incredible roof top restaurant - perfect early November weather too”
Reviews.Author: B8M5E
Reviews.Content: Perfect November break to Rome - my new favourite city, time of year and a great hotel for it. It is a great starting point for many a trip out, looks great both outside and in, top staff, nice breakfasts too. We had a corner room, which was really big, nice seperate entrance area, great bathroom, all the mod-cons - i think it's great value and was very fresh and modern. Everything in Rome is close to this hotel too (Monument Vittorio emanuele is 5 mins - quite unnerving at night when bells start ringing, in a good way!), you turn a corner and there's yet another amazing building, fountain, side street, restaurants... The view from the hotel restaurant is the best too, and it's always quiet, great food and wine, just sit and chill and enjoy the balmy roman evening. Sun was always shining, yet still was still cool enough to wander round all day. Colosseum at night was incredible. Eat at the hotel restaurant for lunch if you like a peaceful moment, its better than most restaurants ive ever been to, just because of that calm feeling. Trevi fountain is spectacular, especially if it's not too busy because you can really hear the water. Vatican is nice if you catch the guard (military band of some sorts?) playing at 12, otherwise it's a bit Doje's Palace... and Michaelangelos Sistine is best saved for reading in history books. Pantheon is very impressive, with the huge open oculus (i wikipedia-d that ;) ) in the roof and amazing artwork. St Peters square is also lovely, serious amount of obelisks around there. Loads of great streets I'd never remember, so you have to walk around and just find places - then you get your own view, and you'll always come across the main moments - like we did with the Spanish steps, Pantheon and Popolo, they pop out of nowehere! Did i mention you have to eat at the hotel restaurant? If not, also check out the area just over Ponte Palatino - its a nice walk in the eve with the river island Basillica lit up too.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff and a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: The_TravelerUSA101
Reviews.Content: A nice boutique hotel located in close proximity to some of the most beautiful ancient ruins in Rome. The hotel is modern and decorated in a clean and stylish manner. The lobby is small/understated but the center courtyard and reading room are great places to congregate. The breakfast area is fairly spacious and clean. The roof top bar and restaurant are impressive—the views are spectacular and the décor is pleasant. We enjoyed having late afternoon/early evening cocktails up there—it was very romantic. David, was especially helpful and friendly to deal with. He really made us feel at home. Alessandra, a waitress in the terrace bar, was slightly aloof and unfriendly. Get to know David and your experience will be excellent. At the end of the day, you really can’t beat the great cocktails and the view. The hotel facilities are solid 4-Star quality. The staff is friendly, accommodating and most speak English extremely well. Marco and Josephina at reception were both nice and helpful. The maid staff was very good—the rooms were clean and the service was efficient. We had a Deluxe Double room with a balcony. It had modern décor, a nice size bathroom and ample closet space. The room was not huge, but it was fine by European standards. The room had some quirky aspects to it (hot water pressure was erratic and A/C leaked on our last day), but we liked the room overall. The best aspect of the hotel is probably its stellar location within the ancient part of the city. You can walk easily to the Forum, the Coliseum, the Piazza Venezia, the Ghetto and Trastevere. You’re a quick cab ride from other central areas of Rome and the views from the roof top terrace are outstanding. Breakfast was included in our rate and it was enjoyable. Service was good as well. Unlike some experiences at other hotels, the breakfast area never seemed crowded and the staff was never overwhelmed. If you’re looking for a boutique hotel with a friendly English speaking staff and an amazing location, the Forty Seven Hotel is an excellent choice. Some restaurant recommendations— Hostaria Antica Roma on the Via Appia Antica was a fantastic experience. It’s a family run restaurant with excellent food that is housed in a picturesque ancient Roman ruin. The service is great and it’s truly an unforgettable time. Nonna Betta in the Jewish Ghetto offered great food in an understated atmosphere (arguably the best fried artichoke in the Ghetto and the lasagna was delicious). Hostaria Costanza had excellent pastas and was located in a portion of the ancient Pompeo Theatre. The food was good and the setting was even better.

Reviews.Title: “Just Lovely...”
Reviews.Author: PiKinni
Reviews.Content: My first preference in any city is to check out the "Boutique Hotels" as they usually provide that little additional something. Although the check in was a little distracted the staff were actively helpful offering very useful assistance from start to finish of the stay. The rooms are very spacious for Rome and the general layout is befitting of the 4stars this hotel holds along with boutique label it sells itself under. Excellent facilities provided and quiet given that our room was facing a busy road. The "restaurant" was a little pokey but there was a decent selection of food and the service wasn't bad (all in all it fell a little short of the overall standard of the hotel which is a shame really). I will end with the one thing that set this hotel apart from me and showed me that people are attentive in Rome. This was a stay on my birthday and nothing was mentioned to the staff as such (why would I?). Arriving back to my room after the celebrations I was greeted with a small chocolate cake, beautifully presented, with a card with well wishes from the staff. A personal touch which to me indicates that the distracted start was possibly due to the attention to detail that the staff are taking over their clients. The comfort and pleasure to stay here is well worth the expense.

Reviews.Title: “sacrifices not worth the location”
Reviews.Author: europeantravel2011
Reviews.Content: Location...My decision to stay in this hotel revolved around the proximity of the hotel to the ancient ruins (Forum, Palatine, Colosseum) and Trastevere area. The location is the only feature that did not disappoint. On the hotel website the rooms looked updated, sleek and clean...not really. The room rate was on the higher end for a hotel with few amenities, but I thought it would be worth it for a small boutique hotel with what seemed in the photos to be a fresh edge. Instead of location/location/location, the three words that described my stay were dirty/dirty/dirty (see photos). Additionally, the breakfast was very forgettable...the pastries were on the stale side, and each morning the eggs looked like they had been sitting there for hours. Fortyseven Hotel has a good location, but do not go expecting a "boutique hotel"...you will be extremely disappointed. Stay somewhere better (and cleaner), and take a taxi or the bus the few times you need transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location, Setting, Staff”
Reviews.Author: jefsackman
Reviews.Content: Away from the bustle but close enough to walk everywhere. Very nice clean roms. Staff was extra helpful and accomodating. Would stay here whenever in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Luizasch
Reviews.Content: Everything promissed in their website is delivered! It is a really great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service and location!”
Reviews.Author: Wally2000
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my four kids for 3 nights at the end of May. The location is amazing and Alina from the front desk was so helpful and made our stay unforgettable. She helped me make the most out of our short say in Rome. The rooms were a great size and could sleep my family easily and comfortably!! I will definitely be visiting again!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic! Great hotel, staff excellent and rooftop bar/restaurant superb!”
Reviews.Author: MangoBreeze
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Rome with 7 people and far too much luggage in tow only to find out that our prepaid hotel had no rooms for us. Full blown scramble ensued. Forty Seven was able to accommodate us and did so with a gracious and welcoming ease. Everyone went out of their way from the moment we arrived until our taxi door closed at departure. We are fairly particular travelers and each of us would highly recommend 47. Breakfast was a great start to the day and more than normally seen with an included plan. You will be pleased

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: pnordstrom
Reviews.Content: This hotel was an easy walk to many of the ruins all tourists want to see, plus a few surprises right across the street. Even the Vatican was an easy bus ride picked up right on the corner. It was clean and bright, well-appointed, the breakfasts were outstanding, the patio attractive and relaxing, and the staff was always attentive and helpful with advice on seeing the sites or using bus, metro or taxi. Would absolutely stay here again. Terrific restaurant upstairs for a special dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Sparkling Hotel in Ancient Rome”
Reviews.Author: timothychou
Reviews.Content: We just spent 3 nights at the Fortyseven in Rome. First of all, the location of the hotel is excellent. You're in walking distance to the Colosseum, Forum, Jewish Ghetto and Trastevere. Even if you're going to the Vatican or the Borghese, you're 15 minutes and 10 euros away. On top of a great location is a first class staff who helpful, efficient and genuinely interested in seeing you have a good time in Rome. We had to leave the hotel at 3:45AM and there waiting at the entry desk were 5 take out bags with an early morning snack. When we return to Rome we'll surely stay at the Fortyseven.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: laurenj31
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a standard room on the first floor. The room was modern (albeit small) and the bed was comfortable (bed not as hard as I expected, but not particularly soft either). The room was a little loud from street noise, so I’d suggest requesting a room on a higher floor if that might bother you. It didn’t bother us enough to request another room—we were so tired from sightseeing each day that we slept very well. There were electric blinds that did a great job of keeping the room dark and kept out a lot of the street noise. The bathroom was nice with a large shower with rainfall shower head. We enjoyed the breakfast buffet (it was my husband’s favorite of the trip). I enjoyed the focaccia bread and my husband enjoyed the doughnuts the most. We also had drinks one night at the rooftop bar—expensive- but the drinks were good and the view was nice. I thought the reception employees were friendly and helpful. They made a dinner reservation for us and were a big help with figuring out the buses. Free internet was included in our rate, but we didn’t have a 3 pronged adapter, so couldn’t charge the laptop. They did have two computers to use in the lobby—but they were very slow, and one of them had no mouse. We alerted the front desk about the missing mouse, but I guess they didn’t have an extra one to replace it with. I thought the location of the hotel was great. Close to ancient Rome and walking distance to many of the sites. There was a bus stop next door to the hotel which we took to the Vatican and the Catacombs. We also took the bus back to the hotel a couple times when we were just tired of walking.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: GBusiness
Reviews.Content: We stayed two night in two rooms with our children(14 and 19 years old) great service, Alina, Sandra and Marco, all over and above. Rooms clean and well appointed, location, perfect - close to everything - roof bar fun and inviting, great views. Would and will return. Luis Gonzalez

Reviews.Title: “perfect 4star hotel”
Reviews.Author: yannisbouves
Reviews.Content: we stay for 4 days in this hotel and we take the top floor rooms with a balcony.very nice views very clean but little small rooms and very kind staff.The location is fantastic for everything

Reviews.Title: “Did not meet expectations”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl02
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews and paid well over $350 per night for a room expecting it to be fabulous. I'm not sure where the other people are used to staying but this hotel did not meet my expectation at all. The first room we were put in was right off the main road and on the first floor. My husband who can sleep thru almost anything was kept awake by the traffic. Additionally it was not very clean and the decor definitely tired! We asked for another room the next day which was better because it was off an alley but still the decor was tired and I certainly didn't feel it was the cleanest hotel I've ever stayed in. The location is great because you are walking distance to most of the sites and the breakfast was very good. As for the staff, I didn't feel anyone went out of their way or was all that interested in having us there. The hotel itself did look like at one time it had been very nice but I do believe it is time for a rehab and sprucing up if they are going to continue to get upwards of $350 a night for a regular room. Also, while there was internet access it was the slowest I have used I think EVER!!!! Took me 45 minutes just to check in for our flight!!!! One of the computers had no mouse (no one could fix that either as a few people asked) so naturally the other one was in high demand!

Reviews.Title: “5 Star service!”
Reviews.Author: MooYo
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure if mgt truly realizes how special his front desk team is for them. Alina was priceless! She exhibited a genuine interest in making us feel special as well as comfortable. I never write reviews but Alina inspired my first. I would bet that her service results in significant bookings, as everyone desires this level of service and the reviews overwhelmingly support her effort.the house maid was excellent as well. If I had any advice on areas of improvement I would suggest the wait staff in the top floor restaurant take a few lessons from Alina and the front desk personnel. It was the only uninspired service I received the entire time in Rome (as most realize that Americans like to tip for good service). The view, however, is too good to pass up so order yourself a drink and enjoy the view. Save your dining for dining outside the hotel to maximize your stay. And with so many amazing choices- you must experience the wonderful variety. Thank you Alina! If I owned a hotel, I would hire you in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, they went above and beyond”
Reviews.Author: stacey601
Reviews.Content: When I made the reservation, I mentioned that it was our 10-year wedding anniversary. They not only upgraded our room for us, but also delivered a bottle of champagne and a dessert to our room that evening. The staff was extremely helpful with anything we needed. The hotel is walking distance to all of the ancient rome sites and there is a city bus stop just next to the hotel. The staff instructed us on how to catch the bus to get to the vatican across town, etc. The Trastevere district is just on the other side of the river, again a very short walk and nice stroll and had excellent restaurants. We could not have been happier with our stay! We threw a coin in the Trevi Fountain, so hopefully we will make it back to Rome one day, and if we do, we will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & service, but if you want to be close to the centre then this is not for you”
Reviews.Author: Mattgreengate
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay, the staff were very helpful (esp Sandra) and the room was perfect (BBC World reception not great). While crossing the bridge to Trastevere provided unlimited good restaurant choices and hotel is close to colleseum, everything else is a substantial walk incl metro (10 minutes minimum power walk). Breakfast is included and was goos. Major gripe was WIFI is 10 euro extra per day and considering everywhere we'd stayed at in europe is free and this hotel was very expensive, it was bordering cheap.

Reviews.Title: “the very best.”
Reviews.Author: Alivougiouklaki
Reviews.Content: Style, beauty, calm, friendliness, perfect locale. I've stayed at the 47 over the last seven or eight years probaby about seven times, and every time it feels like a stay that can't be bettered, then somehow the next time I stay it delivers even more sweetly than before. It's a truly wonderful place. The staff are kind, attentive : the best. I simply want to say it repeatedly. Hotel 47 : the best in all things.

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: TabSea
Reviews.Content: arrived Friday night for a 4 night stay @ the 47- you cant get a better location than this great hotel. A 10 min walk to the Forum, fantastic restaurants in the old Jewish Ghetto, bus stop 1 min from the hotel. Went up to the rooftop bar/restaurant for some drinks & it was a bit on the slow side- I think it may be a cultural thing rather than a hotel thing- but still...... Great views form up there & a comfortable place to have some drinks. Didnt eat there though- it looked very good from what I saw on the menu & what came out of the kitchen. Our room was on the 1st floor facing the busy street- good windows made it quiet & sleepable. Nice electric roll shades & good curtains make it nice & dark. Comfy bed, nice linens, great towels & a fantastic shower :) Strong water pressure is always the sign of a great hotel :) Nice bath toiletries- bring a bar of soap though if you dont like liquid body wash- also conditioner. Its nice stuff though. We had a suite so Im not sure the size of the other rooms. Very nice. Great breakfast in the lobby- assortment of breads, cereals, meats & cheeses. Helpful & cheerful staff, service with a smile for sure. A safe place to stay- no riff raff lurking outside, mostly tourists going from place to place. Good juices & great coffee.The 1 bummer is that the internet is 10 Euros for 24hrs- not 24 hrs of usage- you get it @ 8am- it expires @ 8am the next day & have to get a new code...... A little irritating. Also- if you are charging something over night- make sure you turn on the right light switch- learned the hard way & had dead camera batteries & laptop in the AM. Not many avail plugs in the room as well- you'll need to unplug a lamp. I think it would be nice to have a clock radio in the room that has an Ipod hook up to listen to music. The wake up alarm in on the TV & its not a pleasant way to wake up. Overall a GREAT hotel. Highly recommended- the cooking class that was on Tripadvisor as the #1 activity- we had a great time & it was great food- & about a 20 min walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel with Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: texaschelle
Reviews.Content: We stay here for four days while in Rome. The hotel is very clean, modern and the rooms were a nice size for European standards. The staff arranged a car service from the airport which eased our arrival. Hotel is a little off the beaten path but we still walked everywhere from it...colosseum and forum, trevi, spanish steps, etc. Staff was very friendly and helpful in answering any question we had. The rooftop restaurant was good and offered a nice view of the town. The breakfast was also very good. Fresh fruit, pastries, meats and cheeses, as well as eggs and bacon. The fresh cappuccinos in the morning were a welcome sight. We had a great stay here and I would highly recommend the FortySeven Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “amazing hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: PJDEFEO
Reviews.Content: we just returned home fro our wonderful vacation in italy. This hotel was extremely clean and updated, We had a wonderful stay, the staff here is so helpful in every single way possible. We were there and had not yet recieved our hotel vouchers from american express and the manager Marco went above and beyond to help us retrieve them. Pietro is so funny and had my kids entertained and told us where all the good shops are. If you needed a cab for anything Sandra and Elaina were righ there to help.I asked elaina for a balcony room, as we were checking in, and she found one for us with no extra fee. . Sandra even called our next hotel in France for me to reserve a dinner and also verified our flighs for us; This is the place to stay in italy.. Very nice rooms They have worked out prices with the cabs, so when we came from the airport for a family of five it was 90 euros, and when i booked it through the hotel it was 70 euro, So let them make arrangements for you. I would highly recommend this hotel, They made dinner reservations for us and also have a wonderfu lcomplimentary breakfast buffet. We had drinks at the restaurant which is outside and overlooks the town,very peaceful. I have two friends going to italy and i have told them both to stay here. Truly amazing hotel. I just cant say enough except STAY HERE!!

Reviews.Title: “You MUST Stay at the 47!”
Reviews.Author: dunnb16
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough about the 47. First: everyone at the hotel as exceptionally gracious and accommodating. We went to Abruzzo for a day and Alina at the front desk even gave us her phone number in case we needed translation help. Second: the room was incredibly spacious--even by American standards. As well, the room was clean and modern. Third, the bathroom was just as clean, modern, and spacious--again even by American standards. In fact, I'd like to have that bathroom in my house! Third: breakfast was complimentary and quite satisfying. Not huge, but good. Fourth: good location. It is a 5 minute walk to Piazza Venezia, around the corner from Circus Maximus, and just across the river from Trastevere. And the hotel gave us GREAT recommendations for restaurants in Trastevere. I can't beam enough about the hotel. All in all, a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: VisualGirl949
Reviews.Content: Amazing! This hotel is perfect. The location, the rooms, the rooftop bar...you name it. Thanks to Sandra at the front desk for the fantastic service. Spend the extra money for this hotel...you won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “A Mordern Oasis in a City Overrun by Tourists”
Reviews.Author: Jenasurp
Reviews.Content: The Fortyseven Hotel was everything we were looking for. It was modern, clean, and in an excellent location. It is right across the water from the Trastevere (the "foodie" area of Rome, if such a thing exists). Literally a 10 minute walk. The staff were very friendly, helpful and spoke excellent English. Many of the reviewers have noted the lack of a reception area, but I did not find this to be the case. There are two lucite tables set up right in the entrance when you come in. They were staffed at all times of the day and night that we walked by and people were always eager to help. It is certainly a more modern approach to a reception, which fits with the overall modernist approach of the hotel. The hotel has a bit of a problem with the thinness of its walls. I was literally kept awake in the night (and then woken up in the morning) in the night by the sounds of people having sex (which is not the most pleasant thing in the world...). And I did not just hear one couple. All of the walls of the hotel are clearly quite thin, so I think the sounds were coming from rooms in all directions. This is not the best thing, but it is something that is easily overlooked in favor of the other possitives. The beds themselves were quite hard, but this is standard throughout Italy it seems. The best aspect of the hotel was the restaurant at the top. I didn't eat any of the food, but they have a LOVELY bar area with absolutely stunning views over the river. The wines are all very well priced, and they serve complimentary snacks while you drink. The bar was also open until midnight, and they let us stay and linger even after they closed up. The breakfast in the morning was also quite plentiful -- with a selection of cerals, yougharts, as well as fresh tomatoes and mozzerella and a selection of various meats. It was quite delicious. The hotel has high-speed internet but only on one hotspot area (there is also a computer set up here for communal use). Overall, should I ever venture back to Rome, I would certainly stay here again. The price was very affordable and the bar was absolutely wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: abmilw
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel by Forum and Palatine Hill (southern Rome). Staff works hard to please. A/C rooms. Deluxe room large for Europe. Rate also included basic breakfast. Good price too. Concierge helpful too.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, good value and perfect for a city break”
Reviews.Author: Cacique77
Reviews.Content: We start here for the w/e on our way back to Umbria which was just perfect. Nice, modern hotel in a good position to get around the city. But more importantly, the staff were delightful and accommodating. They practically insisted we have an afternoon check-out without charge when I said my was pregnant. We'd certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Leicester_Girl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the 47 Hotel in Rome for 6 nights in Feb/March. We booked due to the great reviews on tripadvisor and were happy with our choice,. Location - the hotel is walking distance from everywhere. we rarely caught taxis and used the bus outside for the vatican as it's only 1 Euro each way and the reception at the hotel sell tickets. We walked everywhere else and I was 20 weeks pregnant and it's not distance to the Forum, shops etc. Taxis are also easy to get from outside the hotel and are cheap. Rooms - the room was spacious and had a large bathroom, it was clean and had everything we needed. My only complaint would be that it was noisy. We were woken every morning by footsteps from either next door or upstairs and on our penultimate night my husband did go down to reception and complain about the TV volume. It sounds like we're boring but we're not - we just wanted a lie in on holiday! Value - the hotel was quite expensive but for a lovely 4 star hotel in the city centre, I think it's good value for money. Other stuff - the reception staff were fantastic, spoke various languages and were really helpful with places to visit, directions, booking restaurants etc. Breakfast was also excellent - a really good selection which fills you up for the morning - hot and cold - and it's open until after 10 am. My husband used the gym and it's got good equipment and is modern so a really good plus for the hotel. The hotel also had a roof-top restaurant - we didn't eat there but the views were lovely so worth a visit. You also have to pay for the internet in the room but it is quick. All in all we would highly recommend this hotel - I don't see how you could go wrong!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - Superb staff”
Reviews.Author: stewart020
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a four night stay at the Hotel Forty Seven and both my wife and I could not fault it. Having researched it before booking my only concern was the main road outside. On arrival we requested a quiet room we were given one on the top floor at the back with a balcony and we never heard a sound, it was great. All the staff were great but special mention to the two female receptionists. Sandra who found out it was our 40th Wedding Anniversary had a bottle of champagne sent to our room and Alina who promptly organised an English speaking dentist when my wife developed dental problems. Modern, clean rooms, good location away from the tourist centre, but within walking distance of everything. All together a great experience. Thank you all at Forty Seven. Mille Grazie

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: 2CosmicTravelers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a couple of nights in March 2011, and have concluded that it was a great choice. It's located a stone's throw from the Bocca della Verità, and a 15-minute walk along the river to Trastevere, one of Rome's many distinct neighborhoods. We arrived early at the hotel, but didn't have to wait a couple of hours until the official check-in time. We got checked in rightaway. The room was clean and comfortable, and the bathroom was modern. The room didn't have a view, but that didn't bother us at all since we weren't planning on spending much time indoors anyway. The staff of the hotel was very pleasant and helpful. Alina at the front-desk is the go-to girl. You got a question, you go to Alina. :-) During the course of our stay there, she recommended sites, travel routes, restaurants, and even booked train tickets for us. She was extremely helpful! The hotel supplied us with free electrical adapters (US to European) since we had lost ours. Internet WiFi in the rooms was free too (but required a hotel-supplied password). We hit the buffet breakfast every morning before we headed out for the day. It's great! Cereal, oatmeal, scrambled eggs, sausages, breads, fruit, muffins, yogurt, tea, coffee, and snacks. All in all, a great place to stay. If we return to Rome, we'll definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern boutique”
Reviews.Author: ThamyresVM
Reviews.Content: Its hard to find a modern hotel in Italy. 47 is a very good option when in Rome. The staff is very friendly, the restaurant is amazing and the hotel location is great.

Reviews.Title: “Good base in rome”
Reviews.Author: Wandering_persian
Reviews.Content: I agree with most reviews. 47 is a good base in Rome. Location is convenient, freiendly staff, etc. Just a few points: 1) my room needes some fresh paint and a hardwood wax to loom at its best. Very clean, airy and well appointed though. 2) wireless internet needs some makeover. I had trouble connecting from my room as Signal was weak. Also, you need to get a password every single day from reception which can be annoying, specially that you are prompted to enter it every time you log in. Otherwise, top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing deal for the quality of service and room size”
Reviews.Author: Saradish
Reviews.Content: We have traveled to Italy several times and are aware of the tiny rooms, with tiny beds and bath. We were pleasantly surprised when we arrived at this modern hotel with excellent customer service. Our flight landed at 8am, so we didn't think they would allow us to check in early with out charging us for an additional day. Thankfully, Alina the concierge, checked us in and within a few minutes we were in room. The rooms are large (for europe). First time I have seen a genuine king sized bed in Italy (and we have stayed in reputable hotels). The bathroom is also large and two can easily fit in the standing shower. The staff was very pleasant and couldn't do enough for you. We were even greeted with a bottle of chianti after a day of site seeing. Only draw back is that you can hear street noise (which can be blocked out by light music). Also request high floor room so you don't have to worry about noisy upstairs guests. We highly recommend this place. If you have AmEx, book with AmEx travel, not Centurion to get the 189 euro pre-paid special. At this rate it was truly a steal. At any rate, we still recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and well located for Rome marathon runners!”
Reviews.Author: babydoor
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for the Rome marathon in March 2011. The location is good for the Coliseum and is a short walk to the centre of Rome. Very easy to get to from the Metro station and very close to the river for a nice walk. Rooms are a good size and clean. Overall very good. I would recommend this hotel! Especially if you are going to do the marathon as it is only approx 1 mile to the start line!!

Reviews.Title: “NIce Hotel”
Reviews.Author: zr_travel_Opinians
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for one night only, overall I really liked this hotel, and would stay again were I to visit Rome again in the future. the hotel is nice and clean. the room we had was very nice. and for the most part, the staff is very friendly and professorial (other than one minor incident we had.) All the sights were with in walking distance. I would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: RichieUT
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Italy and this Hotel was a great place to stay. The staff was extremely helpful in pointing out places to see and arranging transportation to/from the airport. I can't speak to the food in the hotel since I did not eat there (i prefer to eat out in places with the locals) but the staff happily recommended restaurants in different areas of Rome. The beds here were some of the most comfortable that I've slept on while traveling through Europe and with the window/shutters closed you could not hear any of the traffic from the street outside. You can easily walk to many of the sights from the hotel although some can be a bit of a hike. There is a bus stop about 30 yards from the hotel door so after two days of walking to see everything from the hotel I started to use the metro to give my feet a break. A couple of the routes that stop at this bus stop get to close to most of the sights you want to see within about a 5-15 minute ride. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very unfriendly and unhelpful staff”
Reviews.Author: loboyle
Reviews.Content: there were four friends in our party and each one of us felt that we were a burden if we asked any question or made any request. I have never spent so much money to feel so unwelcome. My parents are visiting Rome in April and after returning from my stay at this hotel, even though the location was good and the hotel was nice,I advised them to book another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific - location, staff, rooms, restaurant all excellent”
Reviews.Author: Melboyg
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel 47 for 5 nights on a holiday to Rome. Location is great - walking distance to Forum, Capitol, Colloseum and Trastevere with its restaurants and bars. Staff were all very helpful and friendly. Classy reception areas and lounge. Room (classic) had great views and was good size, nicely furnished and very clean. We ate in the rooftop restaurant which was very relaxed and equal to any meal we had in Rome. Breakfast buffet was excellent. Will definately stay at 47 on our future visits to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary Hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: hhennessy
Reviews.Content: We stayed @ the 47 for three nights on a trip to Rome to see the International Rugby match between Ireland and Italy. The Hotel is about a 40 min. drive from Fiumicino International Airport by Taxi and costs approx. €50 euro. The hotel is located just around the corner from the ancient sites of - Colosseum and Circus Circus Maximus. Orther sites are accessible by either a tour Bus or buses that run from literally outside the hotel door ( 81, 85, 95 etc). Which will bring to specific sites for a very small fare. It is also across the river from the excellent night life of Trastevere. The reception staff at the hotel are knowledgeable of how to get about etc. so be sure to talk to them first when planning your sightseeing. The Hotel is very clean and the staff we encountered were extremely helpful and friendly. Rooms are well appointed, tastefully decorated, well designed and very clean. There can however be quite a lot of traffic noise if you like to like to sleep with the window open in your room...otherwise you can close the windows, turn on the A/C and not hear anything...in addition there is a electrically operated window shutter from the bed - that will completely block out the light which was great. In terms of facilities there an small but very well appointed Gym in the basement with state of the art "TechnoGym" equipment, a separate steam room, loungers as well as small changing areas and showers. There is a roof top terrace lounge/dining area with retractable awning roof (unfortunately we were told this could not be retracted this time of year for some reason ? - even though the weather was fantastic) - which was disappointing. The 280 degree or so - vista from the terrace is spectacular looking over the city and river. On the ground floor there is a bar and a separate lounge with complementary newspapers and a couple of PC's for Guest use. Located in the centre of the building is a courtyard - which I believe in summer is used to serve breakfast - but was not set up during our stay. The breakfast itself we found average. The coffee was not good (tasted like instant coffee) which was disappointing for a 4* hotel in Italy - We would have expected excellent coffee as standard. The bread rolls also tasted strange. The Scrambled egg was ok as was the bacon. The over all selection was ok but nothing spectacular compared to other 4* hotels we have been in. All in all we enjoyed our stay at the hotel and would recommend it...We would definitely consider staying here again if we returned to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “47 non basta una time!”
Reviews.Author: popaye
Reviews.Content: As they say roma non basta una vita for this hotel which had the most helpful people at the front desk ( they answered our questions before we asked them!) and extremely friendly and with nice real smiles. as with most people i have travelled quite a bit my mum and dad who were with us have also and we have never seen such friendly people in a hotel. genuinely trying to help. I have never been one to write a review but I just had to for this one as I recommend it to anybody who wants a central location, clean and eco conscious hotel, beautiful quality picture books of giants such as Salgado and bertrand to see at the library and located near the bar no less. the TV in the room was hidden in the cabinet for those who hate to see it looming in every hotel room. on our last day we came back sooner just to enjoy the lovely roof garden and it's vista and that's saying a lot for the hotel as we are the sort who would go explore the city until everything is closed but we just had to have wine, from a very good wine list as well, in this roof restaurtant with beautiful panorama of Tiber and in the mean time got so drunk that broke the wine glass which when offered to pay for it was politely and nicely refused as it was "normal"! We genuinely do not have a bad thing to say about this place. and rome of course the most magical city. do not hesitate book with them and you will see. We loved our stay and would definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: djangocat
Reviews.Content: Modern, comfortable, clean, surprisingly quiet, close to the Tiber, and within walking distance of much of the city. We walked along the river to the Vatican and across the city to the Spanish Steps, both very easily done. The Tivoli Fountain is nearer still and the Capitol a mere five minute walk. We loved our week in the Fortyseven and will probably stay there again when we go back to Rome. No complaints whatsoever, although it isn't cheap!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Horrible Service”
Reviews.Author: Camipoo
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is excellent and the food is great. However, the service quality is very low. I won't go into detail here, except to say that if there is an incident and you complain you will not be taken seriously. The staff, with a few exceptions (like Piero who is very professional and attentive), couldn't be bothered . We will never stay here again and we will advise our friends and family that travel to Rome to avoid it as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, beautiful hotel"”
Reviews.Author: kywillia
Reviews.Content: Can't go wrong here. Service was fantastic, location was perfect. Stayed for 5 days. Room was spotless. Food, especially the breakfast, was great!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent service, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: airfoiler
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to us by a co-worker, and it did not disappoint. The location was excellent; the Coliseum, Roman and Imperial Forums, the Circus Maximus, and Trastevere were all within close walking distance. My wife is a neat freak, and is easily turned off by dirty hotels. She did not have one complaint about the property. We did not eat at the upstairs restaurant, but we did enjoy the excellent breakfast every morning. The food was outstanding. I want to really complement two of the concierge's; Marco and Piero. We did not have any elaborate requests, but they were always able to quickly take care of any needs we had. I did have one misunderstanding about my reservation, but it was something I interpreted incorrectly. My reservation said the room came with internet which I assumed meant complimentary internet. There is no complimentary internet available. I was not there to work, so this was not an inconvenience to me. There are internet access cards available for purchase that will provide internet access. We went across the bridge to Trastevere for most of our meals. Our favorite spot was Ristorante Carlo Menta. It is one block west of the Tourist Information kiosk in Piazza Sonnini. The piazza is on Vialle di Trastevere just south of the Ponte Garabaldi. We did purchase a Roma Pass during our stay in the city. The pass is 25 Euro each, and can be purchased at any Tourist Information kiosk. The pass is good for three days, and allows the user free transportation on the subway, busses, and trams. It also gives the user free admission to the first two museums visited, and discounted admission on other participating museums. We did not effectively utilize the pass, and probably overspent our money. To make the transportation portion of the pass pay for itself, visit www.atac.roma.it. This is the website for the Rome bus, tram, and subway services. There is an interactive portion that will allow a user to enter their departure point and destination. The website will show the user the route and busses/subways/trams to use to reach the destination entered. Overall, we were very happy with choosing the Hotel Forty Seven. We are sad our trip is over, and look forward to many returns to Rome and the Hotel Forty Seven. Rome is a great city, and the Romans are a very nice and outgoing people.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem!”
Reviews.Author: DebMc1980
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for several days in Nov 2010. The contemporary rooms are very comfortable. The bathrooms are small but modern. The breakfast is wonderful. We did not have a chance to try the upstairs restaurant. There is a small fitness center. The employees are very pleasant and helpful. We cannot wait to go back to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lanz
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel, location, service, amenities are exceptional. The Staff goes out of their way to accommodate you, the rooms are immaculate and we were very fortunate to have a balcony with a breathtaking view. Location is perfect; you can walk everywhere. The inclusive breakfast is delicious with exceptional coffee and great selections. Guest Relations, Sandra, was fantastic her recommendation for a quick meal was right on, she also arranged for a car to transport us to the airport at 5: OO AM for a very early flight, the driver was on time and professional. This was our third visit, and though short, couldn't have been better or more enjoyable. Bravo, Hotel Fortyseven!

Reviews.Title: “perfetto!”
Reviews.Author: vacatongal
Reviews.Content: My husband, and another couple stayed here for 3 nights on a recent trip back to Italy. The location is good. It's within an easy walk to Travastere , and a nice walk to the Forum. This is a very trendy, hip, technosavy hotel. The concierge are excellent. We loved the rooftop lounge. Due to a foot mishap, we had to order room service for dinner one evening. The service, and food was absolutely delicious, and the prices were right on target. I would surely choose this hotel again. We walked to the Jewish Ghetto, trastavere, and The Forum easily. The ghetto, and Trastavere have very good food and shopping. Rome is large, and we used some taxis as well as our feet! Again, great hotel. I I

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect!!!”
Reviews.Author: Nunya-79
Reviews.Content: Everything was just perfect! The stuff, room, breakfast - everything! I would defenetly stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, clean, central and friendly”
Reviews.Author: proseUK
Reviews.Content: We stayed at hotel Fortyseven for three nights. We had a great stay, good sized room with lovely bathroom with the best shower ever, perfect after a day of sight seeing. We were on the third floor at the front of the hotel and even with a busy road outside the traffic was not distrurbing at all. The staff were very friendly and helpful and aimed to please at all times. We were ripped off by a taxi driver (hint - taxi ride from the train station to hotel is 10-15 euros, we paid 30!!) Live and learn. Everywhere is walking distance and the roof top bar feels very classy. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Fortyseven - An Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: Jerry96
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had the great pleasure to spend five nights at the Fortyseven in October 2010. The staff was excellent and really tried very hard to be pleasant and informative. I really have to laugh at the few comments stating otherwise. They must be impossible to please. Our rooms (we spent one night in Venice) were immaculate and comfortable. Yes it is relatively expensive but you get what you pay for. The hotel is centrally located and within walking distance of most major sites. We really enjoyed our stay at the Fortyseven and found it to be an excellent experience. We would not hesitate to do so again.

Reviews.Title: “Our favourite Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JennyReid
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic boutique hotel and our deluxe room was the largest room in Europe we stayed in on our recent 3 week honeymoon. The staff was exceptionally helpful, knowledgeable and kind. They provided us with great information. The hotel is in a fantastic location and near many must see areas and restaurants. We had some of our best sleeps in the comfy bed and enjoyed the delicious breakfasts. I would recommend this hotel to everyone while in Rome for a luxurious stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, friendly staff and woderful, large, clean, modern room, huge shower and close to almost everything.”
Reviews.Author: RomeExperience
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 2 nights. The manager and staff were so very warm, friendly and helpful. They definately went out of their way to make our stay the best possible. They helped with site seeing, restaurants, checking on our return flight and a ride to the airport. We were upgraded to a fabulous corner suite with a wrap around deck. Great view - yes it was noisy, but when in a major city, you have to expect noise. When the automatic blinds were down, the noise disappeared. Great bed - firm, but not hard. The hotel is very close to great restaurants and the Coloseum and not too far a walk to places such as the Trevi Fountain. Again I have to say how impressed we were with the manager and his staff. After a long day of site seeing, it's very nice to have a clean, pretty room to come back to with pleasant staff happily looking after your needs. Definately would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, good standards in a busy location”
Reviews.Author: ExperiencedInsight
Reviews.Content: Stayed for five nights and ate in the rooftop restaurant on two evenings. Chose the hotel because of its close proximity to all the main attractions as well as the availabiity of good restaurants within easy walking distance. Service was uniformly excellent. Nothing too much bother for the ever helpful receptionists.Particularly useful when faced with dealing with the aftermath of a wallet "expertly" stolen elsewhere in the tourist haunts of the city. The reception area did however become a little chaotic at times owing largely to the fact that there is no reception area! ! Merely two computer screens with reception operators. No doubt this arrangement confers advantages in terms of flexibility but I personally prefer a more formal set up whereby someone has to remain on duty behind the desk at all reasonable times. Strictly a very minor quibble as the rest of the hotel was well geared to our enjoyment. The de luxe room was immaculately serviced and featured one of the most comfortable king sized beds ever. On an environmental note towels were changed only when requested, a practice that all hotels might usefully follow. The shower- personally prefer a bath as well- was effective and easy to control. The internet on the TV proved cumbersome in the extreme and was only useful for the most basic of web functions.No matter as we did'nt have much time for on line activity and more orthodox web access was available next to the foyer. Our room was on a corner immediately abutting the Via Petroselli so some noise proved inevitable.This can be eliminated almost entirely by recourse to the electronically controlled blinds and shutters but we prefer to sleep with the windows and curtains partly open so as to avoid the uncomfortable feeling of being hermetically sealed in a blackout!! No white wine in the mini bar a small minus. The Nespresso coffee machines were a plus provided that you like your caffeine fix very strong indeed. The Circus rooftop restaurant while not cheap was nonetheless good value. It offered a combination of local roman specialities-some better than others- with a more international cuisine. Wine prices were little higher than the average in Rome where even some of the more modest establishments seem to inflate margins by more than is customary elsewhere. Service was attentive without being intrusive and the setting also made it an excellent place to unwind after a sticky day in the city. Breakfasts offered a wide choice and used lots of fresh ingredients. All in all a very enjoyable stay in bustling modern somewhat state of the art hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel & Staff”
Reviews.Author: Blaaberg
Reviews.Content: Nice room, bed, and bath. Very friendly staff. Location is very good and you can walk to most attractions. A lot of traffic on the road outside the hotel, which could be a problem if you want to sleep in.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for seeing all the sites”
Reviews.Author: raelarder1976
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights to celebrate our anniversary. Room was on the 5th floor and was nice and clean - bit small but I guess that's what you get on a city break! Excellent location - 15 min walk to Colosseum/metro, 10 mins to centre of Trastevere (great for dinner) and 25 mins to The Pantheon. Breakfast was good - lots of choice. Hotel very sweetly left us a bottle of wine in the room as an anniversary present so 10/10 for service :) Ate dinner in the roof top restaurant one night - good food but expensive. If you want a different experience try the mozzarella bar near The Pantheon - called Oblika on Piazza di Firenze - corner Via dei Prefetti.

Reviews.Title: “Overnight hotel”
Reviews.Author: AroundGlobe
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in perfect central position - it's close to either almost all sightseengs (four of them are right on the square where the hotel is) or most of shops and restaurants. It also has a definite style which makes this hotel distinguishable among all other three- and four-star simple hotels (I'd rather call them inns) of the central Rome. But nonetheless I'd never choose it for a long stay. The reasons are: small rooms, bad breakfasts and poor sound-proof. Many of previous reviews mentioned the latter and it's really true - you can hear every word in neighbouring rooms combined with the traffic sounds of one of the most noisy Roman streets.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Beauty in Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: Mike_ATL100
Reviews.Content: We checked into Fortyseven after checking out of a disaster hotel on our first night in Rome. Thank god for Fortyseven which was just everything the other place was not and saved our Roman holiday. First, it is clean, modern, well kept and with a friendly staff. Rooms are large. Bathrooms are very nice. Great amenities and everything worked. Rooftop bar and restaurant was just a great way to unwind after a day of sightseeing. The free morning breakfast in the courtyard was outstanding. Staff was quick with great suggestions and even coordinated a private guide for the Vatican Museum on the spot. One negative is that it fronts a somewhat busy street, but at night the shutters drop with the flip of a switch and blocks out all light and noise. Overall, just a great place to stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, not great service”
Reviews.Author: MirellaBudapest
Reviews.Content: The hotel is within walking distance to Teatro Marcello, Jewish quarter, Forum etc, behind the hotel there is a great bio market on sundays. Our first room was really noisy beacuse of the huge air condition system located on the roof, we asked for another room, they could not give one and the way they handled it was not as we had expected. But finally we got a nice room for the second night. The room was good size, bathroom too. The overall design of the hotel is quite neutral not very friendly. Breakfast is okay, but we had better cornetto, latte macchiato or orange juice anywhere else in Rome. Staff is not particularly friendly except for one guy, Valentin. I would not go back but it was an okay experience.

Reviews.Title: “Our Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: manxgirl08
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very impressive, from the moment we walked into the reception we were wowed! Greeting at reception was prompt, efficient and friendly. We were given a map of the area and the best parts for shopping were highlighted to us - they were great - really brilliant service. We had just arrived that morning from a 10 day honeymoon cruise round the Med. The hotel came to our room with a bottle of wine and a welcome note - which was a lovely touch. We had our evening meal on the 2nd night and it was FABULOUS ! We should have ate here every night, the food was incredible and we had our meal outside - beautifully peaceful and lovely atmosphere. The breakfasts were gorgeous. We had a double superior room and it was the nicest hotel room we've had in ages and a wow bathroom! Always very good housekeeping and the air con was a great welcome. I'd definitely recommended this hotel to anyone - wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location and service”
Reviews.Author: mm3808
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel 47 at the end of Sept, 2010. The location is excellent - just a short walk to the Forum/Coliseum site. Also only 5 minutes to the Jewish Ghetto, Synagoga, kosher restaurants. Many bus lines stop very close to the hotel. The rooms are very clean with excellent amenities. Some reviews criticize the noise especially in the front of the Hotel on Via Petroselli. Our room was on the 4th floor and the windows totally shut out the noise. The power window shutters also shut out the sun in the morning allowing undisturbed sleep. Bathroom was well stocked and clean. Complimentary breakfast looked quite good with juices, dry cereal, breads (& a toaster), jams & butter, eggs, assorted meats, fruit salad, pastries, & coffee/tea. Staff was very helpful calling cab to airport. Only bump was when they recommended route to walk to the Forum which we did not listen to. Our route (via Circus Maximus) was much shorter. There is a charge for internet but we upgraded to a delux room and wi-fi was free.

Reviews.Title: “excellent modern hotel with great staff and service”
Reviews.Author: larondr
Reviews.Content: we stayed 4 nights at this wonderfull hotel, the location is superb' few hundreds meter from piazza Venezia. we explored rome for 5 days just by foot. the rooms are big and convenient, in our room the view was of a back alley but it didn't bother us. the fitness room is well equiped and the breakfast is great. but the best thing was the wonderfull, helpfull staff: the cleaning staff, the ladies during breakfast and especially the girls in the reception, Sandra and the charming Alina. they helped us with willingness and efficiency, and allways with a smile .

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location and Fantastic Staff”
Reviews.Author: nosey_rosie_uk
Reviews.Content: Went there on our honeymoon. When booking we asked for a balcony and we got one. While we were booking in we were looked after by Sandra. She was FANTASTIC! She asked if we had been to Rome before, neither of us had. She got us out a map of the area and proceeded to draw on it in highlighter pen all the places of interest! Amazingly 99% of them were in a 10 minute walk from the hotel. PERFECT location! The room was very clean & big. Air conditioning was a God send! The sheets & towels were changed once a day and tidied at a lunch time. Shower area was super clean and the cubicle was huge! Breakfast was lovely, staff were very attentive! We had an evening flight at the end of it. We were told that we could securely leave our baggage with them and come back to shower and collect before our shuttle bus arrived. Very unexpected but very welcome. Location - 10 / 10 Hotel - 10 / 10 Staff - 10 / 10 Whole experience - 10 / 10 WOULD COMPLETELY RECOMMEND TO A FRIEND!!!

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Upscale, Convenient Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lonstarhusker
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 nights and we delighted with the hotel. We arrived at 10 AM and, to our surprise, our room was ready. It was clean, large and had A/C. The rooms also have power outdoor shades that keep light and traffic noise mostly out. Price of the room was also very good given the very high hotel prices in Rome. A simple breakfast came with the room. Staff was courteous and helpful but none of them ever smiled. That could be part of the culture. Some comments have said they look unhappy but their attitude was fine. Hotel is located 5-10 minute walk to Trevi Fountain, Pantheon, and Colosseum. Taxis know where the hotel is just by giving the driver the address. There are no food places nearby with the closest mabye 5 minutes away. Hotel has a fine restaurant on the roof that serves good but expensive food. I had ravioli and a bottle of wine there midafternoon and it is was great. We also had dinner there after a tiring day and that experience was strange. The non-smiling hostess said we needed a reservation even though only 1/3 of the tables were occupied. After a discussion, she said she MAY be able to seat us in 30 minutes so we sat at the bar. After 30 minutes we were shown to a table. However, for the rest of the evening no one arrived after we arrived so most of the tables remained empty. Regardless, the dinner was great. Try the pumpkin risotto with choclate shavings. It is heavenly. The house chianti is a little harsh so step up a few dollars to a better bottle. Overall a great experience and hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff and complimentary breakfast in the courtyard”
Reviews.Author: RebeccaKJ
Reviews.Content: As soon as we arrived the staff were very helpful in regards to restaurant suggestions and offering to make the bookings. The breakfasts in the courtyard with bottomless coffee are a great way to start the day. The bathroom was clean and the room size not an issue. Our room was on a busy road but with the window shut that wasn't an issue and we had a good view of some of the roman ruins. In fact the hotel is close to the pantheon which is great, it is an easy walk into the main shopping areas and across the river are excellent cafes and restaurants. Our only slight issue was that the room was booked as a twin and when we arrived it was a double. The bed could easily be seperated however the evening staff wouldn't do it and we had to wait until the following morning for the cleaning staff. Not a huge issue but not great as i was travelling with a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish with a great location”
Reviews.Author: Radio355
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Rome, we booked this hotel for its location and Tripadviser feedback. The location was fine and we walked to all the main sites, longest journey was 45mins to the Vatican. The hotel room was located on a side street on the first floor, clean and well serviced daily, first night I realised that some of the other feedback was correct and found it noisy from the traffic outside on the main road. The next morning I mentioned this at reception and they did offer a change of room to the back of the hotel, after viewing the room we decided not to change, ours was larger. I mentioned at reception that I would go and buy ear plugs, within minutes 4 sets were sent to our room, (if possible try to book a room on the 4th or 5 th floor). I found the two girls on reception to be excellent, they booked all our dinner reservations at local restaurants, provided maps and other useful information. Breakfasts were good with a couple of hot dishes available with the usual continental breakfasts. We had our last nights meal in the hotel restaurant, great location, my main course was overcooked, no problems they changed it for a different dish which was excellent. Needed to be, its not cheap (27 euros ) for fish. Overall we liked the hotel, the staff and the location, maybe a bit pricey, but so is the rest of Rome

Reviews.Title: “The best location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: xintec
Reviews.Content: If you go to Rome to tour the ancient ruins, this is the place to stay. Everything is within easy walking distance. The hotel is clean and modern with a very helpful staff. Don't miss dinner on the roof-excellent. Breakfast is very good. You won't go wrong staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Quite a decent hotel, a few minor flaws need correcting”
Reviews.Author: TravellingDocCan
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel after finding it on Expedia. Location is great. Although its not right on top of any major tourist sight, its an easy walk to almost everything else. Staff are efficient and polite. Our room was great. It was clean. The air conditioning worked well. With the windows closed street noise was at a minimum. The breakfast was alright although the coffee was not of the best quality. The gym was much better equipped than average. The restaurant/rooftop terrace looked nice, but we chose to go out into the city to eat. A few things could have been improved. The televisions were old and left the rooms with an outdated feel. Most hotels this price I have stayed in have more modern flat screens and satellite TV (would have been nice to have access to more than just CNN and BBC for english language programming). The courtyard in the middle was too noisy to really be appreciated. I think it was the elevator motors making the noise. There were also parasols in the courtyard that were a bit dingy and in need of a wash. These, however, were minor details. In summary would recommend this hotel. It is a bit pricey, but no more so than other hotels in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have done better!”
Reviews.Author: debp
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel very early due to the overnight flight from Atlanta. I was quite expecting to be told to come back in the afternoon. However, they offered the breakfast area to us and said our room would be ready in 1/2 hour. The room, a double deluxe, was spacious and immaculate. The view out of the window to the Temples was great. The bathroom was great with one exception. Those Euro hotel hairdryers just have to go. Ladies, you cannot style hair with these things. It was not noisy at all and we never smelled any smoke at the hotel. The mini bar was welcome after a hot sightseeing day and the prices were reasonable. A bottle of water and fruit candies were provided each evening as well at turndown. Breakfast included cold cuts, breads and pastries, some hot foods and fruit. It was located on the ground floor and was just fine. You can eat outdoors in the courtyard or indoors. They were able to call a taxi for us for our Vaticano and Borghese visits with courteous and prompt service. I really want to compliment the front desk services. I had looked literally all over Rome for a hair flat iron. I had even asked a shopping information booth on the Via Del Corso who sent me on a wild goose chase to a store that had been closed for a while. The front desk answered the question immediately with the store and location. Very impressed. They also always greeted us when we returned from our sightseeing. We used the rooftop bar twice to enjoy a pre-dinner glass of wine. They served some lovely snacks with the drinks and the service was pleasant. The hotel is within walking distance to the Teatro de Marcello where we enjoyed a piano concert one evening. It is also within easy walking distance to the Capitoline Museums and Ancient Rome areas as well as the Pantheon and Trastevere districts (although we were very unimpressed with Trastevere) We did have one sleepless night that was our own fault. We had opened the window at one point and failed to close it tightly. This shuts off the air conditioner and also allows the traffic noise in. This problem was immediately solved by shutting the window tightly after speaking with the front desk about our problem. They stored our luggage for us the last day to allow more sightseeing time before our car arrived. All in all, the best hotel I have experienced in Italy. I would stay here again and recommend it highly to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Would return in a heartbeat!”
Reviews.Author: pdxflygirl
Reviews.Content: Great location, rooms are big, friendly staff. Decent breakfast, had 2 computers with free internet. Bar on rooftop was pricey for drinks but what hotel isn't? Best hotel we stayed at on our european vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated and Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: inelithom
Reviews.Content: The room was average with a view of an alley/garbage. I tried to overlook the stain on the curtain...When our room was cleaned, the blanket folded at the foot of the bed displayed yet another stain (I was surprised that it was not at least folded differently). The walls are indeed paper thin; you could hear everything next door/upstairs. Smoke from another guest's room permeated our room. The internet service was not available half of the time. A couple of the staff members were nice (Mayi and Piero). The rest of the staff gave misleading/inaccurate/incomplete information and/or had snobbish attitudes. Breakfast was ordinary. Location is good for a couple of sites, but there are better locations with more restaurants/shopping. I would rate the room average if the price was lower; however, the price warrants a poor rating. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mkbriggs
Reviews.Content: I took my husband to Rome for his birthday and we stayed five nights at the Fortyseven Hotel. I chose Fortyseven because of the overwhelmingly positive Trip Advisor reviews - any they were all right. It's a lovely hotel and the staff are exceedingly helpful and kind. As seasoned travelers know, hotel rooms in Europe tend to be a bit smaller than in the US, but our room at Fortyseven was lovely, spacious and spotless. The food was terrific and all the public sitting areas were comfortable with contemporary decor. The hotel is in a terrific location, close to the ancient ruins and an easy walk to Campo de Fiori, Piazza Navona and all the fantastic restaurants in Trastevere. I would highly recommend staying there. The only down side to the trip had nothing to do with the hotel. The entire month of August is "holiday" for Europeans, so a great number of Romans head out of town - leaving their shops and restaurants closed for the entire month.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully modern”
Reviews.Author: konrad29
Reviews.Content: Trust trip advisor...we did and were perfectly satisfied with hotel 47. We would stay there again because of the location, service, rooms, breakfast. Very modern and clean. Warning! Previous posters commented on the attitude of the ladies at the front. This has been misunderstanding of typical Roman sophistication. These ladies a extremely professional and are committed to you getting everything you need and their lack of warmth and smiles should not be punished. They were very very very helpful during our stay and are grateful for their professionalism. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “great location, friendly sfaff, amazing rooftop restaraunt”
Reviews.Author: italianprincess_10
Reviews.Content: This hotel is everything that trips advisor says it is. The staff are very welcoming and friendly. They gave us maps outlining all the major sites to see and the most economical way to see them. The rooms were well appointed. We were two adults and two children ages 9 and 11. We tood advantage of their family special which included two adjoining rooms, free mini bar and 100 euro voucher to use at the hotel. These rooms were extremely spacious and very comfortable. The decor is sleek, modern and very clean. The hotel has a beautiful roof top terrace with a restaraunt which must not be missed. The food is fantastic and worth every penny. The menu has a bit of everything with a modern twist. Portions are not huge but definatley tasty, leaving room for dessert. After being in Rome for a week, one can only take so many panini's and pizza. It is also a fun place to relax and enjoy an evening drink and snack. Breakfast was good and ample. It isn't your typical american breakfast but when in rome, no need to have eggs and bacon. It is a continental style with many choices. The best thing about this hotel is the location. You can walk to all if not most of the major sites. If you are looking for a real cozy area don't miss Trastevere, just over the Tiber river there is an array of restaraunts, trattorias, shops and pizzeria's. Take a walk along the river for a more trendy experience. Try not to grab water outside the major attractions it is a rip off. Just a little further out and it is 1 euro or less. If you don't want to pay a premium for pizza and a panini, grab it to go. Most places are tourist traps and the service isn't all that great. Don't miss the Vatican, it is absolutely breathtaking. If you want to see it properly, book a personal tour it is well worth the money. This will also help you to avoind lines up which can be anywhere from 1 - 3 hours.

Reviews.Title: “All the plaudits are justified”
Reviews.Author: chelseagirl10
Reviews.Content: Great hotel- I cannot put it better than the other reviewers. Only small downside that I would mention is that if your room is facing the road the buzz of traffic can be a little noisy early in the morning. A couple of bits of cotton wool in the ears completely blocked it out on the only occasion I noticed it though!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Boutique Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: R0ry
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our 6 night stay at Fortyseven Hotel Rome. Great location and the rooms were very comfortable. Most of the hotel staff were helpful - other than the breakfast buffet staff that were really quite miserable. Even with that we would recommend this hotel to others as a very good value for Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel which we would recommend to anyone”
Reviews.Author: G_KDerbyshire
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights at the hotel. It is in a perfect location for sight seeing. 2 minutes walk to the open top bus stop and about 15 minutes walk along the riverbank to lovely restaurants and squares. It is a modern hotel, luxurious, spacious bedroom with lovely bathroom. Wooden floors and tastefully decorated. The roof top terrace & restaurant very airy with views over Rome. The breakfast was good and the staff very helpful with good English.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced & Noisy”
Reviews.Author: Brewski00
Reviews.Content: The street noise was outrageous not to mention the room above us you could hear every footstep. The breakfast was marginal and the waitstaff looks very unhappy. Although the interior is well done but I wouldnt stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in an excellent location”
