Reviews.Author: shawneex
Reviews.Content: After reading through the top 100 Rome hotels (yes, I actually did that!) I decided upon Hotel Fortyseven. We LOVED it. Staff were very helpful and suggested several great restaurants in the Trastavere neighbourhood across the river. Every major site was walkable from the hotel, despite what previous reviews have stated. I can guarantee this since I was 5 months pregnant and it was 35 degrees while we were there! We got the basic room which was all we needed. It was comfortable and did not notice that is was noisy as mentioned on other reviews. Beds were hard though and not the most comfy. I had one of the best pasta dishes right in the hotel restaurant it was a ravioli dish with a creamy sage sauce...can't remember the details but was delicious! We were given free internet access as well.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: 510bunter
Reviews.Content: I let them know ahead of time that we were celebrating our anniversary. We were greeted with chilled prosecco and a lovely card congratulating us. Very nice touch and we appreciated it. Our room was modern, roomy and had places to put your stuff-and a patio. The staff was lovely and helpful and there were places to hang out after a long day of sightseeing-the rooftop restaurant/bar, a bar downstairs, a big patio where you can also have breakfast if you like. We ate at the rooftop restaurant twice. It was the end of a long trip and we were tired of searching out places and were glad to just head upstairs to eat. It was a bit pricey though. They have two computers and they will give you a code daily that you can use in your room for your computer. It was my husband's favorite place.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: Tornabene
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was super friendly immediately upon arrival. They made my entire family feel welcome, including my fourteen month old daughter. We were given a gorgeous room with a terrace that had a beautiful view of the city, especially at night. The breakfast the next morning was fabulous, there was something for everybody. I could not recommend this hotel more, and will definitely stay there on our next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful experience in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: daughterandmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights in a beautifully appointed room. The automatic shutters eliminated light and most street noise providing for restful nights. Our experience with the staff was very positive as we found them to be helpful and friendly. The location of the hotel provides easy access to the major sights and to more restaurants than can be imagined. Two blocks to Circus Maximus, 6 blocks to the Trastavere area, and under 15 minutes to many of the popular sights. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very helpful staff, very happy with our stay”
Reviews.Author: donfrancis
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 4 days in Rome on the last leg of our honeymoon. The staff was welcoming and friendly upon arrival. They gave us a top floor room facing the city with a balcony because we mentioned in our reservation it was for our honeymoon. They also threw in champagne which was a nice, simple touch. Every day we had questions when leaving, like what bus to take, help finding a location, etc. Everyone was extremely helpful. The location is perfect. You can walk to the Forum and the Colosseum in 10 minutes. You can walk across any of the Tiber bridges (or better yet walk along the Tiber) in 15 minutes. The bus to the Vatican is right outside the hotel and every other spot you want to see is a few miles right up the street. We did not eat at the roof restaurant because we're in Italy. Why anyone would eat at their hotel and then complain about it like other reviewers have is beyond me. Also, the negative reviews about the thin walls are a mystery to me. We never heard anyone in any other room. Also, the rooms have large wooden shutters controlled by remote that can block out the noise and sun when needed. It's definitely pricey, but any good hotel in Rome will be. I highly recommend this to anyone staying in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “It will not disappoint”
Reviews.Author: tillytails
Reviews.Content: I am very fussy and a hotel can make or break my stay! Well it definately made it. Very modern and clean, the bed was the most comfortable I have slept in. Hotel was classy and chic but still had personality and felt comfortable and cosy. The rooftop terrace restaurant was as you can see in the pics. Truely awsome views and just made me smile. We stayed in a double delux 1 night ( i was soo pleased with the room as its very important to me to have a great retreat after a day sightseeing). Lots of attention to detail and great size. Next 2 nights we had the suite and WOW! I was shocked. What an amazing room (well apartment) We had 3 sets of patio doors leading out onto a massive terrace and a wicker bed, table and chairs and sun loungers. It was pure luxury and I will never forget it as I will definately return with a friend this year! Location also perfect EVERYTHING we wanted was walking distance. (bars and restaurants at night and historic areas in the day). 10 out of 10 and special thanks to Alina and Enrica who made us soo welcome!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Hotel, but extremely noisy rooms”
Reviews.Author: ottawaon
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at Hotel 47. The hotel is in a great location close to may sites. The decor is very nice with hardwood floors and cabinetry, warm neutral colours and beds that were very comfortable. We also enjoyed 2 dinners at the roof top restaurant. However, we had the same comment about the female waitress who seemed to be quite miserable everytime we saw her. Our male waiter however, was very friendly and helpful. The room includes daily buffet breakfast on the main floor which was average at best. Our only complain is that, we got very little sleep due to the thin walls and ceiling and windows. A few of the nights we were there, the people above our room arrived late at night and walked around in heels for what seemed to be hours. The floors/rooms seemed to amplify the sound to the point where it was futile to try to sleep until they finally removed their shoes and went to bed. Sounded like a horse galloping right above our head. Even after they finally took of their shoes, we could still hear them speaking not to mention we could hear people coming up and down the stairwell (next to our room). We generally sleep well and haven't complained about noise before, but this was really loud. Our room was 104. If you can get a room on one of the higher floors, it may be better. The windows also don't provide much sound insulator from the heavy traffic outside. If you have a set of earplugs, or can't sleep through a train wreck, then I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully Classy!”
Reviews.Author: TeamLobsinger
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fortyseven Hotel for the first two nights of our Italy trip. The desk staff is wonderful... amazing English. Super helpful, super knowledgeable people. The rooms are beautiful, and quite large comparatively to the other hotels we stayed at... in Rome and beyond. The whole hotel, including the rooms are sparkling clean. Amazing location: within walking distance to everything. I've seen in other people's reviews that they walked to the Vatican in 40 mins... we opted to taxi there for 7 Euros. I would definitely DEFINITELY recommend this hotel to anyone!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: bee7777777
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 4 nights, had a lovely time, very helpful and friendly staff, geat location, we walked every where, even to the vatican city (40min walk) great sevice and rooms where clean. the roof top restaurant was expensive,but the views are lovely.

Reviews.Title: “HEAVENLY HONEYMOON!!”
Reviews.Author: zoe64
Reviews.Content: 1ST CLASS HOTEL!!! we spent our honeymoon there, all the greats...great food ...great staff..great room..And a bottle of bubbly on ice in our room with card" happy honeymoon" THANK YOU FORTYSEVEN!! WE WILL BE BACK!!

Reviews.Title: “5 star”
Reviews.Author: lzb498
Reviews.Content: Do not be fooled by the ordinary entrance and lobby of this hotel. This building was totally renovated with an artistic eye that also includes 21st century amenities such as computer room in lobby, mini gym (loved it) and high tech security keys. Clean, comfortable and spacious rooms. Breakfast; could not be better. Staff; always friendly and helpful. Rooms facing the street do get a little noisy starting at 6 AM ( I always travel with ear plugs) but this is the price you pay for being centrally located, in the middle of it. I wouldn't have it any other way. If I return to Rome, you will find me here at hotel forty seven.

Reviews.Title: “Snobby and Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: MBOregon
Reviews.Content: We were disappointed in Fortyseven Hotel and wanted to help other travelers not make the same mistake we did. We stayed at 3 hotels during our stay in Italy and wanted to end our trip by splurging on Fortyseven Hotel the final night of our honeymoon. The hotel itself has a very nice boutique look to it. However upon check in the staff was extremely snobby. At the other two hotels we stayed at, the staff was very nice and welcoming. After checking in, we went up to the terrace to enjoy a bottle the hotel had nicely waiting in our room to celebrate. Their terrace is a fantastic element of the hotel. Since we had traveled all morning back from Positano, we wanted a snack midday to hold us over. When I approached the female bar manager up there, she was rude as well. I looked over their menu and it was terribly disappointing. We then asked the front desk about where to find an ATM and a jeweler. She was rude AGAIN as if we were putting her out and told us there was an ATM at the end of the block when there was not. Needless to say, we DO NOT recommend this hotel and we were disappointed that we paid more for our final night in Roma for poor treatment.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely nice helpful staff but painfully thin walls”
Reviews.Author: WG928
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, very very helpful & nice staff, expensive internet, spacious lovely rooms but with painfully thin walls. Heard water running, people on phone, elevator, walking on the nearby marble floored steps....

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!!”
Reviews.Author: horns0522
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently went to Rome for our honeymoon and stayed at Hotel Fortyseven. Everything about it was great. When we first arrived we were greeted at the front reception area by a very nice woman and while we checked in with her, another hotel staff member brought all of our luggage up to our room for us. The breakfast was very good as well as the rooftop bar. Everyone who worked here spoke very good English and all were extremely nice. When asked for good restaurants to eat at, they marked it on the map for us and every one that they recommended was fabulous food!! They were very nice to call for cabs when we needed them and also were right on time with wake up calls. The room was cleaned every day, with fresh linens on the bed and towels in the bathroom. Our one week stay was very pleasant and we will definately be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: Patentdean
Reviews.Content: The hotel is wonderful and is near the Colosseum and Trastevere. The breakfast was delicious with hot and cold choices available.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - friendly boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: BosphorusBear
Reviews.Content: Requested a room with terrace and we were lucky. A lovely little West-facing terrace, just perfect for recharging between daytime outings and evening jaunts. Wonderful shower-room (we asked for shower not tub)and huge comfortable bed. Having booked a deluxe room we were pleasantly surprised that the hotel reduced the final bill as they were worried the room they'd given us was smaller than other deluxe rooms without terraces. All the staff were very friendly and helpful without being obsequious and we made use of their airport car service - took all the stress out of transport. The location is within walking distance of all major sites - even the Vatican is only about 30 mins fast walk. This was great as we were able to nip back to the hotel for a cuppa or rest between sight-seeing trips if we wanted to. The road is busy but the double glazing is very effective so traffic noise didn't intrude & we slept very well. We ate in the restaurant on the night we arrived - great view & good food, if not the cheapest - but walked to Trastevere on the other evenings - lots of choice all within 10 mins of the hotel. The hotel breakfast was very good too. Our first trip to Rome and it's hard to think how it could have been improved. Big thumbs up to Hotel 47 and its staff!

Reviews.Title: “A home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Swissonion75
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights at Hotel Fortyseven, the hotel is in a great location, right in the center of the historical sites, such as the Forum, Teatro Marcello, Colliseum, etc. We stayed in a Junior Suite, which was very well appointed, with all modern amenities, two flatscreen TVs, one in the living area and one in the bedroom area. The room also had a large terrace with views of the Vesta Temple. Breakfast offered a wide variety of choice, warm buffet, cold buffet, fresh fruit juices, etc. Room Service was great also, ordered a bottle of wine, which was corked but they replaced it no questions asked.

Reviews.Title: “excelent choice.”
Reviews.Author: tricolor00
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent four nights at 47 Hotel. Execellent: courtesy of the staff;concierge,information service,room clean and confortable,modern tv,bathroom clean and properly supplied, breakfast -buffet quality and varity- Internet connection free. Perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Love this property!”
Reviews.Author: Romeamore
Reviews.Content: We love Rome! This was our third trip to the eternal city - staying there exclusively each time. This was our second stay at Hotel Fortyseven. It is a most wonderful 4-star hotel. The location is absolutely incredible - by the Circus Maximus, Colloseum, Forum, Jewish Ghetto, and directly across the river is Trastevere. The hotel overlooks the Temple of Hercules and is surrounded by beautiful archaelogical areas - of course all Rome is one great archaelogical site. The hotel, however, is a beautifully appointed, modern, comfortable hotel - with all amenities travelers delight in. The rooms have fine linens and luxurious toiletries. The breakfast is incredible; and the hotel restaurant - The Circus -on the top floor with fabulous views is a gourmand's delight. We consider ourselves foodies and feel that our meals here on this trip to the city were the best we had. A testament to that is that the restaurant is often closed for private local functions. The hotel also has a health club and spa. But, what makes this property truly superior is the staff. You will find no other more accomodating and helpful. Enrica and Leysia went out of their way to help us with anything and everything. We remembered them from our first trip to this hotel and they, too, remembered us. It made our trip that more special and memorable as we feel we truly have Italian friends in them. We were excited to share with them our trip adventures and felt they were equally interested. The staff can provide any service - car to/from airport; dinner suggestions/reservations; tour guides/reservations; cab service; anything. There are many properties to choose from in Rome and no doubt many that are fine; but if you want to be guaranteed a truly memorable stay, select this one!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic rooms and excellent staff, worth every penny!”
Reviews.Author: RooieRT
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels I have stayed in. The staff was wonderful. All were very friendly and extremely helpful. We stayed in a double deluxe, and it was a nice size with a big bathroom and wonderful shower. I was traveling with a 8month old, a 4 year old, and my mother, and it was fantastic. There are not enough good things I could say about this hotel. The breakfast was wonderful and we had dinner in the hotel one night and it was delicious. The desert at the roof top resturant was incredible. The beds in the room we had were King size and very comfortable. The shutters they put on the windows are excellent for keeping the noise out and light if you need to take an afternoon nap, or give your kids one. I would definetly stay in this hotel again. The location to the Colleseum and the wedding cake were excellent. It is a little bit further to get to the trevi fountain, but worth it. We had dinner across the bridge to Trastavere, which is much less expensive than near the historic sights and the food is excellent. One note of caution if taking one of those site seeing buses near the wedding cake, make sure when you pay your ticket you hold onto the ticket. Once you get off the bus they will not let you back on the bus without the ticket. Also if you want to eat near the colleseum we ate at El Gladiatore, and the food was fantastic, and we had received complimentary champagne and a free shot.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelieveable hospitality”
Reviews.Author: BENLEWISTELEVISION
Reviews.Content: We are seasoned travellers and have stayed in some of the best hotels in the world. This would not have been my first choice however I was persuaded by the reviews on Trip Advisor to book the 47 for a short week break in Rome. I am sooooo glad I did. The hotel is small by luxury standards but immaculate. The staff, front of house are friendly, informed, helpful and professional. Housekeeping was equally brillent, refreshing our room while we were at Breakfast so we could start the day in good stead. The ambience absolutley soars with old school hospitality and attention to detail. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. However, the hotel really came into its own when we were stranded in Rome by the Icelandic Volcanic Ash cloud. This could have been a stressful, traumatic time. However the management and staff at the 47 hotel ensured not only that we were safe, secure and comfortable but that we continued to enjoy the beauty and hospitality of Rome. We really can't commend the 47 hotel staff and management enough. Its been a very long time since we've experienced such immeasurable standards of hospitality and professionalism.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience”
Reviews.Author: Torlondo
Reviews.Content: We were recently "stranded" for an extra 5 nights at Fortyseven Hotel in Rome. While the transportation industry took every opportunity to take advantage of the situation, Fortyseven offered us a decreased special rate to help us out. This huge gesture turned out to be only one of the many things the management and staff did to ensure an excellent stay in Rome. The hotel is located in a perfect location for sights and dinning, with extremely comfortable rooms. Every member of staff treated us like VIPs, and when out of their way to make sure we had a great time in Rome. I would strongly recommend Fortyseven, and look forward to our return.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location with modern rooms and good service”
Reviews.Author: Phototravelgirl
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for 4 nights on holiday and found the location to be excellent for sightseeing, we walked everywhere from the hotel even to the Vatican city. The hotel is situated nicely between the area with the ancient ruins and the restaurant district of Trastevere and the Jewish ghetto which also has great food. The staff gave us good dining recommendations. Rooms are modern and clean. There is some road noise at times but once the shutters are drawn down it is okay. We found the rooftop bar a nice place to have an evening drink before or after dinner. Finally, we were very thankful to the hotel staff for helping us with internet access and searching local travel options for getting out of Rome and back home during the Volcano ash cloud air crisis. We managed to get the overnight train from Rome to Paris and then finally back to London. This would have been much more difficult without the help of the staff. The staff also offered to help us find lodging within our budget (as the hotel is expensive without an advance special rate) in case we needed to extend our stay. We would definitely stay here again if we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Possibly the worst service I have ever encountered in a hotel.”
Reviews.Author: SimonLiebel
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is fine but the service and attitude of the staff overall is deplorable. They are incredibly rude, unhelpful and arrogant.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: basilbond
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for our honeymoon. It is 10 mins walk from all the main attractions and a nice 30-40 mins walk along the Tiber to the vatican. The hotel arranged our transfers to and from the airport at a cost of 50 euros each way which we thought was very reasonable. We had a superior room on the 5th floor which had a balcony which was a nice extra, the room wasn't huge but adequate for our needs, the bed was king size & comfy, the bathroom was small with only a shower (no bath). Wardrobe space was a bit limited but we were staying for 7 nights. The hotel staff were fantastic, particularly reception and the bar & restaurant, on our first night the roof top restaurant was not open due to the weather so we eat downstairs in the breakfast area but the food and service were excellent with prices about the same as you would pay outside the hotel for a decent meal. The rooftop restaurant is fantastic and nothing was too much trouble i.e. I fancied a salad with my dinner one evening, although not on the menu, this was arranged for me. The hotel does have some traffic noise but where in central Rome dosen't, just take some ear plugs if you are particularly sensitive. Eating out in Rome is highly recommended we only had one dissapointing meal in the seven days. To sum up then, if you like a boutique contemporary hotel with fantastic service and want to be near to Rome's attractions, but not in a busy tourist area, then this is the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for a short stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: WhiskeyCoke
Reviews.Content: Great location: walking distance to the Colloseum, Venice Square. Also, just a few minutes walk to Trastevere area where you HAVE to go for some great dining Room was very clean, staff was very friendly and helpful and gave a lot of useful tips. Nice breakfast and the roof top restaurant has been an excellent choice for a warmer spring evening - nice views, great atmosphere

Reviews.Title: “A nice find - worth considering”
Reviews.Author: Slugnet
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights here just before Easter and we were pleasantly surprised. The hotel describes itself as boutique and I would agree. If you're looking for clean, comfortable, modern accommodation with a nice bathroom and reliable air-conditioning then this may be the place for you. Public rooms are small and you wouldn't want to spend a long time in them. Staff are generally attentive and responsive, occasionally friendly and cheerful. We didn't eat in the top floor restaurant so cannot comment. The breakfast could have been better for a four star hotel. There was a fresh fruit salad, juice, cereals, bread, croissant, jams & spreads. A little cheese and one cold meat. The hot seletion was poor in my view, scrambled agg and chopped frankfurters floating in water. We upgraded to a slightly better room but I'm not sure it was worth it. We were on the second floor near the very busy main road and you could here the hum of traffic all the time. The walls and ceilling were a little thin, we could here a baby crying frequently and the children above running around a lot. It was not intolerable but have learnt to take earplugs with us when we travel anywhere. Location quitegood for restaurants as you can cross the river easilly into the Trastevere area. Location good for visiting Colloseum and ancient sites but a bit of a trek to the Vatican. We also stayed at the Hilton Cavalieri. See our separate review.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, best view ever”
Reviews.Author: Rebjon
Reviews.Content: I normally don't take time to write reviews since my husband and I travel all the time for business or leisure reasons but this time we were so happy with the hotel that we thought it would be nice to share it with our fellow travelers. We were in Rome many times before, and each time we stayed in a different hotel, so we know a few of them. This time, following friend’s recommendations, we booked Hotel Fortyseven, located in the archaeological area, very central. When the cab stopped in front of the hotel we were a bit worried that being in such a central street it would be noisy but now we were there! We entered the lobby and we were very impressed by the understated class and style of the hotel, contemporary art everywhere. The reception was cosy, we sat comfortably and we were welcomed by a lovely girl who did our check-in in a flash! When we entered our room and I looked out to check the view I was amazed! We could almost touch the temples in front of the hotel, no doubt, we were in Rome! Our worries about the noise vanished as we couldn’t hear a thing through the double glassed windows and at night the busy street becomes very quiet. I highly recommend the restaurant at the roof, marvellous view, great service and the food was unforgettable, I still dream with their “tiramisu”. We simply loved the atmosphere, looks and service so we decided that from now Fortyseven hotel is our hotel in Rome. Rebecca and John

Reviews.Title: “Great location - even better for dinner”
Reviews.Author: Pikesb
Reviews.Content: We went for a 4 day break and opted for a standard double including breakfast and dinner on one night. Room smallish but on 5th floor which kept us above the traffic noise. Had balcony, but in March, not much call for sitting outside. Very clean and although near lift, very quiet. Had to keep windows shut because of traffic but air con worked fine. Location excellent 15 mins walk to Forum and 30 mins in bus to Vatican. Hotel staff very helpful and sorted restaurants, taxis, postcards - everything really. Fitness centre ok but steam room not working during weekdays as hotel not busy but was turned on at the weekend. Public areas a bit dull but breakfast very good with plenty of cooked and cold buffet. We were worried about opting for dinner but it was excellent and best value we experienced. Overall godd place to be based if you dont want any liveliness outside your own room. Good access to the sites, friendly staff, clean rooms and good value. Dont rely on the google map timings from the train station, its a 45 min not 25 min walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great ending to our time Italy”
Reviews.Author: pg082008
Reviews.Content: We spent our last few days in Italy at Hotel Fortyseven in Rome. We did our research for what we were looking for. Having started our trip in a smaller town, air conditioning and a modern facility was a treat that we knew we would be looking forward to. The hotel did not disappoint. The staff was very courteous and helpful. The rooms were modern, comfortable, cool and very clean. We were very excited to have scrambled eggs and an American style breakfast again as well. We also picked this hotel for the opportunity to dine on the rooftop, which was also very nice and memorable. It suited our needs in every respect since we visited Rome to tour the city. My only negative feedback would be for those who are looking for a romantic setting. Although dining on the rooftop was very romantic, the location and the hotel itself is not the best in that domain. It is on a busy city street, but it is also in walking distance to many attractions. It's perfect if you are spending a few days to tour the city and relax in the comforts of an upscale hotel (in an older city). Last bit of advice, if you are taking a taxi to the hotel, count your change. The taxi driver kept an extra ten dollars of our money and sped away pretty quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Five Star Hotel, More like a three star”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveler69_10
Reviews.Content: Not remotley sure how this place is ahead of the rome cavileri. Started off by landing in rome and tried contacting the hotel to get us directions to the hotel. Staff indicated they would email it to me....never happened!!! Got to the hotel and the entrance and check in is very strange. One person on a laptop sitting there....not really first class. The hotel itself is on probably the busiest street in the world. Our original room faced the road and the noise was unbearable. we changed rooms to the "quiet" section and you could still here everything......the View was horrible too, we faced a bunch of businesses which was rather creepy. The room itself was nice, nothing special at all.. They had tract lighting on the ceiling but nothing about the room was 5 star quality. Overall, id say its a nice place, but more like a three star and wayyyyyyyyyyyyyy far away from 5 star. The stay at the rome cavelari blew this place out of the water

Reviews.Title: “The hotel and the staff are very helpful...”
Reviews.Author: RenukaC
Reviews.Content: The hotel and the staff are very helpful and friendly. They give excellant advice on where to eat . Only bit they can improve is , if they could provide a tea kettle in the room.

Reviews.Title: “First class modern hotel close to all the attractions.”
Reviews.Author: MaryJeanWashingtonDC
Reviews.Content: I accompanied my husband on his business trip to Rome and stayed in this first class hotel. We stayed in other cheaper hotels for some of our stay and although they offered very good value Hotel Forty Seven was just that much better with lots of finishing touches. The room had a balcony with a table chairs and a lemon tree; there were chocolates on the bed with the next day's weather forecast in the evening and a television with CNN and BBC news channels. The whole hotel was sparklingly clean and the staff very helpful. You could make the buffet breakfast into a substantial meal - it included scrambled egg, and bacon, breads and pastries, ham and cheese, fruit and cereals. Closer to the Forum and Colosseum then the Vatican it is within walking distance of all the attractions, except the catacombs for which you will need a bus. The Hotel staff are happy to give you bus routs and will even sell you the tickets for the bus and metro.

Reviews.Title: “Great Start to the most memorable trip of my life”
Reviews.Author: cmsweet79
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I traveled to Italy for vacation, and were really unsure where to stay. We used tripadvisor to select our hotels, and weren't steered wrong. We chose Hotel Fourtyseven in Rome and Ca Maria Adele in Venice, and both were perfect! The hotel staff was very friendly, and prepared our room very quickly even though we arrived very early (8am Rome time). The rooms were very clean, roomy (by European standards), and modern. The best thing about this hotel was the location. A quick walk to the ruins and Collisieum, and not too far from the Vatican. The rooftop restaurant is expensive, but worth every penny. Although we enjoyed the food in Italy, this restaurant was probably the best.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rp9876
Reviews.Content: Don't let the tiny lobby of this hotel fool you. This is a first class hotel with a wonderful location just south of the Roman Forum. We travelled with 5 people which is an odd number to travel with in Europe. The FortySeven gave us two adjoining rooms that turned into a corner suite. The rooms were spacious and extremely clean. The best service you get is the service you don't have to ask for and the staff of the FortySeven provides it without you having to ask for it. The setting by night is fantastic and it is relatively easy to travel to the other major tourist sights in Rome. I cannot say enough good things about how pleasant a stay we had. This hotel is a bit pricey but well worth it for a truly amazing stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel great city”
Reviews.Author: MorrisGangOnTour
Reviews.Content: What can I say about this fantastic city. Full of history and culture, great food, stunning sights and friendly people. Hotel 47 is located just off the forum next to the Tiber. It is modern with all the facilities you need for a city hotel plus a bit of style. Its a short walk to all the sites of the forum including the Collliseum. Staff were great at organising where we should go and which tours were best. Breakfast was good and could be eaten in the courtyard. We only took dinner once, it was excellent but with the euro the way it was a tad on the pricey side. The crowning glory is the roof bar where you can sit like a film star looking out over roman ruins and the river sipping a glass of chilled wine. We will return as soon as we can save up the euros it is officially our top city and 47 is a top hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good clean fun”
Reviews.Author: JBar123
Reviews.Content: We arrived from New York and this was the first place we laid our heads. It was very contemporary and felt like a home away from home. It was very clean and easy. The location, however, was not that great. We had quite the hike to the Pantheon and the Vatican. If I return to Rome, I will stay in a more central location.

Reviews.Title: “Subtle, cool, great service....”
Reviews.Author: Michaelrome
Reviews.Content: Excellent place. I stayed here two years ago and had a very positive experience. Since then, I moved to Rome and I put my parents up in this place whenever they come to to visit me. They love it. The design of the hotel works well both in winter and summer--either cool or warm ambience. The staff are stellar with, as one reviewed mentioned, a great sense of humour. The restaurant on the terrace is also a nice touch with good food and calm atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Modern Hotel in Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: Mosquini
Reviews.Content: What a find! My husband an I spent a weekend in Rome with friends visiting on business, and found this the perfect hotel for the trip. The hotel is ideally situated just at the edge of the historic district and just across the Ponte Palatino from lively Trastevere. We were able to make the most of a very short trip, taking in sites and enjoying the Rome nightlife. The rooms were spacious and modern (high ceilings, wood floors, large bathroom). The hotel is conveniently situated on a main road, but our room was very quiet. The rooftop restaurant and bar had incredible views of the city - fantastic for a pre-dinner drink. The staff was incredibly friendly and knowledgeable. They were able make reservations for our large group at a trendy restaurant in Trastevere - and even arranged a private walking tour of the city the following day. Looking forward to returning to Rome, and to staying at the Fortyseven again!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: CHBLittleRock
Reviews.Content: The greeting on arrival was a little cool, they ushered us to a side room to wait because the lobby is very small and it took a while to check in. The room was modern and nice, bed was pretty comfortable, a nice bathroom and a small balcony. We did the package that included dinner at the restaurant on the roof, and it was surprisingly good. There was free internet included in our package off the hotel lobby which was very convenient. The open air bar in the center of the hotel was nice for a glass of wine before or after dinner. The only negatives were the plug in the bathroom didn't work and they came and checked it twice only to tell me it wasn't working:) Location was walking distance to the Colloseum and the Forum, and just across the river was Trestevere where there were lots of great restaurants. Great location, very good room and hotel.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING LOCATION! VERY CLEAN! BEAUTIFUL ROOMS! STAY HERE!!!”
Reviews.Author: Fallon84
Reviews.Content: My mother and I took a trip to Rome over the summer (I'm 24 and shes 58) and we pain and agonized over what hotel to pick and which area to stay in. This was the perfect choice! It was centrally located to either walk or take a cab to our tours each day, and it was located near the fun nightlife areas to walk and get dinner. The staff was extremely helpful with recommendation and directions. They even gave us free Internet card so I could Skype all my friends back home. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone planning a trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: hsvclan
Reviews.Content: Booked this has a romantic getaway with the wife for a few days. We arrived late (about 11:00PM), but check in was efficient, quick and hassle free. The lady at the front desk was very helpful. We asked for a room on a high floor with a view, and we were duly obliged. The room was bigger than I expected considering we were in Rome with a 6ft bed, it was very clean and the bathroom was huge. Bearing in mind this is their basic Classic double - we were impressed. Breakfast was basic (pastries, sausages, eggs, bacon, cereal) but nice. We ate at the roof top restaurant, were we enjoyed the excellent view and rather good food. I had the tempura prawns and lasagne, while my wife had the brushette and spaghetti. Location is very good near all the ancient Rome sites. The Vatican was 10 minutes away in a cab (about 9 euros). We walked back from the Vatican via the Trevi fountain without any problems. We used an excellent company called Romecabs for the transfers from the airport. The drivers were on time and very polite.

Reviews.Title: “A great option”
Reviews.Author: April2179
Reviews.Content: On arrival I found that essentially all of the positives and all of the negatives I had read on Trip Advisor were true (yay Trip Advisor!). The positives: - the rooms are spacious and modern and good value for what you get compared to other places in Rome; - the (included) breakfast is very good, the best we found during our trip (I did not find any issue with running out of items); - the "Stay Longer" package deal IS excellent value; - the hotel restaurant is surprisingly good; - the hotel does feel generally clean and safe. The negatives: - we also found the front desk staff to be fairly unfriendly and unhelpful. on one occasion we asked for directions to a laundry mat. the woman at the front desk gave us directions to one. we walked 20 minutes to get there only to find there was no laundry mat. we did find a dry cleaners who advised there was no laundry mat in the area. when we reported this back to the hotel desk staff they were unapologetic and insisted we were simply wrong. - the location is ok, but not ideal. it is a fairly long walk to the metro and though you are relatively close to the roman forum, etc, there are no cafes etc nearby. it feels pretty lonely at night; - the waitstaff in the restaurant are friendly but slow; and - the walls are pretty thin and you can hear people walking around, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, but rather disappointing service”
Reviews.Author: nt7169
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for three nights in October. We booked a special Autumn offer which included accomodation, breakfast, dinner and a drinks/bar voucher, which turned out to be a very good value. Overall the hotel is very nice and clean. Our room and bathroom were very spacious. Although our windows faced the main road, we did not find the noise as bad as some other travellers. The location was good, walking distance to Roman Forum, Coliseum, Capitoline museums and Travestere. It was not near a metro, but Rome has a very good bus system and we used our Roma pass for public transport. The only issue we had was that staff was not very friendly throughout our stay. It started when my partner arrived a bit later than I did. Although he was not asked for any documentation by a receptionist on his arrival, in the evening when we were on our way out, the receptionist quite rudely stopped him and accused him of not presenting his passport to her. It could have been done in a much nicer and friendlier manner. On our second morning we ordered room service for breakfast by leaving a filled in card outside our room. When 15 minutes after the time we should have had our breakfast brought in, it was not there, we phoned the reception to find out what was the problem. They said that they didn't have our request, but would investigate and call later. 45 minutes later we called ourselves asking where our breakfast was. By that time we didn't want any breakfast in our room, as we were ready to go out. After another conversation and 30 mins later they reluctantly agreed to serve us breakfast in the bar. Again, this was done a huge favour to us, and no apology followed. The staff managed to redeem themselves when my partner forgot his passport in the safe and asked for the hotel to arrange a taxi to the airport to deliver the passport. They somehow managed not to tell him off and did as requested. Overall it was a pleasant stay, but the receptionists could have been friendlier and more welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “FAB CONTEMPORARY HOTEL IN GREAT LOCATION - LOOK NO FURTHER”
Reviews.Author: txpositano
Reviews.Content: This is our second time to stay at Hotel 47. It is brand new, contemporary, great bathrooms, luxurious toilitries, spacious and beautifully furnished rooms with noise and light-reduction blinds, excellent air-conditioner with in-room adjustment, great artwork throughout the hotel, wonderful hot breakfast with incredible pastries and cappucino and lots of selection (included in price), great restaurant with views on the roof, workout room, busstop nearby, right around the corner from the forum and colliseum, steps from the romantic Tiber and Trastevere on the other side of the Tiber. Only negatives are that the beds are hard and the wake-up calls on both of our stays were 15 minutes later than the requested time (could be disastrous when trying to catch an early-morning flight). All in all, I LOVE THIS HOTEL - you will, too!!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty close to excellent but the location is a bit isolated”
Reviews.Author: royturk611
Reviews.Content: I spent several days at the hotel in October and I agree with the other reviewers, this hotel is pretty close to excellent but there are one or two issues. Rooms are spacious, modern, immaculate and the bathrooms are large and well equipped--tons of hot water. Excellent bed and I found the concierge to be extraordinarily helpful. Now the issues: there are going to be noise problems, both from the street and the surrounding rooms both next door and above-perhaps because the floors dont have rugs. Definitely ask for an interior room or one on a higher floor--but that wont entirely do it. My major issue is the location: it's a good twenty minute walk to the forum--in the Rome sun, that's alot; other major sites are much further. Most importantly, the hotel is not in any neighborhood whatsoever. At night, once you've returned to the hotel, the area is 100%dead (but entirely safe). There is no grocery, no bars, no restaurants, no pharmacy, no cafe's, nothing at all of that nature within miles; 47 stands alone on a fairly well trafficked downtown street. You will have to take a taxi to and from the sites and to and from dinner-which is obviously costly. Trastervere, which is like the left bank, is hopping but it's a good 15 minute walk simply to get to the beginning of the Trastervere neighborhood and it's a bit creepy walking back to the hotel late at nite from there (drunks/weirdo's particularly in the ill-lit bridge areas and the streets leading to them). My recommendation is to either walk there while it's light (or take a cab) and take a cab back but definitely go there. So, excellent hotel but I think you could find a better location.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel, Thin Walls, Mixed Location”
Reviews.Author: benjin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights while on vacation in rome. Location: My feelings about the location are mixed. It is not near the Metro, but it is easily accessible by various bus lines. The 170 bus picks you up at the train station and takes you directly to the hotel. Other buses facilitate seeing most of the major tourist sights. It is on a wide, busy road and does not have a neighborhood feel. However, it is directly next to the Capitoline Hill, Forum, Palatine Hill, and Coliseum - so it is great for seeing those sights. It is also directly across the river from Trastavere which is good for food and nightlife. I do think I would have preferred to have stayed closer to the Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain areas. The hotel is very smartly decorated. The service was just fine. For some reason, maybe because we were staying so many nights, we got a special deal that included free internet, breakfast, and a 100 Euro gift certificate that could be used at the restaurant/bar. Breakfast was excellent. The roof top restaurant is a lovely place to lounge around. We thought the food was just fine - but we weren't too concerned about price because we were using the gift certificate. It is certainly a nice amenity if you are really tired at the end of the day and don't want to go back out into the thick of things. The walls were very thin, and you could hear noises from the rooms beside and above you. My mother-in-law had to wear earplugs to sleep because her neighbors would watch TV late at night. My in-laws also had problems with the air conditioning. It shuts off when you open the windows. They never opened the windows, but the maids would do so each day when they were cleaning. We finally figured out that you had to SLAM the windows closed hard in order to get the air conditioning to come back on. Rooms and bathrooms were quite large by European standards I would recommend this hotel and stay here again - though I would probably consider options located near the Spanish Steps or Trevi Fountain first.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: normor
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the 47 from Sept. 29-Oct .2 and thought the rooms, food, and location were exceptional. We never encountered slow service in the rooftop restaurant (Circus) or in the mainfloor bar which served lunch. One waiter in the Circus restaurant, Antonio, did everything possible to make our dinner enjoyable. The front desk people (Elena especially and Carlo the bellman) were very helpful and notified me personally with a message from our daughter who phoned when we were out sightseeing the first day we arrived. The hotel is so comfortable it really eases the effects of jet lag. It's close to the Circus Maximus, the Teatro Marcelo, the Ghetto, The Forum, Capitoline Hill, Piazza Venezia (Mussolini gave his speeches from the balcony). If you walk south along via del Circo Massimo, cross over and head down via di Santa Sabina, you'll come to Piazza Pietro d'Illiria (great view of Vatican) and down to the astounding 10th C. church S. Sabina, then look through the key hole of the Knights of Malta in the Piazza Cavalieri di Malta. Then walk down further to see Rome's only pyramid and the Protestant Cemetery for the graves of Keats and Shelley (but it closes at 5pm). Hop on the metro 1 euro and head back to Circo Massimo metro--and walk back to Hotel 47. There's a small stand up cafe behind the hotel (east) on via Di Val Tellina www.cristallidizucchero.it --that's the name Cristalli di Zucchero (sugar crystals) which has fabulous snacks, pastries and cappucino--for ridiculously low prices. You'll hesitate before going back to Starbuck's--for sure. Don't pass up on Hotel 47. The other three hotels on our tour did not compare to this gem

Reviews.Title: “Good for Price”
Reviews.Author: pbear11
Reviews.Content: Very nice and clean hotel but the service is not up to par. It was our first visit to Rome and we would have appreciated a little more open suggestions of top things to do, nightlife, etc. Felt their staff was not up to par with the current tourist events in their city and sometimes they were a little short and rude as well. In terms of the room, it was very large compared to Rome standards and very clean and contemporary. The lobby is small but that does not effect us and the breakfast buffet was great too. Overall a great stay if you're on a mid-range budget.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT hotel in a GREAT location!”
Reviews.Author: teachskool
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic place to "come home to" each night! I'm from the USA so it was REFRESHING to find a hotel that had a stand-up, enclosed SHOWER! The room was on the fifth floor and had a HUGE terrace with a STUNNING view! The staff spoke beautiful English and was VERY helpful. We wish we had made reservations for the roof-top restaurant, but because it was booked - the concierge told us of a FABULOUS place to go instead. Loved all the helpful suggestions. AND, they stored our luggage for five hours on the day we checked out, so that we could do the "Angels and Demons Tour". HIGHLY RECOMMEND! Also, different from the other hotels we stayed in ... this one was ROOMY!

Reviews.Title: “good value for its money - free breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: randomblogger
Reviews.Content: I'll make it really easy by listing pros and cons. We were in Rome for 3 days for our honeymoon before heading to the Amalfi Coast. PROS * Size of the room was pretty nice (deluxe) * Cleanliness of the room * Free breakfast (good selection) * Rooftop bar * Professional personnel (perfect English) * Walkable to Trastevere where all the good, "cheaper" restaurants are (15 minutes by foot) * Comfortable king size bed * Close to Colosseum and Roman Forum (15 minutes by foot) * Modern decor CONS * Concierge was unreliable with late wake up call (by 30-45 minutes!!!) and they were a bit understaffed * Location - it is slightly off a beaten path and not as nice as Via Veneto or Borghese but again I was happy it was walkable to Trastevere so I'm not sure this is a con * Very small lobby (no bell boy in sight to help us) * Internet was 10 euros but we got to use it for free once Next time I go to Rome, I'd like to stay at a hotel in Via Veneto only because it's really nice to walk around there. However, I'd recommend this hotel to friends because it was clean and it was nice with no real complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Location and Staff”
Reviews.Author: Ravn
Reviews.Content: We felt we were sleeping among the ruins! It is all about location and the behaviour of the staff and we attest that they are both exceptional. We drove to Rome and had a little trouble finding the location since the hotel signage is discreet and the traffic has its own set routine. There was no parking but the staff asked for our keys and kept an eagle eye out for the next available space and it was a permanent no payment spot which we never had to move our car for the duration of our stay. For breakfast eat outside, the breakfast staff seems to have some problems with the demands. But the reception staff is extraordinary. Our room had a large balcony over the street and it was very pleasant to sit in the lounge chairs to read about the next days excursions, we had room on the balcony to have room service delivered and privately take in the sounds and rhythm of the city, just the two of us. We conduct a lot of business while on holiday, and we had to pay for the second internet connection, only one plug in at a time but second laptop had a price every 24 hours. The spa is a throw-in, nothing to talk about, but it is a nice perk after a hard walking day. We ate in Rome, but the best food we had was at the top restaurant in the Forty-Seven. I think Rome is good for fast tourist food, eat well at the restaurant or read up and collect addresses of other fine restaurants in the area. Please do yourself a favor and try to squeeze in the fountains they have around Rome. Another tip: Forty-Seven had a special offer for a lower priced room with a free restaurant meal and other coupons. We wanted the deluxe room which did not have the perks. We are very fortunate that management, prior to our arrival, agreed to give us the perks with our chosen deluxe room. The next time we visit Rome, we agreed we are staying at the Forty-Seven.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay on our honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: tcblue5
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved the Fortyseven! We were within walking distance of many of the main tourist "must see" spots in Rome as well as couple less touristy areas- perfect for exploring. Our room was spacious and beautiful. The staff was lovely and very helpful. If you have a chance, have dessert, if not dinner, at the hotel's roof top restaurant. It's wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant/modern, great location”
Reviews.Author: kristopherowens
Reviews.Content: The good: In my opinion, the hotel is in a great location. We could see the Tiber from our room as well as the Boca della verita. The Trastevere area of Rome was about a 7 minute walk. The Colosseum, Forum, etc...are about a 10 minute walk behind the hotel and past Circus Maximus. We were on our honeymoon, and I made note of this when I booked the hotel, and they had a bottle of champagne waiting for us. The room was nicely appointed, a mix of modern and comfortable elegance. Everything was new. The bathroom was great--very clean. There are lots of elevators, so we never had to wait to get to our room. There is an automatic blind that completely blacks out the room and any noise from the street. So having a street side room was no problem at all. Plus we got to see sunsets. Breakfast was probably the best we had on our trip. The bad: The air conditioner did what it wanted. It was never hot or uncomfortable, but sometimes if we wanted it cooler, or warmer, we couldn't figure it out.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!”
Reviews.Author: MarikaCf
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on previous reviews and must say that we have not regreted a thing! The hotel itself is in a great location just between the old center of rome and the colosseum that makes it just a few minutes walk from everywhere. The interior is tastefully modern without overdoing it and the rooms are well attended in modern style and very well equiped with many amenities and small details that make the difference. Taxis are easy to find (and buses) but if you like a bit of a walk then the hotel's location is a great base to explore the whole city. I cant say the breakfast couldn't be better but after reading many reviews on many Rome hotels i saw that generaly the breakfast is poor compared to what we are used to in Australia so i wasn't expecting much. If you ever stay here take the receptions advice on where to eat out, we did and each restaurant was better than the last

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: SheilaAndMatt
Reviews.Content: We stayed at hotel Fortyseven for 4 nights as part of a mini weekend break to Rome. In summary: - The hotel is in a great location and close to the Forum and also walkable to the Trastervere district where we ate every night - Breakfast was included which was good. - The hotel staff were friendly - Our room was nice enough, the bed wasn't the most comfortable we have slept in but it wasnt bad - The shower was good - We loved the hotel roof bar- highlight!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Service, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: bm2i
Reviews.Content: It couldn't have been a nicer stay. Huge, clean room - A/C, flat screen T.V., big clean bathroom. Nice and helpful staff - fluent in English (which was great since we didn't know any Italian). The restaurant on the roof was very good - good food and a ridiculously nice view. The location was great, too...minutes from the Colosseum, Palatine, all kinds of historical stuff and within walking distance of trastavere and lots of shopping. It was a great stay in a beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel near ancient Rome.”
Reviews.Author: CS01
Reviews.Content: Rome was the second leg of our trip, having just arrived from Madrid. We found the Hotel Fortyseven to be a nice hotel, one I would consider solid, but not something that would blow you away. One thing that is amazing is the size of the rooms. If they're all as large as the one we were in, which was booked as a standard room, then you'll be in good shape. It was easily the largest room we've stayed in while traveling in Europe. The rooms are well-appointed and spacious. We did have problems with our tv/internet and that problem was never resolved, even though I brought it to the attention of the hotel the day we got there. They did send someone up, but we never got it to work. Not a huge deal as we didn't spend much time in the room. We had room service the night before we left and it was sub- par. Not terrible by any stretch, but nothing to write home about. We could also hear the people in the room above us; the floors are hardwood, so we could hear their walking and banging, though it was faint. What was really nice was the location. You're right near everything you want to see in ancient Rome, yet all of the other attractions are also still within walking distance. They stated us walking to St. Peter's would be about an hour, but we walked there in about 45 minutes, with stops. You're right across a number of bridges that take you into Trestevere, which we really liked. All in all, this is a well-kept, modern hotel with spacious rooms and is within walking distance of everything you'll want to see.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: AICHI
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from Rome where we stayed seven nights at the Fortyseven. And I must say it was absolutely wonderful. The hotel is a treat, It’s boutique size and we were made to feel so welcome from the check in staff to the door man. Its location is also a bonus and made it easy to walk to some of the area’s main attractions. Our room was lovely with a terrace and the bathroom was well equipped. The breakfast was excellent. All in all loved the hotel and will most definitely go back there again, and I would recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and convenient hotel in good location.”
Reviews.Author: hcychan
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a central location. Since there were of us, we were booked in a Classic and a Deluxe Double room, with a cot in the Deluxe room. Bathrooms were a decent size and brightly lit. Nice amenities in the Deluxe room. Rooms were facing the street, so it could be noisy at night, but the windows and shutters were great at canceling out the lights and sounds outside. Very nice breakfast on the ground floor with plenty of fresh fruit, toast, meats and cheeses. Nice rooftop restaurant. Staff were very helpful and friendly. Good value considering it is hard to find that in Europe! Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “great base-beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: gillvegas
Reviews.Content: after extensive searching we picked this hotel for its contempory decor. we got a better deal (included meal/hotel voucher) by booking direct with hotel. it was our 10th wedding anniversary and the staff were great at emailling me confirmation of our table booking before we went. we also received a complimentary bottle of fizz-which was a lovely surprise. The gym is cramped, but functional-and I'd be stuck to pick a piece of equipment that was not there. However, their steam room looked out of action. Reception staff assisted quickly with travel adaptors (packed the wrong ones again!), taxis and general info. Easy walk to Trastervere-which I'm not sure I would have visited if I had been further into the city-and it was easily the best meal ever-57 euro (including a bottle of wine). Just wished they could have stopped the rain!

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem In Rome”
Reviews.Author: Rizzy_04
Reviews.Content: 47 Hotel was a real gem of a hotel. Great location, just away from the hustle of the city but all within a 5 min walk to main sites. Staff professional. Rooms superb (love the shutters to get a better sleep). Bathroom was clean and spacious. Breakfast was basic and plentiful. All in all great hotal for a great city

Reviews.Title: “Very good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: orhideea2006
Reviews.Content: Well I'll be short you get what you pay. We get advantage of their promotion Summer Longer and got a promo price+some gifts from the hotel... Strong points: - good location -access to all the Rome points of attraction; - clean rooms; - very very professional stuff at the reception; - nice view restaurant -supervalue for the rooms you get Weak points: - poor breakfast; - unfriendly people in the breakfast zone; - food in the Circus rooftop restaurant was medium

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Fortyseven”
Reviews.Author: bbbrutus
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fortyseven on one of their special offers. Included in this was a breakfast buffet, dinner at the rooftop restaurant and a 50 Euro voucher to use towards the minibar or lunch at the restaurant. The restaurant has views of Trastevere and provided us with our best meal in Rome. We stayed in a classic double which was huge and came with a big ensuite bathroom. The staff are extremely friendly and will go out of their way to help you. The hotel is located about a 10 minute walk from Circo Massimo Metro station but does have a bus stop right outside the front. Once again the staff were very helpful in telling us which bus to take where. I would highly recommend this hotel for a long weekend in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel choiec”
Reviews.Author: Richard_A_UK
Reviews.Content: I booked several rooms at Hotel Fortyseven and I was very impressed with them. I was very impressed with the standard especially as I am very hard to please when it comes to a good hotel. The rooms were a good size, clean and bright and well maintained. The staff were polite and all spoke good English and were helpful for booking tours and giving general advice. The hotels location is excellent. Short walk to restaurants in an evening, lovely park area just outside with two temples. Walking back to the hotel in an evening was a pleasure because there are so many sights to walk past. The hotels restaurant is excellent and the service was superb. The deserts really were something else, it's just a shame I didn't get to try them all!! I really can't think of anything to mark the hotel down on, they ticked all the boxes and more besides. Should I return to Rome I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “When in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Traveler1923
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was near the Coliseum and Roman Forum. While it was not convenient to walk to the subway, there was a city bus stop outside of the hotel that we used often. The staff at the hotel was helpful in determining which bus we needed based on our destination. The hotel was modern, clean, and had a cool rooftop restaurant. Our room was quite large compared to European standards.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have chosen a better hotel!”
Reviews.Author: rkjm
Reviews.Content: Flew by Easyjet from Bristol. Um-ed and ah-ed about whether to get a limo or taxi transfer but ended up going with the Terravision Bus service to Termini and the 170 Bus from Termini to the hotel and returning the same way. Total cost per person 10 Euro, saving you the cost of around 2 diners, depending on what you eat! The transfer was a doddle. We had booked a standard double through Expedia, but the hotel kindly placed us on the 5th floor in a room with 6ft bed and balcony, and a splendid view (UK) an awesome view (US). The hotel and room was spotless and the service was first rate. We noted some previous comments about the staff not always looking entirely happy, and whilst this was sometimes the case with the odd one or two, you could not fault their standrad of service. Breakfast was good and plentiful with a mix of continental breads, cheese, ham, pastries and the obligatory scrambled eggs, sausages and bacon, probably to pacify the North American visitors. That said, it set you up for the day! The main hotel restaurant on the roof had a superb position and was a great place to sit and drink as the sun went down, but it was not cheap, 2 G&Ts was 17 Euro. The menu prices were probably similar to restaurants in town but with a more reduced menu. The position of the hotel could not have been better for strolling to Circus Maximus, Colosseum, Forum and Palantine Hill. Close by is also the Capitoline Museum. A must is a visit to the Mouth of Truth that is hung in the portico of the Church of Santa Maria in Cosmedin, which is just across the road from the hotel. After a short queue you can make out to be Cary Grant while your good lady plays Audrey Hepburn, ok slightly tat but it makes a break from all the really ancient stuff. Most of the sights are within relatively easy walking distance and those that are not (Vatican) are an easy bus ride away, invariably caught from outside the hotel. You can buy the bus tickets from hotel reception. Right, enough waffle. This was a great hotel and we will be staying there again next time we return to Rome. Stop reading and book it and try and get a 5th floor room!

Reviews.Title: “Make no mistake, this is a superb hotel if you don't expect or require the usual 'chain' hotel experience.”
Reviews.Author: Marco_Ferraro
Reviews.Content: Make no mistake, this is a superb hotel if you don't expect or require the usual 'chain' hotel experience. We found the location ideal, it's not right in the tourist hotspot areas, but with the popular circular tourist bus routes a minutes walk away from the front door that's no problem. We like walking, so managed to see most of what we wanted on foot. The staff were professional, helpful and provided a consistent level of service. The hotel and bedrooms were tastefully decorated in a modern, but not cold or utilitarian way. Rooftop restaurant in stunning location; superb menu for children, real food. The multinight offers are worth looking out for. For the quality of room, service and food, this hotel offers excellent value for money. We loved it, and will be back.

Reviews.Title: “A great choice”
Reviews.Author: I-Pay-I-Must-Get
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great choice for us. Rooms are modern and spacious, restaurant is very pleasant, location is just far enough to leave you out of the city noise. The staff is always there when you need.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: pb3121
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Fortyseven. THe location was great (we fully expected to walk every where we went) and we found the staff delightful. The room was clean and we never had an issue with noise. All in all, we would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for comfort, convenience, and price in Rome”
Reviews.Author: skilltel
Reviews.Content: After a bad hotel experience on our first visit to Italy in Venice... we were pleasantly suprised with Fortyseven. This modern hotel was very comfortable- the room was spacious, the bathroom was just right, the king sized bed was perfect- and most importantly the air conditioning was excellent. We found the location to be very centralized, we walked just about anywhere and everywhere on this leg of our trip. The concierge and staff were very friendly. The included breakfast was the best we had in Europe, and a great way to start a full day of exploration. Most major tourist attractions are within walking distance, and we found some great restaurants in the Pantheon area that were modern and upscale with great food. Would most definately stay at Fortyseven again when in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Fortyseven was the highlight of my European trip!”
Reviews.Author: d1m4family
Reviews.Content: Sorry this review is about one year too late, but this hotel was so lovely, I finally decided to write a review about it. After being in Paris, Venice, and Florence, Rome was the last stop on my European trip. I fell in love with this hotel. My husband and I were celebrating our 15th anniversary, and when we checked in, there was a bottle of champagne for us in our room! The room was gorgeous--so spacious compared to the other hotels I've experienced in the other European cities. Breakfast each morning was delicious and plentiful. The hotel had a bus stop nearby, so all the major attractions were easy for us to access. I would definitely stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay. Good value for Rome.”
Reviews.Author: CACinLA
Reviews.Content: We stayed here based on Trip Advisor and a NYT review. We were happy with our selction. I believe we got three nights for 720 euros plus a food and beverage credit. For that price in Rome, we were happy. 47 isn't the nicest hotel for sure and the staff is a little bit off their game. However, the rooms were spacious, the bed was comfortable, the A/C worked well and the bathroom was modern. So in all, I recommend it! I actually liked staying in the historical center. It was close to certain attractions and out of the way of the throng of tourists. The daily breakfast was good. We liked the restaurant's rooftop bar. We had a decent meal there, though avoid the squid. The concierges were nice if not completely professional. We got some good recommendations from there. In all we were pleased with our stay. It's not a hotel I'll remember for the experience but it was comfortable, good base in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Prototypical Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tskd
Reviews.Content: Fortyseven exemplifies the idea of a boutique hotel. Rooms are small, but well appointed. Amentieis are somewhat limited, but the staff is very helpful and friendly. It was a perfect place to return to after a day of sightseeing. We loved the location as most sights to see were within a 15 minute walk and there was also a bus stop practically out the door with buses to almost anywhere in Rome. Most importantly for us was the proximity to Trastevere where we dined on most nights. The biggest disappointment was the restaurant and bar. The food was fine, but you could get better quality food for less money in Trastevere. Also, there was no way to get a casual drink at the hotel during our stay. The first floor bar was closed and on the roof, there was no bar, only tables with waiter service amidst the diners. Overall, we liked it and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, wonderful people!”
Reviews.Author: takeomega3
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. Comfortable, clean rooms, close to everything, delighful breakfast and wonderful people. The only thing I have to mention is that the people serving breakfast were very professional but looked very unhappy, never smiled.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: justfrank
Reviews.Content: Fortyseven Hotel was our first stop on a 3 week trip to Italy. We couldn't have chosen better. The hotel arranged a driver, who was prompt and helpful. We arrived, as often happens when traveling from the US, before check-in time, and they really hustled to get a room ready for us. The location is right in the middle of the ancient area, with the Forum and Colosseum easy walking distance. Also an easy walk was Trastavere, which was right across the river and just full of evening action. Our room, a Deluxe Double, was very comfortable, of decent size with a nice little balcony. The included breakfast was good and the staff was excellent. I have only good things to say about this hotel, except that the Internet access in the room as 10 Euro and was wired, so only one of us could use it at a time.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, amazing service and excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: traveler_1234070
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel during our honeymoon and the service is excellent. Upon checking in, the concierge told us they were sending complimentary Prosecco to our room! They even gave us a map and highlighted all the areas to visit (very helpful), along with some helpful tips. The room was very clean and very modern for Italy. The only complaint that I have is the uncomfortable bed (it was two singles pushed together). Other than that tiny issue, everything else was great. The breakfast that was included (as part of our package) was delicious and the coffee was amazing. And I also loved that we received a complimentary bottle of water every night, when they turned down our beds. Lastly, the location is perfect for those visiting Rome for the first time -- we walked everywhere from the hotel and nothing was ever too far!

Reviews.Title: “Great base to explore Rome”
Reviews.Author: FootTraveller
Reviews.Content: After extensive research I settled on the 47 as a base to explore Rome with my family. All I can say is that the hotel and it's staff were brilliant. They made our stay very comfortable, on checking the concierge showed us on a map all the sites, where the best eateries were and how to get to all of our destinations. The breakfast every morning was excellent with a wide variety, and the one time we decided to eat dinner in the hotel the food was excellent. Overall a great place to stay and would stay again when visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “First Class”
Reviews.Author: nyclawyer64
Reviews.Content: This hotel surpassed my expectations. It was modern, elegant, and well-situated with superb, professional staff. The breakfast was great. Overall, outstanding quality for the price. I will stay again every time I vist Rome.

Reviews.Title: “COZY MODERN HOTEL, BEST LOCATION, VERY PLEASANT STAY....”
Reviews.Author: fetihis
Reviews.Content: I think that this hotel is all someone needs for a pleasant stay in Rome. It has clean comfortable rooms, renovated windows (= which means peace at nights, something very important for me and for any tired traveler I think ), nice modern furniture and a very comfortable clean bathroom. The service of the hotel is excellent , they try to find and bring you anything you ask (for example, I asked for an adapter for rechargeable batteries ) , they give you tips for sightseeing and maps and generally they do whatever to make you feel comfortable as they are there in the reception 24 hours a day for every question you have. The location is just best as there is near the river (for romantic walks), the most important places for sightseeing (roman forum , Colosseum, piazzas , theaters, monuments ) , near the territory with many traditional restaurants and off course near the shopping area of the city. We had a great time and we will definitely stay there again when we go back to Rome. Do not miss the breakfast, its rich and has the best cappuccino. The hotel is suitable for young couples and for families too. And something last : the rooms (at least our room) are just what the photos of the hotels site are showing

Reviews.Title: “Hotel 47 and Tour Guide Fabrizio Made the Trip”
Reviews.Author: texaswifeandmom
Reviews.Content: I chose Hotel 47 through the internet and couldn't have been more pleased. It was in a great location and the rooms were awesome. Huge marble bathroom with all new fixtures. Very contemporary and spacious for Rome, for anywhere actually. A/C worked great and the black out shutters were awesome. The staff was courteous and helpful. We enjoyed a bottle of wine on the rooftop restaurant and were served complementary finger food. We used an awesome tour guide named Fabrizio from La Dolce Vita Tours and were able to see all the highlights of Rome in a day and a half. We never had to wait for anything. I would highly recommend using him. He comes from four generations of Italian tour guides and is very knowledgeable and a complete gentleman. He even recommended a great restaurant that was so good, we went there both nights. He made our short stay in Rome successful, memorable, and very fun.

Reviews.Title: “50th Anniversary Trip”
Reviews.Author: RarinT0G0
Reviews.Content: Rome and the 47 Hotel was the last leg of our 50th Anniversary European Trip, and we stayed 7 days. This hotel is the best kept secret in Rome. The room was absolutely beautiful (4th floor in corner with views on two sides). Bottle of champagne in our room upon arrival to celebrate our 50th was lovely touch. The room was immaculate and huge (comparatively speaking), the staff was very helpful, breakfast was great (included), but after 7 days it would have been nice to have a little more variety. The location was great (Campidoglio), and we walked to the Colliseum, Forum, the river, Boca de Veritas, Jewish Ghetto, and lots of other sites. Easy walk in the evening to restaurants, and a park across the street great for people watching. Bus stop in front enabled us to get everywhere without the expense of taxis. We recommend highly.

Reviews.Title: “Great modern hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: boston97
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights in June. This was our first visit to Rome, and we loved the location. We walked everywhere - even the Vatican - and thought the hotel was very central. We found the best dining options to be in Trastevere, about a 5 minute walk. I had requested a quiet room prior to our arrival, and they made sure to honor that request when we arrived. There was no view to speak of, but we didn't have any street noise which was great. The rooms are very comfortable, spacious, and modern. The A/C worked well. The only area that needs improvement is the service at the rooftop restaurant (& room service, which is the same staff). The service was insanely slow. They definitely need to have more than 2 people working each shift. The restaurant and bar were pretty full, but the waitresses could not keep up. However, we noticed that slow service was very common in Italy. Overall, we liked our stay and would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best Experience -- room, service, and cappucino”
Reviews.Author: engzrbunnie
Reviews.Content: Thanks to great reviews from Trip Advisor, we booked a room at Fortyseven Hotel. As soon as my husband and I checked in, the reception was fabulous. Instead of standing up at a usual hotel front desk, we sat down with the receptionist who is seated at a desk and checked in. The receptionists were very friendly and professional and a lot of hotels should look to them as great examples of customer service. They also gave great recommendations for places to eat including a deli on 63 Trastevere Street which has the best pizza and bruschetta we ever had. The room is very clean, modern and big. The bathroom is also clean, modern and big. They have big closets and enough room to move around. Food: We had dinner and drinks on the rooftop and the staff were very professional and friendly. The food was great. During drinks they gave us some appetizers to go with our drink. The food was fabulous. They offered us a 3 course dinner which was fabulous. Make sure to get recommendations from the concierge for restaurants. They sent us to Piperno's which is in the Jewish Ghetto and had a fabulous meal there. They won't steer you wrong. Breakfast was fantastic. They had caprese salad, fresh ham and salami, fruit, pastries and they also had American breakfast of eggs, sausage and bacon which we didn't touch because of the other fresh selection.
