They also have the best cappuccino and we had several all over Rome and their's is still the best. The hotel is close to the coliseum and bus stop. The location is also nice because it is far from the bustle of tourists and people. The last thing you want is a noisy hotel with too much foot traffic. If we go back to Rome, we will definitely stay there again. To the staff of Hotel Fortyseven, please keep on doing a great job and we recommend to anyone visiting Rome to stay at your hotel. You guys are fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Rooms, OK Location”
Reviews.Author: durhamrf
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 3 nights. It was difficult to select a hotel that was not outrageously expensive, centrally located, and with comfortable accommodations. Hotel Forty-Seven did not disappoint!! The room was modern, clean, spacious, with a king size bed and excellent shower/bathroom. We enjoyed the breakfast buffet which was very good. The hotel staff were very friendly and even provided small gifts for our two children who were not with us. We had dinner on their rooftop restaurant which was part of our package. It was one of the best meals we had in Rome with a nice view as well. The location was a bit away from the center of town but near Travasterre for good restaurants and not too far from the Colloseum. I would definitely stay at this hotel again!! (My boyfrriend also proposed to me on this trip - very romantic!!)

Reviews.Title: “Great location - quiet but central”
Reviews.Author: 1976agnes
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel 47 for the first stop on our honeymoon. Rome hotels tend to be pricey so this one was a good compromise - stylish, clean, good food and our perfect location. We could walk into the city centre or Trastevere easily for something to eat. It was right on the edge of the Forum. The staff were friendly but best of all was the breakfast - we stocked up in the morning and didn't need anything till night. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here and would absolutely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A trendy hotel, with friendly people.”
Reviews.Author: UtrechtsurMer
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel, we were surprised to see that there was not a normal entrance, but two glass desks with hip chairs for customers. The approach of the team is very relaxed, and everybody is always helpfull. The breakfast was good, and the restaurant at the roof is great, We loved the champagne, and the snacks they provide as a surprise. The location is excellent, when you love history. It's in between the capitol, the aventijn, forum romanum. When i looked out of my window there were two temples. I would advice to visit the restaurant at the isola tiberini. It will surprise you, and is a 3 minute walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Location & Value”
Reviews.Author: Primadonna9
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Fortyseven Hotel the end of May. We decided on this hotel due to the great reviews on Expedia and TripAdvisor. The hotel did not disappoint. The hotel staff service was excellent and so was the location. We were able to walk to all of the local attractions within 5 to 20 minutes (except for the Vatican). The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful with giving us directions, tips for good restaurants in the area and answering all of our questions. The rooms are very modern and chic. The free breakfast buffet was above average. As for dinner and drinks, we walked 3 minutes across the river to Trastevere every night. There are numerous dining spots in this area. Overall, I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Modern Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: catravelfans
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights in May and were quite pleased with our choice. The hotel is well situated...a 10-30 minute walk to all of the major sights. The rooms are modern, chic, clean, and spacious. Breakfast buffet is generous, offering a great selection of both American and Italian options. We had dinner at the on-site restaurant one of the nights and were not disappointed. The food and wine selection was good, view was amazing, and the staff was attentive. Our only minor complaint was in terms of the inconsistent service from the front desk staff. Some were very friendly and helpful and some not so much. All and all...a great place that we would not hesitate to recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Good!”
Reviews.Author: karinli
Reviews.Content: Nice modern hotel, friendly staff. Loved the location just accross from Trastevere (for dinner and drinks!), next to the Roman Forum, and in walking distance of everything - if you're reasonable fit.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome oasis from the bustling city”
Reviews.Author: HoustonKaty_Mom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Forty Seven from May 5-12th. Prior to our arrival, the hotel offered to arrange a car for us. The driver was waiting for us. He helped us with our bags and took us directly to the hotel in his black mercedes sedan for 50 euros. It was well worth it. Upon our request, the hotel arranged for the same service to return us to the airport. We had a deluxe room and check in was very efficient. Our room was sparkling clean and looked exactly the same as the pictures on the website. The people working in the lobby were gracious and helpful. They gave me a free internet access card to use on the lobby computer. Husband and I had breakfast every morning downstairs in the beautiful courtyard. The ladies working the buffet area brought me a pot of coffee and a pitcher of warmed milk. I loved the granola, yogurt and multi grained bread you could slice yourself. The husband loved the caprese (tomato/mozzerella), salami, ham, eggs, etc. We stayed 7 nights at the Forty Seven and never tired of the breakfast. Late one evening we went to the roof restaurant for a drink. We waited about 30 minutes and left after being ignored. The bathroom in our room had a great shower. It was very large and had one of those rain shower heads that came from the ceiling instead of the wall. The towels were soft, thick and very absorbent. Even the soap and lotion were good! The bed was very comfortable. When we returned from a day full of sightseeing, our bed was made, yummy chocolates and a weather forecast for the following day were left on the pillow! The air conditioning worked great. We used the noise reduction/room darkening screen on our window. There is a safe in the room. We walked alot to the attractions. Also we rode the city bus that stops right next door to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great modern hotel with wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: TravelGalRed
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend Fortyseven Hotel if you're considering it for your next trip. Rooms are very modern and extremely clean. Room blackout shades were so effective we accidentally slept until 3PM the day after our red-eye flight! However, noise levels outside were high following a pivotal win by the national football team, causing a different night to be sleepless. There was a wide variety at breakfast, especially for my vegetarian husband. Food quality and freshness was top-notch. Location is great if you're looking to be close, but not too close, to all the sites. The short walk to Travestere for dinner each night was a highlight of our trip. The bus stops right outside the hotel for easy access to more distant sites. The staff was very helpful and friendly. They helped us figure out the city busses, made several excellent dinner recommendations, and answered a few general questions that helped us plan our visit better.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, Modern, Great Breakfast but lacks key Amenities for the Rate”
Reviews.Author: miaolivia
Reviews.Content: Decor/ambiance: refreshingly modern rooms and public spaces, although not the best we've seen in the 4/5-star category Room/Cleanliness: spacious (for Euro standard), very comfortable and clean Amenities: nice, basic amenities and following extras (note about weather forecast nightly, voucher for 1 gratis cocktail per guest during stay); includes outlet in bathroom for US plug but NOT grounded (problematic) Breakfast: great with wide selection Service: reliable, though not out of the ordinary, and friendliness is hit-and-miss (still, above average for Rome, I guess, but that doesn't say much) Main Complaint: charge for Wi-fi in room and net access in lobby! It is shocking that in 2009 a 4-star hotel in a major city would not include at least wi-fi in-room in the current rate, especially at these rates. I expect and don't mind paying higher rates to travel comfortably and stay in 4+ star hotels so no complaint there, but it's inadequate, short-sighted, backward-thinking and well, unrefined, for a hotel such as 47 to nickel-and-dime on what is now such a basic, modern convenience for its target market. This isn't the norm, even in Italy, because we stayed at another generally comparable hotel that did include both wi-fi and net access in lobby at no additional charge.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous rooms; horrible restaurant”
Reviews.Author: MARworld
Reviews.Content: First, I should say, this was, hands down, the nicest room of any hotel we have stayed in Italy. It is large, well-appointed, with a very comfortable bed and a large bathroom with a great shower, and a very effective AC system. And the place is modern and clean. We stayed in a Deluxe King. The woman who welcomed us in the very pretty lobby was nice, and gave us good restaurant tips. Some of the other concierge types were just basically efficient, showing little interest in being welcoming or warm. The hotel has a great gym, and a neat "Turkish bath" (steam room) off the gym. I was craving a gym during my 3 week stint in Italy. The rooms are pretty pricey, however; so you are paying for the space and the nice decor. Also, the location is a little odd: it's a couple of minute walk to get out of the ruins, where there is no real street life. That means it's quiet at night (easier sleeping), but a bit boring in the very immediate vicinity (unless you are all about the ruins). The only real bummer was the restaurant. We tried it because others had given it a good review. It was HORRIBLE. Silverware was dirty. Floor was worn. Food was down-right terrible. We have eaten every meal out in Italy since our arrival 3 weeks ago, and have not had one bad meal, even at little hole-in-the-wall places. We had our only bad meal of the trip at this hotel restaurant. And the kicker was that it was one of the most expensive of the trip. How is it that every restaurant in Rome seems to have fabulous cooking, but the Hotel 47 chef can't make a decent plate of pasta? I hope we just caught the place on a bad night, but I think it's just a bad restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Fresh & Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: YoungunFortWorth_TX
Reviews.Content: Our room was lovely, overlooked the Forum. Well appointed & a good size by European standards. The bathroom was smallish but very modern. The rooftop bar/restaurent had wonderful views, the food, drink & service all excellent. The breakfast buffet was outstanding, with a great assortment of fresh breads, fruits, meats, juices etc. Overall, a very pleasureable experience!

Reviews.Title: “a great hotel in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: jrca
Reviews.Content: really liked this hotel. not cheap but it's rome and therefore thought it was great for it's location, type of hotel and their fantastic roof terrace. i would definitely recommend it..

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: yuri916
Reviews.Content: Hotel doesnt have a parking lot. We parked next to the hotel, the car got broken in to and all our luggage was stolen. My mother needed the heart medicine. The hotel staff didnt care! They sent us driving in the middle of the night looking for a police station to file the report and to find the pharmacy. They completely ignore all our desperate requests for help. Do NOT stay here!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “An oasis in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Avagoodholiday
Reviews.Content: The 47 Hotel is located in the Ancient quarter, so there are Roman ruins everywhere you look. Although it is not close to restaurants and shops, it's a lot quieter than many other areas of Rome. The rooms are large, clean and modern (in a tasteful way). I like that the bathroom was large by European standards and trendy. They had one of those large round shower heads that drench you which is great after a day of walking in the heat. At first I thought the service was a bit standoffish and some information supplied wasn't really helpful. Try catching a bus without a ticket, then finding out that we could actually buy them from the Hotel! Waste of time. However most were approachable and friendly. In particular the waitress on the rooftop restaurant - lovely. The beds were very comfortable. The amenities were great. The internet didn't work but we coped. Breakfast selection was good and there was bacon and scrambled eggs (or looked like scrambled eggs - what is it with Hotels and fake eggs?) was available. If you can't be bothered walking somewhere for dinner, do try the rooftop restaurant. Book. You can watch the sunset behind St Peter's Basillica. The food and wine is really good quality and the service was very good. My sister didn't order an entree but the Chef made her a little dish anyway. How nice is that? It is a little on the expensive side but spoil yourself and have a wonderful Roman experience. This Hotel was a little expensive but really well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SybilVimes
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the fortyseven for our wedding in Rome and the hotel was fabulous. Our deluxe room was excellent and had a huge balcony. All the staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel is in a great location, a short walk to the colosseum etc but not too noisy. We will definitely be staying here next time we come to Rome

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC!”
Reviews.Author: mheer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the 47 in Rome over the May bank holiday. The hotel was spotless and the service was great through out our stay. This hotel for me ticked all the boxes, after having searched nearly all 1400 of them this comes up top! You will not be disappointed. Breaksfast was definately worth the money and most certainly not skimped on when ordered to the room. We did not eat at the restaurant on site as there are so so many places to eat. A great chinese we found (the best i have ever eaten to be honest) was the Tien Tsin on Via Capo le Case 55, Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: ellimizani
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Fortyseven hotel 5/16-5/19, also stayed there May of 2008. This hotel is truly wonderful, rooms are contemporary and sleek, breakfast is wonderful, location is awesome. Walking distance to many historical sites. It's a bit on the pricey side (about $330/nt) but really worth every penny. I've stayed at a 3 other hotels in Rome in the past, I would not stay anywhere else in the future. Rooms are fairly large, staff are SO friendly and helpful. Really no complaints whatsoever! This hotel should have a higher rating on tripadvisor!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice room to come back to after sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: Kdm154
Reviews.Content: Amazing bathroom, Amazing bed= amazing room. The hotel is very nice, its modern and very clean. The shower was amazing. We had a deluxe corner room on the third floor, it had very nice views. We did not have any problems with noise. We slept with the windows open on 2 nights. The location is great. I recommend going to trastevere for dinner. There are plenty of places to choose from and it takes under 10 minutes to walk there. Our favorite was La Scala. There is a Despar market about 8 blocks away. We purchased water, wine and beer to keep in the room for after a long day. It saved us a lot of money. The daytime desk staff was very helpful, I suggest asking for dinner recomendations from them before you start your day. The night clerk was unhelpful and made poor suggestions. The breakfast was fine for me, I had a yogurt, toast and an espresso every morning. They have meats, cheese, eggs, bacon, sausages and cereals. the breakfast is over at 10:30 but get there early if you want to sit in the courtyard. They close it around 10:15am. One morning we were in the middle of eating breakfast at 10:20 am, they asked us to go inside and finish because they were closing the outside. I understand not letting additional people sit outside but why make us get up and move with our food after we have been sitting there for over 10 minutes already. I would stay here again, this was my fourth trip to europe and this was the best hotel I have stayed in there.

Reviews.Title: “Fortyseven is Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: sd28
Reviews.Content: Fortyseven is situated just within the city centre. Far enough away from the buzz but close enough to walk everywhere. It is situated very close to many of the major sites and we felt safe at all times. We walked each nite to restaurants in nearby Trastevere, Campo D'Fiori areas. The hotel itself is a beautiful property with more of a "Cosmopolitan Boutique Hotel" feel. Contemporary, fresh, and trendy. The staff is very friendly and most helpful in making your stay welcome. Alina at the front desk was exceptional in her attentive service and geniune warmth. We celebrated our anniversary on this trip and the hotel nicely added a bottle of Proscecco upon our arrival and offered us a beautiful room (#509) with an incredible terrace. After each day of discovering the city we felt ourselves wanting to return to the room to enjoy the wonderful terrace with the delightful scent of orange blossoms blooming just outside our door. Breakfast was wonderful and bountiful. There was plenty of lovely pastries, cheese, cold cuts, scrambled eggs, bacon, cereals, juices available. Coffee, cappuccino, and espresso were made to order and included. We sat in the wonderful outdoor courtyard each morning. There was always plenty of space. Most of the travellers appeared to be business types, couples and a few families with youngsters. Our only one hiccup was room service on the first night. We had arrived jet-lagged and wanted to sleep. So, eventually when we rose after midnight we called up for room service for a bite to eat. There was none to be had. Luckily I had packed some snacks from home anyway. Our guess is that they are still working this out. But otherwise it's perfect! Overall, a fantastic hotel that is a little more chic with great attentive staff. They have a beautiful rooftop terrace lounge/restaurant that is a great place to unwind at the end of the day.

Reviews.Title: “comfort”
Reviews.Author: LCaraway
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed this hotel as the finale of my euro trip, I decided to shell out the money on something more expensive and I don't regret that I did. The room was really large, there was room to move around and navigate which seemed rare by european standards. The bathroom and shower were giant, and coming back to the hotel at night was a great feeling. Room was equipped with a mini bar as well. I'm not sure why other people called the breakfast a 'continental' or 'small' when it was really an all out breakfast, continually refreshed. This really helped to start your day off when you have such a wide variety of hot and cold food ready for you. The breakfast was great by all accounts, only complaint I have is the time-- I wish it could have been served until 11AM. I booked a three night package, which came with a nice voucher to my surprise, overall I had a very pleasant stay. The location is really just minutes away from the colosseum, but a lot of the other attractions in the city are a bit away, although walkable. Only downside I could see was sometimes they appeared under staffed. The staff were hard working and always on the move, but all quite friendly. As well, the internet was not free of charge, although I didn't need to make much use of it. If I were going back to Rome I think I would choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay; biggest bathrooms in Rome”
Reviews.Author: PaperChased
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in Rome three times, and this was far and away the best hotel I've stayed at. The others were both 4 star hotels, but they were old school Roman hotels: small beds, cramped quarters, and barely adequate showers. 47 was a modern jewel in a city full of antiquated hotels. The bathroom was comparatively huge with good water pressure, hot water, and nice stone tiles. The styling in the rooms was great, and our window had a heavy-duty metal shade that could block out noise and light. The location isn't Rome's best--you're on very a busy street, and you aren't right in the middle of the touristy parts (although Trastavere and the Pantheon are easy walks). A hotel near the Pantheon or Spanish Steps is probably better located, but the old city is still so compact that we were able to walk everywhere--Vatican, Forum, Spanish Steps--from our hotel without any problem. We found the service to be great. Wonderful front desk and concierge. We even got a free bottle of champagne upon checking in. The breakfast was a good continental breakfast. You probably wouldn't go there day after day if you had to pay for it separately, but it's pretty good for being included in the room expense. When we return to Rome, our first choice will be to stay at 47 again.

Reviews.Title: “Sparkling Fortyseven!”
Reviews.Author: Metaxas
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Fortyseven for 3 nights in early April and this was perhaps the most enjoyable hotel stay I have ever experienced. I had pondered long and hard over where to stay in Rome, given its (somewhat) chequered reputation for hotels that either exorbitantly priced, lacking in quality or even both together. After reading the reviews on FortySeven, we decided to go with it, especially after getting a good deal online. We opted for a hotel pickup from FCO , which was welcome after an arduous trip from Sydney via London. On arrival, staff were extremely friendly and courteous and we were installed in our fourth floor room in no time. The rooms are impeccably clean, spacious, quiet and well appointed with all the necessities. Moreover, the bathrooms are large by continental european standards which is a bonus. After a long day sightseeing, the very comfortable bed ensured a good nights sleep. The hotel itself is very elegant and tastefully decorated with a pleasant outdoor courtyard and an fantastic rooftop terrace with great views over the Tiber and the surrounding buildings. The buffet breakfast is also perfect preparation for the I highly recommend an evening cocktail on the rooftop. There are buses that leave from just down the road although the Centro Storico (Spanish Steps, Piazza Navona etc) is a pleasant 20 minute walk. It is very well located for the Forum, Circus Maximus and Coliseum which are 10 minutes walk away. The hotel staff are ever ready to order a taxi if you require it for places such as the Vatican (about 15 euros) and the taxis arrive almost immediately.The other great advantage of the FortySeven is its close proxmity to Trastevere (and all its excellent little restaurants) which is a short walk over the Tiber. I can't recommend this hotel enough; it is haven of peace and organisation in a chaotic and frenetic city.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room with balcony.”
Reviews.Author: Anzelina
Reviews.Content: We had a great welcome from reception & were pleased with our room with balcony & view of Tempio di Vesta. The bathroom was small, but we had no problem with noise, maybe because we were on the 5th floor. Breakfast was ok, but I expected something a bit more special, & tea & coffee were never hot enough. On arrival, being tired & hungry we decided to lunch in the delightful courtyard. It was very enjoyable, but rather pricey & not a lot of choice. Sightseeing in Rome is pretty exhausting & it would have been lovely to be able to make ourselves a cup of tea at the end of the day. I know very few European hotels provide this but if they want good reviews then why not? It would have been a thoughtful touch. One evening we were too worn out to go looking for a restaurant so ordered room service, which was fine, but again, very pricey & limited choice. The same can be said of the roof restaurant which hardly anyone seemed to be using whilst we were there. We did enjoy a couple of nightcaps there, but were almost alone. There is usually a van nearby for buying drinks etc. in the daytime, but otherwise there is nowhere near to stock up on snacks etc. Trastevere was about a 10-15min walk & there are plenty of restaurants there. It is impossible to find a hotel near all the sights in Rome & this is probably as good as most if you are reasonably fit. But if you want restaurants, shops etc on your doorstop this may not be the place for you. We bought skip the line tkts for the Vatican on the internet, but we needn't have bothered. At 2.30pm on a Saturday there was a queue but it was moving quickly. Also we did not automatically go through to the Basilica, as we had been told, but had to queue again. Take good walking shoes & plenty of money - you'll need both! All in all, I thought the hotel was good but there could have been a little more thoughtfulness for the weary tourist.

Reviews.Title: “Good Overall, Great Location, Service is the main flaw”
Reviews.Author: Rumpelstiltskin79
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as a surprise weekend away for my partner's birthday. We booked our taxi from the airport through the hotel, and it was nice to have a designated car waiting for us at the airport. I had heard that taxi rides can be rather hairy experiences but the driver and car was top notch. I booked a double delux room which on arrival didn't have a bath, just a shower, but I had requested a room on a lower floor as I'm not too keen on lifts/heights so maybe the choice was limited. The room was nice and clean and spacious. We ate at the rofotop restaurant on the first night, and as it was November and chilly, the restaurant was cold as there is no actual permanent inside seating area, there were plastic transparent shutters pulled down, which meant the view wasn't very good. I ordered fish as a main course which was rubbery, they quickly replaced it though. The food was quite expensive. The hotel is really close to ancient rome, so we were a short walk from Circus Maximus and the Colosseum. The colosseum tour was brilliant, we bought it from one of the vendors that haggle outside the venue, and it included entrance. Be aware that the tour is unlikely to start in "just 5 minutes" as promised, they begin the tour when they have their quota of customers (we waited 35 minutes). A short walk from the hotel is also the Vial di Trastavere, where there are lots of restaurants and cafes. We had amazing pizza, the wine was good. Service is generally laid back... We took a taxi across Rome from the hotel to the vatican which didn't take long and cost 9 euros. We ate in the room on the 2nd night as we were tired. Room service was your standard fare. We ordered a bottle of wine which took almost an hour which was a bit ridiculous considering we were on the first floor directly above the bar area. On our third and final night the concierge recommended a lovely chinese restaurant we were really impressed as there aren't many chinese restaurants in Rome so had low expectations, but it was really good fresh food. The cocktails at the bar in the hotel are very nice. There were limited staff probably due to the time of year. The wireless internet wouldn't work so had to use the dial up. I find it ridiculous that hotels can charge for any internet usage but it did come at a cost. I would recommend this hotel if there are any special deals on, but it is overpriced for the standards of service that they deliver.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but quality of service flawed”
Reviews.Author: hblnk
Reviews.Content: If hotels were about location and design only, this place would be a winner. But hotels are about people. Some of whom who read pages like these. The staff at this place quite clearly would rather be doing something else than listening to customers. In fact, they are. We had to search for the staff and when we found one, he or she then expertedly explained that someone else was responsible for the request we had. Considering the prices this places charges, I would rate it rather poor value for money.

Reviews.Title: “The best trip ever!”
Reviews.Author: LeslieGeorgeMaine
Reviews.Content: From arrival to departure, this hotel was excellent. The staff was very friendly and professional, always helpful. The location could not have been better. We walked everywhere - never a need for a taxi or public transport. Steps away from great dining and night life in Trasteverde section. Rooms could use a paint job but were very cool and contemporary looking. We had a balcony room on the 5th floor and a view of the city - unbelievable! Bathroom was great, spacious, nice shower. Loved the breakfast - all the things Americans love and some Italian specialties as well. Bar was well stocked and lots of fun. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Traveler beware”
Reviews.Author: rivergirl4574
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean, the breakfast is ok, (but a free for all), and the room was decent. The elevator drove me nuts, sounded like banging on the walls when moving and the walls are pretty thin. Actually I was very happy the first few days there, but on my departure, something surprising happened. My husband and I decided to go for a final walk, so we left the hotel and I decided I needed a thicker coat. He waited for me outside while I went back to my room. I got to my room and could not open my door, it had been disabled. After about the 4th try, and standing there baffled, because the staff knew the time we were checking out, did not understand why my door would not open. Will, to my surprise, there was someone in my room, it was the bellman. I had the "do not disturb sign" on my door, and never was notified by the front desk that someone needed to enter my room. They had every opportunity to let us know, but did not. The bellman and front desk knew we had walked out the door, they know everything that goes on, it is a small hotel. The bellman that opened my door, did not expect for us to return so soon. That is why he went as quickly to our room as he could. I do not know what or why he was in our room, but one can only feel like they were about to be victimized and do to this I was very upset. Since when do hotels, allow their staff to have access to a room without the guest being aware, and especially with a "do not disturb" sign on the door. The hotel has responded to me by stating that the bellman is also a technician, and he was there to fix the A/C. But, if this was such an emergency, then how come I was not notified. In my opinion, the fact that an employee can enter an occupied room without permission, and with a sign on the door, is one thing. But for the hotel to do it the minute we walked out the door ignoring the sign, and not disclosing to us a reason, is horrifiying to me. We could have been a victim and would not have discovered it until we either got to the airport, or home, more than likely the later. Then who would be to blame, by then it is too late. Nothing was missing, but the employee did not have enough time. In confronting the front desk, they did not have a clue he was in my room. I will let you be the judge for yourself as to whether or not you should stay here. The plus in this hotel, free breakfast, close to everything, and somewhat accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ellochka
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice and conveniently located to most attractions. About 15 min to Piazza Navona. (Some ppl prefer that or near that location). We walked everywhere. It's about 45 min to Vatican, which is the farthest destination point. The bus stop is right in front. Great area 5 min away full of great restaurants. Keep in mind, standard rooms are quite small with small bathrooms. We got upgraded to deluxe. That room is nice, good decor, and comfortable. No bathtubs but nice, large showers. Most rooms face the street and you can hear the cars through the windows. But not bad. Breakfast is good enough. Wide selection but the same every day. Ask for cappuccinos.The hotel has a nice outside courtyard for bkfst when weather permits. The rooms on 5th floor have balconies but are smaller. The concierge and front desk is very helpful and we got some great recs for restaurants! I did an extensive research as far as hotels go. We got the best rate (low 200s) through Expedia.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent "Family" Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: lanna43
Reviews.Content: Having used previous reviews to help us with our choice for hotels in Rome, I felt it appropriate that we should post our own. Our stay at Fortyseven Hotel Rome was fantastic. We loved the location as it was away from the crowds, yet close enough to all of the major attractions. The hotel is very clean, the rooms large and quite. Staff were friendly, knowledgeable and very helpful with everything from accommodating our requests at time of booking to recommending some great restaurants close by. We were so impressed with the hotel that we decided to return at the end of our trip through Italy, rather than stay at an airport hotel as we had originally planned. For me and my family, it was a little like coming back home. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a great place to stay in Rome. Great value for the money and a good refuge from Romes busy sites. Also, if the hotel recommends the restaurant "Inn Roma" - definitely worth the visit! Very close to the hotel and we were so impressed we made this our "last supper" in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend”
Reviews.Author: xe_cross
Reviews.Content: Very friendly, stylish and comfortable hotel. It was everything we wanted and also in a very good spot. The staff were friendly and very helpful, arranging reservations at restaurants and ordering taxis. We also ate in the Circus restaurant which gave terrific views across the Tiber and also wonderful food. If ever we go back to Rome, we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: NCK72
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights in March. The location was very good, there are plenty of sights within 15 minutes, walking. The Travastere area across the bridge has all the restaurantes and bars you need. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful, the rooms were clean and spacious, the views from our room were great adn the breakfast was good. The roof top bar was great also. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful, friendly, hotel”
Reviews.Author: kdove
Reviews.Content: A newish building, big room, extremely nice and helpful staff. Breakfast was among the best in Europe, location is also enjoyable. will definitely stay again.. next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great bit of quiet in the middle of busy Rome”
Reviews.Author: offto
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel! It is modern and clean and a nice place to feel peace after dodging cars and people all day. The beds are really comfortable and they even have two type of pillows on the bed so you can pick what makes you most comfortable. We appreciated the breakfast before heading out each day and found it a much larger selection than most European hotels. The staff is helpful and friendly, the location close to some of the major attractions, and the rooms so clean and wonderful. They even left a gift for our daughter with a little note with her name on it on our first evening. Note: If you take a taxi from the train station and it costs more than around 11E ask the hotel for assistance with the taxi driver before paying. We payed way too much and found out the hotel could have set the taxi driver straight if we had asked.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Would Stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: Globetrotter2267
Reviews.Content: The Fortyseven was all that it claimed to be. Excellent location, walking distance to historical ancient ruins such as Colosseum, Forum, Palentine Hill. The hotel was very clean & fresh. Daily Breakfast was good. Our room was superior and roomier than expected. One complaint, the roof-top resturant & bar they rave about on their website was never open. Each day we were told it would be open that night, and each night it was not. Other than that, I would say it lived up to it's claims.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: NYCguy66
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay in Rome at 47 Hotel. This was in spite of a minor mishap with a minor fire and smoke. The staff handled it professionally. The rooms are small, but well appointed with a decent sized bathroom. Rooms at the front of the hotel (like mine) can be a little loud from traffic, but the automatic shutters keep the noise out. The common areas were comfortable . The inclusive breakfast is simple but very good. We ate one night at the rooftop restaurant....it was a littl chilly, but the view was great and the service, food and wine were very good. The location is perfect in that it is by the the river in the old city with its many ruins. Travel via taxi, public buses and tour buses is very convenient. If you are looking for a nice, small, well located hotel, I highly recommend 47 Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service and Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: betsie32
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Fortyseven over a long weekend with our three year old son. The staff went out of their way to make us comfortable and happy. They were extremely helpful, friendly and accomodating. The rooms were very clean, comfortable and spacious. Tthe location is great- walking distance to everything. The free breakfast in the morning was delicious, everything you need for a day of siteseeing. It is everything you want in a hotel, we highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place.”
Reviews.Author: AMP2008London
Reviews.Content: Great location - about 10 minutes walk from the Colloseum, with bus stop about 20 yards down the road which has busses that go to the Vatican and many other sites. Another 10 minute walk across the bridge and you are near some off the tourist route restaurants which are very good and very reasonable. We had a Delux room which was a very good size, and quiet too. Complimentary breakfast has something for everyone - savoury and sweet. We would go back. One tip when you are out and about - when near one of the major tourist sites, don;t eat on the main roads as you will get ripped off. Try one of the more local places down the side streets or quieter squares, and check prices first.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely smaller boutique hotel in great City”
Reviews.Author: CharlieCB
Reviews.Content: We stayed at 47 for the first week of February partly to celebrate my birthday and our anniversary, but also to have a break after an extremely busy period at work. We decided to use the hotels airport transfer service (cost €50) as this seemed to be only about €5 more than the suggested taxi fare. This worked well, a comfortable car and no worries about finding the hotel, although like most Italian drivers, I think the driver was a would be Ferrari racing driver. The check in was highly efficient and friendly and as we expected throughout the stay virtually everyone we spoke to were pretty fluent in English (note to self must find time to learn Italian!) They were also very helpful with directions to the attractions and the bus stop is just 20 yards from the front door. Number 81 to Vatican City and 95 to Villa Borghese, and at €1 each for the journey not overly expensive, although leaving most mornings just after 9 meant that seats were not always available. We walked back each day and the City is small enough that meandering means it is not too exhausting. The room was a corner room, plenty of space and the only point that we might have expected/appreciated would be coffee etc. in the room. The bed was firm as we like it and plenty wide enough. We only ate in the restaurant on my birthday, the meal was good, maybe a little pricey and as we tended to eat at lunchtime a full meal was too much to eat. Breakfast was the usual self serve continental buffet, with bacon, sausage and scrambled egg for the "English" part. All very nice. We did spend a few evenings chatting in the hotel bar and had an afternoon drink there a couple of times, and the nibbles provided, savoury in the evening and pastry in the afternoon were very yummy. We did most of the must see attractions. We had pre-booked a tour guide for the Vatican museums. On the first Monday in February we found that we did not really need to do this as the queue to buy tickets was short and we had to wait half an hour or so while we waited for her to arrive and us and our fellow tourists to be kitted out with audio equipment so we could hear what she was saying. Don't get me wrong, the information the guide provided was interesting and informative, but on reflection we would have started earlier and seen as much, I guess, if we had wandered on our own. Possibly might have missed a few useful nuggets of information that she provided though. As it was an all day ticket we did then go around on our own to see the bits we were especially interested in, a small but good modern art collection, after we had a snack at the Museum. We were not impressed with the snack and may have been better to have continued looking around on our own and eating later. The most disappointing aspect to the tour was the Sistine Chapel. It says it should be a room of peace and no photos were allowed. These stipulations were mostly ignored and it felt like being in the middle of a cattle market! After visiting the Last Supper in Milan last yar where a number of visitors are allowed in on a strictly time controlled basis, we felt let down and that they could do so much better. What it would be like in the height of the tourist season, we dread to think. The Colisseum was stunning but needs to be visited early in the day so that the combined ticket for the Forum is not wasted. We arrived in the afternoon and did not have time to do the Forum that day as it was getting too late. The Pantheon was really impressive and although had a lot of visitors seemed to be much more peaceful than the Sistine Chapel. St Peter's Basilica was also so impressive, beautiful and very peaceful. The trek up the steps to the Cupola is an achievement but exhausting. There is a lift for some of the way, although I foolishly thought the exercise would be good for me! At the top, though, the view made it worthwhile! We ate at a number of the "tourist" restaurants and got good but tourist price food. The last lunchtime we went over to Trastevere and found Il Ponentino in Piazza del Drago. Looked from the outside another tourist type place but inside we found it was occupied by more Italians than tourists, a small very good value food restaurant which was well prepared and the service was just so friendly. If only we had gone there on the first day!! Overall a great stay in a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jw9691
Reviews.Content: I just spent 5 nights at the hotel and thought it was great...very reasonably priced for the quality. Rooms were very comfortable and clean, staff was great and made some excellent restauarant recommendations in the area. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to others!

Reviews.Title: “Good until New Year's Eve party”
Reviews.Author: Michael0809
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel new, charming, and well located. We got a small but nice room with a big bathroom and a terrace overlooking the temples. Staff at reception and bar were nice, although breakfast was always very busy. Our main disappointment came at New Year's. We paid €100 to attend the party at the hotel rooftop. The party did not correspond at all to what we were told. First, we had to wait a long queue for the lift to get to the rooftop. Second, once upstairs, we realised that there were only 5 or 6 tables, hardly enough to accommodate the 80-100 people in the party. This meant that most of the people ate standing and there was very limited space to move around. Third, the food arrived at 11pm and there were very long queues, the food was cold, and there was very limited quantity of each of the dishes and some of them arrived very late. Fourth, the free bar was limited to very few drinks. At the check out, we were informed that other guests had complaint about the party. They even encouraged us to complain and gave us the hotel manager business card. However, when we contacted the hotel to express our disappointment with the party, the Sales Team replied that the they did not share any of our complaints, and no apology was given.

Reviews.Title: “Best boutique hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Iseult23
Reviews.Content: This is my second time here in less than a year and I couldn't imagine staying anywhere else in Rome. This is a great hotel and at this time of year it was practically empty. 2 of the 3 nights we had the only table in the dining room. Now, you might wonder why in a city known for food we are eating in the hotel, the answer is simple. The Hotel 47's chef is AWESOME. While the breakfast buffet is just average, he excels at lunch and dinner. He experiments with seasonal changes but also keeps the Roman staples of carbonara and amatriciana. Both excellent. The chocolate lava cake is still too die for and I indulge in it at least 2-3 times every visit. The staff here welcomes you back time and time again like you are old friends or family. They know the city and are willing to go the extra mile to help you get anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: PDWallace
Reviews.Content: Based on reviews in Tripadviser we chose the Forty Seven Hotel in Rome for a 3 day break at the end of November. Overall the hotel was excellent - great location near to the Forum and Colleseum. We were upgraded to a deluxe room which had great space and the bed was really comfortable. Breakfast was good and the evening meal in the hotel was excellent although would have been quite expensive except it was included in a special offer we got (3 days b&b plus a dinner). Service was good although the hotel was very quiet when we visited and on occasion we felt a little isolated. Best feature is the rooftop terrace and the location. Would recommend for a city break where you want a location to walk to all the key sites in Rome but don't want the usual "chintzy" Italian hotel style.

Reviews.Title: “Fourth Time and Still Love It”
Reviews.Author: JETravelers
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth time staying at the Forty Seven Hotel and when we go to Rome the next time we will be staying there again. The rooms are luxurious, clean and comfortable. The breakfast buffet is excellent, the common areas modern and comfortable, but the one thing that seems to stand out above all is their signature mark of SERVICE! From the time we checked in until we checked out, the staff provided the best service available anywhere we have stayed. If you are looking for an outstanding exerience in the heart of Rome, this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Great location to sights”
Reviews.Author: pengysan
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in great location, within walking distance to the Palantine, Colosseum, Tomb of Unknown Soldier, etc. and the bus to the Vatican was right in front of the hotel. The rooms were spacious, the bathroom big with enough counter space for your toiletries. The rooms are clean and the hotel was surprisingly somewhat eco-friendly.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: SpikeydogDurham
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights to ceebrate our silver wedding,and we were very pleased we chose this hotel.We were told on arrival that we had been upgraded to a suite free of charge. We had a lovely terrace area overlooking the city,and fortunately due to the warm weather we could enjoy a drink there, after a hard days sight seeing. The bathroom was spotless and the bed was very clean and comfortable.Breakfast was good, a lovely fresh fruit salad,bread,continental meats,cereals,pastries, and also a hot selection.We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: happybunny75
Reviews.Content: From checking in to room cleaning to breakfast, this hotel provided a great base in which to explore Rome. All staff were very polite and helpful, the rooms were clean and spacious and you could swing a cat in the bathroom, if you so desire. The breakfast was a combination of cold and hot buffet items which meant we weren't having to interrupt valuable sightseeing time. Within easy walking distance of the Colossuem, Forum and Piazza Venezia and about 10 minutes from Trastevere across the river where there is a good selection of Trattorias at very reasonable prices. There is also a tour bus stop within two minutes walk from the hotel as well as stops for local buses.

Reviews.Title: “47 is nice....”
Reviews.Author: UMKhan
Reviews.Content: We were traveling with our two toddlers and coming from a hectic journey from Paris and Madrid and frankly speaking, I was a little worried as to how my hotel in Rome would turn out to be like…!! But Hotel 47 proved all my fears wrong as it turned out to be a comfortable experience overall….although I did face some minor challenges like charging my laptop/PDA when needed (because the adaptors did not work as expected!!) but the English speaking hotel staff more than compensated every minor detail with their splendid service and friendliness. I would specially mention the lovely Liza on the front desk who has been extremely helpful with not only our touring guidelines but also came up with great shopping tips which my wife loved!!! The location of the hotel is also great if you are planning to roam around on foot, but also right in front of the hotel, there is a tourist bus stop which was greatly helpful as traveling with 2 babies sometimes did become challenging for us…. Although we ordered room service just a few times, but we found the food great and truly representing the fabulous taste of the Italian cuisine. Bravo to the Chef….!! The menu of the breakfast was kinda alright, but its setting was great and our children had a great time having the breakfast. I recommend hotel 47 based on our experience, and would gladly come back again when in Rome the next time….

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Janet K
Reviews.Content: My boyfirend and I stayed there for his birthday trip to Italy. The location was fantastic but the service was above and beyond. We made several arrangements with the concierge while we were there and every need that we had was exceeded. Any time we needed a restaurant, they would suggest the perfect place. The staff was so nice and always willing to go out of their way for you. The amenities in the rooms were nice and the roof top bar was outstanding. We enjoyed martinis at sunset overlooking the temple of Vesta. I would also suggest trying the carrot soup that is on the menu (aside from all of the wonderful pasta dishes that they have). It was perfect for a lite dinner one evening. This hotel is a must if you are visiting Rome. They have a great location, amazing team, and really add to the experience of your visit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: sylvi97
Reviews.Content: If you're worried about picking a nice hotel, good location in Rome, look no further. This place is great, centrally located, close to bus lines, EXCELLENT service and accommodations. You'll feel right at home there. The staff speaks english and are exceptionally helpful. Its a very good price for a good hotel in italy. Best hotel we stayed in during our trip to Venice, Florence and Rome. I'm picky. This is a great place. Visit the roof top bar / restaurant!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and modern in Rome”
Reviews.Author: MarmyEngland
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Forty Seven for nine nights of our honeymoon. The previous hotels we'd stayed at during our trip were very different from the Forty Seven (old, charming buildings with an understated elegance), so I wasn't really expecting too much from this uber-modern hotel. However, I don't mind admitting that I was wrong! Yes, the hotel is very modern, but at the same time it exudes a certain charm and was really very comfortable indeed. From previous experience of hotels of this calibre, I was also slightly concerned that the staff might be rather stuffy. Happily, however, I was again proven wrong. We were both made to feel very welcome, and the staff really went out of their way to make our stay special - this extended to their leaving a bottle of champagne in our room. The location of the hotel is brilliant. Pretty much all of Rome's major sites are in walking distance (the Colosseum is about 10-15 mins away - depending on how fast you walk - and we strolled over to the Vatican in around 40 mins) and there are a great variety of restaurants and shops only a short walk away. We both loved Rome, and are already making plans for a return visit. We won't hesitate to rebook the Hotel Forty Seven.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Sight Seeing”
Reviews.Author: Yorkshirebloke
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a weeks break in Rome at the Hotel Forty Seven. We stayed in a standard double room, which was of a decent size. Hard wood floors in the rooms, although they look nice, you could hear the person above, walking around the room at all hours wearing high heeled shoes, this coupled with the fact they can’t have been happy with the Feng Shui of the room, as they were constantly dragging the furniture around, making the noise they created start to grate very quickly. They have put rugs in the hallways presumably to dampen the noise. Also the walls between rooms must be thin as we could frequently hear the couple next door talking and laughing. The Bathroom was Compact but usable, although the shower/bath was a little on the small side with the taps offset to the side, I was constantly bumping into them, and I’m not the biggest of people. The hotel was clean, and kept to a high standard from what I could see, but that’s one of the things I like about minimalist design, there’s not many areas for dirt to hide. I can’t comment on the hotel restaurant, bar, room service or gym as we didn’t use any of them. I can recommend this hotel for the breakfast, as they supplied enough to suit most tastes, ranging from hot bacon, sausage and scrambled eggs to cereals, fruit salad, pastries and cold meats. Some reviews I read before I booked, in which people complained about the lack of space around the breakfast area, I though it was no smaller than anywhere else I had been, so don’t know what they’re talking about. There’s also a nice little ground level court yard to sit out in to eat your breakfast, or for evening drinks from the bar (see pic). Front desk staff were great, very friendly and eager to help from the moment we checked in, phoning the attractions up directly on a few occasions, to get us the opening times, nothing seemed to be too much trouble. There is the usual cable/satellite and internet through T.V. offering free and pay per view channels. There are Ethernet cables in every room and two pc’s in the lounge area available at cost. (Come on guy’s this is 2008 where is the complimentary Wi-Fi in the lobby). Don’t expect to charge any gadgets while you’re out and about, the rooms have a keyless entry system, you plug the card into a slot inside the room to activate the lights and plug sockets, so you have to be in the room with the lights on to charge anything, unless you use the socket in the bathroom (but ours didn’t work). I can’t comment on any outside noise from the road, as our room over looked a side street, but I could imagine there may be a problem for light sleepers in rooms overlooking the road, as it’s a cobble stone street and some of the drivers tear past the hotel as if their butts were on fire. This was the second time we had visited Rome, last year we stayed at the Splendide Royale next to Villa Borghese. But this time wanted to try another area of the city centre, and I’m glad we did as we’ve seen much more of the city from this location. On the one hand, it’s perfect for sight seeing on foot, I find this the best mode of transport as you get to see tons more places of interest, rather than a fleeting glimpse from a taxi, or the inside of a tunnel from the subway. The hotel itself is situated right behind Palatine Hill. Head to the left of the hotel for 60 seconds and you will find the church Santa Maria in Cosmadin which houses the Mouth of Truth, and just behind this church is Circo Massimo (Circus Maximus), walk to the end of Circo Massimo and turn left, and a few hundred yards down the road you have the entry to Palatine Hill, the Forum and also the Colosseum. Even the Vatican and Castel Sant Angelo, are only a 35 minute brisk walk away in the other direction, and even that is taking a route the long way through town, not down the river bank. There is a bus stop just outside the Santa Maria in Cosmadin Church for all the main sight seeing tour buses. On the other hand, the area is not exactly teeming with restaurants, like the Splendide Royale (Via Vittorio Veneto). Nearing the end of our stay we needed to exchange currency during a three day national holiday, I assumed the hotel offered this service, unfortunately it doesn’t, which was a pain as the only places that were open, wanted to rob your eye balls out. On the whole, I would say this hotel is worthy of it’s 4 star rating, and I would have no problem in recommending it as a good base to see the attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Loved up and Loving it in Rome”
Reviews.Author: YorkshireAliBongo
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel for our Honeymoon after looking through several websites to check the location and star ratings, and I must say we were not disappointed! Hotel directions on the website were very good - we opted for the train from the airport, then the underground to Circo Massimo then its just a short walk to the hotel down a straight road and its on the right hand side of the road (opposite Temple di Vestra). The staff, room and the food were all of a high quality. Hotel was a little off the beaten track - but its fine for the active people among us.. Drinking - ould recommend the Yoclana - Italian Chardonnay in the hotel - very good and reasonably priced. Eating - outside the hotel proved to be varied in price but not necessarily in taste. Best restaurants for Pizza were off a side street near the Pantheon. Stay away from the Plaza Navona - they will be very expensive!!!! All in all - good hotel for people who wanted to see Ancient Rome with a comfy pair of shoes..

Reviews.Title: “Superb 47”
Reviews.Author: Latty
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel in a great location! The staff were very professional and helpful. The room was very comfortable and clean, big for european standards. Eating breakfast in the courtyard was a relaxing way to begin the day.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and very helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: shortysue
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from a 5 day stay in Rome to celebrate our first anniversary, and we are so happy that we chose to stay at the Fortyseven Hotel. When we arrived at the hotel, the gentleman at the front desk made us feel very welcomed and without asking, pulled out a map and showed us where the main tourist attractions were, where to eat, and where to shop. We were very impressed with the helpfulness of the staff. The location is great! Close to most things, but not too close where you felt overly crowded when you walked out the front door. Everything was within walk-able distance, except the Vatican. However, there is a bus stop in front of the hotel that takes you right to the Vatican. The room was very clean and spacious, the bed was comfortable, and we had a great view from our window. When the windows were shut, we did not find it very noisy as some reviewers commented. Overall, we loved this hotel and it was the hotel staff that made our stay perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cruisin10
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our group that included children. Good location for sightseeing. Hotel had good views from the spacious rooms. Great rain shower heads in bathrooms. Comfy beds that were large. Great breakfast buffet. Great view from rooftop restaurant with an excellent children's menu. Staff was efficient but somewhat stuffy. Housekeeping did not replenish amenities in the evenings as stated in the room brochure.

Reviews.Title: “Ulta cool, contemporary”
Reviews.Author: npretzel
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay at this hotel. Very techy--in fact at first we couldn't figure out how to turn on the lights! The rooms were very slick and very clean with reasonably-sized bathrooms The service was very good, from the front desk to the concierge. A great breakfast is served every morning with available seating in the courtyard. All rooms have very nice views--ours was of the courtyard, and our friends had a nice view of some ruins on the street. Pretty close to the center of many tourist attractions, although it was a long walk to the Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps. Was a very nice contrast to all the ancient ruins in the city. Would recommend highly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Staff, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: lowe12131
Reviews.Content: What a superb experience! Just got back from a 3 day trip to Rome, staying in the Fortyseven. A fantastic base to explore the city, well worth the few pounds more to be right in the heart of the Eternal City. Staff were great, very happy, smiling and helpful - the girl on the front desk was very chatty and gave us a map, and very helpful info on what to see, where to go etc.. We arrived quite afew hours before the alotted check-in time but no problem, our room was ready and we went straight up! perfect. Room was a good size, especially for central Rome, very clean, lovely big bed, quite contemporary, all the usual amenities and good air-con!! Necessary as it was 36deg + every day we were there. Buffet breakfast was nice, sets you up for a good day exploring. All the major sites are walkable, although you can really clock up the mileage, so stilleto's perhaps not the best footwear!! Roman Forum : 10 mins walk Colusseum : 15mins walk Circus Maximus : 5 mins walk Trevi Fountain : 20mins walk Pantheon : 20mins walk Spanish Steps : 25mins walk Vatican : 40 mins walk Would definitely recommend the Vatican, and if you can handle the climb, the 540 or so steps to the top of St Peters basilica gives an awesome panoramic view of the whole city. Unmissable. Be aware - they don't like uncovered shoulders/neck on ladies, or 'short' shorts - you need to cover up to get in, but is SO worth it. There is an incredible amount of stuff to see in Rome, and you just bathe in the atmosphere, especially places like the Collosseum, incredible to just be standing there! We were warned about pickpockets around the streets and attractions, so be on your guard! We never saw anything, although there were some unscrupulous locals fishing coins from the Trevi fountain with telescopic rods!! Dodgy blighters!!! Eating out, especially in the more 'touristy' areas can be a tad expensive, but I guess it's to be expected. The rooftop bar and restaurant at the hotel is lovely - great for a romantic meal for two, although check the limit on your credit card first, it is quite pricey. All in all, a wonderful experience, and i wouldn't hesitate going back, and certainly wouldn't hesitate recommending the Fortyseven as a place to stay. Treat yourself - you derserve it!!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lja123
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from the "Fortyseven" and thought it was brilliant. This small(ish) hotel is intimate, friendly but very professional. We had a deluxe double room which had plenty of space and a large marble bathroom. Staff very helpful, ordering taxi's when needed. On both occasions we were told, taxi will be here in 4 minutes, and it was! The roof top restaurant/bar was fantastic, great food, and again, great service. After the first time, (we went twice, it was so good) after my husband signed for the bill, I was presented with a lovely drawing (quite large) of the view from our room. It was a lovely touch! Walking distance to everything except the Vatican City. Book a tour for the Vatican City, don't just turn up. We booked a tour and got there just before 9am. The queue for people just turning up was already at least a mile long, 2 or 3 people deep. We were able to walk straight in, no wait at all. We went on a Friday, which we were advised was the least busiest day to visit - still busy though! Without a doubt, I would return to this hotel, and recommend it to anyone! Absolutely wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Accomodating Staff, Cool Rooftop Bar”
Reviews.Author: PlanoJay
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Fort-Seven Hotel in Rome during our 25th wedding anniversary. Having never been to Rome, this was the best hotel to stay in because of it's close proximity to most of the "old stuff" (as I call it); the coloseum, forum, circus maximus, etc. The bus also stops right in front of the hotel for trips to the Vatican and Pantheon. We only had a Saturday and Sunday to "do" Rome and we were able to leave the City having the satisfaction of saying to ourselves, "if we never make it back, at least we saw the (fill in the blank)". Althought the room price is high, it's within reason given the location, accomodations (nicest bed I've slept in, in a while) as well as the very helpful staff. The bar on the roof top is a must if you are staying here during the warmer months. We did eat there one night and the food was very acceptable and was a nice relaxing evening for the two of us. Bring good walking shoes and be prepared to walk EVERYWHERE. We were both worn out each evening.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, friendly staff, highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: jayjay470
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed at the hotel in June of this year for a long weekend. We loved the hotel, the staff were fantastic, especially the Concierge and Reception staff. The room we stayed in was a classic and was exceptionally clean. The bed was huge, by UK standards anyway, and the bathoom had a great "rain" shower. The TV was the usual mix of foreign language channels and Sky news etc... One note to mention is that the hairdryer in the bathroom was the old fashioned attached to the wall type with a long hose but no styling nozel to speak of. Luckily I had my GHDs with me, but if you need to style, take your own hairdryer. The bed linen was clean, and crisp and as it was 35 degs, the aircon was great. The breakfast was varied, incl., eggs & bacon, cereal, pastrys, fruit etc.. all fresh and really tasty. We did not eat at the rooftop restaurant but had a couple of drinks there, which were lovely after a days sightseeing in the heat as the roof gave off a lovely breeze. The hotel is centrally located to see all major sights, but at the same time a little away from the the crazy busy centre, at night it was lovely and quiet. Use the bus service to get everywhere, it is fantastically quick and efficient and its much more fun than getting a taxi as you get to see the city as well. The hotel tarif is not inexpensive, but then again, all the 4 star hotels in Rome appear to be around the same rate. I really enjoyed our stay here and would not hesitate to recommend to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Guis
Reviews.Content: After checking the reviews posted on Tripadvisor, we decided to give Hotel 47 a try. Glad we did, we have no complaints at all. The location was for us, excellent, a short walk to the Collosseum via the Roman Forum with a view of the Circus Maximus from the roof terrace! On arrival we were greated by a most pleasent receptionist who after checking us in, gave us a street map showing routes to the main attractions and also marking several restaurants for us to try. Please take the opportunity to talk to reception and also to the concierge, they are most helpful. The room we were given was at the side of the hotel, so we were not troubled by road noise from the very busy road that runs outside. It was a good size and very clean with fairly new furniture. The bathroom was of ample size and again, very clean. The room was kept very clean during our week long stay, towels changed each day and bed linen when requested. The room had a tv with internet access and also a mini-bar. The continental breakfast was very good, with a very good choice, very fresh with cooked food if required. Coffee was excellent! The waiting staff were very friendly and helpful. The roof top terrace bar was open on an evening, with views across the city. We booked walking tours with www.enjoyrome.com These helped miss the queues, expecially at the Vatican City, which were vast! The guide gave us a radio and we could hear her commenary well. Most recommended. We did try a bus tour, the stop is right outside the hotel, but this was not to our taste. We could see what we wanted to see by walking the route. The Trevi Fountain area is vert busy, we were later told that early morning or late afternoon is the best time to visit.

Reviews.Title: “What a honeymoon in Italy!”
Reviews.Author: off2negril
Reviews.Content: We booked hotel forty seven by winning a bid on sky auction, what a fantastic hotel right in the middle of Rome! The staff was exceptional, making all restaurant reservations and recommendations. Our balcony overlooked the old city, and the rooms were modern and large, for european standards. I highly recommend this hotel, the rooftop bar was fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: AandASanJose_CA
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Hotel 47 which is in an excellent location - walking distance to the Coloseum, Forum etc and just over the river from the Testevere district which has a huge range of great restaurants and bars. We had a superior double room which was slightly larger than we were expecting and had an extremely comfortable bed. The bathroom was very big with a huge shower and very nicely tiled throughout. The front desk were very helpful with check in and restaurant reservations when the concierge was not around (she seems to keep fairly restrictive hours!). There is a very pleasant bar on the roof with lovely views of the nearby area. Breakfast is included in the room rate and is very extensive with a wide variety of European and American items efficiently served by three waitresses.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel 47- Great area to stay in!!!”
Reviews.Author: gringa430
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel 47 in mid-May, and really loved the location!! The hotel is so close to the Colosseum, Forum, Palantine Hill, etc (which I've heard referred to as the historical district)...the area has a really nice feel and look about it. It's also very close to Trastevere on the other side of the Tiber, which we loved, and is a wonderful area for dinner/drinks or just wandering around. We also found the location of 47 to be a convenient distance from all the other sites of interest...Trevi, Pantheon...even the Vatican... As other posters have noted, the hotel is very clean and modern...rooms are well maintained and well-equipped...with a luxury feel...staff was friendly...only criticism I will make is that we were introduced to the concierge upon arrival, but never saw her again during our stay...however, the staff at the front desk were available and accommodating for any questions we had...so it really wasn't a big deal by any means... Also, I have to add that we thought the breakfast was very very good compared to the other 4 hotels we stayed at during our trip to Italy, and we didn't notice any road noise at all, as mentioned by other posters. We had a great stay at 47, and will definitely return!! I wouldn't stay anywhere else...

Reviews.Title: “Great base to explore Rome”
Reviews.Author: bisonDublin
Reviews.Content: Hotel 47 was probably the nicest place we stayed in our tour of Italy. We spent 5 days there and loved it. One day it rained and we stayed in the hotel all day! I know its 300 Euro a night so you expect Clean Rooms, Quality rooms, good food and all the facilittes. But often at these places the service can be efficient or even disinterested. Hotel 47 is not like that. All the staff are very friendly and helpful. My wife was pregnant and they we so good to her. We got great restaurant recommendations. Also the restaurant on the roof of the hotel is very good and not too expensive. Our bill wasn't a shock - no hidden extras. The rooms are very nice and the breakfast is excellent. We have stayed in a lot of similar hotels around the world i.e. 4 star in major city and this would be up there with the nicest to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location but loud”
Reviews.Author: Eustatia
Reviews.Content: The location of the Hotel 47 is great. Rome is a very small city – we walked everywhere every day of our weeklong stay. It right next to the river and you can cross the bridge and go out to the lovely residential neighborhood restaurants of the Trastervere. The hotel, however, is located on a main road and it is very noisy – if your room faces the main road, you have to close the outside electric shutters. Even then, I still had to use my earplugs. You may want to ask for a room on the side of the hotel away from the noise. All rooms have hardwood floors and are very pleasant. But they don’t use pads under the furniture legs so if the person in the room above or the maid drag furniture across the floor, it will make a good bit of noise in your room. The rooms are very clean with firm, modern looking furniture. Both the bed and chairs were too firm for much comfort. And there’s a lot of furniture packed into the room. The bathrooms were nice and clean. The closet in the room is tiny and the few pieces we brought could not fit in the provided space with hangars in short supply. The breakfast was great and fulfilling and the staff was very nice. We did not have good luck with the concierge, however. The phone just kept ringing with no answer every time we tried to reach her during the trip. I asked her about the restaurant in my guidebook but she discouraged us from trying it. Instead she sent us to the restaurant that was awful in every way – food, service and ambiance. The next day we went anyway to the restaurant recommended by the guidebook after all and it was the best restaurant of the whole trip. You are so much better off finding your own restaurant as we did every night than asking the hotel. I think they have a business alliance with certain restaurants. The bar upstairs is very pretty and the views are very nice. The drinks are very expensive - $15 -$18. One more thing, I asked for a bathrobe and the guy at the front desk said that I have to stay in the suite to be eligible to get one and if I pay enough that could be done. He said in the jokingly way but I felt rather insulted because when you pay 400 a night you expect to feel somewhat special on your vacation. I think he should have accommodated his guest with such a small request. Even though I loved the location of the hotel, I probably would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely attentive and kind staff”
Reviews.Author: coltsfans
Reviews.Content: Hotel Forty Seven is conveniently located near the Colliseum, Boca della Verita, Circus Maximus and a plethora of other ancient Roman sites. You are greeted by the sleek exterior of the building but there are no bellmen or anyone outside. It is chic but not a full luxury hotel. (If it is a luxurious retreat you seek check out Hotel Eden) Once we made our way into the building we were very graciously greeted by the front desk staff who were extremely accomodating to us weary travelers and allowed us to check in as soon as a room was available. The rooms are basic, nothing too posh but comfortable. The breakfast every morning is delicious. We were exprecting your standard pastries and fruit hotel breakfast fare but were pleasantly surprised by a large selection of proscuitto, bacon, sausage, cheeses, eggs, fruit, cereals, breads and pastries. For the price (350 Euro per night) I think we were expecting something more luxurious and liked the Hotel Excelsior Vittoria in Naples better but Hotel Forty Seven is definitely a great place to stay and the kindness of the staff cannot be beaten.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel could not fault it”
Reviews.Author: travellingtomtom
Reviews.Content: I decided on the 47 after scouring reviews on Tripadvisor. It was superb - I emailed a few questions to the hotel before arriving they were very happy to help and prompt in replying. On arriving our room was ready - a quieter room on the 3rd floor at the side of the hotel. Traffic can be heard but I suspect it is not as bad s a front street facing room and despite not having a view you spend more time out and about looking at the views not fromt the bedroom window. Room was spacious modern and well decorated . Great sized bathroom and shower/bath tub. Bed was very comfortable and the electric shutters helped keep the room cool and blackout for sleeping. Breakfast buffet was fantastic great seletion of fruit cereals pastries breads cheese and eggs bacon sausage.juices etc. Great way to set you up for the day. The hotel staff were all very friendly and although we did not use them for information purposes they were all very pleasant carrying bags to rooms calling a taxi and extending our chekout time as we had a later departure. Several of the staff even came to say goodbye as we left which was a nice personal touch. Would most definitely return to this hotel if visiting Rome again and have no qualms about reccommending to friends and family. I would urge people to ignore and negative reviews (there are very few) I am sure it is hard to please everyone but this hotel and I stay in many across the world for work cannot be faulted Finally the GLT Breen bus tour leaves from outside the door and once you get to know your way around this fantastic city you will be able to easily walk everywhere Collosseum, Trevi Fountains Spanish Steps We only used a taxi to and from the Train station for the airport. Well done Hotel Fortyseven thank you for a lovely stay

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: pvg
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for four nights following a cruise from London. We picked the hotel based on feedback on Tripadvisor and were quite happy with the choice. Front staff was friendly and helpful. Check-in was very efficient. We were placed in a room at the end of the second floor overlooking the front of the hotel. The room was quite spacious and had a huge bathroom. Furnishings were very stylish and modern. The room was extremely clean and comfortable; the bed was quite nice with high-quality linens. We did have some occasional noise issues with upstairs neighbors walking heavily on the hardwood floors in shoes and moving chairs, as well as housekeeping in the mornings.
