We had no problems with street noise and the room comes equipped with automated window closures. The room had Internet service for 10 euros a day. Most TV channels were in Italian, but we did find a few English channels to watch. You can also order movies, although we didn't do so. The room came with a safe, mini-bar, and bath amenities, including a towel heating rack. Self-service breakfast was included in our hotel rate. There was a good selection: hot foods, cereals, tomatoes and mozzarella, fruit, yogurt, and several juices. Service was friendly and efficient. We ate dinner at the hotel one night and were pleased with our meals. Food quality was very high, although there weren't a lot of menu choices. We liked certain dishes so much that we came back the following night for a "snack". We had to eat in the downstairs dining room for the first meal due to rain but were able to enjoy the rooftop the second time. The hotel is nicely situated near the Capitoline and Circus Maximus, close to the river and the Trastavere section of town. For transportation, we either walked or bought multi-day passes on the hop-on, hop-off tour buses. The buses run fairly frequently and hit all the major tourist stops, so they're an easy and predictable way to get around. Avoid the taxis, as the road traffic is insane and we got scammed by two drivers who didn't reset their meters. The Colosseum and ancient Rome area are very close; the major shopping areas are a good 30-45 min walk away, but easily doable. If you plan to visit the Borghese Gallery, note you have to purchase tickets ahead of time; we didn't realize this, so couldn't get in there during our stay. The concierge helped us with some restaurant suggestions. We tried the one closest to the hotel the last night and unfortunately had the worst meal of our three week trip there. Nice staff and lovely restaurant, but what we were served was not what we expected to have. If you can venture farther afield, I would recommend doing so, as there are tons of great restaurants all around. We would definitely stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: GirlLovesToTravel7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel 47 for 3 nights while in Rome and you can't beat the location. It's about a 5 minute to the Colosseum, Roman Forum, and Capital Hill. The walk to the Vatican is about 30 minutes. Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, and Pantheon are about a 15 min walk. It was wonderful because we never once had to take a cab or public transportation. Right across the river from the hotel is Trastevere which is a really cool area with great restaurants that are pretty cheap and a lively nightlife. There is only one thing I didn't like about the hotel. We arrived on a Sunday, so I went to the concierge to ask about restaurant recommendations. Well the lady told me that not many restaurants were open because it was Sunday and that we should eat at their rooftop restaurant. My husband and I looked at their prices and said no thank you...it's way overpriced for what you get and the drink prices are ridiulous. So, we went over to the Trastevere area (about a 5 min walk) across the bridge and the nightlife was hopping. We found tons and tons of open restaurants that were reasonably prices and the food was great. The nightlife on Sunday is hopping just like any other night, so don't let the hotel tell you that you have to eat at their overpriced restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: JMS1002
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoyed 4 days at the Fortyseven in mid-May 2008. The hotel is located in a nice part of town, only a few minute walk from the colosseum and other major historical sights, and right across the bridge from Trastevere. Fortyseven is clean, modern, well-appointed, with a friendly and helpful staff. The concierge especially went out of her way to help us with a Vatican tour, train tickets, and dinner suggestions. The rooftop restaurant was good, although service can be a bit slow. The circus bar on the main floor of the hotel looks abandoned. The one night my wife and I attempted to get a drink, we sat for 10 minutes unable to find a waiter or bartender so we gave up and left. The hotel is truly a boutique property, so don't expect a large staff and constant activity. Our room was very large by European standards, as was the bathroom. Fortunately the rooms all have thick windows and electric insulating metal night-shades which help dampen the street noise (which is loud and constant in Rome). Overall, a fine little hotel with no major problems.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in Rome, Great Rooms”
Reviews.Author: flydanair
Reviews.Content: The Hotel FortySeven is very well located in Rome. Major sights are within walking distance (Colosseum etc). The hotel is modern but without being minimalist. The hotel has an excellent roof top bar and whilst it was raining during our visit on a summers night it will be a perfect venue to look out across Rome whilst sipping on a delicious cocktail. The staff were very helpful on arrival and made an excellent choice of restaurant for us on our last night plus arranged our transfer back to the airport. We had a deluxe room which was huge and looking at the floor plan of the other rooms on our floor the standard rooms looked to be well proportioned also. The shower in the deluxe room has to be one of the biggest ive ever seen. The bedroom and bathroom were decorated to a very high standard. All the rooms looked to have electronic shutters which when fully closed helped to minimise outside noise. This was helpful because the only drawback of this hotel was the traffic along the road our hotel stood on. On a night the road isnt particularly busy but there is some traffic. During the day it was very busy and the fact it was cobbled made the noise slightly worse. Having said that I would stay here again, not all of the rooms were at the front and the comfort inside the rooms more than made up for any noise outside, which given the busy roads of Rome I would imagine quite a few of the hotels had this issue.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Forty Seven”
Reviews.Author: emo_qs
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights in May 2008 to celebrate our silver wedding anniversary. Prior to arrival the hotel staff were extremely helpful in providing information and arranged for a driver to pick us up from the airport [at a cost!]. Throughout our stay they proved helpful and polite and helped make the weekend memorable. Location is perfect if you wish to see the historic sites although the walking is tiring to say the least. Rooms clean, air conditioned and furnished in contempoary style. We would have no reservation in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location! Fab hotel for explorers”
Reviews.Author: sweetsnay
Reviews.Content: What a brilliant location. We walked most places to explore Rome and everywhere we headed our hotel was conveniently near. The room we had was lovely, we had some issues with the window but the porter was prompt and came to sort it out. A huge bed! Staff were helpful and friendly, advising us on places to visit and the best way to travel there. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great service in Rome”
Reviews.Author: CapTeb
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived, we were welcomed by a very friendly and attentive staff, who were more than happy to help. We had mentioned prior to our arrival that our stay at the hotel was part of our honeymoon and that we would like a nice room if possible. The room we were given was little bit small, but clean and nicely furnished but best of all, it had its own private balcony. The hotel is conveniently located for sightseeing and shopping, and is a short stroll from the restaurants in Travestere. The concierge was only too happy to help us plan excursions and provide us with information and recommendations for traditional restaurants. The facilities here are very good, as was the standard of the food. The views from the roof top restaurant sets the scene for a wonderful evening meal as the sun sets behind the hills of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel 47”
Reviews.Author: tx32f
Reviews.Content: Six of us stayed at Hotel 47 for 2 nights before our recent cruise. It was a perfect spot for our needs. We easily walked from the hotel to the Coliseum, the Forum, St. Peter in Chains, the Pantheon and Circus Maximus. And the "Mouth of Truth" from Roman Holiday was just down the street. The employees were all very helpful and cheerful. The front desk was efficient, the bellman courteous, and the waitresses (in the complimentary breakfast buffet) pleasant. The downstairs bar was woefully understaffed in the evenings, but that was a small blip in the operation. We didn't eat in the upstairs restaurant. All our rooms were large, clean, and modern. And the beds were wonderful after our long flights from the States. We were on the 4th floor, facing the busy street, but didn't hear much traffic noise. It was a bit expensive, but probably in line with hotels in any large city--especially with the dollar so weak right now. We booked our rooms online and the process was easy and efficient. When we got caught up in the American Airlines MD-80 debacle on our connecting flights in the US, we emailed Hotel 47 that we would be arriving late and they quickly emailed us back to assure us that they would hold our rooms. Hotel 47 made for a great start to a wonderful Italian holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ortrip
Reviews.Content: Have been to Rome a number of times and have never settled for a hotel that we really liked until we stayed in Hotel Fortyseven on our last visit. The hotel is centrally located to the historical area and walking distance to most other areas. Taxis are cheap and hotel will arrange within minutes. The reception is friendly and efficient, concierge recommended excellent restaurants. Breakfast is included in the rate and was excellent, usual continental breakfast but also scrambled eggs, bacon and excellent proper coffee. The rooms are clean and spacious (unusual for Rome). We stayed in a deluxe room and the beds are comfortable (actual king bed, not 2 singles pushed together) flat screen TV, bathroom large with huge shower and great water pressure, extras like exfoliating mitts/bath scales/bathrobes etc, turndown service, weather report for next few days. I would highly recommend this hotel. We will definitely stay here on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Suzanne85
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after extensive research online (I'm one of those annoying people who researches everything, twice, before making a decision). We weren't disappointed. The location of the hotel meant it was easy to get to all the major sites. We enjoy walking and had no problem walkng from the hotel to the furthest of the tourist sights. The room was a good size, although the windows overlook a fairly busy road so if you're a light sleeper you might want to consider somewhere further from a major thoroughfare. The bed however was a huge super-king and the most comfortable bed we've ever slept in. Breakfast in the hotel was a well stocked buffet affair and set us up for our long days of sightseeing very well. We didn't eat the in the restaurant, but we did have a few drinks in the bar. Thank God it was only a few as they were charging 7 euro for a bottle of Italian beer :o but then I suppose that's to be expected in a 4* hotel. The service in the hotel was excellent. I even got a birthday cake delivered from the Manager on my birthday, which was a nice touch. Tip: Don't bother with the coaches in from Ciampino airport. By the time you pay for the bus AND the cab from Termini, it's cheaper to get a cab direct from the airport to the hotel (30 euro).

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Bad Service”
Reviews.Author: SarahN79
Reviews.Content: The Good: The hotel is in a good location, albeit on a very busy road. The hotel is clean with everything you'd need. The rooms were spacious and well equipped! The reception and conceirge were excellent. The Bad: The bar and restaurant staff haven't got a clue. Do not know how to make cocktails that are on their menu. Serve the wrong drinks. Take incorrect food orders. We ate in the circus rooftop restaurant on Sunday as most restaurants are shut on Sunday's. It was overpriced and very over-rated. We told another waitress about the issues we had experienced and they did nothing. Upon check-out we mentioned it again, and received a 20% discount off the meal from the previous evening, so they did try and rectify the issues. On another note I would recommend a restaurant called Antico Arco. It was not far from the hotel, but worth every penny if you are celebrating a special occasion.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Very Nice Staff”
Reviews.Author: downtheroadnback
Reviews.Content: My wife, daughter and I stayed at the FortySeven Hotel for 5 days at the end of March and 1 more day before we left for home April 5. We loved the hotel. If there were FortySeven hotels in other cities that is where I would stay when visiting. It's a wonderful boutique hotel with all the amenities I've experienced at Westins and W's and even Ritz's but on a small, boutique scale. There is a small bar, a small lounge a small outdoor garden/patio and a small breakfast/dining room where the level of service and the quality of food is excellent. Additionally it all feels very European which I find refreshing in a much too homogenized world of chain hotels. Our room (Deluxe room on the 4th floor) was very nicely furnished in a modern, simple style- very clean and very comfortable. The bed was excellent and the extra bed which they brought in for my daughter was as firm and comfortable as our king bed. It was not a cot, it was not a pull out couch, it was not lumpy or saggy- it was a real bed with a thick mattress. The bathroom was spotless with marble or granite counters and with nice extra touches like a towel drier/warmer and a scale. Well, considering we were in Italy where food was almost constantly on our minds maybe the scale...... Though I've read some mention of the hotel being noisy we did not find that to be true. We were never disturbed by noise in the hallway or from other rooms and with the windows closed the nighttime noise was no greater and much less than other big city places I've stayed. No question that taking an afternoon nap with the windows open creates a noise challenge but this is a hotel in a big, vibrant, noisy city. If you are looking for a truly peaceful, noise free environment, Rome would not be at the top of my suggestion list. Maybe best of all was the staff. They were all nice, all of them. Granted some of them were less experienced than others but they were all nice and part of the charm of a small place is you get to know who to ask for what. And they seem so happy when they do help you. The concierge is very good. She helped us get tickets to a Serie A soccer game at Olympic Stadium and when we asked her for a simple restaurant where Romans might go she recommended exactly what we were hoping for. (A place where only 1 other party was made up of foreigners -in a city teeming with tourists- and where the staff seemed delighted we came. The cook who looked like Momma, came out to chat though we speak no Italian and she very little English.) We were in Rome with my brother and sister in law. Sadly, my sister in law is in a wheelchair. The bellmen always smiled and always, always were there to help carry her down the front steps to the street and always, always noticed us when we returned and rushed to open the wheelchair accessible side door. I loved Rome and I really liked FortySeven Hotel. Did I love Rome because of the hotel or did I like the hotel because we were in Rome? Does it matter? I highly recommend both.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: dmurphy
Reviews.Content: Hotel Fortyseven is a great choice for Rome. It's located right near Ancient Rome (about a 10-15 minute walk), and the neighborhoods of Trastevere and the Jewish Ghetto. The hotel is modern and comfortable, and the staff is excellent -- they all speak English and are very welcoming and helpful with all requests. When we arrived after a long flight, we were treated to breakfast while our room was being prepared. You will definitely look forward to the buffet breakfast every morning: pastries, breads, fruit, cheeses, meats, eggs, fresh cappuccinos (they will even make them with non-fat milk, hard to find in Italy) and juices. The room we stayed in was #410 - we were upgraded at check-in. The room was large and very nicely furnished. Chocolates on our pillows and a weather forecast for the next day, large TV and a king size bed. The bathroom was wonderful with a huge shower and the most towels I have ever seen in a hotel room! The hotel also has a cute courtyard where you can relax or have breakfast, and a rooftop restaurant that serves dinner nightly and drinks after 11pm. We were really spoiled here and we were thrilled to have such a comfortable oasis to come back to after days of sightseeing and crowds. While in Rome, if you are looking for a great dinner spot, check out Enoteca Capranica, near the Pantheon. Watch out for taxis who will be looking to overcharge you, and make sure not to miss out on a walk through Trastevere, which is much more of a typical Roman neighborhood with lots of quaint alleyways and small, family run restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great break in Rome”
Reviews.Author: AV1
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a good location for those who like walking. Also the Metro and bus stops are close by. Rooms are modern and clean. Buffet breakfast includes scrambled eggs, bacon, sausages, lovely fresh bread, cakes etc.... The staff are extremely helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: velinas
Reviews.Content: This is a very clean and efficient hotel. The location is wonderful, it is a 10 minute walk to the coliseum. There was 9 people taking up 5 rooms and everyone enjoyed there stay. Breakfast in the morning was great.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Forty seven”
Reviews.Author: hsbrz
Reviews.Content: Afetr some trips to Rome I discovered this gem in the city. Location wonderful, staff helpfull and nice, breakfast OK. Surely I will come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, good location”
Reviews.Author: miramol
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights when visiting Rome for the recent rugby international. Staff were very friendly and helped with restaurant recommendations and reservations. Room was pleasant, bright and modern. Hotel located on numerous bus routes including sight seeing buses and well located for forum, colossseum etc. We walked back from the stadio flaminio after the match and although it was a few miles it was a great way to see the city. Only criticism was the breakfast which was a bit uninspiring and the breakfast room was cramped. other wise would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “An absolute gem”
Reviews.Author: Crouchy10
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my wife for a five night stay. Great breakfast; fantastic service; clean. modern rooms; fabulous location. Couldn't recommend it more highly

Reviews.Title: “Great find!”
Reviews.Author: sky4700
Reviews.Content: A great little hotel. Stayed on 6th-10th February 2008. Unusually, the room looked as good as the pictures on line. Room: Clean, great bedding, minimalist lines, has the atmosphere of a boutique hotel. Room 412 had a lovely view, and was spotlessly clean. Before I review the hotel, I would like to mention the cab company that I found through Tripadvisor (Thanks to the people who recommended it). It is much cheaper and more convenient thatn any other mode of transport if you are more than 1 person. The cost is a standard EU35.- one way. It is called : Rome Shuttle Limousine , and their website is romeshuttlelimousine.com. The lobby of the hotel is not great, and on entering was a bit of a disappointment, but everything else about the hotel was great. The breakfast was excellent, the rate, very reasonable (booked through the hotel site). The location is wonderful.. near to everything. Trevi fountain was about 10-15 minutes on foot, and the Collesue a stone's throw away (just behind the hotel). The other side of the river is walking distance (Jewish quarter, etc). Furthermore, the bus stop was just outside the hotel. Ask the front desk staff for tickets and directions. Tickets are very reasonable, and the bus takes you everywhere, Vatican, Spanish Steps, etc, if you don't feel like walking. You can even reach the Catacombes by bus. Rome is like an outside museum, but don't miss the Villa Borghese (you need to book- the hotel can do this for you). The hotel can help you plan trips out of Rome. We went for a day trip to Napoli and Pompei. I checked the price of the trip by train, but it would have been the same and a lot more trouble. The coach took us there and back, provided a guide and a very decent lunch. Ask at the reception. There is a sightseeing bus ride that can be taken from the stop which is about 2 minutes away from the hotel. There are a million things to do in Rome, but the most enjoyable thing is simply to walk around the old streets and Pisazzas. What a wonderful time in Rome, and a very pleasant and comfortable stay at the Forty Seven. If I go to Rome again (and still don't want to spend a fortune on a hotel), I would definitely choose it again.

Reviews.Title: “Similar to the W hotels”
Reviews.Author: SFBayMommy
Reviews.Content: Great hotel - stayed 3 nts, first time in rome. The good: 1. has a steam room & fitness room 2. modern, clean & new - very much like the W hotel chain 3. staff was great the bad: 1. they charge extra for wi-fi here 2. location - everything is at least a 10 min plus walk away really, a nice hotel - only thing - i found a cheaper rate on expedia. when i emailed the hotel, they told me they couldn't match it - basically they couldn't help me. so i saved a hundred u.s. dollars (a night!) simply by booking on expedia rather than thru the hotel directly or any other website. the only downside of this is that with expedia, you pay in advance rather than on checkout fyi. totally worth it for 300 bucks savings.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, No Faults”
Reviews.Author: CandyWicklow_Ireland
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband stayed here for 4 nights. We had a deluxe room, which was absolutely gorgeous. It was my husband's birthday during our stay. I hadn't even told the stafff. On the night of his birthday when we returned to our room there was a cake and a card for him. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We booked our taxi to/from the airport through the hotel. Everything was superb about this hotel. Definitely would go again and recommend it 100%. Caroline - Wicklow - Ireland

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel.. great great staff!”
Reviews.Author: lisaflippo
Reviews.Content: Our first time in Rome, this was an awesome location. Months before our trip I was emailing with an representative from the Hotel 47, she was so so helpful in helping me plan our entire trip and time in Rome. The rooms were well equiped and the staff was more than helpful. Breakfast was very good, overall we loved this hotel and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Just one night ...we will come back”
Reviews.Author: manta972
Reviews.Content: We were in Rome for friends weeding. We stayed just one night at the 47, but it was perfect. Room, Staff, breakfast, etc.. If we return to Rome one day, it will be at the "47"

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: urbangirl1175
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in October 2007. Was everything I thought it would be! A great location! Awesome design! Friendly and helpful staff! They even had parking for our car. The room was huge! Was in walking distance to everything...even walked to the Vatican from here, along the river. We arrived in the late evening the first night, so we ate at the restaurant on the roof. It was amazing, looking out over the city lights...I felt like a movie star! I would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pagey54
Reviews.Content: Stopped there after picking it with help of TA. Went for a long weekend covering England V Italy rugby and my wife's birthday. Arrived at 10 a.m Sat and with a short private hire car trip (Rome SL - a TA recommendation - 35 Euro each way) from Campino were checked in and in our room by 11 a.m as it was all ready for us. Hotel in excellent location very close to the Island on the Tiber, Collesium ,and Foro plus within walking distance of nearly everything else. A lot of the open bus hop on/off tours also stopped nearby. The restuarant area of Trevestere was literally only a 5/10 min walk and the staff were able to advise and book for you depending on what you wanted. The staff were very friendly, helpful, and courteous as soon as we walked in til the Tuesday morning when we left. They even left a small cake and chocolates on the bed for my wife on her birthday. Only had breakfast there as there are so many good Italian eateries to try for lunch/dinner but breakfasts were good with real fruit juice, lovely contintental selection of meats, breads, yoghurts , pastries etc and scrambled egg, bacon, and susage if it you wanted cooked. Room (408) was very modern, clean, and a reasonable size for a major city and we had a view out of the window overlooking some of the ruins of the oldest Roman temples in Rome. Only small criticism was some traffic noise at times and no coffee/tea making facilities. The Hotel was really lovely and I guess the roof top terrace would have been great if it had been open. Not the cheapest in Rome but would reccommend and worth the 4 star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but beware Design Defect”
Reviews.Author: Londoner016
Reviews.Content: Interior decor: minimalist design, clean lines, elegant, boutique atmosphere. Location: one of the best locations for a hotel in Rome? superb in this respect. Staff: extremely efficient and helpful. No complaints there. Food: expensive and not to a very high standard as you would expect for the price (much in common with many restaurants in Rome) although the terrace setting is spectacular. Breakfast: excellent start to the day, delicious. Rooms: clean, well-equipped, no views (not such a problem in a city like Rome where you will spend a lot of time outside of your room) and no sound insulation. I was in room 104 and could hear noise from above and next door. Conversations could be heard clearly and moving chairs/furniture caused great disturbance during the night. Light sleepers should take this into serious consideration when selecting this hotel should they wish to have privacy and quiet. That such a great hotel could be spoilt by such a fundamental design fault is a great pity. Of course, floors on higher rooms may not be so badly affected. Terrace bar: great setting and a definite bonus. So, overall a great hotel with a lot going for it, particularly the location which is extremely convenient, but spoiled by a basic design fault.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: skykingLakeland_FL
Reviews.Content: Fortyseven has it all; location, top quality staff, attractive design, high level of attention to details, sparkling clean, large and beautifully designed rooms, grand baths, and on and on. The staff of Fortyseven was extraordinary; they made us feel welcome and were very helpful during our tour of Rome. Our 3 night stay was the best of our month long tour of Europe. For us it is by far the best 4 star hotel in Rome and better than many 5 star hotels. On our next visit to Rome we will return to Hotel Fortyseven. We were very happy and satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: dshorey
Reviews.Content: i stayed in this hotel with my wife and two friends during our stay in rome in april 2006. we all found the hotel to be spotlessly clean and very friendly. everything was of a very hgh standard and we were made to feel very welcome by the friendly staff. the rooms and food were excellant. the hotel has a great roof terrace with beautiful views over rome. we spent our evenings there sipping cool drinks after long days sightseeing. a great way to end the day....the hotel was very central to all the tourist attractions which were all within easy walking distance (if you are reasonably fit). a great hotel which we would all recommend very highly.

Reviews.Title: “New Year's Eve”
Reviews.Author: ManuelaPadua_Italy
Reviews.Content: After reviewing feedback on this site I decided to book Fortyseven Hotel, contacting them directly. At time of reservation they suggested me to spend new year's eve on the rooftoop terrace where a party was organised. We enjoyed it very much. Good ambiance, great view and delicious food. I definitely recommed this hotel, value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: travellover33333
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the fortyseven hotel over thanksgiving holiday and enjoyed every minute of our stay. The staff was courteous, helpful and prompt. Breakfast was amazing. Room was clean and bed turned over nightly. Impressed with the beds and how comfortable they were after a long day of shopping, walking and touring. Location is central and perfect for site seeing. I thank previous trip advisor postings on this hotel because it helped us make our decision on staying here. I would stay here again with no hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: bowler456
Reviews.Content: We stayed six nights at the Fortyseven Hotel for our 2nd Anniversary and it was perfect. The staff is very courteous and professional and will help you with anything you need. The rooms are spacious and include a huge king bed and huge bathroom. Breakfast is included and includes wonderful coffee, hot food, and various rolls and pastries. Perhaps the best part of this hotel is the location. Everything is within walking distance with the Vatican being the furthest thing away at a 40 minute walk along the river. The Colosseum and Roman Forum are 5 minutes away. The Trevi Fountain and Pantheon are 15 minutes and the famous shopping street, the Via Del Corso is only 10 minutes away. We only used the bus once and the taxi twice and you really should walk to enjoy Rome. Thank you Fortyseven for making our first trip to Rome perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Solid choice but....”
Reviews.Author: sfjonathan
Reviews.Content: This was our first hotel for our honeymoon. We had an easy check-in and were treated to welcome champagne. The room was great. Sleek and stylish. The location was walking distance to most sights and an easy cab ride to others. The only reason why this is not getting 5 stars is that they messed up my football match. I had worked with them on getting tickets to the Lazio and Juventus match. I had the date marked down and had planned the trip around the date they gave me. Sadly, they messed up. We went down to get a cab to the stadium when the front desk guy told us he saw the match already. The day before! This was a punch to the stomach. I'm still bitter.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Highlight of our Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: TheTilsteads
Reviews.Content: We spent three weeks in Italy for our honeymoon, visiting Rome, Tuscany, Florence and Venice, with our first four days in Rome at Fortyseven Hotel. The staff was fantastic. The hotel was modern, clean, quiet, very well appointed, with original art and a different theme per floor. Bathroom although small, was luxurious and well appointed. The Concierge (Lesya) was VERY helpful. I needed absolute confirmation of a particular car we were renting, as I’m a died in the wool car nut and didn’t want any substitutes. Lesya was relentless until she got what I had ordered from Canada. The hotel was within walking distance to all of historic Rome. Our room (#506) was modern, spacious, everything worked, and it had a fantastic balcony over looking Caesar’s Temple. The room had really cool remote controlled blinds that completely blocked the sun and any the noise. Great for sleeping in, keeping the room cool and shutting out all the world. Great internal court yard for breakfast, with relaxing music to enjoy a wonderful selection of breakfast fare. We had dinner at the roof top restaurant enjoying food, atmosphere, wine and view. Trip tip: always buy local maps for street by street directions. Tourist maps just don’t cut it, whether walking or driving. Visiting Rome and staying at Fortyseven Hotel was the highlight of our honeymoon. Eighteen days in Italy and five hotels, Fortyseven Hotel was the best. We hope to return again someday.

Reviews.Title: “The friendliest hotel staff anywhere”
Reviews.Author: Everton
Reviews.Content: We spent five days over Christmas camped out in one of Hotel Fortyseven's two suites - essential, now that we've got a toddler in tow. This place is as great as the general Trip Advisor consensus suggests, but with one added dimension: its staff. If there are friendlier, more attentive, warm and genuinely helpful hotel staff anywhere in the world I'd be surprised. These guys are outstanding - a far cry from past experiences of Rome hotels. Breakfast is a fresh feast each morning, with plenty of choice and the best scrambled eggs I think I've ever had in a hotel. Other reviewers have mentioned the hotel's location and there's no avoiding it: you're on a five lane highway which sits parallel to the main in-bound road along the river and also takes traffic from across the Tiber via the bridge over from Trastevere. Throw in cobbled streets and the sound of rubber on stone can be loud indeed. Great double glazing and window shutters, however, deal very capably with this come night-time and we always had a great night's kip. The location is fantastic, nestling just below the Forum and the Capitoline Hill. You're in the Jewish Ghetto and Centro Storico within a minute or two and it's only five minutes from Piazza Farnese. One last point: we haggled hard over the phone and got a 45% reduction on the cost of the suite because we were staying five nights. Put another way, 1,500 euro in our pockets, not theirs. Ask for room 504...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - Best location for Rome Travellers”
Reviews.Author: doglock
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my wife as a 40th birthday weekend trip to Rome. Fri / Sat / Sun nights at hotel room on 2nd floor. This is a modern and contemporary hotel. The room we were given was very large with a large confortable bed and a very nice bathroom with shower. It was well equipped and comfortable. Rome was very hot at the time and the rooms air conditoning was excellent maintaining comfortable temerature without just blasting cold air. There are comments from other reviewer about noise and although the floors in the rooms are wooden we really didnt notice a problem. The staff were polite and helpful. We had breakfast each day at the hotel which was varied and good quality. I also booked the rooftop returant for the Sat night and this was a good experience, high quality - expensive but worth it if the weather is good. The situation of this hotel is absolutely fantstic and if you are sightseeing in this amazing city you are in just about the best place you can be. You have access to all local bus services, taxis outside and a the colleseum is a 10 minute walk way. Overall a memorable stay in a great hotel - highly reccomended

Reviews.Title: “Simply fantastic”
Reviews.Author: SteveLaz
Reviews.Content: We have just returned home after spending 4 nights at Forty Seven Hotel in Rome. We knew this hotel had excellent reviews , and it did not disappoint. The success of the hotel ,is that they have got all the basics up to a fantastic standard. Modern contemporary design, with Italian granite and marble, extremely friendly and helpful staff in the reception. The rooms are immaculately clean , bright and airy , fresh white cotton sheets, good sized shower, simple but good quality breakfast, it is difficult to pick fault with this hotel. The Roman forum / ancient ruins and the colisseum are a short 10 minute walk away, but the immediate area is steeped in history and Roman remains. We found the Trastevere area on the opposite side of the river Tiber , to be probably the best area for dining out in the evening with numerous good restaurants and pizzerias. The hotel is to the south end ,of the central core of the city , but Rome is a beautiful place and great to walk around . It is true that there is no Metro station in the immediate area , but the only way to get a true taste of what Rome has to offer is to get a good comfortable pair of shoes on ,and wander through the narrow streets and piazzas. We would highly recommend Forty Seven Hotel as a fantastic base to stay in the amazing city of Rome

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms, service not particularly great”
Reviews.Author: blobblob008
Reviews.Content: Hotel was okay, we stayed in the suite and obviously it was a good sized room. The terrace is a good touch and we ate out on there for a few times. The concierge wasnt much help and didnt really notice our rooms being tidied or anything when we were out. The best thing about this hotel was location as it is close to alot of tourist sites and is just opposite a bus stop. Will definitely go to Rome again, but for the money, I could probably go to a place that offered better service.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish Hotel”
Reviews.Author: peedeeBathUK
Reviews.Content: A quiet and stylish hotel with modern decor and facilities. We took our young daughter so had a king size and a single bed. A walk to all the sights and a very relaxing place to stay after trying to visit them all in three days! Avoid the rip off taxis to and from if possible, ours took us to the edge of the city and back and some places we passed twice on the journey. The bus is one euro and drops you outside the hotel. Hotel was perfect but could do with better quality loo paper.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in every way”
Reviews.Author: kenbinghamton
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at forty seven. The room was large, modern, and very clean. The king size bed (rare for Rome) was a welcomed bonus for tired travelers. The staff was pleasant, informative, and extremely helpful. The breakfast was great and even had hot items. Would not hesitate to stay there again. The location was great (easy walk to everything). Also, there is a bus stop in front of the hotel. Note: do not take taxis as they will rip you off (they do not reset the meter, don't have change, take you the long way etc.- take bus 170 from train station right to the hotel!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: If not there, then thinking about it
Reviews.Title: “A sense of humour is everything”
Reviews.Author: Pellegrino
Reviews.Content: The hotel has been designed in unobtrusive good taste -- and that is high praise. But the highest praise of all goes to the staff, who were cheerfully engaging, showed infinite patience with some completely hapless arrivals and above all were not afraid to show that rich, sly sense of humour that is such an essential component of the Roman spirit. No obsequious zombies here. Highest marks for the staff. I want them all to come to my house.

Reviews.Title: “Still superb - again!”
Reviews.Author: ChrisNI10
Reviews.Content: The first hotel I have stayed in two years in a row... just as good the second time. The staff are really excellent and very knowledgeable about travel, sights, restaurants etc etc. We had a day down to Florence (by train). Book 1st on the Eurostar as 2nd class can be very crowded and not air conditioned! THe travel advisor in 47 is absolutely excellent and will give you the best advise. Well recommended agin!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: andlamToronto_Canada
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Fortyseven Hotel for four nights in October 2007. We enjoyed our stay at the hotel and would recommend the hotel to others. The key highlights of the hotel were the following: - Modern and clean room; - Professional and courteous staff; all were fluent in English) - Reasonably central location (e.g., within 10-15 min walk of the Colleseum, bus stop almost right in front of the hotel); and - Good buffet breakfast; The only complaint I had about the hotel was that the walls were not very soundproof - we could hear our neighbours' conversations and they were not particularly loud)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location to ancient rome”
Reviews.Author: Got_soccer
Reviews.Content: The room was elegant and spacious. The rooftop resturant was perfect for ambiance and food was very good. The location near the Forum and Circus Maximus was wonderfully convenient as it was an easy walk to all the "old Rome" sites. Would definately recommend Taxi, Bus or Metro for trip to Vatican though.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel 47”
Reviews.Author: SpiderChesterGirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic, we were celebrating our 20th Wedding Anniversary and when we arrived we had been upgraded to a beautiful rooom with a balcony and fabulous views with a bottle of champagne in the room. The hotel is immaculate very modern beautiful bathrooms, the breakfast is excellent and the staff really helpful and friendly. It is perfectly placed for all the sightseeing on offer, I would definitely go back to this hotel and would recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Possibly the best hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: RocknRolf
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Fortyseven for three days late October. It was a last minute booking and a bit expensive, but I don't regret our choice. I spend approx. 50 - 60 nights a year at big city hotels in Canada and I would pick Fortyseven over any five star hotel in Toronto, Vancouver or Montreal. The hotel is ultra modern and hip but provides old fashioned top notch service. Our room was spatious (even by North American standards) and luxurious. The personal tour of the hotel with the concierge at check-in was a nice touch. You could not ask for a better location. You are steps away from ancient Rome and the Tiber river plus the open tour bus stops right outside the front door. Because of the price most of the guests seemed to be either middle aged couples or honey mooners. The only problem we experienced was getting a taxi. Even when the front desk called for one they only showed up half the time. Your best bet is to flag one down. Be careful - the Romans still drive like the chariot race in Ben Hur. Overall, this was one of the best hotels I have ever stayed at, and I would recommend it to anyone willing to spend about 100-150 euros more per night than your average 3 star tourist hotel in Rome. Dining tips: Take a 10 minute walk across the Tiber and visit Spirito DiVino for dinner. True italian dining on an old narrow side street in Trastevere. The food is first class, not expensive (try the old roman recipe pork shoulder), they speak excellent english and the owner will give you an interesting history lesson about the building which used to be a jewish synagogue over a 1000 years ago. You can walk downstairs to experience the history and see their fabulous wine cellar. Rolf E., Toronto

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels ever!!”
Reviews.Author: The_Madcap_Gadfly
Reviews.Content: This is one of the nicest hotels in which I have stayed, and I have been in Ritz's, Mandarin Oriental's, etc. The hotel decor was modern and the room beautiful and spacious. The bathroom was huge with top quality fixtures. We ate in the restaurant one evening and it was one of the better meals that we had in Italy. The staff were all friendly and helpful. From this hotel, the Coliseum area is a 15 minute walk; the Vatican and Borghese both maybe 30 minutes with a billion or two sights in between. Everything about this hotel was top notch. It would be hard to find a way to improve anything.

Reviews.Title: “Great again - the second time around”
Reviews.Author: Albany_GATraveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel in July of 2006 and enjoyed it immensely. My mom and I returned to Rome a couple of weeks ago, and I chose to stay at this hotel again!! The rooms are large, modern, and spotless. The breakfast is wonderful, and the location is great. But the best part about this hotel is Lesya, the concierge. Unfortunately, my mother's passport was stolen during our visit to Rome and we did not realize it until Friday afternoon. Lesya called the police and the embassy and found out the we would have to wait until Monday to get a replacement passport which meant that we would miss our return flight home on Sunday. Lesya called our airline and got our flight changed, arranged for a car to pick us up on Monday am and take us to the embassy, wait for us, and then take us to the airport. (At no extra charge than for just a trip to the airport.) She was extremely helpful to us in a scary situation and was able to smooth things over for our return trip home. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone!! Thanks so much, Lesya!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Forty seven shone in the Oct sun!”
Reviews.Author: Degas
Reviews.Content: Picked the hotel from TA reviews and as location was near to the historical area. We had a great stay - I would guess that the hotel has been remodelled to a clean and modern design recently . We had a deluxe room which was a good size with a bathroom that didn't have a tub - but what a walk in shower ! - could have accomodated a family of 4 without crowding. Nice big comfortable bed with high quality linens. Flat screen TV - albeit with limited channels available - but who goes to Rome to watch TV? Internet access available in lounge for those who don't lug a laptop on hols and worked well. Location was ace - not only was the forum a short walk away but the river was 2 mins in the other direction and you can be in Travastere with all its bustle and fun in 5 mins. Service was good - our room kept spotless by invisible maids and the buffet breakfast was of a good standard . We used the roof top terrace on several evenings and found the staff helpful and efficient and the food great - they seemed to have an ongoing battle with the patio heaters, but generally managed to win. Still can't understand why we couldn't have 2 key cards. Only really minor downside was a bit of a run in over the switch over of the hotel AC system to a heating option mid way through our stay - despite temps of >25 degrees C (!!) - managed to reach a compromise with our room maintaining the 'fan only' option, which was comfortable enough. Would happily return.

Reviews.Title: “Would return in a heartbeat”
Reviews.Author: KalTorak
Reviews.Content: Loved it - would return in a heartbeat. Wife and I stayed here in September '07 as the first stop of a four-city honeymoon; it was far and away the nicest place we stayed, and priced similarly to the others. Location is wonderful - you're on the back side of the Palatine Hill, and within an easy walk of the entire city center / all the major sights, with the exceptions of the Vatican and the Borghese Museum. We didn't figure out the bus system till our second day; the Rome busses are just fine for getting around, and the Petroselli stop in front of the FortySeven is on most of the more significant routes (bus 30 was particularly useful) Rooms are clean and well decorated (by anyone's standard) and big (by center-of-a-major-European standards). Even from an American perspective, they're big enough to be comfortable. Staff were consistently very helpful; maps, directions, and recommendations were no problem. They drew up a couple suggested walking itineraries for us, got us a taxi when we had to leave, and simply made us feel at home. Breakfast buffet was sufficient - I've had more opulent spreads, but the food here was quite good. Rooftop restaurant was a little overpriced; the food wasn't particularly special, but the atmosphere was great.

Reviews.Title: “Good in parts, but some issues”
Reviews.Author: UKtraveller143
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights here in early October. Overall not a bad experience but there are things that need improving. Pros : Helpful reception and concierge staff gave some very good restaurant recommendations. Room was comfortable and clean. Cons : Top floor bar served undrinkable champagne cocktail (flat champagne, cheap cognac in a warm glass) and poor red wine by the glass. The three girls up there serving were always far more interested in chatting to each other to see whether guests needed a drink, a wine list or anything at all really. We were planning to eat up there based on prevous reviews, but following two instances of poor service decided against it. The plumbing is very noisy with the bathroom next door sounding as though it was in the room - not great when the toilet flushes throughout the night. No real sound proofing at all. They use a very good masseur called Angelo but the area he works in is very open to the public to the point that people are walking right by the table to get into the steam room - not very private or conducive to relaxation. Not much they can do about this, but it was quite tricky getting taxis outside, so you have to rely on staff ordering them for you.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Rome and 47”
Reviews.Author: GerryO
Reviews.Content: Both my wife and I stayed at the 47, arriving September 10th. for 4 nights. We arranged a pickup (€50) from Fiumicino airport with the hotel just before our departure to Rome – our driver was there waiting patiently outside the baggage hall despite the fact that there was a general 40 minutes delay in the arrivals terminal. We stayed in room 106. The décor is modern, somewhat understated and spotless. We had a super-size bed which was really comfortable. The bathroom is spacious with a really great shower and marble floor throughout. The outdoor window shutters, controlled from a bedside switch, added that little extra touch. Overall the room was our little haven after a long day (and night) in the Eternal city. Just perfect! The hotel is located on a street 200 meters from the Foro Romano which is at the rear of the hotel and is really quite spectacular. There is no entrance fee, and you can easily spend a morning wandering through the ruins of the Forum. The Colosseum (entrance fee) can be found at the far end, a few hundred metres away. The breakfast buffet was perfect for us, although I know some would regard it as a little short on choice – it’s not the sort of buffet where you can pile up the plate with loads of hot food. The staff we encountered during our stay were friendly and very professional. We had lunch in the hotel on arrival – bit expensive; for dining, we recommend the restaurants in Trastevere, just across the river. We spent our nights at different restaurants, and found the quality and choice really good. A good meal for two with wine, coffee etc. is €50 - €60. Il Ponentino and Vincenzo alla Lungaretta are two I recall. There is a nice walk along the river bank at night where a number of bars and market stalls are setup at evening time. We visited the hotel rooftop bar for a cocktail before retiring each night – the end to a perfect day. We walked everywhere in Rome; just turn right on leaving the hotel and you will arrive within 5 minutes at the enormous Victor Emmanuel II monument at the Piazza Venezia. The Trevi Fountain and the Pantheon are less than a 15 minutes stroll from here – Trevi on the right just off the Via del Corso – turn left for the Pantheon. The Spanish Steps are 10 minutes further along Corso. We walked to the Vatican City – takes about 30 minutes. The redline sight-seeing tour bus (No.110) stops just down from the hotel (as do many local buses) and is worth the trip – purchase tickets on the bus. It covers the main sites of Rome and the Vatican City. To sum up – we loved Rome and loved the 47; the hotel is in a nice location, is very comfortable and we have no hesitation in recommending it. It is our intention to return to Rome very soon, and to the 47. Ciao for now.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: Peony29
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for the first four nights or our honeymoon in Italy. Because this was the first leg of our vacation, I booked directly through the hotel's website and chose a suite on the top floor with a balcony and ordered champagne and chocolates to celebrate our nuptials. I was completely disappointed from start to finish. When we arrived at the hotel after an all-night flight from the West Coast we were told that our room would be ready shortly and to have a cup of coffee and relax. "Shortly" turned into an all day affair. I would have preferred that they told me upon arrival that it wouldn't be ready for hours. Turns out they made us wait until hours after the stated check-in time. Then they gave us the news that the couple who stayed in the suite before us elected to stay on an extra night and that we wouldn't be able to have the suite. I suggested that they kick out the holdovers and make them take the standard room but my suggestion was rebuffed. Therefore, at about 6 p.m. we were finally shown to our standard room. I had to fight with the front desk to reduce the charge - they actually wanted us to pay for the suite we booked despite the fact that they put us in a standard room. Because the standard room was comfortable and because we didn't feel like switching rooms, the next morning I requested to just stay put in the standard room for the remainder of our stay. We were told that the somebody else had booked the standard room so we would have to move to the suite. Funny - when someone wanted to stay over in the suite we were told we had to take a lesser room but when we asked to stay over in the standard room we couldn't because someone else had booked it. Finally we made it to the suite, which was beautiful. I had to ask no less than three times for the champagne and chocolates I had ordered (and paid for). Bottom line - the service was horrid and a complete let down. I would never stay at his hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location without breaking the bank”
Reviews.Author: edamame
Reviews.Content: Just back from Rome and would recommend this hotel as a great choice without breaking the bank (not easy in Rome!) It's not the Hotel de Russie or one of the high end design hotels; however it's modern and the rooms are spacious; great location (10 minutes from many of the must sees); great roof terrace for lounging with views across Rome (perhaps not as great a view as say the Capo d'Africa or some of the 5 star hotels) and compared to a lot of hotels in Rome, the rooms and service are impeccable. Friendly staff (only one hiccup with a taxi that failed to turn up but that wasn't really the fault of the staff and belated apologies if I was a bit stroppy about it!) Breakfast is fine - good buffet with coffee/cappucino as you wish; nice cocktails in the evening; the restaurant looked quite expensive and we had a hot list of places to go to so we didn't eat in the hotel. The only downside is that the rooms are a little noisy (there are blinds to minimise traffic noise); the room above us seemed to like to move the furnitiure around and clop about in high heels at 6 in the morning! Each to their own... I'd definitely hire a guide for a half day if you can - you get a much more in-depth feel for an area / monument. The guide we had on our second day really brought ancient Rome alive. You will pretty much eat well anywhere (avoiding the tourist traps though) - Maccheroni and Santa Lucia around the Piazza Navona area - Al bric (near Piazza de Fiori - but closed this trip shame!) - Enoteca Ferrara in Trastavere Needless to say we're off to the gym to burn off those excess calories!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, very friendly, too much insecticide”
Reviews.Author: fletch3742
Reviews.Content: Very impressed with the hotel and staff. Booked it through Expedia and every aspect was seamless. We chose the Forty Seven because it was one of the luxury hotels which had a fitness centre. The only issue, the fitness centre is in the basement and there's not a lot of airflow. Unfortunately it had been sprayed with insecticide and we both got sick after working out. Some what our fault as we could smell the fumes of the bug spray and should have just skipped the workout that day and went for a run outside, which we did the next day. Restaurant is a little understaffed but breakfast buffet was excellent. Restaurant on the roof is outstanding. Great location...

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary”
Reviews.Author: scolona
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, very contemporary. Many of the rooms do not have a great view but they are very spacious, contemporary and clean. The restaurant on the roff is absolutely amazing. The staff was friendly and very helpful. The only two problems are half of the hotel overlooks a street with no other view and it is not in the center of Rome. Many of the main attractions are fairly far away (Trevi, Spanish Steps, Pantheon, etc.). With all of this in mind it was still a fantastic hotel and I would highly reccomend it. Rent a moped and see everything Rome has to offer!!

Reviews.Title: “An Outstanding Hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveller123456789
Reviews.Content: An outstanding Botique Hotel centrally located for all of the sights. Booked after searching the Internet for some time. We fully recommend this htel to any one wanting a good break in Rome. The staff were extremely helpful and help out with everything we asked of them. Our flight was cancelled which delayed our arrival by 10 hours and at short notice the hotel arranged for a car to meet us at the airport and take to the hotel for 50 Euro. The breakfast was excellent, so all in all a good hotel and as our daughter lves in rome we will be staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “Can't fault this hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelbuddy56
Reviews.Content: Each year my daughter and I have a short trip together to a European city and this year it was Rome for five days. We normally use 5* hotels but chose this hotel (which is 4*) because of reviews on this site and we weren't disappointed - excellent location with great rooms, good food, and friendly helpful staff. The rooftop bar was a haven for a drink after a long day exploring Rome. The reception staff were particularly helpful and nothing seemed to be too much trouble for them. I can wholeheartedly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel, location & staff”
Reviews.Author: Member_UK
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel - a pleasure from start to finish. We booked a four night stay, based on the feedback we saw on Trip Advisor - and we certainly werent disappointed. The location is great - only 10 minutes walk to the Forum, Colosseum, Pantheon and the shopping district. We booked a superior room hoping to get one of the rooms on the fifth floor with the balcony but instead got one on the fourth floor which was still brilliant - a great view of the river and the Temple of Vesta. Well worth the additional cost. The room had a large king size bed (which we found a little hard), hardwood floor, large screen TV, desk with light & wired internet access and the marble bathroom with large power shower big enough for two to share! We had a meal in the rooftop Circus bar/restaurant on our first night and returned later in the week because we found the meal to be one of the best we experienced during our visit. My partner (a veggie) thought the Vegetable Risotto one of the best he had ever tasted. If you get the chance, try to have breakfast in the Courtyard - its a bit inconvenient having to go back into the restuarant to get your food, but is much quieter and a wonderful start to the day. Being a gay couple we were worried about the service, but we found the hotel staff very welcoming and cant fault the service from start to finish. From when we arrived & the young chap on reception spent 5 minutes giving us the low-down on the hotel and the nearby sights through to sharing a laugh with the two women on reception while checking out - they were great. We took the opportunity to book a personal tour of some of the more distant sights - the hotel arranged this through "Love Holiday" and Geoff Fitzhugh was a mine of information. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Wow - amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: spal
Reviews.Content: I booked hotel fortyseven as a last mintue deal based on the reviews on here, and I was not disappointed! from the moment I arrived the service was great, rooms were spacious and stylish, great to get back and relax after a long day exploring rome! The rooftop restaurant served great food and was a great chilled end to a busy day. I can't think of a single bad thing to say - it was just bliss! can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great location”
Reviews.Author: MASToronto
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on a friend's recommendation and were not disappointed. Although only staying for one night, we received excellent service from the moment we walked in. It was our anniversary and we received a bottle of champagne although we did not even mention our anniversary to them directly - they did this as a suprise after overhearing my husband and I chatting in the elevator. Hotel is contemporary, with good ammenities. If possible, get a room with a terrace as they have wonderful views. Location was excellent for seeing many sites.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: MizT1955
Reviews.Content: Hotel Fortyseven is a nice hotel and well located for walking to sights, restaurants and some shopping. The hotel is very well kept and clean and all staff were efficient and pleasant. They accommodated a last minute change on one room. I got the impression that they "run a tight ship"; not overly friendly, but professional and polite. The buffet breakfast was good. Fabulous air-conditioning easily controlled during a record heat wave :-) The rooms seemed pricey given their average size, but given the location it was still worth it. Had lunch there once which was good, and ordered room service once. One entree was missing when room service arrived and the server was nonchalant, yet polite, and the food arrived 30 minutes later. A nice spot, especially the location.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary Treat”
Reviews.Author: Servius
Reviews.Content: Myself and my wife recently treated outselves to a return trip to Rome on the occassion of our 10th Wedding Anniversary. We had been to Rome before on our Honeymoon but were sadly disappointed with our original hotel. We therefore spent some time investigating the most popular hotels in Rome and were very grateful for the comments provided by previous travellers in Trip Adviser. As you would expect we were looking for a Hotel were we could pamper ourselves and relax. Location was also important as we wanted to be fairly near to the main attractions. After many hours in the internet we finally decided on FortySeven and I can genuinely say that I don't think we could have chosen better given our budget. The rooms are an excellent size (Standard Double Room) and the bed was enourmous, I'm over six feet tall and my feet didn't have to stick out the bottom! Good facilities in the room and the air conditioning was essential given that the August temperatures were in the high 30's. Breakfast was included in the price and this consisted of the usual spread for a continental hotel. Everthing was fresh and continually topped up. The view from the roof top bar was great and an excellent place to either start or finish off a romantic evening. Only a short stroll to the good sights so no need for taxis etc. My only small gripe was in relation to the mini bar. We had some crips, peanuts and some drinks on our first night and these were never replaced throughout our four day stay despite a telephone request to the reception. We eventually bought our own drinks and nibbles and happily stored these in the mini bar. A rather cheaper option but this may not be ideal depending on your point of view. Ther was a fantastic Church just a long the road from the Hotel (St Gerrard's I think) which was built over the remains of three Roman Temples. The columns can be seen on the outside walls of the church and, if open, you can take a tour of the crypt in which you can see the foundations of the original temples. The tour was very interesting and personal and a small contribution is expected. All in all a great Hotel which is clearly focused on the English speaking traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location, Amazing Everything”
Reviews.Author: ChazMalibu
Reviews.Content: Wow. I cant talk this hotel up enough. The staff when out of their way to make us comfortable. My wife was hungover one day and they brought her up tea and bread for free. When we arrived at the hotel they returned our rental car for us and arranged a taxi for when we left. Breakfast was typical and nice. The rooms were fantastic. Did I mention location? Right behind the hotel (5 minute walk) it the ancient roman ruins. Talk about amazing. Cant wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and location but on very busy road”
Reviews.Author: outwardbound10
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for 4 nights in August and found that the level of service, cleanliness and quality was excellent. Room The standard double room was spacious and very modern with all the facilities you would expect (except coffee but that is the case in every Italian hotel). Hotel The staff were extremely helpful, especially the concierge, calling taxis, booking us train tickets and advising on restaurants. The hotel itself has a modern and well equipped gym, fantastic rooftop restaurant and bar and breakfast is excellent. Breakfast is served in the inner courtyard and surrounding rooms and consists of pretty much everything. Location The location is really close to the ancient Roman sights - out of the door and left takes you to the bocca della verita and round the corner to the circus maximus. If you go out and right and across via Janiculum you get to the Tarpean cliff (the start of the Capitoline hill where criminals were hurled to their death. If you go up the steps you come out above the Roman Forum which is amazing. The hotel is literally minutes from most of the ancient Roman sights. If you go out of the hotel and cross the busy Via Petroselli to the river there is a lot to do in the evening. Along the river in the evening, and on Isola island, are many bars, restaurants and a market. Cross over to Travastere and there are even more bars and restaurants. Via Petroselli is very busy, as are most roads in Rome and it does create some noise in the room - we were on a side street and it was still noisy in the early mornings. Rome The 47 hotel is the best location for ancient Rome although around the Pantheon is where I would stay next time because it is pedestrianised and more central to all of Rome. Our favourite area at night was around Piazza Navona and Piazza della Rotunda. Places to eat outside in Rome, in pedestriansed areas like this, are surprisingly rare, which is a shame. I would not stay near the Spanish steps, as many people suggest, because this area of Rome is busier and has less to do. I may be missing something but the steps are just steps covered in thousands of people who do not seem to have realised it is just steps and there is virtually no where to eat in the evening overlooking the piazza. Rome is amazing for its history and places like Piazza Navona but I was very surprised by the amount of (mad) traffic and the endemic graffitti. Around Termini station is pretty rough and I would not recommend anyone staying there other than a one night stopover.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rikky-Kitty
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel from August 9 - 12 and we didn't want to leave. We had a thoroughly enjoyable stay here. The room was clean, tidy, modern and quiet even though we had a room facing the main street AND was next to the elevators - we didn't hear a thing. The location is great and a 10-15 minute walk from the Colosseum. The staff were super friendly, polite and helpful. The concierge recommended great restaurants (especially the restaurant "Osteria Del Campidoglio" which is a 2 minutes walk from the hotel - beautiful!) You can also buy bus tickets from the hotel and they do offer tours of the big sights although we didn't go for any of those. The conceierge (her name began with an "L" but that's all I can remember) also recommended that for going to the Colosseum to buy tickets in a booth on the road between the Colosseum and Circo Maximo as there are few lines - we did this and didn't have a line at all - much better than buying at the Colosseum! The hotel didn't seem to offer room service late at night however we arrived back at the hotel around 2am after a trip to Pompeii and the night duty guy offered to make us up a plate of meats and cheeses which was fantastic. We took the train shuttle from Rome airport to the city which was about 30 mins long and 11 euros a ticket - it was great and very easy, I'd imagine much cheaper than a taxi. Pros: 1) Great location near to the Colosseum 2) Train station is about a 10 euro Taxi ride away 3) Staff is knowledgable, super helpful and friendly 4) Quiet, clean, comfortable rooms with big bathroom (and slippers to boot!) Cons: ...can't think of any...

Reviews.Title: “Modern and excellent”
Reviews.Author: dfall
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for 4 days in August 2007, having picked it from previous positive Tripadvisor reviews. The hotel certainly lives up to previous reports. It is a modern 5 floor hotel (plus roof restaurant). I booked a deluxe bedroom which had air conditioning, plasma TV, king sized bed, safe and a balcony overlooking Rome. The bathroom was well equipped, including bidet, but was a little small. Breakfast is served in an open air ground floor restaurant and in the evening you can dine at the open air roof top restaurant, overlooking the Rome skyline. There is a good variety of foods and wine and service standards are high. All staff are courteous, helpful and speak english. When I return to Rome I will certainly use the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel 47”
Reviews.Author: Southie1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel 47 for 4 nights in early August and was very satisfied with the customer service, cleanliness, and room size. Breakfast was excellent with plenty of choices. Location can't be beat very close, within easy walking distance, to all the Ancient sites. Also near the Tiber River and Trastevere. Major bus stops are right near the hotel entrance too. Outside noise not a problem. Noticed some nights that the internal noise from adjoining rooms can be disturbing. The rooftop restaurant and loung was a great retreat in the evening with good views of the area. Would highly recommend this hotel. Also stayed at other Summit Group hotels in Florence and Venice on this trip and had similar experiences.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: gkraus1
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our 5 nights stay at the Fortyseven; everything was perfect, good breakfast and very nice and clean room. The only thing that I did not like is their internet system through the TV available in each room, don't waste your money, it just does not work. We also expected a better service from the concierge.

Reviews.Title: “Nice modern hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: ryzee
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Fortyseven from August 13-17, 2007. Booked room bases on Tripadvisor reviews. The hotel is modern with minimalist decor. We had a double deluxe room which was of average size by North American standards but larger than many European rooms. Our room was #509 and had a lovely balcony overlooking the sites of Rome. Note that only the rooms on the 5th floor have balconies. Service level was middle of the road, housekeeping did not replenish the minibar daily, bathroom amenities not completely replenished each day either. Front desk and concierge were very helpful , and friendly. Location of the hotel is great for access to Colleseum and Forum but is quite a long hike to shopping of Via Condotti. Overall a nice hotel for its price point.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: kona1234
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the FortySeven Aug 3-6. The suite was great with a huge balcony. The location was located close to all ancient Roman sites. The service at the hotel was top notch. Everyone very friendly and willing to help. I highly recommend the FortySeven!

Reviews.Title: “Chic, comfortable and ideally located”
Reviews.Author: RCM-7
Reviews.Content: If you want a nice boutique hotel that is walking distance to virtually everything in Rome, Hotel 47 is a great choice. We went with our three kids and had a gorgeous balconied suite overlooking the city. The rooms are modern and nicely decorated. We were welcomed with a nice bottle of Champagne. Service was fine as you would expect from a hotel of this category. The roof-top restaurant is an idealic spot to end up the day with cocktails or to have a light meal. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ZadaZainal
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Rome, decided to treat my boyfriend to a nice holiday for his birthday. Thought I had to write a review straight away. First of all, it's a great hotel- friendly, smart, clean, art deco, lovely rooms with great views, air conditioning, big bed and very comfortable pillows. Although it's right next to a big road it's completely soundproof, and it's only a few minutes walk to circus maximus and palatine hill. Almost all the tour buses stop in front of the hotel too! Anyway, you don't need me to tell you about all the great things about fortyseven, just read the other reviews. The bad points that annoyed me during my weekend there- the rooftop restaurant/ bar is not open for breakfast which is a shame. Breakfast was from 7:30 - 10:30am and ok, not that much choice. Scrambled eggs and fruit salad were obviously popular but were not replenished when I came down at 10:20 for a quick one. When I tried to sit in the courtyard was told by a staff member "Inside!" because there were trying to clean it up and obviously I was one of the later guests for breakfast. Oh, and the shower temperature was very delicate and difficult to control. If I sound like sour grapes, it's probably because I paid a lot of money for the hotel and was expecting a bit more. I know Rome is expensive, but I've had better experience in wonderful hotels in London, Berlin and Paris paying less than half of what I paid for at fortyseven. Value for money's very important to me and I don't think fortyseven belongs in that category.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: HRHalac
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights at this hotel on our way back from 7 days in the Amalfi coast. We are a male gay couple in our 30's. We researched a lot online and through friends where to stay when in Rome, and placed a bet on 47 because of its strategic location near all the main monuments and sites of ancient Rome. We requested a quiet room when booking and were given room 101, on the first floor, facing a side street, which was indeed, very quiet; Via Luigi Petroselli is a main thoroughfare, I knew it'd be noisy from having been to Rome before. After the marvelous sights of the Amalfi coast we could have not made a better choice. My partner had not been to Rome before and I wanted him to have an unforgettable first time, everything is reachable by foot from the hotel, you can easily cover all the monuments in 1 1/2 day. The staff is very helpful and knowledgeable of their city, we got good recommendations to restaurants and the nightlife. Our room was spotless when we got in, and everyday left in excellent conditions, with a turnover service to top it all. The bathroom is marbled, with top notch hardware, their bath products are very good too. The furniture is kept in good condition, so are the bed linens, the bed was very comfortable too, it felt like a new or not-so-old mattress, a problem in hotels through Europe. The breakfast is varied and plentiful, and if you know a bit about the food industry, you know that when the coffee is good, there is attention to detail in the kitchen. The bar at the rooftop deck offers breathtaking views of the surroundings, their cocktails were good, dinner served by the restaurant was excellent. When we were there, there was no phone or internet service due to a problem in the neighboorhood, but in the end, this allowed us to completely disconnect for a few days more. The hotel building is very well kept, many old buildings like that smell of mold, but this one is definitely looked after, once you step in you feel like in a sanctuary away from the Roman traffic, the hotel walls are thick and the inner court is very quiet. I suspect the rooms facing the street are more noisy, though. Overall, we had one minor issue: delays with room service, not everyone in the kitchen speaks English, but efforts were promptly made to assist us and the food was freshly prepared. I would most probably stay there again when I return to Rome (no doubt I will return soon), I know now why so many rave about it and with reason, it is a great escape if you are in business, but also an excellent option for a romantic weekend. The high price tag is well worth if you are like us and wish to return to a comfortable bed and a pristine bathroom after a day sightseeing; and want guarantee of good drinks, excellent coffee and prompt professional service, the front desk staff and the conciergerie were impeccable at all times. Even though Rome has a reputation for not being a gay friendly city, we were at ease at all times, and the hotel staff made efforts to guide us to the nightilfe and beaches. There were absolutely no changes in attitude when asking about gay life in the city, to the contrary, more associates were contacted to ask about the latest places to go and things to do, this gave us an everlasting impression of warmth and goodwill that made us feel welcome, we would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: aagrawal
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a trip to Italy and spent two nights at the Forty Seven Hotel that were wonderful. This trip was to celebrate our 20th wedding anniversary and we informed the hotel of this. Immediately, one of the hotel people emailed us to assure us they would make our stay special and looked forward to seeing us. At the time we checked in, they were expecting us and had upgraded our room to one of the nicest, top floor deluxe rooms in the hotel. Check in was painless. The staff is clearly focused on personal attention and makes you feel like your needs and desires are important The hotel appears out of the way but is located near the Colosseum and Roman Forum and we were able to hit all of the major stops in Rome (Trevi Fountain, Pantheon, Colosseum, etc) walking the town (in 98 degree heat). The setting was quiet but with easy access to the center of Rome. The hotel decor is very clean and appears minimalist / Swedish style. The rooms are clean and high tech.
