Breakfast is included and had ample choices and a nice inside courtyard setting. We would highly recommend the rooftop restaurant for dinner. We showed up there on our last night without reservations and were provided a table with a nice view and a beautiful breeze as a backdrop for a delicious meal in a very romantic setting. I highly recommend it. We encourage interested parties to contact the hotel directly by email at (--). You will surely find them responsive. Our experience at the Forty Seven hotel was great and every encounter with an employee there was positive. Try it - you'll love it.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Rome for the price”
Reviews.Author: tlbjpds
Reviews.Content: All the reviews are true, this is an excellent hotel for the price. The staff is very helpful at providing directions, bus tickets, train tickets or tours. They are all very professional and friendly. The food at the hotel is great too! The breakfasts were included, but for a change you must order room service at least once- the croissants are out of this world, best we have ever had. The espressos with hot milk were great as well. Make sure to have a dinner at their roof top restaurant at sunset. Say hello to the tall blonde waiter for us. The room was very clean and modern. The location is perfect if you want to be close to the center of the city, but not surrounded by tourists 24-7. You can walk to the Vatican (about a 40 minute walk), the Pantheon, Trevi Fountain, Colosseum or you can take advantage of the bus stop located just outside of the hotel. This hotel was just perfect and we would stay again on our next trip to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Good for a Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Maramu
Reviews.Content: We were a party of 10 (adults and children) distributed in three rooms of which one of them was a suite overlooking the Plaza de la Verita. We arranged for an airport pick-up from the hotel which ended up charging us more because our plane was late. The people at the reception were young, hip, and many times clueless - but sometimes helpful. The elevator is fairly small but serves its purpose. The suite was nice, modern, and comfortable. You can sometimes hear the noise through the walls but it wasn't a big deal. The best part was having an early morning coffee or a late night limoncello at the huge balcony overlooking the church, ruins, street, and panorama. They had a small gift for the kids (nice touch) and the maid service was efficient. We were invited to a hotel party one of the nights but we passed on it - it sounded like they were having a good time. Breakfast was not that bad - enough to have fuel for 2 or 3 hours. We didn't rent a car in Rome because everything is relatively close and we like to walk. In a fifteen minute walk you will be at the Colosseum or Piazza Navona (lots of restaurants). Trastevere is a short walk across the river - get snacks & water during the day and have an interesting time and dinner at night.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: rwc7
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel in a great location. I have posted a photograph that shows the view of a temple that is across the street from the hotel. Beautiful art is shown in all the rooms and public areas, and the modern design of everything, down to the toiletries, is warm and calming. The service is excellent throughout, and the staff is uniformly friendly and kind. When I asked the concierge about a problem with a guided tour reservation for the Vatican Galleries, she took care of everything while I went sightseeing. The rooftop restaurant is lovely, with a great view and food and wine. I recommend the seafood and the Tuscan wines. The morning breakfast buffet is very good, has a varied selection and you can eat inside or outside in the courtyard. It's a great way to start the day of sightseeing. The location is especially good if you want to spend time in the Forum-Coliseum area, but I walked everywhere I wanted to go.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Fortyseven!”
Reviews.Author: YoungTravelersUsa
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the beginning or our European journey which kicked off in Rome. We arrived REALLY early in the morning, jetlagged but eager to explore the city. The staff is kind and friendly and made some great suggestions as to where to walk and provided us a map. Our room was clean and spacious and the bathroom was also stellar. Internet access is available for a reasonable fee. The hotel is pretty itself and has a great restaurant at the top with views of the city. We had coffee and dessert one night at the top and it was delicious (prices comparable to anyplace else in the city). Our favorite part was the complimentary breakfast! The coffee/cappucinos were the best we've ever had, and the breakfast options were delicious and generous (everything from scrambled eggs and bacon to fruit, pastries,and cereal). This is a great place and we couldn't recommend it highly enough!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - excellent location”
Reviews.Author: DerbyBuncey47
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from 8 to 12 June for our 25th wedding anniversary. Due to our flight we arrived several hours before check in but our room was ready. Reception staff could not have been more helpful - talked about palces to visit , best way to get there etc- impeccable English. Breakfast on the patio area in the sunshine was a great start to the day with plenty of choice - cereals, cheese, yogurts, eggs, pastries ( sweet criossant to die for !) We had dinner one night on the roof terrace - 140 Euro for 3 courses + 1 drink each - expensive but so worth it - very attentive staff and fantastic atmosphere. Road/other guest noise - yes we could hear it but nothing a hard days walk around Rome / earplugs couldn't overcome. One tip - if you want to go to the Collesium - get you tickets at the Palentine Hill location - barely a queue and you can walk straight pass the huge Collesium line. Great hotel and the location was excellent - walked to most places - to get to the Vatican get the no 81 bus for 1 euro right outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent rooms, over priced, terrible service at the restaurant.”
Reviews.Author: Florida_Orlando_2007
Reviews.Content: Well it's a safe heaven within Rome as far as staying away from the city chaos after walking all day visiting the sites. Also nice, as pointed out by another reviewer, to come back at night to a new, fresh hotel room (an exception in Rome). Now the bad... You can't help but feel short changed when staying there. We paid $500 euros per night for a suite with 1 king and 1 queen for the kids. That is per night and in euros. You agree to that kind of price but you end up setting your expectations high because it is a lot of money even in Rome. The service from the front desk was extremely nice and courteous with the exception of one staff member and unfortunately that is all it takes to leave you with a bad taste in your mouth. Upon arrival we were basically greeted with a "what are you doing here?" because we were supposed to be picked up by a driver that was booked by the hotel, however we arrived in Rome 4 hours earlier. After trying unsuccessfully to call the hotel twice to let them know, we then decided to take a cab as we would be there at least 2 hours prior to the set time so we could simply cancel the transfer service upon arrival at the hotel but the staff member gave us some real attitude as to what she expected from us (a call from the airport). If you are the party paying the $500 per night you really don't find yourself in the mood to be questioned and getting some bad attitude from who should be welcoming you instead. Breakfast was OK. Another reviewer raved about the breakfast but I quite didn't get it. We stayed in 10 different hotels this trip. The Fortyseven was the most expensive hotel and their breakfast was quite frankly OK. They would run out of ham every 5 minutes and then take another 5-10 minutes to replenish the VERY small tray. There was one kind of cheese, 3 or 4 kinds of bread, scrambled eggs from the heated tray (as in NO omelet station), so that is why we can at the most rate their breakfast an OK (especially at $500 euros a night). All other cheaper hotels had better breakfast. On the second night we decided to try the hotel restaurant at the penthouse. BIG mistake. Overpriced, terrible service as in 1 and a half hour to bring the meal although there were no more than 4 other tables having dinner. After 1 and a half hour they forgot my son's spaghetti. There was nothing special about the food except for the time it took to arrive and the price. Location is so-so. Not bad but if I were to return to Rome I would stay somewhere closer to the Spanish steps.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: PMP
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the FortySeven Hotel for two nights and was really pleased that we had chosen this hotel. The whole experience was wonderful. The rooms were nice/clean. We were on the 4th floor and had lovely views from our window. You can hear the road noise but we ignored it. The roof top restaurant is fantastic. The food/service is very good. Breakfast - there was ample to choose from. The Conceirge was lovely, as was the reception staff. Location was also the best - walking distance to many of the favourite tourist bits. Would stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Rayjock
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic! We loved the location - within EASY walking distance of Trastevere, all the major ancient sites, shopping, etc. Great views of the "Forum Boarium" from your room and the rooftop cafe/restaurant. Fairly quiet too, for Rome. I'd go back here in a second! Highly recommended! I

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Wonderful EXPERIENCE!”
Reviews.Author: TravelGirlPa
Reviews.Content: Booked 47 as part of a package with Expedia . Was a little worried about a couple of the reviews that mentioned noise. We did not find the hotel noisy at all. Plus after all day touring all th sites in Rome, you bascially collapse into bed at the end of the day! The staff was friendly, spoke English, called taxis ( which by the way arrive in about 3 minutes when you are calling from a 5 star hotel), they were just great! The restaraunt on top of th hotel was fabulous , with a beautiful view, and the guests we invited to dinner mentioned they wished they were staying at our hotel too! Both concierges were super friendly, and on our last day, there was a Race for the Cure right in front of the hotel, with thousands of runners passing by,,,,,,,there was a guest who had to cross the street with her infant and I witnessed the concierge go outside and halt traffic so the hotel guest could get into a taxi across the street ! Also, Carlo, the man who handles the baggage made us feel great when we arrived early and he locked up our bags so we could start touring Rome immediately. You really feel safe and welcomed here. I wouldn't stay anywhere else! I hope to go back again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Wow! What else can I say?”
Reviews.Author: Dudley0
Reviews.Content: This hotel get's a five star for location alone. Add the service and decor and you have an unbeatable property. If your primary desire is location, don't look any farther. The hotel rooftop restaurant and bar are very good, though don't expect bargain prices (average by UK & North American standards). The view from the rooftop is worth the higher prices. The beds are very hard, but that was great for us. Also the noise complaints from previous posters are true, but we found most of it came from other guests slamming doors, no the cleaning crew. I will stay here again (hopefully in a few months). Cheers!

Reviews.Title: “Bliss!”
Reviews.Author: Dewfactor
Reviews.Content: We loved 47! As is to be expected, it wasn't cheap -- our four night stay (from 13 to 17 May) was €1248, which included breakfast (more on that later), Internet access (cards) and tax. It's comparable to a stay at the W in NYC, which is overall the hotel I'd compare it to. Small but very well-planned room with plenty of space for the two of us and our two weeks' worth of kit, felt close but not crowded. We had a proper queen-sized bed, which was the last one we saw in Italy (or here in London, for that matter). The bathroom was all marble and spotless and they have a great conservation program of only changing sheets and towels every three days unless you wish them to do so more often. The hotel is just three years old, and all the furnishings, art (real art!) and public spaces are pristine and impressive; the staff is mostly bilingual (at least) and was very patient with my pidgin Italian when not. Allora, breakfast! WOW. Colossal (appropriately enough) and delicious. I'd experienced "typical" Italian b&b breakfasts before and was prepared to be underwhelmed, but 47's is great. There's a plethora of hot and cold foods, several pastries and breads (delivered fresh right at 7 by a wizened local woman who looked remarkably like a Kitchen Witch -- remember those?!), cheeses, meats both hot and cold, caprese, fruits both fresh and dried, cereals, juices, other drinks, coffee with hot milk (mmmmmm!) and attentive friendly service that wasn't overpowering. I took advantage of the plenty, I'm almost embarrassed to admit, and crafted several "tramezzini" to go every day, because we just couldn't face eating whatever's in those ubiquitous carts at every monument and museo. -- nothing beats a nice little sammy on a crusty roll, eaten in front of a 2000 year old hunk of rubble somewhere in the Eternal City!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Staff and Location.”
Reviews.Author: Justinraff
Reviews.Content: We booked a double deluxe room and stayed on the 5th floor - Room 506 again, as the previous reviewer. The double deluxe was large with two french doors leading to a similarly large balcony complete with cute little lemon trees. The room itself was fresh and spotless, and the only negative points we could think of was a weak shower and there was noise which bothered us during the first night (toilets flushing, telephones etc). Those minor issues did not detract from the overall excellent impression which this hotel left on us. Check in was the fastest ever - the staff seemed more interested in getting us to our rooms so we could unpack and relax. Little things continued to impress us, like the turn down service, little weather forecasts on the bedside table for the next day and little plates of food to accompany drinks in the rooftop bar. We ate twice in the hotel and the food was of a very high standard. It was my partner's birthday on the second day of our stay. The check in staff must have made a note of this from the passport because that evening, they arrived at the door with a huge slice of cake! It was this continuous personal attention from staff which made this one of the best hotels we have ever had the pleasure to stay in. We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to the great city of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Location=perfect”
Reviews.Author: ickled
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in a summit hotel while in Prague so looked for one when we were booking accomodation for Rome. 47 Hotel was perfect, rooms were big and clean, with TV and internet access (at a charge but could check certain e.mail accounts for free). Breakfast was simple but nice, fresh pastries, egg, bacon and sausage aswell as yougurt, fruit and cereal. Bar and resturant at hotel was expensive but food was fantastic! The staff at this hotel could not do enough for you. They booked a resturant for us, advised on cost etc, called taxis which arrived promtly. I left my brolly in the back of the car which picked us up from the airport, I asked at reception about it and when we returned in the evening it was in our room. As we arrived late at night the kitchen was closed but they arranged for a snack to be made for us. The location of this hotel was perfect, only 10 minutes from the historic center. Also for the Vatican a bus stopped right outside the hotel which went to the Vatican. We booked tours with ANgel tours before we left and I would recommend this tour group. We used them for The colloseum and the Vatican aswell as a tour of the Panthonon which was free. Rome is in general an expensive city, however we went a walk across the river and found a supermarket to stock up on snacks and beer and wine,which was very cheap! Would recommend this hotel to everyone but it is very modern and not for those looking for a more traditional hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beutiful Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Luybim
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the hotel for two nights in April, 2007. The service was impecable. The staff was very helpful. We stayed in a standard room which was plenty big. The bathroom was spacious and very clean. You should check out the rooftop terrace at the hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary Service & Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Bradius
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 4 nights at the Hotel 47 during the last week of April 2007. Prior to our arrival, the concierge Lesya was very helpful in arranging our airport transfer. Our driver was awaiting our arrival outside of baggage claim and promptly delivered us to the front door of the 47. At night, the Via Petroselli is fairly quiet and you would never know that you are just steps away from many of Rome's most famous sites including the Forum and Colleseum. The front desk staff took extra time during check in to explain a map of Rome and suggest several routes that we might consider taking to see all of the sites. Our room on the 5th floor, # 506 seemed to have one of the best locations in the hotel. The balcony overlooked Via Petroselli, the neighborhood of Trestavere and some lesser known monuments and had fantastic views of the surrounding area. In addition, the balcony was twice the size of those on either side and allowed for two sets of French doors to open into the room. The room was very modern and new and had all of the amenities you would expect to find in a four star hotel. Because of the great location, we walked everywhere with the exception of the Vatican, which we reached by a bus that stopped 20 ft from the front door of the hotel. The roof top restaurant had excellent views and was a nice place to relax with some wine and cheese after sightseeing. Breakfast every morning was much than your typical continental spread and included eggs, ham, caprese salad and cheeses among other choices. We had plans to take a day trip to Tuscany and the concierge was very helpful in making travel arrangements for us to Siena as well.(If you are interested in taking a wine tour in Tuscany, I can recommend the perfect tour with Franco Fadda. His website is [--]. You can read my review of his tour by searching Franco Fadda on this site) We highly recommend the Hotel 47 and would absolutely stay here the next time we are in Rome. Its location is perfect for sightseeing and the hotel is not directly affected by the crowds and traffic that some of the other hotels seem to face. Please let me know if you have any questions about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely modern-art hotel”
Reviews.Author: davesax
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 1 night during a week-end. This hotel is really well designed and modern, you also get a masterpiece of art in each room ... Staff at the reception desk is top-level and breakfast was very good. The overall impression of the property is excellent with no particular downsides.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably Good”
Reviews.Author: Richard007
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Fortyseven for 5 nights from 27 March to April 1. The location is easy walking distance to the Palatine Hill and Cicus Maximus, and not too bad a walk to the Roman Forum or even the Pantheon. The location is enough removed from the Roman mainstream that you are not immediately surrounded by tourists when you step out on to the street. The street on which the hotel fronts, Via Petroselli, is definitely noisy and quite busy. It is wide and the hotel itself is positioned so as to be almost directly across from the temples of Hercules Victor and Portunus. The roof top bar was not yet open when we stayed at Fortyseven as it was still early in the season, but I imagine that at night with the temples lit up, the view should be very nice, though the street noise will definitely be audible. We had a deluxe 4th floor room on the side of the hotel that is off Via Petroselli, so the street noise was much less a problem. The 5th floor of the hotel is all suites, each with a balcony overlooking Via Petrocelli. Our room was nicely appointed and the bathroom quite large by EU standards. Both the room and bath were clean and quite comfortable, including a large walk-in closet and room safe. TV was a large flat screen, high speed internet access via cable connection in the room with a large pull out desk with well positioned electrical sockets. Maid service was good and prompt each day. Unless you have a suite with a balcony, I would make sure to get a room on the side, since the windows are not especially large and you won't have much of a view, you might as well have a bit more quiet. Ear plugs would help. We tried to watch a pay-per-view movie one night, but the movie did not work, so the hotel immediately refunded the charge. Taxis appear in 5 minutes when called by the hotel and it's an easy 30 minutes to the airport by car. there were two floor tiles loose in the elevator the whole time we were there, which is a little unsettling when you first arrive and an obvious maintenance issue that should not have been overlooked. As indicated in other posts, the staff is bilingual and very friendly. The reception and front office staff are all very friendly and helpful. The food is not anything spectacular but certainly passable and the wait staff at dinner needs more training. the breakfast buffet is adequate but the breakfast room is rather crowded. Again, the wait staff seemed a bit short handed and tables were not cleared as rapidly as necessary given the numbers of people, but there was generally not a wait for a table. This may be alleviated if the center courtyard is opened for breakfast this time of year. By EU standards, this is a good hotel, larger than average rooms, modern decor and accompaniments. It's a new place in a very old city, close enough to the center but, as I indicated, not so far that you can't walk to most places of interest. In fact, in about a 10 minutes you can walk to the Circus Maximus and sit on the far side away from the Palatine Hill, and gaze on some of the oldest ruins in the Western world, all for free. Would we stay there again, probably, but it's not like a fantastic "yes"!

Reviews.Title: “A Roman Holiday Audrey Hepburn would like”
Reviews.Author: Claudine123
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Fortyseven Hotel for 4 nights and I was extremely happy with the atmosphere, location, service and price. The staff was multilingual, extremely helpful with train tickets, email, information about schedules, and fast. The prices are extremely reasonable in terms of bar and room service and i was happy about that because it is a four star and the dollar is not that strong. The food was both exquisite and beautifully presented. For example, their vegetable soup is made everyday with fresh vegetables. They served typical italian fare like bresaola and the breakfast buffet included excellent warm scrambled eggs, along with a fresh fruit salad, nothing from the can. The location is fantastic: a few steps away from the Forum, Campidoglio, Trastevere, temples and ruins of all kinds. The closests subway is Colosseum. A cab to go from hotel to the railway station is no more than 7 euros. The rooms have email available through the television, and they changed the sheets every single day, while following all sort of ecological measures to avoid waste. Everything they serve is organic. They carry a great selection of newspaper including the Herald Tribune. The clientele is mostly American couples and families, or groups of friends. The interior decorating is all Italian design but very understated and relaxing. The staff includes many different nationalities. I recommend this hotel because the location is a dream. Angela

Reviews.Title: “Perfect city hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hailst0rm
Reviews.Content: From the moment we stepped into reception we were greeted by friendly staff who could not have been more helpful. Easy to get to, its located within a 10-15 minute walk of all the major 'must do's'. The room was fairly small though not cramped, however, the quality and cleanliness made up for it, and the shower was great! The roof terrace is well worth a visit, lovely views, and the food well worth every penny, very different from the tourist food on offer elsewhere. If I went back to Rome, I'd definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: greeners007
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect. From the moment we arrived to the sad time we had to leave, the staff were warm, honest and very friendly. The location is ideal with the Colosseum only a 10 minute walk away. The hotel itself is tastefully decorated and the rooms are large and well equiped(we stayed in Rm 405). Breakfast is buffet style with a large selection to chose from. If you want a hotel that is ldeally located, friendly and clean then look no further...... this is a gem !

Reviews.Title: “Great value in expensive city”
Reviews.Author: Dean07
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in mid-March and selected the hotel on the basis of its proximity to the start and finish lines of the Rome Marathon. We were not disappointed. We were less than a 10 minute walk from the Colesseum, the Palantine Hill, the Roman Forum, the Pantheon, and the Trastavere neighborhood. The hotel is located right on many main bus lines. The room was great – a large, modern, well-appointed with a great shower! Francesca, the hotel’s concierge, was fabulous. She assisted in restaurant reservations and recommendations for eating and bus routes. The front desk staff was hit or miss, but not a big deal. The Turkish spa is also not to be missed – we had it to ourselves the whole time we were at the hotel. The hotel was a very good value in a very expensive city.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty hotel for a pretty penny!”
Reviews.Author: TravelinBuddy
Reviews.Content: The 47 Hotel was very chic! The lobby said it all: modern/stylish, clean, bright, and inviting. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was spacious, comfortable and had a great view. Interesting things in the room included a bidet in the bathroom, ambient red lights under the ceiling moldings over the bed, and powered shutters for the window. Breakfast at the hotel was good, however the selection was the same everyday. Dinner at the hotel was just OKAY, so we recommend a short walk to the restaurants on the other side of the Tiber River. Although the Circus Bar at the top of the hotel was closed in March (it opens from April thur November) we were able to go up there to enjoy the roman sunsets. The location of the hotel was about a 40 minute walk to the Vatican, a 10 minute walk to the Colosseum, a 5 minute walk to the Capitol Museums, and a block away from the on-off tour bus stops. We would recommend this hotel if you want to stay and PAY for a luxury hotel in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Lux With Noisy Housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: TurtleCreekTraveller
Reviews.Content: The Fortyseven is a VERY nice modern boutique-lux hotel. The rooms and bath are well done, service was polite, efficient, and all-around excellent. The fragrance of the generously sized Italian toiletries was fantastic, and food service pleasing. The hotel is easily accessible to nightlife in Trastevere, an easy walk from the Circo Massimo metro stop, and an easy walk to shopping on Via Condotti. However, if you are a light sleeper and don't plan to awaken early, the hardwood floors may prove a nuisance. Each morning of my stay, I was awakened to what sounded like moving day...apparently furniture being scooted by maids cleaning rooms. It honestly is the only ding I would give to a stylish and well-managed hotel, but it was significant for me. If you sleep like a rock, I would recommend this great hotel to you in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel book it”
Reviews.Author: IrelandMarto
Reviews.Content: stayed for 3 nights with my boyfriend. Good size room with plenty of space. Absolutely spotless. Kingsize bed, tv, complimentary slippers. ensuite was lovely, shower was very powerful. Breakfast was very good cereals, pastries sausages bacon scrammbled egg, juices cheeses yogurts.great way to start the day. situated very near the coloseum. got the metro and just asked for directions. it is 2 stops from termini circo massismo stop and is across the road once you leave the underground.keep walking straight and take first right and keep right.big building on its own.read reviews about noise but we heard nothing. Taxi from termini was costing 28 euro rip off so got our own way on metro. rome is fantastic. wed best day to go to vatican as pope does audience. get the tours of collosem and roman forum and vatican. met them outside colloseum and made the trip more real.callled pegasus or romearound and for a few extra pound you are showed around and given all the infor. pizza pasta and ice cream are amazing.tours also go to catacombs but we were heading home. will be back and will definitly stay in this hotel.pricy but well worth it after a hard day walking around rome. it is within walking distance to all sights but bring a good pair of runners

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointing”
Reviews.Author: bigcatwhite
Reviews.Content: We booked this as a late Valentine break. Our deluxe room was pleasant but the bathroom was small and narrow and only had a large shower. No deluxe room with a bathroom was available. The air conditioning was faulty and our room was very hot. We were told to turn it off, whihc we did but the room remained hot. We fortunately had windows which opened and cooled the room down, but the noise from the cobbled streets was loud and sleeping wasn't easy. Breakfast was excellent - buffet style with a good choice, and contianers which were frequently replenished. The staff were very helpful recommending good places to eat and booking taxis and cars for us. The bed was a little hard, especially for those suffering from bad backs! The location was excellent and we walked to most of the sites we wanted to see.

Reviews.Title: “47, Super Modern”
Reviews.Author: jvos
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at 47 for 4 nights in February and we had a great time in Rome. The hotel is very clean, well-appointed and overall modern. The hallways are dark until someone walks into them and the lights automatically turn on. The hotel staff are friendly and everyone speaks English. Our room was large; it had a nice desk, huge bed, and a beautiful, new bathroom. The room even comes with comfy slippers to wear on the shiny hardwood floor! The only downsides: (1) the bathroom did not have a bath tub; However, it did have a gorgeous tiled shower with a huge glass door and rainmaker shower head, so we forgot about the tub relatively quickly. (2) The walls at this hotel are oddly thin and you really can hear everything next door. The breakfast buffet at the hotel was great; it included scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, cereals, fruit salad, yogurt, and deliciously sweet croissant. The coffee pot also came to the table with steamed, frothy milk which was quite a treat in the morning. You can also purchase Hop On/Hop Off Tour Bus tickets at the front desk and the bus stop is literally across the street from the hotel. (I recommend you use this bus at least once as Rome is somewhat difficult and dangerous to walk due to the sheer size of it, vespa drivers, cobblestones and amount of traffic). In terms of location, the hotel is not centrally located, although I am not sure where in Rome would be. It just seemed like a long walk to all of the atrractions and the metro really doesn't help. The hotel is, however, very close to Ancient Rome including the Roman Forum, Colosseum, and Circus Maximus as well as the Bocca della Verita. Additionally, it is easy to cross the bridge over the Tiber River, into Trastavere. If you cross the bridge, do go to Taverna dei Mercanti in the Piazza de Mercanti for a very interesting and delicious eating experience. You may wish to also try Il Giardino Romano in the Jewish Ghetto just to try the house appetizer dish, fried artichokes (carciofi alla judeea). They are outrageously good and the proprieter/staff are very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Everything”
Reviews.Author: lovewine
Reviews.Content: We loved the FortySeven - the hotel was very clean with great bathrooms. Very modern rooms with firm beds, which was a plus for us. The service was great - the hotel staff is happy to give directions, make recommendations, etc. Breakfast was a good European style buffet with some eggs and bacon as well. Via Petroselli is busy but the auto shades in the room block most of the noise - if you are sensitive, just pop in some earplugs. The bar is cozy - drinks are expensive but are served with cute little snack plates. The hotel is very close to everything - the farthest "sight" is the Vatican at about 1m - we walked there along the river in about 20 minutes. The Forum, Palantine, Capitoline and Collesium are 5-10 minutes away, and Piazza Navona and the Pantheon are 10-15 minutes walk. The hotel is in the middle of the Foro Bario area with many less-visited ruins and churches. San Nicola on Via Petroselli will let you down into the grottos with ruins from 3 temples for a small fee. Wear good shoes - Roma is hard on the feet! For good restaurants, the hotel is just across the river from Trastevre - we liked Pizzerie Ivo, off Piazza S Maria and Pizzerie Marmi on Via Trastevre. We also had great luck eating in the Ghetto on Via Portico Ottavia - it's a real neighborhood with few tourists, at least this time of year. There are also good restaurants on the quiet streets and piazzas north of the Ghetto but south of Campo de Fiori - try the wine bar on Piazza Margana. Overall, a great hotel in a very convenient area for sightseeing - we would stay there again without any hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: onlyleigh
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the 47 prior to joining a cruise in October. The location is exceptional, across the street from the Mouth of Truth (Boca de Veritas). This is a small hotel with very nice rooms. We booked directly with the hotel and chose a large room because we needed luggage space and European hotel rooms are generally small. When we arrived, our large room was not available, so we were put in a smaller room for one night. Of course, the price was not adjusted to reflect the smaller room size! (The only negative to the entire experience). We had looked at over 100 properties before choosing the 47 and we chose well. While not inexpensive by American standards, the price was very good for central Rome. I believe we paid around $340 USD per night. When we did finally get to our larger room the next day, it was a view room on the front. We had a refrigerator which made bringing back wine or cheese very convenient. They have electric window and noise shutters so we only heard the loudest noises from the street and these were hardly noticeable. This property is across the street from numerous bus stops and the hop-off, hop-on tour bus stop. A great location. It is within easy walking distance of Campo di Fiore (5 minutes), Piazza Navona (10 minutes), the Forum and Coliseum (10 minutes), the Jewish Ghetto (10 minutes) and Trastevere (10 minutes). It is a quiet area with few street people, so is safe at night. As to the hotel facilities, everything worked in the room, but it did take us a bit to figure out that the room key had to be in the slot near the door for the electricity to work. the decor is stylish and modern. The hotel is clean and the personnel friendly. The hotel has a generous European style buffet breakfast and requests were promptly taken care of. There is wireless free internet in the lobby, although you need to get a sign-on code from the front desk. The concierge arranged both our airport pick-up and transport to the cruise ship. We had read of problems, so we were careful to confirm these arrangements and the exact logistics to meet our driver. It worked out fine and we enjoyed both rides with good drivers. Our Italian is limited and the drivers English was limited, but we hacked along in a combination of charades, Spanish, English and Italian supplimented by guide books and laughter. We would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a reasonably priced central Rome hotel. As to eating, we thoroughly enjoyed the Ristorante Pizzeria La Scala, Piazza della Scala 60 in Trastevere. We also dined one day in the Magnolia Cafe/Winebar/Lounge in Campo de' Fiori - I'd pass on this one, the food was mediocre and the service stunk. They acted like we owed them a favor. For a really fun local meal try the old Peroni factory which is near the Pantheon. No one speaks English and it is crowded and noisy. The food portions are generous, the beer really cold and the atmosphere is truly Italian business people at lunch! Loads of atmosphere and great decor. We did the hop-off, hop-on bus on Sunday. Take the entire loop before you get off anywhere. The lines at the Terminus station and the Vatican were very long, but the view from the top of the bus is very nice and it gives you a good overview of Rome. This was our second visit to Rome and we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely First Rate Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bellaoes
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel forty seven for 5 nights from 16th January 2007and were welcomed warmly by the reception staff who took the time to take us to our room and show us how all the modern gizmos worked (ie auto window shutters etc). The hotel had a promotion on where they provided a personal shopper who showed me the various shops about town and it was thoroughly enjoyable and set me up for the days ahead exploring the january sales!! We stayed in a gorgeous room on level 5 (just below the terrace bar) overlooking some ancient temples and the church of Santa Maria (where Gregory Peck stuck his hand into the slit-mouthed Bocca della Verità in Roman Holiday). The room had a lovely balcony with outdoor seating/dining area which we were able to take advantage of due to the unusually warm weather. Watching the sun set from there with a bottle of chianti was truly amazing - would be even more glorious in spring!! The room we stayed in was a deluxe and was massive in size with lovely parquetry floors and modern furnishings. It was great to get a room as shown on the website (which is soooo often not the case in Europe!!) The rooms feature a large LCD widescreen tv (with free cable incl english movies), blockout shutters, king size super comfy bed which lends itself to long sleep-ins if you dont set your alarm due to the blockout shutters and blinds cutting out all light and external noise!) The hotel was central to absolutely everything. Circus Maximus (5 mins walk) Roman Forum/Colloseum, trevi/pantheon/trastavere/main shopping district (10 mins walk). I would recommend taking a cab to vatican though (max cost is about 6 or 7 euro). I would also recommend a cab if coming from Termini (particularly with luggage - negotiate a price first and dont pay more than 7 euro!!) The hotel has an extremely well equipped gym and steam room. The concierge was absolutely sensational. Providing the greatest restaurant recommendations - you simply must ask for assistance as there are so many to choose from (do not even attempt to do it on your own!) In particular we highly recommend the osteria behind the hotel. Breakfast staff were very attentive even at busy times and the selection was good (by european standards). If I were to have to pick on some of the negatives of the hotel it would be the sound coming from other rooms (we were next to the maids room and noise could be heard through the thin walls). Also we were told a breakfast pack would be ready for us as we were leaving at an early tour (which wasnt) and we were phoned twice (once very early in the morning) to advise our hire car was waiting which was actually for another room. Also internet access could only be bought in sessions of 24 hours (which was a bit inconvenient when you only want to log on quickly to check emails). But that is really nit-picking. If you cant put up with those sorts of minute inconveniences you shouldnt be travelling (stay at home where all is routine!!) Our stay at this hotel came at the end of a long trip and made Rome one of the highlights!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - Quiet - Clean”
Reviews.Author: Martp
Reviews.Content: A very nice place to stay if you are in Rome. Set just a little out of the main hustle and bustle a stones throw away from the river Tiber and the Roman Forum / fort (ruins). I would recommend a good pair of walking shoes/trainers because its at the bottom quite a steep hill to get to the main part of town. Room was very tidy and spacious. It was expensive in comparison to the other hotels but it was worth it. Nice food and good service. The roof top bar is quite impressive also..... but you'll need your credit card if you are going to hit the cocktails!

Reviews.Title: “Takes some beating !”
Reviews.Author: EnglandMamasita
Reviews.Content: We visited this hotel in October, 2006, having read the very positive reviews on Trip Advisor. We found the hotel to be ideally situated - the 10 minute walk to the centre was beautiful and enabled us to take in many of the sights and soak up the atmosphere of the city. We were very lucky in that the weather was lovely - shorts and t-shirts were all that was required. The accommodation was very good - the room was spacious and immaculately presented. The bathroom was spotlessley clean. On our return one evening we found a hotel t-shirt which they had left for my 8 year old daughter - a lovely touch ! The rooftop terrace bar and restaurant was a real treat for us. As the weather was so good we relaxed there each evening on our return from a busy day's sight seeing. The only drawback to the hotel was the price of the drinks- quite expensive and the cocktail I had wasn't great, however this did not detract from the enjoyment of our stay at all. A fantastic hotel which we will definately stay in again - soon I hope!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Experience”
Reviews.Author: BMCL
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I chanced upon this hotel at tripadvisor.com whilst searching for a pleasant, clean and a good value hotel during the December holiday break. This hotel is centrally located and is like a walking hub to many of the major sites of Rome such as the Colosseo, the Temple of Vesta, Piazza Vittorio Emanuele (tomb of the unknown soldier), Circo Massimo and Bocca della Verita' and not to mention a short ride away from the famed Caracalla baths. As for the hotel, the staff is friendly and professional and the bathrooms are spacious and clean. We were there during the winter so the rooftop bar was closed which was a pity since the views are quite amazing especially when having a late afternoon/early evening aperitivo. The bar at the lobby was okay but the service was very professional and warm. We would definitely stay at Hotel 47 during our next trip to The Eternal City.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Loved Loved the 47!”
Reviews.Author: sorenkkg
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the 47 as part of a trip we put together going to 6 European cities (London, Edinburgh, Dublin, Rome, Paris, Amsterdam). This was a fantastic find, thanks TripAdvisor! It looks a little like a bank from the outside, but once you're inside, the simple clean lobby is a cool refuge from the days of traipsing around Rome. We loved our room! Lots of space to move around, great shower and bath products (big bottles, worked great and smelled great). Decent towels too! The staff spoke great English and were helpful, day or night. There is a gorgeous rooftop bar with a lovely view-- you can eat up there too. The location was perfect for us-- you can walk to the Circus Maximus, and to the Colosseum, and even to the Trevi Fountain (a bit of a trek, but that's what it was all about for us, and taxis are hard to find). Also, there is a tour bus stop (the red tour bus I think) just outside the door of the hotel, so that was great the days we used the tour bus as a regular bus to get around a bit. We had breakfast included, and it wasn't as huge as some places we stayed, but it was certainly not skimpy! There were scrambled eggs and sausages for the American palate, but also a big selection of italian cold cuts, cheeses, fruits, cereals, breads, juice, coffee... what more could you want? We loved this hotel, and recommend it to everyone, and would certainly go back in a heartbeat!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel for a City Break”
Reviews.Author: Peter6151
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 4 nights in this hotel. Some of the floors were being redecorated and we were put in a first floor room. We were given the choice of a room at the rear of the hotel or one overlooking the road; we chose the latter.With double glazing we did not find the traffic noise too intrusive As other reports suggest the internal walls do not keep out all sound but this is a quiet time of year and we were not too disturbed The hotel staff are extremely friendly and helpful even noticing it was my wife's birthday while we were there and leaving us a wonderful Tiramassu in the room We did not use any public transport at all as Rome is a very compact city and we walked to all of the major sites As far as restaurants are concerned we would recommend 3 Firstly Taberna De' Mercanti in Piazza dei Mercanti Tratevere; a little Gothic but good atmosphere and full of locals Second Checco er Carrettierre, via Benedetta . A more formal restaurant but again full of local flavour and excellent food and service And finally AnticaPesa, Via Garibaldi This is an excellent high quality restaurant. We went on a Tuesday evening anf fortunately we managed to get the only available table; the staff were very friendly and the service was excellent 3 courses with a bottle of wine, aperitifs and after dinner drinks for 150 Euros was excellent value; please try it

Reviews.Title: “Ancient setting, modern comfort”
Reviews.Author: MJPBAF
Reviews.Content: In our experience, it’s rare in a city as ancient as Rome to find such a modern hotel – rarer still to find a modern hotel done well. The Fortyseven Hotel is that place. The two-year old hotel was formerly an office building and you can tell that they must have gutted the place and started over. The shell of the building is intact, but everything else is modern and new…and it works! The hotel has modern electronics, cooling and heating that actually work, and a great roof deck that boasts views of ancient Rome. The rooms have comfortable beds, hardwood floors, flat screen televisions, marble bathrooms, and, best of all, electronic shutters that block out light and sound. Luckily, the view is ancient, so that you can’t forget that you’re in Rome (our room looked out on the Temples of the Forum Boarium that date from the 2nd century BC). The great view from the roof top was by tasty food and drink – expensive, but worth it when you realize where you are. The hotel is not perfect, however: there was noise from other rooms – scraping sounds of furniture being moved in the room above – but this was a relatively minor distraction. Despite generally helpful advice, we regretted following the recommendation of the concierge on the night she made a reservation for us at a traditional Italian restaurant that seemed more New Jersey Turnpike than Rome. If you’re interested in ancient Rome, this hotel is in a great location – the Capitoline Hill (and its museums), the Colosseum, the Forum, and the Circus Maximus are all nearby – and it’s a short walk across the Tiber to the trendy neighborhood of Trastevere. We think this is a good hotel for independent travelers who know what they want to see, don’t need recommendations or a lot of tourist assistance and don’t mind (or actually enjoy) walking and exploring the city. If that describes you, then this hotel will be a good match. We greatly enjoyed ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here next time I get to Rome”
Reviews.Author: NickJB
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for three nights and would recommend this hotel to others. Key attractions are only a short walk as well as some lovely restaurants. The room was larger than I was expecting and looked like it had been recently refurbished. The staff we always very helpful and friendly while the hotel itself was spotless Tip -Although more expensive than other bars the roof top bar is well worth visiting if only for one.

Reviews.Title: “Overall very good”
Reviews.Author: kellydinc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fortyseven for four nights over New Years. The only complaint I have about our entire stay is the paper thin walls. You could literally hear everything, talking, furniture moving, toilet flushing. Even my earplugs did not help. Though, this was the only downside. I am a VERY light sleeper so this was tough for me, but I was so tired every night I was able to sleep okay. The rooms are nice size, and very clean. The bed is comfy. Make sure to get a room away from the street though as it can get noisy. The hotel is not very far away from the sites of Rome, my first suggestion would be to learn the bus routes. They are very easy and there is a stop right in front of the hotel and they will give you bus tickets for 75 minutes. We learnt this too late in our stay so walked everywhere! The breakfast is okay. Normal fare of eggs, croissants, fruit salad, variety of cereals, etc. The staff was nice and courteous. Overall, a good stay and we would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Kildare highly recommends!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lisnaree
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed in Forty Seven Hotel from the 27th December 06 untill the 30th. It was our first trip to Rome and neither the magnificence of the city or the experience of the hotel disappointed. We found the hotel to be very nicely decorated, modern but not austere, and the staff very efficient and friendly. An example of their service- we had asked for an adapter plug on one occasion and unfortunately, none were available at that time. When we later retunred to our room after sightseeing, the staff had left an adapter for us. Obviously, this place is well run and your needs are taken on board. Be assured that the photos you will see on this site are completely accurate. The rooms are very spacious and spotless. Advice to first time travellers of the city -Forty Seven Hotel has a transfer service from the airport that you can enquire about when booking- for €50 a chauffuer will collect you at the air port and bring you directly to the Hotel. Well worth it. Food in the Hotel is standard fare, breakfast a bit European for our Irish Bacon tastes but pleasant nonetheless, and plenty of options. The location of the Hotel its self is great, within 15-20 walking distance of the Trevi fountain, Piazza Navvona, The Pantheon and even closer to the Forum, the Colleseum and Palantine Hill area. We walked to the Vatican in about half an hour. Superbly located really. We booked this Hotel on foot of the reviews of other travellers on Trip Advisor, so well done to Trip Advisor and to Forty Seven Hotel. We had a fantastic time.

Reviews.Title: “Near Everything.... Next to Nothing”
Reviews.Author: JamesBBB
Reviews.Content: I was extremely disappointed in my experience at this hotel. Some of the points have been hit on in other reviews. Others have not. 1) Location - yes, you can walk to everything -- in about 15-20 minutes. You are actually in the middle of nothing. There are no restaurants, clubs, etc... in the area that a tourist might expect, except for a bus station in front. I think I walked at least 15 minutes to find a simple ATM machine. 2) Noise - the walls are paper thin. Noises from adjacent rooms are not even muffled. I heard the Italian man in the room next to me perfectly, who appeared to be speaking in moderate tone. Also, I heard furniture moving, walking, showering, etc... of the room above me. This is not to mention the abundant street noise, because the windows provide absolutely no insulation. 3) Breakfast - Service was poor. There was no one to seat us. It took 15 minutes to flag down someone for hot beverages. They actually burnt my cappucino milk (I didn't realize you could physically burn milk). Selection was average. The eggs were unappetizing, the cheese, breads, etc... were standard fare. 4) Wireless - No wireless access in your room (if you can get your laptop charged). Instead, you need to inconveniently plug into a cord, extremely limiting your access. Wireless was avaialble downstairs through prepaid cards. When I went to purchase one such card, I was informed they were out. 5) Outlets - I am not sure how this is even possible, but their outlets were not powerful enough to power my laptop. It was fine in every other hotel, but I could not recharge my laptop here, unless it was powered off, in which case it would slowly recharge. 6) Nickel and diming - local phone calls are charged, lost room key (unidentifiable white plastic card) are charged . I wouldn't expect this at a hotel for the prices being paid.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: boorami
Reviews.Content: great location. can use better insulation. great staff. will use again. very clean. loved my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: ShaneinHK
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed here in Sept. & held our Northern hemisphere wedding party on the rooftop. I am so glad we chose Hotel fortyseven & have such happy memories from our stay there. Paolo, Erika & all the staff were amazing & did everything they could for us during our stay. The night of our party on the rooftop was amazing. The decor & attention to detail of the table settings was faultless & the rooftops views & ambience is nearly too romantic. The food (hot & delicious) & service was excellent during the meal & I want to emphasise the service - the service was spot on but so discreet, you felt as if the staff were not there. We had approx. 30 guests & most stayed at the hotel. They all felt the same as we did & spoke v highly about the night / hotel even weeks later. The rooms are modern (unlike most Rome hotels), spacious & comfortable as is the entire hotel. If you stay here, you must have a drink / dinner on the rooftop bar. My wife & I love Rome & we will always stay here when we come back to Rome. I would like to congratulate Paolo & all his team on ensuring this hotel competes on service, coolness, etc with the best boutique hotels globally.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Nice Staff”
Reviews.Author: Mazza&Fazza
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel next to some interesting archeological sites. Staff were very friendly and helpful, and the hotel itself modern and very clean. Breakfast was lovely, with a decent selection of pastries, savoury dishes and fruit.

Reviews.Title: “Noise, Noise, Noise!!”
Reviews.Author: tzitzi
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel 47 with my wife for 3 nights in early December. Excellent location, spacious room and bathroom, average breakfast quality and unfriendly staff, moderate sound-poofing windows (very noisy via Petroselli) and totally unacceptable sound insulation. The people from the room next to ours had the tv moderately loud but you could hear almost everything, apart from their conversations, the family of the upper floor with their little child running all the time, or the other adjoining room with the shower running all the time around my ears! Such a nice decoration and a wooden floor do not match with that complete lack of insulation. I have to admitt that the bell boy (a very friendly guy) did his best to help us but the concierge ladies did not ("well, it is like a building with many people" was their answer). I agree, but not when you pay 225 euros/day! Not for my next visit to Rome. Kostas, Thessaloniki, Greece

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: andi82
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have recently returned from 3 nights and it is a beautiful place. On arrival, the receptionist was extremely helpful - gave us a map of the city and pointed out places of interest.. It's location is very good. We had booked a "Double Classic" room which is the hotel's standard room. The room itself was very nice - well decorated but not particularly large but it has a very nice view. A little pricey but well worth it. We did have a problem with the heating in our room but it did get sorted out right away when we asked from the front desk. We did eat in the restaurant on our first evening when we arrived late and it was very good - good service, good food, decent wine (good selections) and a very reasonable price plus, when we went back for lunch on our last day they treated us like old friends! There is a gym in the hotel but we didn't manage to use it just have a look. Great exercise equipments. I would definitely recommend this hotel and will definitely stay here again.(specially at spring/summer when the roof top restaurant will be open) .

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend experience”
Reviews.Author: Yoav_C
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I had a great romantic weekend staying in the Forty-seven hotel in Rome on January 06. Ever since then, I promised to post this review so there it goes. We got a great bargain (180 EUR / night with buffer breakfast) through the Summit hotels web site and were happy to discover that the hotel was perfectly located, modernly and comfortable designed, clean and quite. The bedroom was very spacious in European cities standards and the bathroom was great and well stocked with good quality toiletries. Staff was nice and informative (gave good restaurant recommendation) though bar service while enjoying the heated inner courtyard was a little slow. Altogether, excellent lodging experience and highly recommended (if you get a decent rate).

Reviews.Title: “Good location and value for Roma”
Reviews.Author: HVB
Reviews.Content: The location was great. It was a quick and easy walk to all the sites. We stayed at the Capo D'Africa one night at the end of our trip and found the 47 location to be much better for our purposes. The only complaint about the 47 we had was the HVAC did not seem to work very well. We were hot/ cold. The concierge was terrific and made excellent dinner reservations for us for the 2 nights we stayed. The bed is a little hard and I could hear the people upstairs one night but we were so tired from walking around Rome it did not really bother us. The shower and room were excellently large sized for a Euro hotel. I thought the breakfast was great. Scrambled eggs, sausages, cheeses, meats, breads, juices, etc. The bar was awesome with attentive staff who taught us rudimentary Italian. Everyone was pleasant. I would return again.

Reviews.Title: “Great find!”
Reviews.Author: wsgf
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 4 nights at the FortySeven Hotel and loved everything about our stay. Our reservation was handled efficiently and within minutes we were in a magnificent corner suite with a terrace that wrapped around the room, giving us a panoramic view of the city. Directly across the street were ruins, and we enjoyed the location, near the Colisseum. It's a small, chic and sophisticated boutique hotel, but it lacks nothing. It has a fabulous rooftop lounge, restaurant, full bar and very nice staff. The rooms are meticulous, spacious, well-appointed with a large, modern bathroom and a plasma TV. We would happily move in, as it was larger than our first apartment. We thought it was a great value and we will definitely return. We hated to leave. Note: We thought our room was very quiet and the walls were so thick that our daughter had to call us on her cell phone because we could not hear her knocking outside our door.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous contemporary hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bridg
Reviews.Content: We returned from Rome on Weds 29th November having stayed at Fortyseven Hotel. What a stylish contemporary hotel ! The room was a good size with lovely large shower, spotlessly clean, the staff extremely helpful, good selection at breakfast , very close to Colloseum & Pallatine, within walking distance of Spanish Steps (try La Rampa Restaurant up side street to the right of bottom of steps), Trevi etc. Sadly we did not get time to use the gym & steam room. We would return again and again!!

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as they think”
Reviews.Author: Goolsy
Reviews.Content: Very average hotel that is no where near as good as they think they are. We had a number of issues throughout our stay of 4 nights such as having to wait 45 minutes whilst they found our reservation, food/drinks ordered but never coming and personal items 'missing' from the room. However, two main issues stood out. The first was the room's thermostat was set at 19 but it never got below 26 as the room was only being heated and not cooled. 'It's November' was the answer from the staff. The second and by far the biggest issue was the paper thin walls. We could hear people walking on the floor above us and full conversations in the adjoining rooms. I have never come across such cheap sound insulation, ever! The location is brilliant but this is a place trying to be a boutique hotel. However, I've stayed in a lot of these and it takes more than just an aquamarine glass check in counter to be one.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to all expectations..”
Reviews.Author: Igoraontour
Reviews.Content: After reading numerous reviews on Rome hotels, I decided to book this hotel for a 3 night stay (19-22 Nov. 2006). This is my first time to actually report back on a hotel but I feel in this case Forty Seven has earned a great review. From my initial contact with the hotel via their website , I experienced professionalism and courtesy. The booking service was clear and efficient. On arrival we found the hotel to be spotless, food good and service great and 2 double rooms waiting for my husband and I and another couple. I do agree with previous reviewers that the bar etc.. was pricey .. seven euro for a beer but it was served with canapes and snacks so to be fair we did not ever feel we were being ripped off. (paid 9 euro though for a double espresso in Piazza Navone... ridiculous). Breakfast each morning was beautifully presented and had a good choice. The conceirge Francesca recommended excellent restaurants every night and was exceptionally friendly and helpful as were Loredana and her male colleague in the bar Mi???. and indeed all the staff. Location was excellent, close to everything. Taxis were cheap and plentiful. All in all Forty Seven is by far one of the better hotels I have stayed in, in numerous cities. By the way we paid 190 euro per room per night incl breakfast. Great value in our book. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “WOnderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Andy-Thompson
Reviews.Content: We have stayed a total of 3 times at the FortySeven. Our last stay was for the first 2 nights of our honeymoon at the beginning of September. Each time we have stayed we found the staff to be very courteous and friendly. Reception staff are very helpful. The rooms are clean, spatious and comfortable. The roof bar is great, we had 2 wonderful nights eating, drinking and taking in the views. The staff were great and we even had cocktail recomendations for our last night. The restaurant menu, while not extensive is still good. They are willing to mix and match menu items to suit tastes. Breakfast is good with a selection of hot and cold. We have stayed on the second, third and fourth floors and had no problem with the noise other people have mentioned, the window shutters seem to keep traffic noise out. The situation of the hotel is good as well, many attractions are within walking distance. Travester is a 10 minute walk away, some nice places to eat there and a walk along the river on the way back. All in we would highly recomend the FortySeven to anyone wanting some comfort and hospitality in Roma.

Reviews.Title: “much better than paris!!”
Reviews.Author: rachel1978
Reviews.Content: Honestly this is one of the nicest hotels i satyed in, myself and my partner ahve been working all year and this is the first break we have had. The hotel was really nice, very modern and spotless, which I think is probably one fo the most important things. The room wasn't massive and overlooked a back street but it was nicely sized and had a good bathroom. The pay to view movies were really cheap for a 4 star hotel only 8Euros which is good as like most foreighn sat, it has mostly italian channels (fair enough we were in italy) Breakfast was varied and very tasty and we never ran out of anything. The hotel is really close to everything, 30mins walk from anywhere, the only negative is that there are no shops near buy, to buy water or a snack, it's a good 15minute walk to anyting like that. but as long as you know that it's fine. the roof top restaurant is lovely but was only open one night as it was too cold but we had a lovely evening. We would deffinately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointed”
Reviews.Author: sjuhawks19
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful, make no mistake about that. I really enjoyed the decor, but I was a bit disappointed in a few things. First of all, the MAIN reason I booked this hotel was for the outdoor circus bar they have on the rooftop. Since it was my honeymoon, my wife and I fully intended on ending our night on the roof enjoying the beautiful views of Rome. But what they don't bother to tell you on their website is that in November they close that bar because of the cold apparently. So we got to enjoy it our first night there but it was not open the other 2 nights. So please be aware if you go in the winter months this is probably not available to you. The second problem was that we had 2 wake up calls that were 30 minutes late. What's the point of a wake up call if it's late? The second one was for the day we left so we could get to the airport in time, and we told them it was very important to get called on time and it was still a half hour late. Not a fun morning scrambling to get out of the hotel in time to make our flight. The room itself was very nice, very clean, and very comfortable. I particularly enjoyed the power window shades, that was pretty nice. The people above us for some reason seemed like they were into moving furniture in the middle of the night, not sure why, but that woke us up a few times, but that's not the hotel's fault. The breakfast was nice in the morning and pretty tasty, and the concierge and staff were nice and helpful. The location is pretty good too. So overall it's a nice place, a little expensive for what you get, but overall we were just disappointed in the circus bar closing and the wake up calls not being on time.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Frqnt_Traveler
Reviews.Content: Forty Seven Hotel was wonderful! The room was great, the food was tasty, the location was convenient, and the staff was friendly. I would definitely go back and highly recommend Forty Seven Hotel. ACCOMODATIONS: The room was clean, new, and very nice. The window shutters that close out the outside noise at night are such a nice feature. I slept very well. The bed was a little hard compared to 4 star hotels in the US, but not uncomfortable. The bathroom was clean, roomy, had good water pressure and was even better than 5 stars we had stayed in in London. FOOD/RESTAURANT: The complementary breakfast was good and offered a nice variety of options, including fresh fruit, eggs, cereal, pastries, yogurt, and plenty of juices and milk. Meanwhile, I cannot say enough good things about the rooftop bar/restaurant. The food was amazing, the service was great and the view was fantastic. It's also small enough that the atmosphere is nicely relaxing/romantic and comfortable. LOCATION: The location is also great, we were able to very easily walk to the Roman Forum, the Colloseum, and the Imperial Forum. Trevi Fountain, the Pantheon, and the Spannish Steps were a little further, but still very close (we actually walked too far the first time we went there, because we didn't expect it to be as close as it was). The Vatican was the furthest away, but we still walked with no problem and enjoyed getting the fresh air. For some, the vatican might be a bit far, but if you don't mind walking, it's not bad at all. STAFF: The staff was extremely friendly and spoke very good English as well, which made the whole experience very easy. They even set up reservations for us at a nearby restaurant one night, when we wanted to eat upstairs, but got back too late and it was closed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel with location”
Reviews.Author: typhoonsurf
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for my anniversary in one of the suites. Positives - - Suite was large and had a very large balcony with view - excellent service from all staff, they all were very friendy and tried very hard to please you - concierge made reservations for a dinner which was one of the best I ever experienced - excellent free breakfast - excellent location near ruins Negatives - - room needed some updating ie chipped paint and fixtures - very limited restaurant selections Overall, this was a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, but very poor advice from concierge on restaurants”
Reviews.Author: RT12
Reviews.Content: Very nice rooms, pleasantly suprised. Good location. Not too impressed by breakfast (little choice). Very poor recommendation for restaurant by concierge; restaurant Le Fric (absolutely overpriced, poor service and YMCA music in the background); must be friend of the concierge (with commission)!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: tab+mac
Reviews.Content: We have nothing but rave reviews for FORTYSEVEN HOTEL. Part of our 3 week Italian holiday was at Fortysevan hotel. Wonderful staff, excellent location, hearty breakfast, quiet and truelly romantic. We only stay at boutique hotels and 47 is a gem.

Reviews.Title: “Forty Seven Hotel a real gem”
Reviews.Author: bradentonbelle
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a wonderful stay at the Hotel Forty Seven in Rome. We had booked a deluxe room but on arrival were given a complimentary upgrade to a fabulous suite with an amazing terrace (complete with lemon trees) overlooking some of the wonders of Rome. Rome was extremely busy and the hotel was in a great quiet location (although next to a busy road) and was a real haven away from it all but convenient at the same time. It was my seven year old son's 7th birthday during our stay and the hotel gave him a T shirt and made him a birthday cake. On the last day we asked for a late checkout and again it was no problem and there was no charge. Absolutely superb!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Hotel, Loved Rome”
Reviews.Author: Calfan
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Rome. Although I have travelled all over Italy and Europe, I had been warned off of Rome for years. My mother had business in Rome, so I offered to join her there for a mother-daughter long weekend. I can't say enough about how fabulous Rome is. But I've seen wonderful old cities before. What separates Rome from the others are the ruins, in particular the Palatine and Forum, which are located directly behind the Fortyseven hotel. What also made our stay great was the warm staff, large room (and bath) and fabulous rooftop restaurant and bar at the hotel. While "pricey" to some, it was no where near the prices of the Hotel de Rusie where we had a wonderful lunch one day. The rooftop restaurant/bar alone was worth the price of our stay. We walked the city each day and returned at sunset each night to enjoy the views of the ruins around the hotel, the sunsets behind the Roman hills beyond and the comfy but luxurious atmosphere. The two (of the five) nights that we ate dinner at the hotel, the food was above average -- even for Rome. In particular, the carpaccio and grilled squid were excellent. Our room was spacious -- larger than your typical european hotel and was spare and modern, which I prefer. The room and bath were spotless and came with oversize toiletries. We also enjoyed the breakfast each morning. They always had scrambled eggs, bacon and the usual assortment of cheese, breads, cereals and juices you typically find at a European buffet. Unlike other reviewers, we had no problems getting coffee service. We used the concierge for dinner reservations one night -- gracious and adept service. And because we had an early departure, we booked a car with the hotel to take us to the airport at 5 a.m.-- again, no problems. On a separate note, although it is a bit of a trek, I highly recommend the restaurant Al Presidente, which is a few blocks from the Trevi fountain -- fabulous tasting menu and impeccable service.

Reviews.Title: “loved hotel fortyseven”
Reviews.Author: buddyboy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at fortyseven end of September based on reviews on TA. Hotel is modern, clean, large rooms, electronic shutters that block out light and most sound. Great concierges at frontdesk. very friendly, accomidating and all spoke great English. Wonderful full breakfast included. Cannot say enough about this well run gem.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dr.yosh
Reviews.Content: We loved this modern hotel in Rome. My girlfriend and I stayed 5 nights (September 21/26) in room 506, we loved the intimate nature of the hotel , the daily breakfast and the balcony (and sunscreens) in our room, that was very clean and spacious. The first night we had trouble with the air conditioning and they changed our room almost immediately. The staff was friendly and helpful, although we were students in a primarily adult hotel we were treated very kind. The hotel is ideally situated in the heart of Rome, which makes life easy for shopping, nightlife etc. The Roman Forums and Colosseum are about 15 minutes walk and you have a few ancient monuments nearby. Everything was perfect: we would definitely come back and recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Refuge after Sight Seeing”
Reviews.Author: JLPL
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the 47 for 6 nights. We loved it. After a day pounding the cobblestone streets of Rome, which are packed with people, it was a nice place to return to. Quiet, not a crazy area of town. Big rooms with electronic shutters to block out light and traffic noise while you sleep. GREAT big bathrooms, nice shower, even a towel warmer! Unlike some other opinions, I loved the beds and slept great. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooftop restaurant was nice, a bit overpriced and the selection somewhat limited. The breakfast was a good start to the day-coffee, juices, pastry, eggs, proscuitto. It is close to old Rome-the Colosseum, the Forum. It is a minute's walk from La Bocca della Verita as well as the bus stop. It is a close walk to Trastavere. Vatican City, Spanish steps, Trevi Fountain are more of a walk 20-30 min. On days when we were not up to the challenge, we simply grabbed the bus in front of the hotel-very easy. The hotel staff will sell you the bus ticket and tell you which one to hop on. We plan on going back to Rome and will definitely be staying at the 47 again.

Reviews.Title: “Pros and cons”
Reviews.Author: Exvancouverite
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Forty Seven Hotel for 5 nights in early October. Based on many reviews on Trip Advisor our expectations were very high but, unfortunately, were not always met. We booked a deluxe room several months in advance and asked for a room with terrace if possible or at least a room on a higher floor. On check in, we were shown to a room on the 3rd floor but were informed shortly after going to the room that there was a problem with it's internet connection and were moved to a room on the first floor (second if you're North American). This room was larger and nicer than the first one we were shown but not my idea of "deluxe". When I inquired about switching to a room on an upper floor, I was told that the hotel was full and nothing else was available. The room was quite large for Rome and the bathroom was fine with a large tiled shower but no tub. Closer inspection revealed a bit of mildew in the hard to clean areas of the shower but other than that the room and bathroom were very clean. The room turned out to be quite noisy from the traffic and the metal shutters did not keep all of the noise out. It only bothered us one night but if you're a light sleeper, you really need a room on the upper floors. The hotel is very well located if you like walking. The Vatican is the furthest of the major tourist sites from the hotel and it's only a 30 minute walk along the Tiber. Most major sites are within 15 or 20 minutes. The disadvantage of the location is a lack of convenient cafes or bars. The food and drink at the hotel are only of average quality and very expensive. The exception is a good buffet breakfast although the service at breakfast is very spotty. However, generally, the hotel staff were very good, especially the concierges and front desk. We opted to have the hotel send a car to pick us up at the airport and this proved to be an excellent option. 50 euros but well worth it. All in all, we weren't dissatisfied with the hotel but felt that it didn't live up to it's lofty reviews. We likely wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “"Style but no Atmosphere"”
Reviews.Author: bojangal
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 3-night stay at Forty Seven. The hotel is based on a ‘minimalist style’ and is modern by Roman standards, yet somehow there is ‘something’ about this hotel that just doesn’t click. We stayed in a standard room given the prices in Rome. The room was a great size, very clean and the bathroom was fantastic (I didn’t want to get out of the shower and the toiletries are great). The bed was very hard and my husband and I ached - felt like we’d slept on the floor after 3 nights! The hotel is in a great location for many of the sites and the bus-stop is right outside for those sites further away (mainly the Vatican City). It is disappointing that you have to walk a fair distance for a coffee, a drink before dinner or food because the bar/restaurant in the Roof Garden of the hotel is very pricey, although it is the only place in the hotel that appears to have atmosphere – nicely done with gas heating for those cool nights. There are no tea-making facilities in the room, but there is a bar fridge that can be stocked with your own wine! The reception staff and concierge were very helpful, but the breakfast staff definitely need to take lessons from them! Breakfast is a disaster, the tables are not cleared and re-set often enough, they do not offer coffee and if you ask for it, you will get it eventually, but don’t expect ‘service with a smile’. The courtyard for breakfast is a nice setting, but again there is ‘something’ lacking.
