The fitness centre is equipped with fantastic machinery, but is deserted and the Turkish Bath didn’t appear to be working. Overall this hotel was a good choice for 3 nights other than the bed and breakfast! We have stayed in many hotels around the world and although we thought it was pricey for what it offered, on comparing Rome hotels with others it appears this hotel was average in price and that the breakfast service (or lack of it!) is usual in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “An Okay Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NikiInVA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Forty Seven for 3 nights in the beginning of October. Overall, we were happy with the hotel. The location is a little off the beaten path so be aware that most things are a good walk, but certainly doable. The rooms were spacious, very modern and clean. As for the staff, we had mixed results. The concierge’s were very helpful and willing to assist in anyway possible. The front desk staff was actually quite rude when we were checking out and very arrogant. The breakfast buffet was tasty, although the servers were not friendly and ignored us and our requests. The view of the rooftop restaurant was fabulous. The service and food were mediocre. This hotel isn’t bad; I just think we probably could have done a little better for the price with all the options in Rome. Next time, we will probably check out something else.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: paulafrances
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights. We were very happy with the location. It is close to all the sites of ancient Rome and a short walk across the bridge to the Trastevere area. We were delighted by the spacious rooms. We had a deluxe room on the 5th floor. The balcony had a view over the Temple of Vesta and the church of Santa Maria in Cosmedin (where you will find La Bocca de La Verita). My parents stayed in the Suite, which was a larger room with a sitting area and large terrace with the same view. The hotel was lovely and clean throughout. Loved the parquet floor (hate carpets in hotel bedrooms). I'm a light sleeper and was not disturbed at all. There are electronic shutters which block out the road noise. Wasn't too impressed by one member of staff at breakfast but the rest of the hotel staff were most professional and courteous. I'm usually difficult to please but I realised how good the room must be when I hadn't even thought about it.

Reviews.Title: “First time in Ancient Rome”
Reviews.Author: sao
Reviews.Content: First time in ancient Rome. My husband and I wanted to visit all the historical sites we all have read about (the Forum, the Colosseum, Tojans Column, the Jewish Getto, the Vatican, the Capitolini Museum, Palatine Hill, Spanish Steps, the Trevi Fountain, Circus Maximus and many more. Choosing this hotel was the best thing we ever did. We did not want to rent a car and wanted to walk to the sites. Almost all the sites were within comfortable walking distance. The hotel was lovely (very modern & upscale). We had an upper room with a balcony facing the ancient Palentine hill. Room was appointed very modern and very chic. The bathroom was very upscale and included a towel warmer and built-in hair dryer. We had dinner at the hotel restaraunt one evening. It was exceptional but pricey (but hey... the view is worth it ... its on the roof and Rome is fantastic at night.). The complementary breakfast was awesome. It had bacon, eggs, sausage, fruit, cheese, pastry, muffins, juices and of course coffee & tea. Our experience was grand. We even booked a trip to Capri for a day through the hotel and it too was fantastic. We are planning to return to Ancient Rome within the next year or two with our adult children and will definately stay at the Forty-Seven. It was a wonderful first time experience!

Reviews.Title: “The BEST hotel we ever stayed at!!!”
Reviews.Author: Twizler
Reviews.Content: We were lucky enough to stay at the 47 Hotel after our original hotel had a mixup with our booking. We are so thankful because it turned out to be the best hotel we ever stayed at. The staff were amazingly friendly and helpful and even spent the morning searching for an additional hotel for the remainder of our stay. The location is ideal, just a couple of blocks from the Forum and really close to several buslines and a quick walk over the bridge to the Trastevere neighborhood. The rooftop restaurant has a great view and they welcome you to just sit there for a cocktail if you want. We had the delux suite with a huge private terrace overlooking ruins and the church where the Mouth of Truth (hello Roman Holiday!) is located. We enjoyed watching the pink sunsets over the rooftops and cocktails on our terrace every night! If you can book the delux room with the large terrace, you should go for it! Also, we liked the tasty breakfasts, free internet connection, and the turkish bath! If you asked me what I will remember most about Rome, it's not the ruins or the food, it is the 47 Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Forty Seven!”
Reviews.Author: connied76
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of spending 3 nights at the Forty Seven Sept 21-24th. It was a lovely hotel- a little boutique hotel in the heart of ancient Rome. We loved the location- could walk to anything and when you got tired of walking, various bus lines stopped right in front of the hotel. Travestere was a quick 5 minute walk across the river and here we found wonderful little gems of restaurants, a supermarket and funky little bars and street markets. The hotel was very classy and elegant, with sleek furnishings. The desk staff was very friendly and the porters were great. We booked a standard room but I believe we were upgraded to a deluxe room. It was spacious, on the 5th floor with a double-sized terrace with a gorgeous view of the Temple of Vesta. The room was decorated nicely with sleek, neutral furnishings. The bathroom was great with a nice shower and tub and excellent bathroom amenities. There were eletric metal shades which blocked out all noise and light and allowed for an excelent night's sleep. We lved our room!! The breakfast was good quality and selection. The hotel also had a nice gym as well as a turkish sauna that was very nice. Since we had the gorgeous terrace with the same views, we never went up to the rooftop restaurant. The only negative about the hotel was the concierge who seemed rather disinterested and was never very helpful when we asked about tours, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect!!!”
Reviews.Author: Puppielove
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel! The location is great! We walked to the Vatican following the river..it was possible to walk everywhere to the major sights...all within a 30 minute walk. Very close to the Via de Corso which is a straight shot to the Spanish Steps & the Trevi Fountain. Many ancient sights are in the immediate area. The decor is fabulous...beautiful common areas and our room was spacious and no detail was overlooked. Modern decor with wood floors and marble bathrooms...luxurious. The view from our room was of ruins and beautiful buildings. The staff is exceptional...helpful and so friendly. The breakfast buffet is good and we were glad we opted for it as there are no close places for breakfast nearby. We had drinks at the rooftop bar...beautiful but very expensive. You are paying for atmosphere here...but it is fantastic. We will stay here again...definitely. Modern facility, beautiful & clean, superb staff and great location! A winner.

Reviews.Title: “This place is perfect!”
Reviews.Author: tracyhoran
Reviews.Content: The location, the friendly staff, the size of the rooms, the roof bar/restaurant make this an excellent choice in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel dont order room service”
Reviews.Author: vivi2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from rome we stayed at the 47 hotel on the last two days of our trip. The first three were at capo d africa great hotel! This hotel is very nice too great rooms good staff location is o.k. you can catch the bus right outside the hotel. I had only a few problems with the hotel. I felt that the walls must be very thin because every morning i could hear the people on the floor above us walking around at 6:30 am we were on the first floor, outside noise did not bother us it was the inside noise. The second thing is that i ordered 1 cup of tea to the room and they charged me nine euro that is about 11 dollars it bothered me that they charged me 4 euro for the tea and 5 euro for the room service charge i should have just went to the the bar and asked for hot water my mistake. Otherwise i felt the hotel was nice rooms were big our was 104 staff was nice very helpful breakfast was very good i would suggest staying on the top floor and dont order room service unless ask before order how much it will be

Reviews.Title: “La Dolce Vita!”
Reviews.Author: todd_70
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the 47 based off the reviews here and it was fantastic! Very chic hotel in a fabulous location! Right across the street over the bridge is a super spot to hang out and have drinks along the banks of the river with crafty little shops. If the weather is nice, the hotel is within walking distance to the majority of sites, such as the Coliseum. I stayed on two separate occasions during a two week period and had two different rooms. The first room I had was a deluxe room with a view of one of the ruins. The room was very spacious with a huge shower that I really enjoyed after a long day of exploring the city. The second room was a standard room and was a bit smaller than the first room, but it had a nice balcony, which was a nice feature since the weather was superb. A great feature that my friends and I really enjoyed was the rooftop bar and restaurant. I ate there the first night and the food was very tasty, but somewhat overpriced, however, the view made up for that. My friends were envious because their hotel sucked. After I checked out they actually returned for the rooftop bar! The breakfast was included and I thought it was a delicious assortment, including scrambled eggs and bacon. What made the visit the best was the staff. Enrica is hilarious and provided great city tips. One negative; take the bus (I think it's bus 175 plus a few others) to the hotel instead of the metro if possible. The metro stop is 10 minutes with cobblestone streets, so with luggage it makes it a very long 10 minute walk. I'm athletic, but was beat by the time I got to the hotel from dragging my luggage. The bus, however stops right in front of the hotel. In the end, the hotel stay was la dolce vita!

Reviews.Title: “Not as impressed as over reviewers here”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoVuitton75
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Forty Seven hotel September 2nd through 5th. Given the raves the hotel receives on this website, we were sorely disappointed at this mediocre hotel. Granted the hotel is modern and does have a nice courtyard for taking breakfast and a nice outdoor roof bar/restaurant, but the rooms are tiny, the beds are hard and the service level negligible. The breakfast was good and more than sufficient. The location is a bit far off the beaten path in the ancient Rome section. It is a good 10-15 minute walk to the Roman Forum or Colosseum. The closest metro station is a 15-20 minute walk away. Definitely would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: lynne54
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip to Rome and we found that the Forty Seven was a great hotel. It was exremely clean and fresh. Great roof top bar and restaurant. Lovely room. Great staff. We had a lot of choice in the Travel Agents brochure and found that by using Tripadvisor we were able to choose the right one. We would certainly go back to this hotel. Should be a 5*

Reviews.Title: “Wondeful Boutique Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Campania
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our 3-night stay at Fortyseven hotel late Aug 2006. We had a double room with terrace on the 5th floor. It is a new, comfortable, and very well designed boutique hotel, from the decor in the room down to the tableware for breakfast. The room is spotless with light color hardwood floors throughout, and it comes with a very comfortable king size bed, and is furnished with contemporary pieces and decorated with original art work. The room is not very large, but large enough to be comfortable. The marble bathroom is modern and bright with high quality toiletries and towels. One of the best features of the hotel is its rooftop bar/lounge on the 6th floor. We were up there twice and the view was amazing when the sun was setting. The hotel also has a "living room" at the lobby level where you can read newspapers or use your laptops if it has wifi capabilities. Staff was helpful and courteous. The entire hotel is modern and cool, but not a "scene". The hotel is conveniently located near Ancient Rome. We toured the entire Ancient Rome/Colosseum/Imperial Rome area on foot from the hotel. To give you an idea of distance, it takes about 10 minutes walking north to reach Piazza Venezia, and from there it's another 10 minutes going south along Via dei Fori Imperiali (which is line with ancient ruins) to get to Colosseum. But there are shortcuts before you reach Piazza Venezia, where you can go up to the Capitoline museum and have a great view of the entire Ancient Rome. The hotel is also close to the Tiber River across from Trastevere, an area that's lively at night with great restaurants and bars. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel 47: A Gem!”
Reviews.Author: Patagonia8
Reviews.Content: We stayed 7 nights at Hotel 47. The location is amazing; across the street from the Temple Vesta and easy walking to the Forum, Coloseum and Circus Maximus......all this while being in a quiet area in Rome. The bus stop is right at the hotel as well. The hotel stalff is wonderful. Alina at the front desk is very special...........warm, charming, lovely, helpful, efficient, a wonderful sense of humor and sets a tone for one's wonderful experience at the hotel. All the staff is very friendly and efficient as well. The rooms are beautiful. The breakfast is delicious.........cold cereals, excellent Italian cheeses, eggs, bacon, fresh fruit, etc. We were thrilled that we discovered this hotel through Trip Advisor. We would definitely stay there again if we return to Rome. A Trip Advisor member; Los Angeles.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the spacious room”
Reviews.Author: Janus115
Reviews.Content: Visited Rome for our honeymoon stayed at the Hotel Forty Seven for four days. The deluxe room was great, lots of space and very quiet even though we were at the front of the hotel. We used the restaurant on the roof the first night, beautiful setting and great food and service. Would have liked to use this for breakast but this was served on the groung floor in the courtyard. This was a shame. Used this area in the afternoon when arriving back from our travels, must say we thought the service at this time ws poor, very slow. The staff were generally very helpful and assited us in sorting out transport and restaurants

Reviews.Title: “Fab-tastic !”
Reviews.Author: Sauceybird
Reviews.Content: This is the first time i haven't written on this site but since i used this website to find this hotel in the first place i thought i should give some feedback ! This hotel is wonderful in everyway, from the welcome we got late at night when we arrived to the taxi that was ordered to take us away 2 days later. I stay in 4* hotels with work at least one night everyweek of the year so when we look for hotels on holiday they have to be better than what we would expect with work, and now only a special 4* or 5* will do. We have plenty of experience and i can honestly say 47 was everything we hoped. We booked direct with the hotel and as part of a Amex promotion was upgraded to a room on the 5th floor that had a balcony and lovely views. The roof top restaurant was great too although we only ate their one night as it was a little pricy (but what do you expect with a view like it has!) and prefered the local street side restaurants.The location is great, we had only one day to see Rome on our trip and set out on foot from the hotel with their advice and map. It is approx 15mins from our first stop at the Colosseum. We then walked everywhere and had a lovely walk back to the hotel along the River. I have already recommended this hotel to friends and will recommend it 100% to you. Its modern, newly furnished, with great staff that can't help enough, great value for money and the best place to stay when in Rome - we will be back !

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel, July 24, 2006”
Reviews.Author: wnyc
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after finding it on Trip Advisor. THANK YOU EVERYONE!! All the reviews were positive and let me tell you ... THIS HOTEL IS AMAZING!!!! I am a seasoned traveler and I will admit, I can be considered a New York City "snob" and this hotel has everything. It is a modern, clean, perfectly situated hotel. And, the rooftop restaurant is fabulous!!!!!!!!!! The most memorable meal I have had in a long time. Definitely make a reservation in advance for this restaurant because there are only a few tables!!!!!!!!!!! Overall, this hotel is a great deal and anyone who stays here will absolutely LOVE IT!!!!!!!!!!! Check it out and note that the photos of it on this website are pretty accurate and it is probably even better in person!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Forty-Seven - Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: ALWardle
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Fortyseven Hotel in autumn of 2005, and it went straight to the top of our list for our 10-year anniversary trip in 2008! The facilities, the food, the location, the bar, and the staff are all simply outstanding. In the interest of full disclosure, I must explain that our visit got off to a bit of a rocky start, with our rooms - reserved 5 months in advance - somehow being unavailable when we arrived. However, Marco, the Fortyseven Hotel manager, had already arranged other rooms for us at the Trilussa Palace Hotel - a lovely, very accomodating, above-average hotel, but not nearly as luxurious or in as spectacular a location as Fortyseven Hotel. Within 24 hours, Marco had our room at Fortyseven sorted out, and sent a car to bring us back. We were stunned at the lengths to which he went to make up the error to us. He arranged for our party of four to be upgraded to the two penthouse suites, which had massage chairs, huge bathrooms, sitting areas, and, best of all, incredible wrap-around balconies with unbelievable views of the temples of Apollo and Athena, the Palatine, and Teatro Marcello. He sent up bottles of champagne, comped our delicious breakfasts, and made dinner reservations for us at one of the best restaurants I've ever been to in my life. We were completely pampered by Marco, Sergio the bartender, and the entire Fortyseven Hotel staff for our remaining two days in Rome. Upon our return to Rome a week later, we tried to upgrade our regular rooms to the suites again (cost be darned - it's worth it!), but they were unavailable. Nonetheless, our regular rooms turned out to be wonderful, too - spacious, elegant, and with every amenity. The bathrooms were stocked with huge fluffy towels, luxury bath products, hair dryer, towel warmer, and more. Every area of the Hotel - both rooms and public areas, was sparkingly clean. The laid-back and luxurious open-air lounge on the roof of the Hotel was the perfect place for a bottle of wine and a relaxing read before dinner each night and for a nightcap in the evening. On our last night, the young lady staffing the front desk sent my husband and I to Vinando - a thoroughly authentic and very romantic restaurant just a few steps from the Hotel. The location of the Hotel couldn't be better - and the view has to be seen to be believed - it feels like you can see all of Rome without ever leaving the roof! The tiny bar is chic yet cozy and manned by the world's most attentive bartender. All in all, I highly recommend Fortyseven Hotel and can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel In Ancient Rome”
Reviews.Author: carpeoccasio
Reviews.Content: Hotel 47 is wonderful! Modern yet right in the heart of ancient Rome, half a block from the river. The Colosseum , the Arch of Constantine, Palatine Hill, the Arch of Titus and the Roman Forum are all just around the corner (a 10 minute walk). Also nearby is the Via del Corso which makes it easy to walk to the Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps and the Pantheon. The rooms are small but very well appointed and the bathrooms are gorgeous. Our room on the fifth floor also had a private terrace overlooking the street. The roof top restaurant and bar are a treat, with fantastic wine and views of the city. The lavish breakfast buffet in the outdoor courtyard each morning started each day perfectly. And the staff! Friendly and accommodating , they made our stay a joy. This was our first trip to Europe and Hotel 47 was the perfect choice for Rome. Grazie!

Reviews.Title: “47 Hotel....no. 1 for me!”
Reviews.Author: Tom-Kenny
Reviews.Content: I don't usually take time to fill this in.......but if you are looking for a top Rome Hotel, look no further! Big, clean rooms, wonderful shower/bathroom, excellent breakfast. Our room overlooked 2 wonderful temples. Perfect position to walk to all the shops/sights/eating places! Book it and look forward!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: dawn1pc
Reviews.Content: Hotel 47 was a perfect oasis in the ancient part of Rome. Its modern decor and cool ambiance helped my family start our vacation in Italy. The rooms are very clean and have some nice interesting features, such as black out shades that close at the touch of a button. The breakfast was the best breakfast we had during our 2 week stay in Italy. It included eggs, bacon, fresh baked goods and cappuccino. We would absolutely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: bencb
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Nice staff. Good location (short walk from Colosseum). Superb roof terrace. Great room. Very good breakfast buffet. Only criticism is overpriced restaurant on roof.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: bibi123
Reviews.Content: Would recommend this hotel to anyone. Modern and comfortable. The hotel staff was very helpful and friendly. Their breakfast made for a good start in the morning. Conveniently located to most of the ruins and sites.

Reviews.Title: “Cant recommend the Forty Seven highly enough”
Reviews.Author: Simontru
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a three night stay at the Hotel. The hotel had been booked as a treat for my boyfriends mother and myself so I had not seen any details about the hotel. The weather in Rome was 36 degrees so the air con was much appreciated on arrival! We found the hotel to have a very friendly atmosphere considering the size. The hotel was superbly located for siteseeing. We spent all three nights on the rooftop terrace bar/ restaurant as the food was nearly as good as the view! The only minor drawback is that it was a little distance away from nightlife.(Although, bus stops right outside hotel!!) In all I would highly recommend staying at the hotel and will no doubt be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Fab @ The Hotel Forty Seven”
Reviews.Author: holidayfan1
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Forty Seven is a must when staying in Rome. We stayed there for three nights and received excellent service and a very welecoming stay. Our room was on the second floor and despite other members complaining about the noise from the road, we did not consider this a problem. Once you have closed the electric shutters this not only acts as a black out but keeps the traffic noise out as well. Breakfast at the 47 is a nice and relaxing start to the day, the choice is ample and the relaxation music playing in the courtyard whilst having breakfast is a nice touch. When we arrived at the airport, instead of booking the hotel car, we got the coach from the airport (Terravision) to the Termini. Once at the Termini walk round to the bus station bit and catch the 170 bus, tickets are available at the newsagents opposite the bus stands. I think it is the 5th stop, which is right outside the hotel. This is certainly much cheaper than the 50 euros for the hotel car but we did book this to return to the airport which was in a very nice Mercedes Benz. The Rooftop bar is a must, although expensive you get excellent views over the city and the chilled and laidback atmosphere is a perfect end to an evening. Tour bus 101 is very good as you can jump on and off through out the day, reception sell tickets for this. Ladies - wear flat and sensible shoes, I though I could get away with a trendy pair of wedges but they are just no good on the streets which are all cobbled! I would strongly recommend Vinando restaurant which is situated Piazza Margana street (www.vinando.net). We had a lovely meal here, it is a small, non-tourist diner which makes you feel like you are in Rome. Overall, if/when I return to Rome I will most definilely be booking the hotel 47.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lanz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Forty Seven for four nights pre cruise; we were very pleased. The location could not have been better, we could walk everywhere only took a car to the Vatican. The staff could not do enough to accommodate us; the car service they arranged to the airport and pickup at port were on time with friendly courteous drivers. Our room was so comfortable and surprisingly large for European standards, big bath with tub and shower; the first night we slept 10 hours, we had to rush down so we would not miss breakfast which was a delight in the beautiful little courtyard. The croissants were to die for with excellent coffee and steamed milk. The only thing I would ask would be for early coffee service in the morning; just a coffee pot set out to help yourself would be great. Our room looked out to the ruins; we loved just looking out the window onto a very busy street. WE HAD NO NOISE PROBLEMS, the shutters were fantastic, wish I had them on my home. The roof bar/restaurant was expensive but what a view, to relax and have a drink was worth every penny. When we returned for a post cruise stay for one night we were upgraded to a suite; corner room with huge balcony, FANTASTIC. We will definitely stay at the wonderful Forty-Seven in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Forty Seven Hotel good choice”
Reviews.Author: paulavk
Reviews.Content: We got back last week from spending a few days at the Forty Seven Hotel. Although the hotel lacks the charm of other hotels we had stayed in, it makes up for it with the comfortable rooms and friendly staff. We were particularly impressed with the greeting we received when we first arrived at the hotel and the speed with which we got our rooms. The beds were comfortable, the air conditioning worked well, and the showers were great. We looked forward to returning to the tranquility of the hotel each day after sightseeing with the mobs of people in the more touristy locations.

Reviews.Title: “wow!”
Reviews.Author: malysa
Reviews.Content: we just returned from italy stayed at hotel forty seven for 4 nights and were very pleased. the hotel is very modern. Rooms were very large and clean. Bathrooms were very spacious and clean, far exceeded european standards. The staff was very nice and helpful, the resturaunt on the rooftop had a beautiful view but i would not recommend eating there.The food was average and expensive. Location of the hotel was great we walked everywhere. Overall i would highly recommend this hotel and will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't Have Been Better!”
Reviews.Author: Tombrid
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed three nights at the Forty Seven Hotel ; we had stayed two nights at another Rome hotel two weeks before and then a series in Sienna, Florence and Sorrento. When we walked into our room at Forty Seven, my wife said I had "saved the best for last!" This hotel was the perfect end to a wonderful two-week stay in Italy; it couldn't have been better! The location is ideal for the Ancient Rome expierence as well as its proximity to the Trastevere section where the food is so excellent. Good staff, plenty of amenities, and the best breakfast we had throughout the trip. If we get to go back to Rome, THIS is where we will stay.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel but had a few quibbles”
Reviews.Author: Kathybax
Reviews.Content: We stayed eight nights in this hotel in May and June, 2006. We loved the newness of the hotel and the great remotely operated window shutters that completely blocked light (we learned that was not a good idea on the night of the day we arrived in Rome and ended up sleeping 14 hours!). We had a room in front and were not bothered by the traffic noise and loved the view of the two temples, both over 2000 years old, and of the house directly across the street which is one of the few remaining medieval houses in room, built about 1050. The beds, the toiletries were great. My husband loved the shower, although I missed a tub. What could use improvement: the person who reviewed the breakfast has a point. Getting coffee is a challenge. I think there were not enough servers for the numbers of people. We took one day trip out of Rome and had to leave the hotel early and they could not give us coffee at 6:30 a.m. My husband nearly went crazy without his caffeine fix. But they gave us a box breakfast which was nice. there is NOTHING nearby. No ATM, no laundry, no newstand or place to buy bottled water, coffee or beverages. It is only a ten minute walk to some of these places, but this is a busy street. All restaurants are a goodly hike away--Trastavere is close, and we also ate at the Campo di Fiori, which we love. But this is a major street the hotel is on, and traffic can be daunting. I would love a washcloth. I have stayed in 35 hotels so far in 2006, so am a frequent stayer. I wish trip advisor members included this information so we have a better idea of what they expect/ are used to in a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Cayman1112
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay while in Rome, staff is very helpful and friendly. The rooms are huge compared to European standards. The room is furnsihed well. We had room 410 and our children had 407. Dont miss a chance having a cocktail on the roof at the bar,

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but don't rate breakfast”
Reviews.Author: norgate
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at the Forty Seven Hotel Rome, it was as expected. Location very central and the hotel Fab, everything sparkled in the room, the bed was big the sheets soft and the staff well informed. But as part of the hotel experience breakfast was a let down, the staff where not very curtious, we and most people who wished to sit in the courtyard had to wait for staff to set the table up around you, then you had to catch there eye to request coffee, as this was the only table service the waiters had to provide it was very lacking. Breakfast was a self service buffet of hot and cold food, and as was the case on our last day we came for breakkfast at 7.15am the room was in darkness and no staff about, some people had to leave for taxis before they received any coffee. So do not expect a grand breakfast or service from this hotel. I do feel that I could not give a excellent rating for this hotel just good. The waiting to be served or table cleared took the edge off our stay. But do go to Rome it is wonderful and we will be back but not here.

Reviews.Title: “An 'OK' hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rupert25
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Hotel fortyseven, and felt a little bit let down, as after reading the reviews on tripadvisor, I was expecting a really special hotel. The rooms are great, modern, spacious and clean. And the roof terrace is really good, in fact that is the main redeeming feature of the hotel - if it wasn't for the roof terrace, it would be a dull hotel. The staff are not overly helpful and come across as unapproachable and quite abrupt. As for the breakfast, I cannot believe the reviews on here which rave on about the breakfast. It was very very average - the selection and choice was poor, they ran out of most stuff and we had to ask for replacements - it was no better than a bog standard UK Travel Lodge. The ground floor to the hotel is cramped and there is nowhere to go and sit and relax during the day. The rooftop bar doesn't open until 6pm. We ate one night in the Circus rooftop Bar and the service was very slow, and the food was cold. It is still a great place to go and drink though and watch the world go by, although quite expensive. The traffic noise which a lot of people have commented on isn't too bad, as long as you put your window shutters down. The hotel is located in a very busy location in terms of traffic and if we went again, I would be tempted to stay in a different area, as there isn't too much near the hotel apart from a very very busy road and non-stop traffic. Overall, it isn't a terrible hotel - but I would rate it as an average hotel and if you are looking to go to Rome and stay at a really special place, I personally don't think the FortySeven Hotel can offer that.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lmolly
Reviews.Content: We've just come back from 3 nights staying at the Forty Seven and just couldn't fault it! We were made to feel welcome and the staff could not stop fussing over our 2yr old daughter. They checked us in early because we had the baby and gave us a large, quiet room. The breakfast was great and it was lovely to eat in the outdoor garden with relaxing background music. The rooftop bar in the evenings was also a great bonus. I don't understand anyone complaining about the location, we thought that it was central to all the sites. If you go to a city then you should expect to walk to get the most out of it. Isn't that the point? We been to many european cities and have learnt that walking is part and parcel of the trip and allows you to see more. Anyway, Rome is a fantastic place and we would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Wait To Go Back!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Although pricey (isn't all of Rome pricey though?), we could not have been happier with the Forty Seven Hotel. The room was very clean, comfortable, quiet and the view was fabulous! The breakfast is incredible - what a great way to start a day of sightseeing. The location was perfect - central to so many things - and we walked almost everywhere, including the Vatican. The staff at the hotel were very helpful about giving directions. Of special note, we had a bit of a "crisis" while in Rome when stupid me left her purse in a taxi with all of my cash, credit card, etc.... Enrica at the front desk was absolutely a gem in assisting me to contact the credit card company and to comfort me "Don't let this ruin your vacation" she gently counselled me as my eyes welled up with tears. Thank you, Enrica. We will definitely stay there again if we are ever so lucky as to return to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - you will not regret choosing the 47 !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Alvin&Tracy
Reviews.Content: We have just recently returned from staying at the Forty Seven Hotel - we chose a Summit Hotel last year when we stayed in Venice so we knew by choosing Summit again we would not be disappointed, particularly, after we read the reviews everyone had written. Like with all hotels, there will be some negative reviews, however, I would urge you to concentrate on the good reviews - in my opinion, this hotel is a fantastic choice when staying in Rome. We booked the hotel via the internet and everything worked out well. They emailed us to ask if we wanted them to arrange for an airport transfer - we chose to do this as it only cost 45 Euro's (which is not much more than a taxi). We would highly recommend this, someone was waiting for us at arrivals for us and the transfer was in a Mercedes. We cannot rave about this hotel enough, when we arrived, they knew who we were and immediately showed us to the room. The Hotel has a lovely bar inside and a roof top bar and restaurant - the staff were incredibly helpful and could not do enough for us during our visit. It was my wife's birthday whilst we were there and the team from Forty Seven gave her a cake - small touches, but they make all the differences. Forty Seven is a contemporary hotel and therefore is very clean - the bathroom was properly the best we had ever experienced in a hotel. With our package we had breakfast thrown in, they do a nice selection of cereals, cheeses, meats and breads - more than enough to cater for most people. In terms of location, the Forty Seven is central. You literally turn right out of the hotel and you will then find yourself exploring Campidoglio, Monumento a Vittoria Emanualele II, The Roman Forum, Colosseum, Arco Di Costantino and Circo Massimo. If you chose not to stop, you could walk this whole circule in approx 45 minutes. We did a tour of the Colosseum which we would recommend, we paid 40 Euros for the entrance fee and tour for two people. We thought this was really good value and did save us having to que. You can easily walk to the Trevi Fountain and Castle Sand Angelo from the hotel as well (although this takes a little longer and get yourself a good map!). Taxi's are cheap in Rome - from Forty Seven to the Vatican, it cost less than 10 Euros so properly best to save those legs ! We arrived when the Pope was meeting the flock (this takes place on a Wednesday) and nearly got caught up in it all when we wanted to go to the Sistine Chapel - to get to the Chapel, you need to go right of the Vatican. Get there early ie 8:30am or before and you will miss the que, otherwise you could be waiting for 2-3 hours. We found two fantastic restaurants - both within easy walking distance of the Forty Seven. One was called the Alle Fratte Di Trastevere and is in the Trastevere area. The food here was typical Italian fare and was fantastic and was very reasonably priced. To get here from the Forty Seven, you turn right out of the hotel until the first set of traffic lights. Cross over at the lights and walk up the hill, turn right and on the left is the first bridge you come across - walk across this and then when you get to another smaller bridge you walk over that as well. When you get to the road turn right and keep walking until you get to the next bridge. Turn left and walk up the Viale Trastevere - cross over on the right hand side of the road (you should see Trams). You will have to walk approximately 3 blocks until you reach Via Luciano Manara - turn right up here and the restaurant is just up on the right. They do not open on Wednesdays. The first time we went there we had a 3 course meal with wine for 34 Euros !!!! The other restaurant we would recommend is Ristorante Galeassi which is in Piazza S Maria in Trastever 3 - you get here by following the above and then take the first right and keep walking. When you get to the square you will see it right in front of you. We had a 3 course meal with wine (lots of wine!) for 50 Euros. This restaurant does not open on Mondays. Someone recommended for ladies not to wear heels, my wife agreed with this as the majority of roads are cobble stones. If you need any further info, please do not hesitate to contact us.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Forty Seven - Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: anothercountry
Reviews.Content: I visit Rome twice a year for R&R and decided to chose the Forty Seven due to the location close to Trastevere. I am so glad I did as everything about the hotel was just what I was looking for. I deliberately wanted somewhere away from the very busy tourist areas but close enough to some excellent restaurants and bars - Forty Seven fits the bill. Well worth arranging with the hotel for a driver to pick you up at the airport - this saves so much time and hassle. The hotel is a modern design with the most helpful desk and staff - welcoming and informative. The rooms continue the modern design so if you are looking for ancient antiques look somewhere else. My room faced the road which was a plus as you feel part of the city - you can block out the noise using the shutters if preferred. 5 minutes walk out of the hotel leads you to the Forum or Trastevere across the bridge. Just strolling along the Tiber outside of the hotel gives you a great perspective of the city. A must is a drink on the rooftop bar - after the inevitable walking during the day it is an oasis of calm with wonderful views, definitely the place to relax with a prosecco or 2! My next trip will be in September and for the first time in 2 years I will be returning to the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: JandB_Nashville
Reviews.Content: This place was great - my wife and I stayed at Hotel 47 for three nights at the end of April 2006 (Room 501 at the back of the building) - this was during our first trip to Italy. We chose it largely on the basis of great reviews on Tripadvisor. We were VERY happy with the choice. A little expensive perhaps, but it’s that time of year and it is ‘Roma’ – BTW the location was ideal. From the moment we arrived and throughout our whole stay, the spotlessly clean and quiet room, the wonderful breakfasts, the excellent restaurant recommendations (particularly Giggetto’s and Il Pastarellaro), the umbrella when we needed it, the cute little bar, we LOVED this hotel. Great service, great staff – it would be hard to find nicer and more helpful people than Francesca and Marco and the others whose names regretfully we didn’t record. Forget being near the overrated and very crowded Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps with touristy restaurants with 'American' menus - rather be adjacent to the Coliseum, the Capitoline Museums, the Roman Forum and a short walk over the river to Trastevere for wonderful restaurants and the beautiful Santa Maria in Trastevere, there was even an ATM nearby. You can walk a good portion of Rome from here (including the Trevi) except perhaps the Vatican & St Peter’s and the most Northerly sites. While walking you can stop for lunch along the way (pizza, caprese salad, etc.). In fact there are so many sites it is so easy to keep walking and forget how far you’ve gone – even as members of the AARP crowd we ended up at Castel Sant’ Angelo, but it’s only a 10 Euro ride back. If it is in the budget, splurge about $500 (50 Euro an hour) and get a private guide when you do go to the Vatican and St Peter's - Silvia Rossetti was wonderful, a great recommendation from the hotel. You could spend a week at the museums. Two small tips - it’s useful to be able to name the hotel and street in Italian; and ignore the initial indifference of the waiters – smile, attempt a little Italian and be appreciative of this wonderful city – it will win a lot of smiles back and a great experience. Thanks to all at the 47, we will definitely be back. P.S. We returned to the hotel after traveling to Portofino and Monte Carlo to stay a night (Room 212 at the front of the building) and day before returning to the USA. We were concerned at first about the front (street side) room but it was well insulated and, with the windows closed, there was little noise from the traffic. Same service, same everything…….

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I felt the Trip Advisor reviews let me down a little bit. This is a perfectly fine modern hotel, which could be in any city anywhere. We had a deluxe corner room, which was large and clean. The service was just OK. The breakfast was decent and the rooftop terrace was a nice amenity, if overcrowdedl. The hotel was filled with your average American tourist which looked like they all got some package deal at AAA. The biggest problem we had, tho, was the location. Maybe some people like being right near ancient Rome, but there is a reason why there are no other hotels down there. Basically, its in a shabby neighborhood with a ton of traffic all around. If you've come to Rome to see the sights, you will end up walking all day, everywhere, and this is too far from the better areas. Unless you got some package deal at AAA, there's just no reason to stay here. If this is your once-in-a-lifetime Rome experience, stay near the Spanish steps, preferably at the Hassler. If your budget is lower, and you want a central hotel with a lot of character, stay at the Raphael on the Piazza Navona. You will remember it forever.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Samuel_75
Reviews.Content: The Forty Seven Hotel Rome is a modern hotel with a great location in walking distance to the Forum and the Colleseum. The roof-top terrace is wonderful, the rooms are lovely and the food is excellent. Service is variable, but when we raised a particular issue with management the hotel went out of their way to address our concern. In addition, I note from other reviews that people have had an issue with noise. I can say that I slept soundly without ear plugs and we had no issues with noise from other rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have picked a better place in Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in July 2005 after doing much research on TripAdvisor to choose a hotel. We were beyond happy with our choice! The staff was friendly and accomodating from the minute we arrived. The rooms were clean, with super nice bathrooms. We really liked the decor of the hotel.The location was great as well, right in the heart of the ancient ruins. I think the best part was the rooftop bar! Each evening before going out to dinner, we'd stop up for a drink and relax on the comfy furniture while enjoying the beautiful views. Also, very nice breakfast in the morning.....a good way to start the day before a long day of sightseeing. We are still talking about this place and would DEFINITELY stay here again if we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Ushers
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at the Forty Seven, absolutely ideal location in the heart of Rome, wouldn't stay anywhere else if we were to return. Everything about the hotel was great, comfortable, spotlessly clean and modern, and very friendly helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: jta1012959
Reviews.Content: The best location for a hotel in Rome, next to and overseeeing the classical ruins and within walking distance to just about everything you want to see (it is also one block form the Tiber River and the romantic area called Trastevere). The roof tope terrace has some of the best views of Rome, and it does not feel at all like a typical, cheesy tourist rooftop restaurant/bar. It is elegan, realxed and chic all at the same time. We had a large and beautifully done roo,. Our veiw was out onto the road side of the hotel. I am a light sleeper and was worried about the noise. I was surprised at how quiet is was, but I wore earplugs just in case. The only thing I would warn about is the wood florrs in the room can make for noise when the cleaning staff is cleaning the room above you; whihc can be a problem if you are sleeping in late in the morning. We had stayed earlier in the week at the St. Regis, which is elegant, but this hotel is better, especially for its location.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy!”
Reviews.Author: Cathy111
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 2 nights at the FortySeven Hotel in Rome. The hotel is in such a perfect location, and it really is clean modern and lovely. BUT, there is no noise insulation, I could hear EVERYTHING in the room above, from when they dropped a coin on the floor, moved a chair, had a conversation. It stopped me sleeping and was really annoying. Despite the fact the hotel was fairly empty and reception/bar/breakfast were far from full, this noise was so intrusive it felt like we were sharing our actual room with other guests! Apart from this, it was lovely. All you need to do is turn right out of the front door, keep walking round the corner, and youre there in the action, by the Vittoriana, the Colloseum etc. We didnt take a guide book or know where we were going, and in 2 days wandering around we found all the sights, and all the back street wonders too. Its in a fab location.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved it. Me and my best friend went to rome for a little rest and relaxation. We had the vacation of our lives. The hotel staff is friendly and helpfull. I have never encounted such a friendly hotel staff ever, and I travel alot. The hotel was clean and well decorated. The bar ustairs was kind of pricey so we drank outside the hotel alot. The view was amazing, the ruins made you feel like you were in the times of Ceasar. Would recommend to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Location Stylish and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: travelalot
Reviews.Content: We have just spent a wonderful Easter break and early birthday treat in Rome. As always tripadvisor helped us find the hotel. Earlier reviews say it all, the location is excellent and the hotel is modern and clean. I would not stay anywhere else if we go back. The traffic noise was not too bad and we were on the 1st floor. You expect traffic when staying in a city. We used romanoddessey tours for our vatican trip and they were excellent. Only 2 other couples so nice small group. The guide was interesting and even our 8 year old did not get fed up on our 6 hour tour so she must have been good. I think the web site is romanoddesseytours(-)

Reviews.Title: “Ci Perfecto”
Reviews.Author: Ella2006
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in Rome once before (Hotel Della Nazione nr Trevi Fountain) - we wanted to see a different part of the city. Hotel Forty Seven is excellent for the forum, colosseum, trastevere and campo di fiori(recommended) The hotel is very clean with a more modern style. Terrace is lovely. Staff were very pleasant. Two reasons to pick this hotel: 1)Really nice roof terrace for a wine and a view over the Tiber 2)Location for Southern Rome. Two things to consider when booking: 1)The road is a little busy (doesnt have the quiet winding streets feel of the city. 2)It's about 15-20 mins walk to VIa Condotti(the posh shops) so if your wife likes to shop high end this may be the perfect deterrent! Enjoy - lovely hotel

Reviews.Title: “clean and friendly 47”
Reviews.Author: chomyszyn
Reviews.Content: Thanks to Tripadvisor, my husband, I and our 7 year old daughter,have just spent 5 wonderful nights at 47 hotel. We loved everything about the hotel; the friendly staff, the cleanliness of the rooms and hotel, the lovely breakfast room and service. Our daughter loved returning to the roof terrace where we had coffee and enjoyed the sunshine, the music and view. The bathroom was lovely and well equipped. The shutters were superb and the traffic noise acceptable (we got used to it after the first night.) We enjoyed eating out in Travestere, where the prices were reasonable. Ivo's do great pizza. Our daughter loved the ice creams at Blue Ice at Campo Di Fiori, and the Villa Borgese park above the Spanish Steps, where we hired a four wheeled bicycle. We did all the sightseeing and recommend the guided tours , and especially because they get you in quicker. We also took a small folding seat for our child , as there is so much walking and queuing. The Santa Maria church / 'mouth of truth', was only 100m from the hotel. Reception warned us about pickpockets in Termini, so we didn't use it, and later met someone from our flight, who had had her purse taken from her bag whilst in Termini Station. Our only negative experience in Rome was when our pre-booked taxi didn't arrive at the airport, as it was midnight. The hotel seemed to have forgotten about it, even though it was booked over the phone with them, at the time of booking. But this aside, everything else was superb, and we would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hate to give away this secret”
Reviews.Author: trojannut
Reviews.Content: As travel agents who have spent a LOT of time searching for good hotels, we're a little reluctant to let the word out on this gem. We accompanied a group of about 20 clients on a land/cruise vacation ending in Rome. The Forty-Seven was a perfect ending to a wonderful trip - all we had hoped it would be. The rooms are lovely and spacious, the location is particularly ideal for most of the traditional sites. An easy walk to the Forum. The staff was absolutely magnificent, particularly the front desk personnel, who were always cheerful and helpful. Breakfast was quite good. Love to keep this our own secret, but the Forty-Seven deserves high praise.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel 47 -- Fantastico!!”
Reviews.Author: Zeev10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel 47 the last week of March and had a wonderful experience. I had lived in Rome many years ago and had wonderful memories of Trastevere which was starting to become an "address". Forty Seven was a great choice since it is located a short stroll away, as is the Ghetto neighborhood. Both of these neighborhoods are loaded with some wonderful restaurants. Mangia bene! It's great location , within walking distance to almost all the sights and buses are right outside the door if you choose to use them . A very short walk up a back street brought us to a little known view over the entire Foro Romano . WOW! The Hotel has a design element that is stunning. The breakfasts are wonderfully bountiful and the service is perfection. The entire staff has to be one of the most friendly and helpful I have ever met. Pascal's enthusiasm, when helping guests,is downright infectious. Thanks Pascal! This Hotel will be our destination on the next trip to Rome!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We loved this Hotel. I spend over one month trying to get the best deal and location. This is a great selection. Not very cheap but reasonably for the location, security, cleanliness, attention, food, bus stop and the great personnel, specialy Francheska. Don't look any more this is the place. It is a bit far for some areas but walking around Rome is the best way to know this magnificent city. Mrs. And Dr. Enrique Amy, Puerto Rico

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at the 47!”
Reviews.Author: sdlevi27
Reviews.Content: What everyone else said here is absolutely true. One of the best hotels I've stayed at in a long time. Staff was wonderful, roof bar was amazing, breakfast was good. My only complaint (like others here) was the road noise, but if you can get a room off to the side you are better off. Location is great, 10 minute walk to the coloseum and buses to the Vatican and train station stop right in front of the hotel. We highly recommend using their transportation to and from FCO as it was highly reliable, cheaper than a taxi and both ways was in a Mercedez-Benz.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Fortyseven Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Steve67
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night weekend stay celebrating our 20th wedding anniversary. This hotel is great and is highly recommended. It's a modern contemporary hotel with a great location. The service and staff were excellent and friendly. I would recommend you request the Hotel book a taxi transfer from the airport for you before you go. We stopped B&B and the breakfast is more than adequate to keep you going for the morning. Best place to eat at night is over the river into the Trastevere area. Loads of restaurants to choose from. Best we found was called 'Da Otello' on Via Della Pelliccia. The room did suffer a little noise from the busy road but was rectified by closing the window! All in all a superb experience. We loved the Fortyseven and will definately be returning. Excellent.

Reviews.Title: “life begins at 47”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: date 4/4/06 my wife and i have just returned from a fantastic short stay break at the hotelforty seven. our first immpressions were what we had hoped for. a very friendly reception. the members of staff couldnt do enough to help us regarding both information about the hotel and the surrounding area. the hotel is very clean and tidy and our room was beautifull. the room facilitys were good if i had a small complaint it would be that the television for english speaking people was reserved to cnn and not bbc world. the breakfast catered for everyone from fresh fruits cold meats and of course the english eggs and bacon. the roof top bar is a must just to sit and watch the world go by. this hotel was a wonderfull experiance and we hope to go back very very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Service, Great Terrace”
Reviews.Author: VJoyal
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a weekend in Rome at Fortyseven. I had a completely positive experience. The hotel is as described, in a fantastic location close to the Roman ruins. Our comfort was ensured by the courtesy, and availability of the Fortyseven staff. The hotel service was superior to what is expected from the 5 star hotels I have experienced in the past. The view from the terrace of the hotel Fortyseven is lovely, and the Bar Menu interesting. Mirko, the bartender, suggested some Tuscany wines, which were excellent and reasonably priced. We enjoyed the comfortable elegantly furnished setting of the terrace. On my next trip to Rome, I have no doubts in my mind, I will stay at Fortyseven again. Val from Oxford, United Kingdom

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel at a good location”
Reviews.Author: srk55
Reviews.Content: Hotel Forty Seven is a very good hotel that is located a block from Circus Maximus and 2 blocks from the Roman Forum. What else can you ask for in location. The 2 rooms our family had were very nice and comfortable. Very modern and had all of the amenities you would normally want, unless your a prince or something. The breakfast was great, it had the normal european fare as well as eggs and bacon. The staff was more than helpful. The only negatives are that the walls are a bit thin as in many hotels in Europe and the 2 beds my mother and son used in their room were quite small ( my wife and I had a King bed), but overall this did not give us much of a problem. If you are looking for a nice hotel in Rome at a good location and a very helpful staff, this is it. P.S. As to taxis in Rome at the airport and train stations, there are taxi drivers and their brokers looking for tourists. They will quote you prices that are nothing near to reasonable. Look for a taxi that uses its meter. To give you a comparison, we took a taxi from the train station to hotel 47 and were charged 30 euros. When my mother and I took a taxi the next day from the street in front of the hotel back to the train station for a side trip to Nettuno ( thats where the American Army Cemetary is located) it cost 8 euros with the tip.

Reviews.Title: “Was all the other reviews said it was”
Reviews.Author: amelda marcus
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 5 days at the Hotel Fortyseven for our 30th wedding anniversary. I had e-mailed the hotel to ask for a room on the upper floor with a view. I got a room on the fourth floor without a view so that was the only thing that put a damper on the stay. I did go to reception to ask could they not give me one with a view and was told I would sleep better in the room I had. After reading the other reviews I had brought ear-plugs with me and I can say they were great. I would strongly recommend anyone going to the hotel to bring them with them because the traffic on the roads is very noisey. However, apart from my disappointment over the view I can honestly say the hotel is excellent. The staff are the most curtious and friendly I have met.The reception staff were very helpful and especially Marco. The breakfast was excellent, but I did miss my toast. The bedroom and bathroom were lovely and everywhere was very clean. We got the slippers but not the robe. The black-out shudders were fantastic, you would forget that it was daylight outside. The rooftop bar was closed and the hotel bar was very expensive, 14 euros for a barcardi and coke and 8 euros for a bottle of beer. I would also recommend getting the hotel to book you the taxi to and from the hotel. For 45 euros each way it is cheaper than what the local taxis charge. Also ladies bring nothing only comfortable shoes even for the evening. To walk the short distance over to the Trastevere in the evening for a meal is difficult even with the smallest heels as there is nothing only cobblestones. If you have good shoes on the heels will get ruined. Would strongly recommend a restaurant called Alle Fratte Di Trastevere they do fantastic fillet steaks. All the sights are within walking distance and are fantastic. The street sellers and beggers were in their thousands and spoil the atmosphere of Rome. Be very very careful of your belongings met people that were robbed. It seems to happen mainly on the bus or underground. We did not use either as the one time we were going to use the bus to go to the audience with the pope the hotel did not have any bus tickets so we walked.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL stay at the Forty Seven!”
Reviews.Author: basiae
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned home from a wonderful European vacation - a particular highlight being our 4.5 days in Rome and our stay at the Forty Seven Hotel. The staff was lovely and ever so accomodating. There was a problem with our reservation upon our arrival (although the confusion may have been my fault), however, the front desk took my husband and I to the hotel bar and served us espresso and cookies while they took 10 minutes to resolve the issue. They copied our passports upon our arrival and must have taken note that it was my husband's birthday that day. After strolling through Rome for a few hours we returned to the hotel to find a wonderful Italian birthday cake with a kind note for my husband. The staff is incredibly charming - be sure to tip as they deserve it! The breakfast is fantastic as far as European hotel service goes - each day there are fresh baked goods, breads, sliced cold cuts, cheeses (including buffalo mozzarella and tomatoes), cereals, dried fruits, fruit bowl, yogurt, juices, coffee, bacon, eggs, and sausage - a great breakfast to start the day. The housekeeping does a fantastic job as this hotel is SUPERCLEAN! The housekeeping provides service 2 times per day including the turn down service with chocolates in the early evening. Bathrooms are refreshed daily with clean towels and washcloths. The toiletries are very nice and in large bottles. We were also provided slippers for walking on the room's hardwood floors. We stayed in room 507 and had no problems with noise. Our room's balcony, facing the Temple of Vesta, remained our favorite place to rest after walking all day and before heading out for a late dinner. We would absolutely stay at the Forty Seven Hotel again! You cannot beat the location! We walked everywhere and only once used the bus (we were confused about how to return from the Appian Way/Catacombs, which are a MUST SEE). The Vatican City is likely the furthest walk, but just walk 1 block to the Tiber and follow it all the way up to the Vatican and you will enjoy a lovely 40 minute walk. You can see several ruins, the Tiber, and even Campodoglio from the hotel rooftop. What an unforgettable experience!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bjm_cmm
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the 47 March 24-26. The hotel staff was friendly helpful and spoke good english. The rooms are very contemporary but still maintained Italian style. The location was great. This was the last stop on a three country tour and we were very gald it ended at the 47. Plus the hotel soap smells fantastic!!

Reviews.Title: “"Flood Damage", this is worth a read”
Reviews.Author: Nick_0195
Reviews.Content: Firstly I would like to say the hotel was fantastic. Its location is excellent, as are the rooms, facilities and to an extent the staff. The reason for the terrible review is that out of the three nights we paid to stay in the hotel, we only actually slept there once. Due to "flooding problems" we were transferred to another hotel, which was dated, dilapidated and completely inferior. Also, when we finally checked into the hotel, a cursory inspection showed no flood damage, no signs of flooding, and when other travellers in a similar predicament were consulted we had all been given differing excuses. In effect they double booked us, lied to our faces and then fobbed us off with an "overspill hotel" for two of our three nights in Rome, presumably for a tidy profit. I am an experienced traveller, and having backpacked across much of the world I have learnt that the maxim "you get what you pay for" is sound. I am sure it would have also been applicable in the case of Summit 47, if having paid for the hotel for three nights we were housed there for the duration. Instead, having forked out for three nights in a four star luxury hotel (which undoubtedly the summit is), we were given one, and two evenings in a dated, fawlty towers like establishment with a mediocre meal thrown in as compensation. In light of the other excellent reviews the hotel has received, which to a certain extent have been reinforced by our experiences, I have to concede that the quality of the establishment and its location are second to none. However, I would personally be very wary about booking there again because of the way that we were treated. This young hotel is obviously double booking to ensure it is full to capacity and is willing to inconvenience its customers in order to turn a profit. I would therefore recommend erring on the side of caution and booking at one of Rome’s other excellent hotels. Rome is a wonderful city; my girlfriend and I rate it as one of the best places we have ever visited. I fully recommend anyone reading this review to visit the historic capital, indeed I will return later this year, and if you like to gamble book with the summit 47.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Fortyseven”
Reviews.Author: Scolsie
Reviews.Content: After so many good reviews myself and girlfriend booked at the Fortyseven Hotel for our 6 night stay in Rome. We were impressed the moment we pulled up in the taxi outside, it was a very smart and modern looking hotel, someone met us as the taxi pulled up and welcomed us and took our bags to our room, 409. I was a little concerned about the reports of the road noise, but I am a light sleeper and the traffic didn't bother me at all. The rooms come with superb blinds that you can lower or raise with a switch at either side of the bed, the blinds completely blacken the room and on the first morning when we raised the blinds to find out that it was infact daylight and we had missed breakfast, alarm set from then on. Rooms were very smart as was toilet which had a lovely sized shower. Loved the breakfast and there was plenty of staff keeping the breakfast items topped up if they ran low, they would also take your order if you wanted tea/coffee etc. In the evening reception would always order us a taxi when we wanted to go out for a meal (couldn't get to grips with the buses). The only gripe that we had and the reason that I have given a 4 rating is the attitude of a lady on reception on our final night. It was about 1900 and I looked out of our window to find that the road had been sealed off and there was a number of police vans and officers with shields stood right outside the hotel, after 10 minutes or so lorries with huge sound systems appeared to the left with hundreds of followers, the bass made our windows vibrate and I don't exagerate when I say it was as loud as being at Notting Hill carnival. As the Police had no intentions of moving the rave on that was taking place next to the hotel my girlfriend phoned reception to find out just how long we were going to have to endure half a dozen lorries blasting out drum and bass music that was drowning out the tv. We were informed by reception that it was a demonstration about the punishment handed out in Rome for carrying marijuana and would be gone in half an hour, that came and passed so we again phoned reception and the lady point blank refused to move us to a quieter room and told us to go out for a meal and it would all be gone when we got back. We were dumbstruck by the attitude that we shouldn't enjoy our last night in our €190 a night room but go out for a meal, the receptionist said on one hand she had no other complaints from guests and on the other told us that everyone else was out to dinner, maybe then that's why there had been no other complaints. We were also told that we should go outside and have a word with the police officers or maybe have a word with the Italian PM Silvio Berlusconi as he was in Rome, really this attitude dissapointed us, being sorry and telling us that all the rooms were full would have been better advised. Although we experienced problems, that was with one member of staff only, the rest were very polite and helpful and would have no hestation in recommending Fortyseven Hotel, only a short walk from the Trastevere and unlike everywhere else in Rome very clean, there was a member of staff vaccuming the pavement when we came back one afternoon!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: EveLorraine
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights before staying at the Westin Excelsior. Loved both hotels but if i was returning to Rome I would choose the Forty Seven over the Westin next time. The rooms are large, clean and well equipped. The location is excellent for walking to most major attractions. Staff are very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was very good.

Reviews.Title: “An Exceptional Roman Holiday”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Rome and, while we have traveled quite a bit with the kids (ages 14 and 15), it was probably our best vacation. Of course Rome is the kind of place that makes everything seem better. (Even if we stayed in a hotel that looked like the Cook County Jail, I don't think we would complain because Rome just seems to put you under the ether, and its a feeling that lingers longer than any trip I have ever taken.) We stayed at the Hotel 47 in January and found that the generally excellent reviews in Tripadvisor were right on point. The hotel was modern, clean and stylish - but that was nothing to the service. We were given recommendations to fantastic restaurants just across the Tiber (walking distance from the hotel). We were the only Americans in the restaurants the staff suggested and do not think we could have found them without their help because they were not in the tourist books. The entire trip was great and our stay included a very nice breakfast. We did have a problem one night with the heating system making noise, however, there was no need for us to do anything but to mention it for the hotel to put us in another room. There was no fuss at all and when they brought us to the new room they made sure that the equiptment there was fine before moving our luggage. I highly recommended Hotel 47 to everyone thinking about going to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel 47”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 5 night trip in Rome. I could not recommend Hotel 47 highly enough. The hotel is really comfortable, breakfast was really good and the staff are lovely. I have read the reviews about the noise from the road previously posted, we stayed in room 401 and heard no road noise at all.

Reviews.Title: “Bravo, Hotel 47”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 6 nights at the Hotel 47 and could not have been more pleased with our stay. The staff is charming and efficient to a fault. The rooms are larger than Italian standard and are beautifully outfitted and decorated. Only complaint is the lack of electrical outlets for US gadgets like chargers and such. Location is truly convenient for both the sights and dining options--easy walks to restaurant hotbeds of Trastavere/Campo Fiore/Ghetto/Navona. Breakfast is ample and well chosen. Rooftop bar is the icing on the cake--spectacular views--but not the choice for a rainy week in February. Stay here if you can--very comfortable and accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We visited Rome on the 17-19th Feb and stayed at the Forty Seven...couldn't have made a better choice. Beautiful hotel with an excellent location. We were on the 5th floor and were not troubled by the noise mentioned in a couple of other reviews. So if you can ask for room higher up. The staff are excellent and very helpful. We arrived at 11pm and they endeavoured to find us a restaurant that could get us in before they closed. They succeeded and we were whisked off in a cab to a nearby eaterie. I was a little nervous about the language barrier, this being my first time in Italy but I need not have worried. Alina on reception spoke Italian, English, Spanish, Romanian and is learning Japanese....there was another but I forget. Similarly the rest of the staff all spoke excellent English. My only gripe...there has to be one right!...was the restaurant recommended to us on the Saturday night was not very good at all. Very expensive and the food was not great. They liked to bathe the fish in lemon. That was not enough to put us off Forty Seven and Rome though...we will definitely be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service and staff!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: queenybride
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed at 47 from Feb 8-14 and could not have been more happy with our decision. When we arrived the staff quickly got us registered and let us into our room an hour and a half early, which was a wonderful after our 12 hour flight. Throughout our stay the staff was wonderful and breakfast was always great. Just an FYI if you want coffee just ask one of the busy staff members to bring you some. I had to only ask on the first day and the next five when they saw us they brought it right out. I highly recommmend this hotel and will try to stay there again the next time we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Not so Great.....”
Reviews.Author: Bella Nota
Reviews.Content: Great location, but the 47 has some severe shortcomings. The hotel is located near a major intersection and is horribly noisy. Our room was on the second floor and we could hear the patrons above and below. The room was overheated and stayed that way even after the thermostat was turned down to 16C.,and due to the noise and pollution of the traffic outside, opening a window was not an option. The staff however was very pleasant, and enthusiastic about sharing their reviews of local restaraunts, and giving travel advice. The service alone saves this hotel from a one star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Just as good as TripAdvisor reviewers said”
Reviews.Author: Jackdog85
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Forty Seven for two nights Jan-Feb 06. Hotel lived up to all expectations from previous TripAdvisor reviews. It is a little expensive, but worth it (we paid about 150 Euros per night). Cross the river into Trastevere for dinner by using the Tiber Island bridges and you will not have as many traffic-dodging problems as crossing on the Palatine bridge. Hotel recommended Gensola for dinner, which was excellent but not cheap, also La Cisterna, which was sadly closed for holidays. They also recommended Vinando (not in Trastevere but towards Jewish quarter), where we had lunch, which was very good, with great house red in a wine-oriented restaurant. We chose one restaurant ourselves, called Ripa No. XX or something, on Via S.Francesco a Ripa. Very nice food (mainly fish), but poor service, inattentive and careless staff. Great trip in all, thanks to others for recommending Hotel Forty Seven.

Reviews.Title: “Great-47”
Reviews.Author: LeLag
Reviews.Content: Spent a long time researching the ideal hotel for a romantic and traditional break in Rome and I think we found it! The hotel is very modern and clean and does have the wow factor as you enter it. The rooms are wonderful as well as the gorgeous bathroom and shower (no bath was seriously not a problem at all). Popping up on to the roof garden was something special. A useful tip is to know that drinks down in the bar were wet and strong, whilst the same bottled peroni was over 3 times the cost on the roof as it was in the downstairs bar!! We did have a couple on the roof however just for the views, but then went back downstairs to finish off the night. Another tip is to study the maps of Rome the hotel gives you. Rome is tiny and as a result is very walkable. Don't buy into the underground passes, you won't use them and if you are finding the going tough,then cheap bus tickets can be bought from the extremely friendly receptionists. What was most great about the hotel however was its location. If you want to stay in style in and around the ancient city of Rome (as you imagine it in your head) away from the crowds and wake up to look out of the window on ancient churches, monuments and roman hills, then the 47 should be on your short list.

Reviews.Title: “Forty Seven is fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Maureen1221
Reviews.Content: Forty Seven Hotel has a very convenient location, particularly for the Forum, Collisseum, Palazzo Venetia, and Trastavere. There is a bus that stops in front of the hotel that goes directly to the Vatican. The view from our room was the Temple of Venus and the Tiber River. The hotel rooms are large, clean, bright, and very comfortable. We especially liked our bathroom with its nice large shower and large vanity mirror and marble sink. The robes and slippers are a thoughtful touch. The Forty Seven is not a small hotel but it has a pleasingly intimate atmosphere. The staff are knowledgeable, friendly, polite, discreet, and really think about the needs of the guests. We were very appreciative of the small but important attentions that we received. We look forward to returning to this beautiful hotel and seeing Alisa, Enrika, and Ali.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: travelmomDeerPark_IL
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Forty Seven for 4 nights right after Christmas. Hotel is located within a easy walk to the ancient city and is surrounded by ruins. It is also convienent for going to the other sites since the bus stops right outside the front door. Since it rained all four days, we used the bus a lot which worked out great. The front desk sold bus tickets so it was very easy. Very modern hotel. Great breakfast in the morning and nice lounge in the evening. Housekeeping was very attentive. Hotel staff was very pleasant and never seemed to tire of giving directions. We had a triple room to accomodate my husband and I and 16 year old son. Only negative is the street noise early in the morning. Ask for an inside facing room if you don't want to experience the hustle and bustle of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Forty Seven”
Reviews.Author: Louise018
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Forty Seven for 3 nights in January & would recommend it. Great location within walking distance of collesseum, and there is a bus stop on the same street for the 81 bus which will bring you directly to the Vatican.
