Room & bathroom very very nice - great shower also. Staff are very professional & friendly. As other reviewers have mentioned, there is noise from traffic ouside but all you need to do is close the shutters! One negative point I have to mention is the bar prices - 12 euro for a vodka & coke!! Apart from that, we loved this hotel & would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific!”
Reviews.Author: pipeman28
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Forty-Seven between Christmas and New Year's 2005, and had a terrific time. To a person, the staff was friendly, spoke great English, and went out of their way to make sure we had a great stay. The location couldn't be better -- just a short walk to the Coloseum and the Forum, a bit further to the Vatican, but certainly walkable. As others reviews have pointed out, traffic noise could certainly be problematic, but we weren't bothered by it. Ask for rooms off the main drag if you're a light sleeper.

Reviews.Title: “Forty Seven at Christmas”
Reviews.Author: TheVancouverites
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Forty Seven for 9 nights over Christmas based on the reviews on Trip Advisor (thanks everyone) - the experience was everything that the good reviews said it would be - rooms well done, great bathrooms, great location, amazing service, etc. Here are some additional observations: 1. Hotel was not noisy at all at night if you closed the window shutter. However, as one reviewer noted, you can here some noise from other rooms (someone in an adjoining room was practically yelling.) 2. The bar is always empty - likely because of the stupid price of a drink - 12 euros for a gin and tonic. This really bugged me. In talking to fellow guests, this was annoying for many and it appears that the hotel is missing an opportunity here because we bought wine for the room or went elsewhere for drinks. 3. On the suggestion of Trip Advisor people we did not use the hotel's recommendation from the tour company (thanks). Instead the hotel made arrangements for a car and driver to Pompeii. It was expensive (550 euros) but worth every penny. Ask the hotel to arrange for Angelo as your driver - he suggested we go to Sorrento for lunch after seeing Pompeii - a great side trip. 4. Clearly the reviewer who raved about the breakfast was from someplace with atrocious food. It was ok - lots of it but nothing to write home about. Toast would have been nice. 5. There is really not a lot shops nearby. For wine or snacks the closest place is a great little cafe about a 4 minute walk up Via Teatro Marcello and across the street. There are 2 all-night cafes close by in Piazza Venezia. 6. Would recommend that the hotel provide a clock in the room (there is one on the TV only) and perhaps a radio/CD. There is no music in the room. 7. The staff really makes the hotel experience great - they are all helpful, friendly, and pleasant. We would definitely stay at the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Magnificent”
Reviews.Author: CKempa
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights, December 24th-27th 2005. This hotel definitely lived up to prior reviews on Trip Advisor. The hotel is absolutely spotless and the service was always friendly. This hotel is very accomodating to those that do no speak Italian. Breakfast was a wonderful way to start the day. Drinks/food are a little expensive but not terribly bad for a hotel. When checking-in I was given a map and they pointed out all the sights and the best way to reach them. I would guess that it is only 1/2 mile or less to Capotoline Hill and the breathtaking view of the Forum. I would not hesitate to book this hotel again. These were the first 3 nights of an 8 night trip and none of the other hotels I stayed in (despite being very nice) could live up to the 47 in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in hotels all over Europe for work and pleasure, from 2 star to 5 star and have never even thought about writing a review. Thats because the 47 just stands so far out. Rome was made so much more enjoyable because of the 47. We had deliberately searched for a hotel via the internet and this site was the deciding factor. The hotel is right next to Boca del Verita, round the corner from the Forum and Circus Maximus!! We walked everywhere. The hotel staff were exceptionally courteous and helpful, even with a very late check in and the late check out meant they could show how even more accommodating they were. They arranged a car to & from Ciampello airport for a lower cost than anyone else. Mini bar prices were dirt cheap compared to rome's bar prices!! Yes, prices on the rooftop bar are high (15 euro for a bacardi and coke) but it is a very large measure and was worth it for the midnight view across the city with sumptious sofas and patio heaters keeping us toasty in the winter chill. The floodlit views were just what two weary travellers needed to snuggle up and forget labourious and painfull flights. We had a standard room off the road, but then living in Glasgow and Aberdeen, we didn't hear a sound, even with a window left open. The room was very large and immaculate. The breakfast in the morning is absolutely sumptious by European standards. Not only a choice of quality cereals, fruit, pastries, juices, and associted trimmings, but hot bacon, eggs and sausages too. Set us up for the day (well, until we found the gelatti shops) We booked with the hotel direct through the Summitt website. they give you THE best rate (which meant we paid for our stay what one gentleman was paying via his agent per night) Stay there. If I ever go back to Rome, I shall.

Reviews.Title: “Overall - Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: blueyedtravler
Reviews.Content: Pros: - Extremely comfortable room -Gorgeous bathroom -Great shower -Had an 120 volt outlet in the bathroom so we could charge multiple camera bateries with an adapter in the other room -Very good breakfast buffet -Interesting art and decor -very luxious -great view from rooftop restaurant -great location, really feels like the center of tons of monuments you want to see. Very close to the Colloseum. We walked everywhere, took the bus a few times. Cons: -Very hard to find initially, sign is kind of hidden, if you stay here ask for VERY specific directions. was frustrating when we first arrived, especially because we were tired and dying from the heat. If you rather be spared the hassle take a taxi but it will cost you about $40. A bus ticket is like $1. -They sell bus tickets at the front desk but ran out right when we had to get to the airport! I asked for a free cab ride because we were late and they had recommened the bad tour, but they did not want to make any restituion. -Recommended a very very bad tour company with which we took a night tour and would not help us get the money back -The staff could not help us find any late nite dining. if you want to eat food, ANY food, after 11 or 11:30 PM bring your own list. According to the staff there was nothing open in all of Rome. We had to raid the breakfast bar. -bar was dead -restaurant is pretty expensive -different staff will give you different directions. very confusing. we decided we had to ask 3 different people to get the right directions.

Reviews.Title: “Very good except for the traffic noise”
Reviews.Author: SaoNYC
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for a week in November, based upon reading other reviews in Trip Advisor and also on the fact that the Hotel came up on Expedia with a very good package rate. While almost everything good that people have said about the hotel is true, I am only giving it three stars because of the noise problem, which is quite significant. If you are a light sleeper or would be annoyed by spending a lot of money only to hear the constant roar of traffic outside your windows all night long, then you do not want to stay here. While some readers have mentioned the in window shutters as cutting down the noise, they do not eliminate it. They also make the room pitch black, which cuts out any Roman midnight light which you might want to peak through your windows. Despite what the reader from London says below, there are no inside rooms--the layout has all the rooms looking out on the streets, with the corridor in the inside. The superior rooms that were written about are not on the high floors but are the corner rooms on each floor, so that there are windows on two sides. Also, the way each floor is designed, if you look at the floor plan, you can see that superior rooms have bathrooms and closets on both sides of their walls, thereby elimininating the problem that some readers have had getting room noise through the walls. Aside from the noise, the hotel is very nice. It's new, in a boutique style but still tasteful too. Everything is brand new and works well, and the hotel is also very, very clean. Each bathroom has one outlet for US plugs, so you don't need to bring a converter with for small appliances or chargers. Expedia mentions that each room has a clock radio, which is not true, but they do have a programmable alarm on the TV which slowly turns on. There is a wake up service but the phones give the impression that it is automated when you have to actually call down to the desk and they will write down your request for the next morning. Likewise, the TV gives you the impression that you can access the internet through your room which is not true. You need to buy a card and then use one of the two high speed connection computers in the sitting area on the first floor. While some others have complained about the rates, it was pretty comparable to situations I've found in other places in terms of paying for Internet access (10 Euros for 60 minutes). I also called back to the US several times using the direct dial phones, and the rates for evening calls were quite reasonable by hotel standards--seemed to be about 1 Euro for the first minute and fractional charges after that. The breakfast spread was pretty good, and while maybe not up to American buffet standards, it's the best breakfast we've seen after several trips to Italy. The hours are long also, and last until 10:30 AM, which is unusual. If you want true cappucino and or latte, make sure to ask for Italian coffee, which will be stronger than the "American"coffee which they normally serve if you don't specify what you want. The staff is friendly and helpful, and quite geared towards an English speaking clientele. Don't take their recommended tour company, of which the brochures look pretty tacky, but instead find one on your own and then either call yourself (every place in Rome geared towards tourism speaks English) or have the hotel call for you. Context Rome and Through Eternity Tours were two good companies that we used. If you need a taxi, the hotel has a computer terminal where they punch in the information and give you a receipt with the name of the taxi and its estimated arrival time, usually no more than five minutes in off peak hours. In Rome, when you call for a taxi by radio, which you need to do unless you're right at a taxi stand, the taxi starts the meter on the way to pick you up. The one morning we called for a taxi at 8 AM, it took a while for the cab to get there and that part of the fare was more than our actual ride. The rooftop is beautiful, but the prices as noted are expensive. However, when we inquired about wine, one very nice bartender suggested that we buy a bottle instead of wine by the glass or mixed drinks, and then suggested that we take the rest to out room, which we did and stashed in our minibar. So instead of paying 12, 15, or 20 Euros for a mixed drink, we paid 18 Euros for a great bottle of wine and had it for two nights (although we drank it in our room on the second night:) Finally, as others have noted, the location is superb. An easy walk to downtown, the Colisseum, the Ghetto, and the Trastevere neigborhood. We stumbled into a fabulous restaurant/wine bar in the Ghetto, which has been mentioned by others-Vinando, where we had the best lunch of the week. The wines were phenomenal, the food delicious, and it was one of the closest restaurants to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Forty Seven Hotel twice in June 2005 during a 3-week visit to Italy. We loved it both times The service was fantastic, rooms were clean, large, and well-appointed. Breakfast was great. The rooftop bar was divine. A great value. Stay here, you will love it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel near the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Travelled07
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for three nights at the end of November and had an excellent stay - I would definitely recommend this hotel! The hotel is in a perfect location near the Coliseum and within short walking distance of all the main attractions. We had a gorgeous walk up the river to the Vatican. Yes, the hotel is located on a very busy road but on the third floor in a room over looking the road, we experienced very few problems with noise and there are automatic shutters on the windows should the noise become particularly unbearable. Also excellent were the staff, especially the receptionists who were more than happy to help with any query or request we had and made our trip even more enjoyable, recommending restaurants, calling cabs and telling us the best sights to see in our short stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Definite Destination!”
Reviews.Author: tghiemstra
Reviews.Content: The Forty Seven is an excellent hotel, albiet a little expensive. The location, right between the Tiber River and the Roman Forum, is great. We stayed three nights at the end of an eight day stay in Rome and this was the nicest of our hotels...but also the most expensive. Our room was on the 4th floor (of five) and you could definitely hear the noise of the busy boulevard out front. With the windows latched, it wasn't very noticable, however. The beautiful decor, wonderful (huge!) bed, walk-in shower, clean, clean bathroom, and oversized bedroom...everything about the living space was great. Public areas are very adequate. (Although the rooftop terrace was closed for service in November, we could still walk around and soak up the views. The rooftop would be fantastic in warm weather.) Breakfast was excellent, even scrambled eggs. No problem with seating space, as numbers weren't so great in November. Proximity to most everything in old Rome is within an easy walk. It took us 45 minutes to walk from the Forty Seven to the Borghese Gallery, for example. We didn't use the buses but the stop is right outside the hotel. The staff is very friendly and welcoming. We were connecting with family in Rome so we didn't need recommendations or services but I expect they would have been helpful if needed. We would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Faultless”
Reviews.Author: mackfrance
Reviews.Content: We chose Fortyseven because of the excellent reviews on Tripadvisor and were we right to do so, it is great. The unassuming exterior fronting a busy road into the city belies this superb hotel. On arrival the welcome from the staff was warm and generous and remained so throughout our stay. We took a standard double room which was large and equipped to a very high standard with the very best cotton bed linen changed daily. The bathroom was equally roomy, superbly equipped and with an efficient shower. Breakfast was hugely enjoyable and we ate far more than we should. The hotel is showcase for moderm Italian design without being agressively modern. We had the impression that the owners had put their sole into the decoration, it appeared that they wanted an hotel that they could be proud of irrespective of budget and they have certainly acheived this. Ancient Rome surrounds Fortyseven, the shops are 15 minutes walk and the Vatican 30 minues. We walked everywhere during our 5 night stay. For dinner try Piperno in the Jewish quarter (5 minutes walk) where you must have the fried artichokes.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel - But Noisy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel in a great location, no doubt about it. It is also very cosy and has nice breakfasts. It is very close to the river and strolls to local restaurants can be very romantic. Staff speak very good English and have always recommended top class restaurants. We stayed for three nights, first of which was unbearable - the only problem with this hotel is the noise. Not just the noise mentioned in previous reviews, that comes from the road, but also from other rooms. We were awoken at 3am by people talking (not shouting, laughing, no, just talking!). When we asked the concierge for help, he suggested earplugs, which we gratefully accepted. He also said that all hotels were noisy! Not true. We didn't let the experience spoil our stay, however, and insisted on moving from the 1st floor to the 4th floor (still facing the road as they did not have anything else), but much, much quieter. From then on, we really enjoyed the hotel. Tips if you are staying: have a garden facing room and take some earplugs! Otherwise, lovely, would return if it wasn't for the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KentMrMark
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from 3 nights at the forty seven. The hotel is very well located for most of the major attractions in Rome. The only downside to its location is that it is on a very busy road, and road noise can be heard in the rooms which some people have already pointed out in other reviews on this site. We stayed in a deluxe room, however I was led to believe the deluxe rooms were located on the higher floors, but our deluxe room was on the 1st floor which was a little disappointing as the road noise was more apparent but you have to get used to it and accept that the lower the floor you are located on, the closer to the road and the noise you will be. So my advice if you are going to stay at the forty seven and are given a room on the lower floors is you may want to ask if there are other rooms available on higher floors. The hotel itself and the rooms are very very clean and modern. The rooms are very spacious and I thought the bathroom was fantastic and the large walk in shower was amazing. The only downside to the room was the lack of storage available for cloths. The minimalist look of the rooms the forty seven has achieved is great, but lets not forget that people need to put their cloths somewhere. The room only had a wardrobe with 3 small draws inside and 6 coat hangers, enough only for 1 persons suitcase at best. But overall the rooms are great, very modern, stylish and clean, the electric shutters on the windows controlled from within your room was a very clever idea. The hotel staff are very nice and always welcome you with a smile so you will feel very welcome at the forty seven. Breakfast was average I thought. There is a large choice but the only hot food was scrambled egg, mini frankfurters and very fatty bacon. Also there are less tables and chairs than guests inside and you may find when you go down for breakfast there is no space. However we went in winter when it was too cold to sit outside but if you go in summer there are chairs and tables outside so space would not be an issue. Overall I enjoyed staying at the forty seven and thought it was a very nice hotel, but personally I think it is very overpriced for what you actually get and probably would try another hotel if I was to go back to Rome. But I would give the forty seven 4 out of 5 for the hotel itself, but think the price you pay is not justified for what you actually get overall.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Temporary
Reviews.Content: This was the first hotel we stayed in on our honeymoon. The front desk staff was friendly as they helped us with our bags, and then gave us an upgrade when they checked us in. (our original room only had a single bed in it). The room (on the fourth floor) was really nice, and the furnishings, flooring, etc. looked new. The bathroom looked a little bare, but everything was clean. We especially appreciated the bathrobes, slippers, and large bottles of shampoo and lotion provided. We had a nice view of the Temple of Virile Fortune (see picture). However, there was a bit of road noise at night, (with the ambulances going to the Fatebenefratelli hospital particularly noticeable). Free breakfast is offered until 10 a.m, although the staff likes to start cleaning up around 9:30. There's a wide selection of juices, fruit salad, cereals, yogurt, pastries, etc. There is a nice lounge with Internet terminals (5 euros for 15 minutes), a beautiful courtyard, and even a small roof garden with a few sun loungers (due to bad weather, we didn't really use the latter two features much) The hotel is situated near the Tevere river, the Bocca della Verita and the Teatro del Marcello. Walk a little further, and you can get to the Piazza Navona, Circo Massimo, or Trastevere. There's also an ATAC bus stop near the hotel, with several routes (including two to Termini train station) All in all, a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful stay”
Reviews.Author: jim_ontheroad2011
Reviews.Content: Hotel 47 was well located for our week stay in Rome. A friendly front desk helped in many aspects of the stay. The suite was comfortable and had a lovely spacious terrace. The bed was firm and the bath spacious. Breakfast was good. Only complaint was the charge for internet use and no workout room (they did respond to my complaint by comping my use). A great value, quiet and easy. Will return.

Reviews.Title: “Seems redundant, but another positive review!”
Reviews.Author: NSI_Innerloop
Reviews.Content: Booked this based on ratings here and was not disappointed. The largest room we had on our trip, big huge bed (but VERY firm), good staff, good location, nicely decorated, classy, and good included breakfasts. Only downsides were their in-room internet service did not work in our room, the WiFi covered only the lobby and the staff was not savvy enough to even come close to fixing the problems. And even when it does work, the costs of the internet seem grossly overpriced via some third-party provider. Would cost them little and buy a lot of goodwill to just setup free WiFi covering the building. Staff was helpful in recommending dining options and getting cabs, etc. The free map in the lobby was probaby the best free map I've used on a trip - accurate and shows all the must-see locations. Great location, you can walk just about anywhere you'd want to go in Rome. Unquestionably would book this next time I'm heading to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel double-booked me”
Reviews.Author: trippers64
Reviews.Content: I know this rating is going to stand out like a sore thumb, but I am so incensed by our experience that I feel duty bound to share it with you. We placed a reservation with Hotels for 3 nights at Hotel 47, commencing 28th May 2005. On arrival at reception, we were told that our room was unavailable. We were very quickly ushered out of reception and taken to a nearby apartment block for a one night stay. This was not the 1st time that Hotel 47 had used the apartment block as an over-spill facility. We moved into Hotel Forty Seven on the 29th May, and were provided with a complimentary meal and glass of wine, along with at least one other couple that had been double-booked. The meal was mediocre, if it had been good I would tell you so. I complained to the Duty Manager and explained that we’d specifically chosen Hotel 47 and had not wanted to stay elsewhere, and certainly not in an apartment where our view from the window consisted of a huge assembly containing air handling units. Reasons for the double-booking ranged from someone being intoxicated and couldn’t move from the room, to it being due to an air-traffic control strike, to it simply being a double-booking. But to cut a long story short, we were never given any satisfactory answers. Subsequent to our stay I wrote to Hotel 47 on a number of occasions asking for explanations. It has taken five months for them to respond, and then they only responded after I copied in the Summit Group in London and asked for their assistance. But Hotel 47 has failed to answer any of my key points and I’ve given up trying. I’d be interested to hear a Management Response on this subject. Yes, I agree with other Trip Advisor comments that the hotel is very good, but that’s not much use if you are not given a room in the hotel. So be warned.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Forty Seven”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Rome having stayed in the Hotel Forty Seven for 5 nights. This was an excellent hotel from the lovely foyer to the fabulous rooms. We had booked a deluxe room as it was our 20th wedding anniversary and after being allocated the wrong room at first (not sure if the hotel staff would have changed us if we hadn't queried our room allocation) but both rooms were lovely but the deluxe had the benefit of a balcony with table and chairs and this gave us the opportunity to watch the world go by. The rooms had small special touches such as slippers which were great after longs days out sightseeing. The breakfasts in the morning were great from the fresh fruit salad, ham and cheeses, scrambled eggs and bacon to rolls and pastries and this set you up for long days seeing Rome. We ventured up to the rooftop bar and the views were fab and you could even see the top of St Peter's at night however did find it a bit expensive with most drinks ranging from 12 to 15 euros each this was for beers to champagne cocktails. One or two things about Rome that would have helped us before hand and may help anyone else in the future. The 110 tour bus round Rome stops just down from the hotel but please have exact change as they don't seem to have any change!! and we ended up giving them an extra 2 euros or we wouldn't have got on otherwise so be warned, nice little earner for them. If you want to have the audio guides for St Peter's etc please remember to take some form of identification as you will need this to get them out. We didn't have any credit cards etc and missed out on this. Must say though felt very safe walking around Rome even in the evening. We walked everywhere as the hotel is in a good spot. It took us 35 minutes to the Vatican walking at a reasonable pace so really you don't need to use any other transport if you really want to see Rome. I would recommend a lovely Sicilian restaurant called Trattoria "Melo" on via Magnanapoli it is half way up a set of stairs on this road near the Foro di Traiano, the staff were lovely and the meal cost 80 euros for starters, steaks with veg, side salad and a good bottle of Chianti and a couple of drinks. We used Rome shuttle limos for our transfer to and from the airport and have nothing but praise for this company with no problems as mentioned by other reveiwers. Rome now has a place in our heart and when we return will not hesitate to return to the Forty Seven.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dickie
Reviews.Content: Went to Rome between 21st-24th October and stayed at the hotel Forty Seven on the strength of the reviews on TA. I was not disappointed. The hotel is very contemporary with soft neutral tones with a relaxed feel about the place. Small reception which opens out onto an internal courtyard. Nearby is a small bar/lounge and there is a breakfast room adjacent. There is an open air rooftop bar/restaurant where they serve dinner. Although we didn’t dine we had drinks there on Sunday evening before we went for dinner and were treated to a stunning sunset. The staff is young and efficient all smartly turned out in modern uniforms. The reason for my trip was a birthday treat for my wife and I ordered flowers delivered to the room on arrival. I expected a bouquet to be lying on the bed but the hotel had them presented in beautiful vase already in water. The room was very nice with plenty of space and again keeping the modern contemporary feel. Bathroom was clean with hairdryer, shower over bath, large vanity/sink and heated towel rail. The bed was one of the most comfortable we have slept in. The room was air conditioned and overlooked the street (very busy 4 lane road, watch out for the mad drivers!) with the Temple of Vesta opposite. The Mouth of Truth (remember Roman Holiday) is just to the left of the hotel. Location is excellent, 3 mins from the Ponte Palatino bridge (to the front of the hotel) and 3 mins from Circus Maximus (behind the hotel). Walking over the bridge brings you to the Trastevere region. This is the traditional Rome (lots of narrow cobbled streets, lots of bars and restaurants). We ate there every night (21st - 23rd) using a list of places taken from this forum. All the main attractions are within easy walking distance: Collesium (15 mins), Roman Forum (15 mins), Palace of the Unknown Soldier (10 mins), Trevi Fountain (25 mins), Spanish Steps (30 mins), Pantheon (30 mins), Piazza Navona (30 mins), St Peters (35 mins), Vatican Museum (40 mins). Even though I had two niggles (cost of a glass of wine is 10 euros but the staff don’t inform you that a bottle is only 18 euros and a faulty bath plug that took several calls to reception for someone to arrive to fix it), the hotel will not disappoint and I will certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “A great find!”
Reviews.Author: Banjax
Reviews.Content: Bright, spacious, comfortable rooms, twin wash handbasins in the bathroom, pleasant staff, good breakfast, great coffee. Best of all is the location - slap bang in the middle of Old Rome and a 5-minute walk from lots of reasonably priced restaurants. We came here early in October, on the spur of the moment, during a month long touring holiday and despite an initial hiccup with booking, this was by far the best room (a superior double) and the best value for money that we found in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “An Aesthetically Pleasing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Fortyseven Hotel was a pleasant surprise after a very expensive stay in Venice. The aesthetics of the hotel and its beautiful ancient surroundings appealed to us. The staff was friendly and genuine and also eager to help. We had one excellent recommendation for a restaurant nearby and one disappointing recommendation. I think that staff could work on this area. When you're traveling, good eating experiences are important! Booking this through a website called Tablet Hotels was thankfully an easier experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great Modern Rome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pugluvr
Reviews.Content: We would stay at this hotel again if we go back to Rome. The rooms were large, modern and clean. The hotel had a great location that is in walking distance to almost all of the major sights in Rome. We also found many good restaurants in walking distance. One of the best parts of the hotel is the roof top bar. It was the perfect ending to our long day of sightseeing in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A True 4.5 Star”
Reviews.Author: kshangil
Reviews.Content: On 9/22, we spent one night at the Forty Seven. The staff was extremely helpful in providing us a map and highlighting key spots and routes from the hotel. In fact, we used the suggestions upon our return to Rome at the end of our trip in Italy. The lobby was uninviting. However, this fact was not important to us. Elevator available. However, bellhop carried bags and showed us how everything in the room worked. The location was a 10-15 minuite walk to the Colesseum metro while toting two suitcases. Great ruins surround hotel. The room was elegant in neutral colors of tans, whites, and black. The window was especially nice as it provided sound proof from the busy street below but also able to fully open. A nice touch was the sensor light outside the room that increased brightness upon stepping in front of the door. High tech lighting system in room. The slippers were a nice touch in the bathroom. A perfectly hot shower with fluffy towels and nice soaps. The breakfast was outstanding. Meats, cheeses, pastries, eggs, and bacon were the main events. We appreciated the small packages of cookies that we took with us on our train ride in the afternoon. Fresh fruit salad deserves honorable mention as well. A typical 4 star hotel as found in the US. Paid $300USD. Wished we had returned to 47 on our final two nights in Rome instead of cheaping out in a 3 star in Termini. Thought it would have been worth paying double than the 3 star across town.

Reviews.Title: “THE place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Forty Seven for our Honeymoon September 17th. It is in a fantastic spot! The pictures of it are exactly as it is. Big clean contemporary rooms, the breakfast every morning is a great way to start off the day before you walk to the corner to see the Mouth of Truth. You can walk to the Colosseum, the Roman Forum and take the subway from the Colosseum to the Spanish Steps and the Trevi Fountain. There is a bus station right outside the hotel that will take you to the Vatican and anywhere else you need to go. The staff is AMAZING! Because it was our honeymoon they moved us to a room facing the ruins. I know that many advise to eat elsewhere because of the price, but our last night we ate on the rooftop and not only was it the most romantic layout with an incredible view, the food was good and the service was never without a huge genuine smile. We had a glass of wine, one beer and we each ate a modest plate meal for a total of 54 EUR, which for us was high. Never have I thought anything more worth the money! I'll never forget that hotel and would HIGHLY recommend this hotel to anyone. You do need to pay for internet access. Good grocery store at Termini Station for munchies to keep in the room. I didn't find one closer, but didn't really look either. Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a short break in the city”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great location, good value. Very pleasant terrace. Room was spacious and although not deluxe, had eveything I needed and it was perfect for the weekend. I would definitely stay again. My room was on the main road, which can be noisy so light sleepers should request a room away from this side of the building.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: sigmund
Reviews.Content: Apart from a minor slip at Sunday breakfast, the hotel lived up to its high reputation. My wife and I stayed over a weekend in late September for a brief holiday. The hotel is modern, classy and bright, just 5-10 minutes walk from the Forum. We had an excellent 5th floor room with balcony, the best we have had in Italy. It was large, clean and modern with interesting murals. The reception and general service was very friendly and efficient and breakfast on the second day was fine, offering scrambled egg and bacon as well as good continental cuisine. The Sunday breakfast was marred however by slow service and an absence of cooked food even by 8:15. The breakfast area was crowded and my wife observed some (large) American ladies disappearing with plates piled high with eggs and bacon. We concluded that the staff were simply overrun. Despite this, we would not hesitate to stay at Forty Seven again. Highly recommended. PS For those want a great tour of the Forum, check out Icon at icontours. "Mike" was brilliant; in 3 hours he painted a highly informative and often funny picture of Antiquity. It was the highlight of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Quakertown Resident
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel based upon reviews in trip advisor and we were not disappointed! The location was terrific, very close to a lot of sights... The Roman Forum is only a few minutes walk from the hotel. There are some very nice restaurants across the river, just a few minutes walk from the hotel. I highly recommend La Cornicopia, which has wonderful food and not too expensive. The hotel was very clean, modern, and staff was very friendly. The room was spacious by European standards. There is a thermostat in the room so you can adjust the temperature by yourself and the airconditioning works nicely. The bar on the rooftop was wonderful although a little pricey. The breakfast in the morning was sufficient. Plenty of drinks and food. Taxi ride from the airport to the hotel was pricey - 75 euros. The hotel arranged for a driver to take us back to the airport at a fixed price of 45 euros which was much better! The only minor issue was hot water in the shower. If you get up later, the water in the shower is warm, not hot. Overall, it was a terrific hotel and we will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite hotel on our Italian vacation!”
Reviews.Author: CalStyle
Reviews.Content: This is one of the nicest hotels we have stayed in not only in Italy, but also throughout Europe. The rooms are large enough to be the size of average Las Vegas rooms. And the decor is amazing, if you like the modern look. The bathroom is meticulous and the morning breakfast in the central courtyard is great. The service is awesome as well. Talk to Simon and the rest of the guys at the rooftop lounge and you'll notice that they're super nice and very helpful. The crew at the reception desk is very helpful as well, especially if you need to find your way around town. I would go back to this place any day. The hotel made our 4 nights in Rome unforgettable!

Reviews.Title: “Immaculate and Reasonable”
Reviews.Author: LARS6743
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 3 nights. He wanted to stay near ancient Rome while I'm a Spanish steps kind of gal. I chose Forty Seven with some misgivings but was reassured by the tripadvisor reviews. I'm glad we stayed. The staff was friendly and the room exceptionally clean. The bathroom was immaculate. Really this is a great hotel for the money. I must say I didn't realize how close the Tiber River was to the hotel. It was lovely to walk along it, away from the tourist sites as wonderful as they are. Another unexpected bonus was how close the hotel was to great neighborhood restaurants that were reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at this hotel for our first 3 nights in Italy. This hotel has an unbelievable location if you are interested in seeing "historic" Rome (ie Roman Forum, Pantheon, Coliseum, etc etc). Are there better hotels in Rome? Probably. But the staff was conscientious, the room was clean and reasonably big (by European standards) and the included breakfast was amazing (again, by European standards). We'd asked for an early check-in since we knew we'd be arriving in Rome at dawn, and the staff had our room ready when we arrived. A blessing, to be sure. Caveat: when we read the hotel overlooked the "Temple of Vesta", we assumed we'd be looking down on the Roman Forum's Temple of Vesta. In reality, the hotel is a few blocks from the Forum and the "temple" we looked at was another lesser monument across the street from the hotel. This building/ruin? is also called the "Temple of Vesta", but it is not THE Temple of Vesta inside the Roman Forum. The view was pleasant but not what we'd expected. The rooftop wine bar was delightful for sipping wine & cheese -- spectacular views of the city -- and should not be missed. However, if you're interested in dinner, I'd go elsewhere. Not much choice and too expensive. Other comments: do not trust the hotel staff to set up tours for you. We asked the concierge to arrange both a private walking tour of the Roman Forum and a group tour of Vatican City. Both were overpriced and dreadful, especially the group tour of the Vatican. On our 3rd day, we found a group on our own called Eternal City Tours and I cannot say enough about the company. They give free tours in English at various monuments in Rome and if you like what they do, they invite you to take one of their paid tours of other sites. We took their free tour of St. Peter's and came back for a paid walking tour at night of Rome that was the best tour we've ever taken. If we'd known about them, we would have arranged all of our "Rome" tours through them, as they offer a variety of group tours, as well as private & customized tours. Interestingly, though, when I asked the hotel staff to book the walking tour of Rome at night for us with the company we'd found, they balked, choosing instead to send us (again) to their "preferred" touring group.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: gedwards100
Reviews.Content: I admit that being upgraded to a junior suite may have affected my opinion of this hotel but the experience was still superb. Room was well appointed, clean and the en suite was fantastic. Breakfast was typical for rome hotel but a good example of it. Roof terrace is great and the views are magnficent overlooking the forum towards the colloseum. One slight downside, the bar on the roof terrace is very pricey, but you only live once.

Reviews.Title: “Simply spectacular”
Reviews.Author: Scottological
Reviews.Content: It seems that most hotels I've stayed at recently have been overpriced mediocrities. Rooms are often shabby and cramped and the service provided by the staff is anything but inspired. Not so at the Forty Seven in Rome. This place is an absolute revelation. Hoteliers world wide could learn a thing or two about their industry by checking in at the 47 for a night. Despite the fact that we arrived early in the morning after a gruelling multi-layover trip, the front desk had a room waiting for us on the top floor, complete with a balcony, just as I had requested. While the room was on the smaller side - because of the generously-sized balcony, they explained - it was extremely well-appointed with high-quality, modern furnishings and linens. The bathroom was spacious by European standards and featured a full tub, plenty of counter space, toilet, and bidet. Counters and floor were in marble or some sort of beautiful light-colored stone and the fixtures themselves were modern and of the highest quality. As I mentioned, we arrived early in the morning and were in need of sleep. The balcony doors featured a metal shutter that could be rolled down at the touch of the button. The effect was an absolutely dark and silent sanctuary for severely jet-lagged travelers. Other reviewers have mentioned that breakfast was fine, but nothing special. While it was certainly not gourmet, it offered a wide selections of pastries, breads, meats, yogurts, cereals, scrambled eggs, and bacon. Consiering it is included in the price of the room, I can't complain at all. Everything was fresh and delicious. I didn't eat at their restaurant, but did have a glass of wine on the marvelous rooftop bar. Sure, it was expensive, but this is a hotel, after all, and the wine was excellent. For all of its spectacular features, what made the 47 truly stand out was its staff. Without exception, the staff was eager, friendly, and accomodating. When I asked the front desk for an umbrella at 5:00 AM, explaining I was going out for a walk beacause I couldn't sleep, they showed grave concern that perhaps something was wrong with my room and asked if they could help in any way. When I explained it was only jet lag, they still persisted, making sure I had absolutely everything I needed to make myself comfortable. (In the end, the sunrise walk through Rome was all I needed. I highly recommend waking early and going for a stroll. The streets are quiet and deserted and you're free to see Rome in all its glory.) In short, the 47 is a smashing success. From its convenient location near the ancient center of Rome, to the rooms and service, its an oustanding place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for Rome”
Reviews.Author: mad4travel
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on the basis of the reviews on this site and was not dissapointed. It is a lovely modern hotel smack bang in the centre of the action. You can walk to the Forum and Colleseum, over the Tiber to the Trastevere district with loads of great restaurants and get a normal bus or the 110 tourist bus from a few metres down the road. Taxis are pretty cheap. The vatican is about 20 mins walk or 5 mins and 5 euros by Taxi The rooms are a good size, well equipped and very clean. The staff were wonderful, the friendliest and most helpful I've met in a hotel for years. There is a tranquil courtyard and a fab rooftop bar with very attentive staff which is wonderful for sitting out in the balmy evenings looking at the city lights. Be warned tho' drinks are quite expensive and its easy to get carried away!! Breakfast was good but it can get a bit crowded at the weekends. Also, make sure you have the address and a map with you when you get a taxi back cos most taxi drivers seemed to have a problem knowing where it was. I think a previous poster was very ripped off by the Taxi from the station as it cost us only 7 euros both ways! All in all a great stay. I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...but....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My Husband and i stayed at the Forty Seven from the 19th-22nd August 2005. The location is unbeatable and the rooms are very spacious modern and clean...but and there are a few buts: No irons in any of the rooms. The hotel will not provide one and the only way to Iron your clothes is to give them to housekeeping for 4 euros a piece????!!! Apparently no hotel in Rome will alow Irons due to health and safety. I believe this may not be the truth. They are still advertising on Expedia that there are Irons. Management were very unhelpfull and did not want to tell us where to get an iron from. Had to trapse around the streets to find a shop. On check out there was an extra 5 euros added to our bill for taking two bottles of water from the bar. This was a total mistake as we never took anything from the minibar. The receptionist was extremley rude and asked me to e-mail in to get my 5 euros back. My advice is check the minibar when you get there and every day as the maids are obviously not trustworthy. On the whole is a nice hotel but the slightly arrogant nature of the reception staff when something is not right is quite off putting.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CVCVws
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the place to stay while in Rome. The electronic shutters keep the noise out at night. The location can't be beat for the price and the breakfast was great. Make sure the taxi driver knows exactly which Forty Seven Hotel you are staying at as ours took us to this nice but wrong hotel and then charged us for trip even though we showed the address to him. Me thinks this has been done before - and not wanting to aurgue our first day in, we paid. Breakfast was great the view from the hotel unbeatable.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the 47”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed..the hotel is new..modern..clean..and centrally located to major attractions.. The staff was fantastic..I have no complaints....I would definitely stay again when I return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed”
Reviews.Author: Fionnb
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel, and seemed to be a very good rate for Rome in August. Right beside several of the main sites. Surprisingly modern with a lovely bedroom and bathroom and nice little balcony. It was everything we would have wanted. Also, it's quite a small hotel and therefore has a nice, personal atmosphere. Breakfast was lovely and I was impressed that stocks were still being replenished right up to the finish time of 10.30. Staff were really nice and helpful. Note: It's about 10 minutes by taxi from the main train station, but check the fare first as we were definitely ripped off. (25 euro to the hotel, but only 13 going back...)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JanuaryMom
Reviews.Content: Myself and 2 friends just returned from 5 days in Rome. We spent all 4 nights at the Forty-Seven Hotel and loved it! We too had a reservation error...we had booked one of their 2 suites. I called the day before the trip to confirm the reservation and they told us that there was some kind of "internal problem" with the suite and we were being bumped to 2 seperate rooms...one was a double deluxe and the other a standard. Actually, since we booked through Expedia they should have contacted me about the change,but never did so. We were disappointed, but there was no time to find a new hotel. I'm so glad that we didn"t change...the hotel was beautiful (art deco style) and the staff were excellant. They made several reservations for us throughout the trip, made suggestions, gave directions, and called taxis. The breakfast was the best I've seen in Italy (this was my 4th trip)...eggs, bacon, tasty fruit salad, standard Italian fare, cereals, different coffees, etc. Breakfast was served in a lovely courtyard on the main level. The rooms were luxurious....comfortable beds, tons of space, marble baths, fluffy towels, slippers and robes. Maid service twice a day. The windows had electric blinds (controls by your bedside) that completly blocked out noise and light....it was like sleepinig in a cave! There was also a gorgeous roof top bar to sit and relax at night (drinks were very pricey..18 euro for a bellini). The location was fine...walkable to many sights and bus stops right outside the hotel. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel 47 - the one drawback”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and myself (late 30s) stayed at Hotel 47 in mid-December, 2004 before any reviews existed for this hotel (I see that has changed). Everything said by the other positive reviewers is true - sleek design, great staff, location can't be beat, very convenient for nightly dining outings in Trastevere (highly recommended), etc...but I can't believe no one has mentioned that the street the hotel is on is LOUD. Petroselli (or whatever it is called) is a major thoroughfare as much as that is even possible in Rome. Look at the candid photos on this webpage and you'll see this busy street crowded with buses, Vespas, etc. And it gets busy early in the AM. There isn't really a room that can escape this situation - we were moved once by the very competent staff (a young British woman who brought men home to her room and made loud noises on the parquet floors all night made moving a necessity - not the hotel's fault of course) so we noticed the street noise from two different locations in the hotel. Noise in Rome is a given - but this location is especially brutal. Try the Aventine Hill neighborhood if peaceful sleeping matters to you.

Reviews.Title: “Bad reservations system....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After checking out the website, calling the hotel direct and calling central reservations (this is a Summit Hotel) I booked a suite for myself, my husband and our 2 young children. We are staying in Rome for 1 night (which happens to be our wedding anniversary) on our way to a wedding in Siena. Confirmation received by email of the booking. Day after booking, received a phone call from the hotel advising me that the suite was 'ubavailable due to maintenance work' however, I could have 2 x double rooms instead - not interconnecting or even next to each other but 'on the same floor'! Very romantic - this meant that I would have to sleep with one child and my husband with the other - not really what we had planned for our anniversary!! Declined this offer..... Now booked alternative hotel but has put me off using Hotel 47 in future.

Reviews.Title: “Staff and room were unbeatable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Where do I start? We were getting married in Rome October 2004, on a bit of a shoestring budget. We were planning to spend about a week in beautiful Rome, and started doing some research for accommodations. I came across Fortyseven Hotel while doing my research and read a number of positive reviews. The price and location seemed to fit, so I booked the room. Let me tell you the reviews I read did not do the hotel justice. The location is prime (short walk to great shopping, subway, and of course many great sights). The room was lovely, and the staff was unbelievable. For starters, when they found out we were getting married they upgraded our room (I would HIGHLY suggest you do the same), so we had a balcony overlooking ancient ruins. When we returned from our wedding ceremony we found Champaign and flowers in our room. The staff was ultra friendly, helpful and informative. They answered emails and any questions we had quickly and helpfully. Next time I am in Rome, Fourtyseven Hotel is where we will stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous place... wouldn't stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: thezucca
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel 47 from July 6 to July 9 as part our our honeymoon trip in Itlay. I can't say enough about this hotel.... The rooms were amazing.. very large, modern and spacious. The air conditioning worked perfectly, the staff was AMAZING.. so helpful and friendly. The hotel is in a PERFECT location. So close to many of the ancient ruins, and 1 block from the river, where you can walk to Trastevere in the evenings where there are great restaurants and bars. It's away from the crowded touristy streets of Rome like the Via Conditti and the Piazza Navona, but close enough to walk there if you're interested in sightseeing. I would highly recommend this hotel to friends and family and would ABSOLUTELY stay here again.... as far as we're concerned, there's no better place in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and welcoming hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent 7 nights in this fine and welcoming hotel, from 20 to 27 may. Great confort, modern design, welcoming staff, excellent breakfast. Not very far from metro, but very close to buses. Excellent location to have lunch or dinner in Trastevere, a 5 mn walk crossing the Tibre. Just one negative thing: the hotel is located in a busy place and sometime it could be a bit noisy. Despite that we rate this hotel with 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Forty Seven Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: W.R.F.
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Forty Seven Hotel for six nights at the end of June. It's a beautifully appointed hotel, done in a very modern Italian style. We arranged for a driver to pick us up for $44 Euros- very nice. The hotel is in a great location at the Petroselli bus stop, where most every bus in the city stops. It is also walking distance to most everything, and right across the river, over the oldest bridge, is Tiber Island and Trastevere, where we had dinner everynight. We looked out our window on the fourth floor to the Temple of Hercules and the Temple of Fortuna. Our room had lovely hard wood floors and nicely tiled bathroom. It was well air-conditioned, with good shutters, but I loved having the windows open to the view, as the noise doesn't bother me. On my birthday, after a long day of walking, we came back to the hotel to freshen up and lie down. We got a call from downstairs telling us to open the door. They had delivered Italian Champagne and a big bowl of fresh fruit. The bar staff at the open air rooftop were particularly nice. One night the rooftop bar was closed for a private function, and the manager gave us complimentary drinks for downstairs and invited us back up the next night. They also made a great expresso. Breakfast was good-with eggs, bacon and sausage for my husband, and rolls and cappacinos for me. There was also a quiche or frittata most everyday, and lots of fresh fruit and juices, etc. We highly recommend the Forty Seven Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bellisimo Forty Seven”
Reviews.Author: LindyLouWYorkshire
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from Hotel Forty Seven having stayed for 3 nights with 3 girlfriends to celebrate a special birthday in Rome. We chose the hotel following reading very good reviews and we certainly were not disappointed - in fact everything exceeded my own expectations. The hotel is newly opened, modern and stylish - a brilliant and safe location - close to lots but far enough away too for some peace. Breakfast is fab - especially by Italian standards - and we ate a leisurely breakfast outside on the terrace twice - just bliss! The rooms were lovely - the blackout shutters were great in blocking out the noise as well as the light - book a de- luxe if you can afford it and want lots of space. The staff were really helpful and rather chic in their black trendy armani- like uniforms but it was Oscar and his team in the rooftop terrace bar who made our holiday such fun - it was great to be able to return to such a civilised environment after a hectic day walking around (amazing, stunning) Rome. Yes the drinks were pricey as another reviewer stated but the location of the rooftop terrace, for me, made them a steal! We cried as we left as we were overwhelmed not only with Rome but with this great hotel - we truly did not want to go home!!!

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best”
Reviews.Author: StormSurvivor
Reviews.Content: Good reviews led me to book this hotel for the end of a three-week vacation. I have very few complaints. The room, by European standards, was huge as well as clean and comfortable. The hotel staff were among the friendliest and most helpful I have encountered in several years of travel. The location is perfect. There are many good restaurants within easy walking distance and there was never a time when I felt unsafe. The hotel has a well-stocked downstairs bar with a few seats, but there is a large lounge on the roof. We didn't try the food other than the included breakfast with eggs and bacon (and pizza) as well as the usual European fare. One morning we came down for breakfast at the last minute as did a number of others. Instead of closing up and leaving us with leftovers, the staff cooked more of everything--long after the closing time. This is the spirit of Hotel 47. I hoped to return to this great hotel someday, but I will not make the same mistake with taxis that I now hope to spare readers here. We were nailed by a driver when my wife handed him a bunch of euro notes and scooted out of the taxi. The driver substituted a smaller demonination for one of the bills and claimed he had been shorted. We paid up, but learned a good lesson: fan out the bills for the driver (or anyone else) and get a nod of approval before letting them go. . . . but I digress. Stay at the 47--you'll love it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Traveler2112
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel. Excellect full breakfest. Eggs, bacon, sausage, donuts, cheese, meats, coffee....ect. too much to list. Close to Forum, Collousseum, Circus Maximus, next door to the Mouth of Truth. Staff friendly and helpful. Rooms quite and modern. Nice bed, room darkening shades. Will stay here again next time I'm in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “They have the worst service at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I thought it looked great when I checked in. Nice, clean, and bright. The room was small, but fine. Everything seemed OK until I asked for an iron. They didn't have one in the hotel for any of the guests so we had to send out our clothes to be pressed. I was fine with the charge and we dropped off four pieces at 7:30 am and asked that it be ready at 5 pm when we returned. We returned at 6 pm and still no clothes. We waited and waited and had dinner reservations at 8 pm. The front desk person was rude and unaccomodating. They kept saying that the van was on its way (apparently they had it sent out to be pressed). By 7:30 I asked that they push our dinner reservations to 9:30 and asked to speak to a manager. They could tell that I was upset and told me that they couldn't help me and that the hotel manager was out on a walk and would not be back all weekend. They wouldn't let me speak to a desk manager, night manager or any manager in charge. When the clothes finally arrived, they charged us the regular rate of the pressing and then a 50% mark-up because it was sent rush. Since I didn't get the clothes until after 7:30pm, I couldn't believe they charged me a rush charge. The manager never tried to remedy the situation. I would never stay at this hotel again and I would never recommend this to anyone. You should spend your money elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great location, but ...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in this hotel for six nights in May, and we could not have made a better choice. Our room was clean and spacious, and the shower was a dream. The staff could not have been more helpful, and were extremely friendly. The location of the hotel is perfect, just minutes away from the major sites. We walked everywhere; there was no need to take a cab. The 24/7 room service was very handy: we needed to use it a few times after arriving back late in the evening. Now the downside: don't use GreenLine Tours to make an excursion to Naples and Pompeii (the staff at the front desk give you the brochures when you check-in). The tour was a complete waste of time: the organization was chaotic, the included "lunch" was just awful, and to cap it all we only got to spend two hours in Pompeii. Take it from us: don't waste 100 Euros pp on this tour. Just buy the train tickets and do the tour yourself.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Steve C
Reviews.Content: The Forty Seven is a great hotel. We stayed here for 3 nights in room 508 (one of 2 suites). The suite has vitually all you need - a spacious seating area with TV and minibar, a wardrobe area, and a queen/king bedroom with another TV. The balcony is very large (with 3 double doors opening from the suite) and has a table and chairs. It overlooks the Temple of Vesta and the bridge over the Tiber to the Travestere area of Rome. The only items which we would have liked to have been available in the room were a CD player and an iron (apparently there is a law in Italy which forbids irons in hotel bedrooms). The hotel were very efficient however in ironing any clothes at no charge. Overall the hotel is very modern, with great Italian taste. Reception was helpful and were always on hand to take care of all our needs. Breakfast was continental style and included in the cost of the room - it was perfectly acceptable to kick off the day. The location of the hotel is great - not right in the hustle and bustle of the main shopping area (as quite a few hotels are) but only a bus/taxi ride from all the main sightseeing locations. For a great orientation tour take the 110 open top double decker sightseeing bus from the stop just across the square from the hotel (13 Euros for a round trip of about 2 hours). This stops at all the main sights and you can hop on and off as many times as you like. It runs about every 20 minutes. The hotel were very efficient at arranging transport to and from the airport (allow at least 30 minutes drivetime - more at peak traffic times) at 45 Euros one way (believe me, this is far better than trying to navigate the train into central Rome and then a taxi to your hotel!). We definately plan to return to Rome and to this hotel in particular. Very happy to try to answer any questions you may have - just email me.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable rooms, but staff a little unfriendly”
Reviews.Author: jentuna
Reviews.Content: The rooms were incredibly clean, modern, fancy, cozy, perfect!!!! One of the best hotels I have ever stayed at in that respect. However, I found the staff to be mixed in terms of friendliness and helpfulness. We stayed there are 2 separate occasions within a few weeks. The bellman and wait staff were super friendly and helpful. The people behind the desk were NOT friendly. Not only were they not warm, but they were completely unhelpful to me when I needed help booking activities and other hotels on multiple occasions and in some cases gave me misinformation. I felt as if they could only set us up with a few specific tours, rather than help us book things I read about in other books or heard about. We had the hotel arrange for a car to come pick us up and take us to the airport. That worked out great, the first guy was not friendly, but got us there quickly. the second guy was super friendly and drove a Mercedes! He pointed out sites along the way like a tour guide would! Overall, I would recommend this place, but dont count on them to help you in all situations -- go there prepared already!

HotelInfo.Name: Fortyseven Hotel Rome
HotelInfo.Address: Via Luigi Petroselli 47, 00186 Rome, Italy
